sourceString: Rapidly increasing cumulative incidence of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) in the European Union/European Economic Area and the United Kingdom, 1 January to 15 March 2020
targetString: 2020 年 1 月 1 日至 3 月 15 日期间，欧盟/欧洲经济区和英国的新型冠状病毒疾病 (COVID-19) 累积发病率迅速增加
en-mt: Rapid increase in cumulative incidence of novel coronavirus disease (COVID-19) in the EU/EEA and UK between 1 January and 15 March 2020

sourceString: The cumulative incidence of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) cases is showing similar trends in European Union/European Economic Area countries and the United Kingdom confirming that, while at a different stage depending on the country, the COVID-19 pandemic is progressing rapidly in all countries.
targetString: 在欧盟/欧洲经济区的各个国家以及英国，新型冠状病毒疾病 (COVID-19) 的累积发病率显示出相似的趋势，证实虽然不同国家处于不同的阶段，但 COVID-19 大流行病都在迅速发展。
en-mt: Cumulative incidence rates of novel coronavirus disease (COVID-19) show similar trends across EU/EEA countries, as well as in the UK, confirming that the COVID-19 pandemic is rapidly evolving, although different countries are at different stages develop.

sourceString: Based on the experience from Italy, countries, hospitals and intensive care units should increase their preparedness for a surge of patients with COVID-19 who will require healthcare, and in particular intensive care.
targetString: 根据意大利的经验，国家、医院和重症监护病房都需要做好更充分的准备，迎接数量激增的 COVID-19 患者，重症监护任务尤其重。
en-mt: Based on Italy's experience, the country, hospitals and intensive care units all need to be better prepared for a surge in the number of COVID-19 patients, especially intensive care.

sourceString: On 31 December 2019, a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown aetiology was reported in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.
targetString: 2019 年 12 月 31 日，中国湖北省武汉市报告了多起病因不明的肺炎病例。
en-mt: On December 31, 2019, multiple cases of pneumonia of unknown etiology were reported in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.

sourceString: On 9 January 2020, the China Center for Disease Control and Prevention reported the causative agent as being a novel coronavirus now referred to as severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: 2020 年 1 月 9 日，中国疾病预防控制中心报告称，病原体是一种新型冠状病毒，现在称为严重急性呼吸综合征冠状病毒 2 (Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus 2, SARS-CoV-2)。
en-mt: On January 9, 2020, the Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention reported that the causative agent was a novel coronavirus, now known as Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: Since, the illness resulting from SARS-CoV-2 infection has been named coronavirus disease (COVID-19).
targetString: 此后，由 SARS-CoV-2 感染引起的疾病被命名为冠状病毒疾病 (COVID-19)。
en-mt: The disease caused by SARS-CoV-2 infection has since been named coronavirus disease (COVID-19).

sourceString: Evidence to date is that ca 80% of individuals with COVID-19 have a mild disease, i.e. a respiratory tract infection with or without pneumonia, and most of these recover.
targetString: 迄今为止的证据表明，大约 80% 的 COVID-19 病例为轻症，即伴或不伴肺炎的呼吸道感染，并且大多数都能康复。
en-mt: Evidence so far suggests that about 80% of COVID-19 cases are mild, a respiratory infection with or without pneumonia, and most recover.

sourceString: In ca 14% cases, COVID-19 develops into a more severe disease requiring hospitalisation while the remaining 6% cases experience critical illness requiring intensive care.
targetString: 在大约 14% 的病例中，COVID-19 会进展为重症并需要住院治疗，而其余 6% 的病例会进展为危重症并需要重症监护。
en-mt: In about 14% of cases, COVID-19 progresses to severe disease requiring hospitalization, while in the remaining 6% it becomes critically ill and requires intensive care.

sourceString: The mortality of patients hospitalised due to COVID-19 is ca 4%.
targetString: 因 COVID-19 而住院的患者死亡率约为 4%。
en-mt: The mortality rate among patients hospitalized with COVID-19 is approximately 4%.

sourceString: In this study, we assess the trends in the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 in each European Union/European Economic Area (EU/EEA) country and the United Kingdom (UK) and compare them to that of Hubei Province, China.
targetString: 在这项研究中，我们评估了欧盟/欧洲经济区 (European Union, EU/European Economic Area, EEA) 的各个国家以及英国 (UK) 的 COVID-19 累积发病率的趋势，并将其与中国湖北省进行了比较。
en-mt: In this study, we assessed trends in the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 in various countries of the European Union/European Economic Area (EEA) and the United Kingdom (UK) and compared them to those in Hubei, China. Provinces were compared.

sourceString: We also compare the current number of COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK with that in Italy during 31 January–15 March 2020.
targetString: 我们还对 2020 年 1 月 31 日至 3 月 15 日期间 EU/EEA 国家和英国的现有 COVID-19 病例数与意大利进行了比较。
en-mt: We also compared the number of existing COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the United Kingdom with Italy between 31 January and 15 March 2020.

sourceString: COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK
targetString: EU/EEA 国家和英国的 COVID-19 病例
en-mt: COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK

sourceString: Subsequent to China, COVID-19 underwent further geographical spread and the dynamic of the COVID-19 pandemic in the rest of the world currently follows that of this country.
targetString: 继中国之后，COVID-19 的地理分布进一步扩大，目前世界其他地区 COVID-19 大流行病的动态变化与中国相仿。
en-mt: After China, the geographical distribution of COVID-19 has further expanded, and the dynamics of the COVID-19 pandemic in other parts of the world are now similar to those in China.

sourceString: On 11 March 2020, the Director General of the World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a pandemic.
targetString: 2020 年 3 月 11 日，世界卫生组织 (WHO) 总干事宣布 COVID-19 为大流行病。
en-mt: On March 11, 2020, the Director-General of the World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a pandemic.

sourceString: In the 5 March issue of Eurosurveillance 2020, Spiteri et al. reported on the first European confirmed COVID-19 cases according to the WHO case definition.
targetString: 在 2020 年 3 月 5 日出版的《欧洲监控》杂志上，Spiteri 等人根据 WHO 的病例定义报告了欧洲首批确诊的 COVID-19 病例。
en-mt: In the March 5, 2020 issue of European Surveillance, Spiteri et al. report the first confirmed cases of COVID-19 in Europe based on the WHO case definition.

sourceString: In the EU/EEA, the first three confirmed cases were reported by France on 24 January 2020 in persons returning from Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.
targetString: 在 EU/EEA，法国于 2020 年 1 月 24 日报告了最早的三例确诊病例，患者为中国湖北省武汉市归国人员。
en-mt: In the EU/EEA, France reported its first three confirmed cases on January 24, 2020, in returnees from Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.

sourceString: As at 15 March 2020, COVID-19 cases had been detected in all 30 EU/EEA countries and the United Kingdom (UK), whereby between 31 December 2019 and that date included, 39,768 cases and 1,727 deaths had been reported, with 17,750 cases and 1,441 deaths from Italy alone.
targetString: 截至 2020 年 3 月 15 日，所有 30 个 EU/EEA 国家以及英国都已经检测到 COVID-19 病例，自 2019 年 12 月 31 日至 3 月 15 日，含当日，已经报告了 39,768 名病例和 1,727 例死亡病例，其中仅意大利就报告了 17,750 名病例和 1,441 例死亡病例。
en-mt: As of March 15, 2020, all 30 EU/EEA countries, plus the United Kingdom, have detected cases of COVID-19, and from December 31, 2019 to and including March 15, 39,768 cases and 1,727 deaths, with Italy alone reporting 17,750 cases and 1,441 deaths.

sourceString: Obtaining cumulative number and cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases
targetString: 获取 COVID-19 病例的累积数量和累积发病率
en-mt: Get the cumulative number and cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases

sourceString: At the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC), the notified COVID-19 case counts in each country worldwide, obtained from only official sources such as the countries’ Ministry of Health, national and regional health authorities and the WHO, are updated each day at 8:00 a.m.
targetString: 欧洲疾病预防控制中心 (ECDC) 在每天上午 8:00 更新全球每个国家已通报的 COVID-19 病例数，它们仅通过官方来源获取，例如各国的卫生部、国家和地区卫生当局以及 WHO。
en-mt: The European Center for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) updates daily at 8:00 AM the number of notified COVID-19 cases for each country in the world, obtained only from official sources such as ministries of health, national and territorial health authorities, and WHO.

sourceString: These data were used for assessing the trends of COVID-19 in EU/EEA and the UK, and comparing them to that in Italy.
targetString: 这些数据已用于评估 EU/EEA 和英国的 COVID-19 趋势，并与意大利进行比较。
en-mt: These data have been used to assess COVID-19 trends in the EU/EEA and the UK and compare them with Italy.

sourceString: As a proxy of the prevalence of active COVID-19 cases, we calculated the 14-day truncated cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases, thus taking into account the natural course of COVID-19, in each EU/EEA country and the UK, during the 1 January–15 March 2020 period.
targetString: 我们计算了 2020 年 1 月 1 日至 3 月 15 日期间每个 EU/EEA 国家以及英国的 COVID-19 病例的 14 天截缩累积发病率，作为活动性 COVID-19 病例的患病率指标，以便考虑 COVID-19 的自然病程。
en-mt: We calculated the 14-day truncated cumulative incidence rate of COVID-19 cases for each EU/EEA country and the UK between 1 January and 15 March 2020 as an indicator of the prevalence of active COVID-19 cases, in order to take into account the natural history of COVID-19.

sourceString: We also presented the cumulative number of notified cases of each country as at 15 March 2020 8:00 a.m. compared with that of Italy for the 31 January–15 March 2020 period.
targetString: 我们还提供了截至 2020 年 3 月 15 日上午 8:00 每个国家已通报的累积病例总数，并且与 2020 年 1 月 31 日至 3 月 15 日期间意大利的数据进行了比较。
en-mt: We also present the cumulative total number of cases notified by each country as of 8:00 am on March 15, 2020, and compare with data from January 31 to March 15, 2020 for Italy.

sourceString: Trends of COVID-19 in EU/EEA countries and the UK
targetString: EU/EEA 国家和英国的 COVID-19 趋势
en-mt: COVID-19 trends in EU/EEA countries and the UK

sourceString: The trends in the 14-day truncated cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the UK generally followed that of Hubei Province (China) (Figure 1).
targetString: EU/EEA 国家和英国的 COVID-19 病例的 14 天截缩累积发病率的趋势总体上与湖北省（中国）的一致（图 1）。
en-mt: The trends in the 14-day truncated cumulative incidence rates of COVID-19 cases in the EU/EEA countries and the United Kingdom were generally consistent with those in Hubei Province (China) (Figure 1).

sourceString: For the EU/EEA and the UK overall, the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 started to increase around 21 February and then increased sharply around 28 February 2020 (Supplementary material).
targetString: 对于 EU/EEA 和英国整体而言，COVID-19 的累积发病率自 2020 年 2 月 21 日左右开始增加，然后在 2 月 28 日左右急剧增加（补充材料）。
en-mt: For the EU/EEA and the UK as a whole, the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 started to increase around 21 February 2020 and then increased sharply around 28 February (Supplementary Material).

sourceString: This was mostly driven by the rapid increase in the number of reported cases from Italy, but all other EU/EEA countries and the UK showed similar increasing trends of the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 (Supplementary material).
targetString: 这主要是由于意大利报告的病例数迅速增加所致，但所有其他 EU/EEA 国家以及英国的 COVID-19 累积发病率也呈现出相似的增长趋势（补充材料）。
en-mt: This was mainly due to the rapid increase in the number of reported cases in Italy, but a similar increase in the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 was observed in all other EU/EEA countries, as well as in the United Kingdom (Supplementary Material).

sourceString: Figure 2 shows the cumulative number of COVID-19 cases, in EU/EEA countries and the UK compared with that in Italy for the 31 January–15 March 2020 period.
targetString: 图 2 显示了 2020 年 1 月 31 日至 3 月 15 日期间 EU/EEA 国家以及英国的累积 COVID-19 病例数，并与意大利进行了比较。
en-mt: Figure 2 shows the cumulative number of COVID-19 cases in EU/EEA countries and the United Kingdom between 31 January and 15 March 2020, compared with Italy.

sourceString: It highlights that, as at 15 March 8:00 a.m., 15 other EU/EEA countries and the UK had already reported a total number of cases comparable to that of Italy just 3 weeks prior or less.
targetString: 需要强调的是，截至 3 月 15 日上午 8:00，其他 15 个 EU/EEA 国家以及英国在不到 3 周的时间里就已经报告了与意大利相当的总病例数。
en-mt: It should be emphasized that as of 8:00 am on March 15th, the other 15 EU/EEA countries, as well as the United Kingdom, had reported a total number of cases comparable to Italy in less than 3 weeks.

sourceString: Our results indicate that the number of notified cases of COVID-19 is rapidly increasing in the EU/EEA and the UK.
targetString: 我们的结果表明，EU/EEA 和英国通报的 COVID-19 病例数量正在迅速增加。
en-mt: Our results show that the number of notified COVID-19 cases in the EU/EEA and the UK is increasing rapidly.

sourceString: The observed trends in the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 suggest that the pandemic is progressing at a comparable speed in all countries.
targetString: 观察到的 COVID-19 累积发病率趋势表明，疫情正在所有国家以相似的速度发展。
en-mt: The observed trends in the cumulative incidence of COVID-19 suggest that the outbreak is developing at a similar rate in all countries.

sourceString: This is despite countries being at different stages, variations in national public health responses, and possibly different case definitions in countries and different protocols for selecting patients that must be tested for confirmation of COVID-19, including catch-up testing.
targetString: 尽管各个国家处于不同阶段，国家公共卫生应对措施各不相同，各个国家对病例的定义可能不同，并且用于选择必须接受 COVID-19 确诊检测——包括追加检测——患者的方案存在差异，但情况均相同。
en-mt: Although countries are at different stages, national public health responses vary, case definitions may differ across countries, and protocols for selecting patients who must undergo COVID-19 confirmatory testing—including additional testing—varie, The situation is the same.

sourceString: Early March 2020, doctors in the affected regions of Italy described a situation in which ca 10% of patients with COVID-19 required intensive care and media sources reported that hospitals and intensive care units in these regions had already reached their maximum capacity.
targetString: 2020 年 3 月上旬，据意大利受影响地区的医生介绍，大约 10% 的 COVID-19 患者需要重症监护，而媒体报道表示这些地区的医院和重症监护病房已经达到最大承载量。
en-mt: In early March 2020, according to doctors in affected regions of Italy, approximately 10% of COVID-19 patients required intensive care, and media reports indicated that hospitals and intensive care units in these regions were already at maximum capacity.

sourceString: Data on admission of COVID-19 cases in a hospital and/or an intensive care unit are currently available at EU/EEA level for only 6% and 1% cases, respectively (data not shown).
targetString: 在 EU/EEA 层面，目前可以获得的数据是住院/或进入重症监护病房的 COVID-19 病例分别仅有 6% 和 1% （数据未显示）。
en-mt: At EU/EEA level, currently available data are only 6% and 1% of COVID-19 cases hospitalized and/or admitted to intensive care units, respectively (data not shown).

sourceString: They should, however, be collected in a systematic fashion to complement current surveillance data that focus on the number of reported cases and the number of deaths.
targetString: 但是，这些信息应该以系统方式采集，以便补充重点关注已报告病例数和死亡人数的当前监测数据。
en-mt: However, this information should be collected in a systematic manner to complement current surveillance data focusing on the number of reported cases and deaths.

sourceString: A study performed in 2010–11 showed a large variation in the availability of intensive care and intermediate care beds in Europe, ranging from 29.2 in Germany to 4.2 beds per 100,000 population in Portugal.
targetString: 2010-11 年进行的一项研究表明，欧洲各国可提供的重症监护和中期照护床位数存在很大差异，每 10 万人拥有的床位数范围从德国的 29.2 张到葡萄牙的 4.2 张不等。
en-mt: A study conducted in 2010-11 showed that the number of intensive care and intermediate care beds available varies widely across Europe, ranging from 29.2 beds per 100,000 people in Germany to 4.2 in Portugal.

sourceString: This means that countries may have more or less resources than Italy (12.5 intensive care and intermediate care beds per 100,000 population in 2010–11).
targetString: 这意味着各国拥有的资源可能多于或少于意大利（2010-2011 年每 10 万人拥有 12.5 张重症监护和中期照护床位）。
en-mt: This means that countries may have more or less resources than Italy (12.5 intensive care and intermediate care beds per 100,000 people in 2010-2011).

sourceString: Modelling scenarios related to healthcare capacity saturation, with estimates for each EU/EEA country and the UK of the prevalence of hospitalised COVID-19 cases associated with a > 90% risk of exceeding intensive care bed capacity, are provided in the sixth update of the ECDC rapid risk assessment on COVID-19.
targetString: ECDC 对 COVID-19 快速风险评估的第六次更新对医疗保健能力饱和相关场景进行了建模，并对每个 EU/EEA 国家以及英国的住院 COVID-19 患者的患病率与超过重症监护床位量的风险 > 90% 之间的关系进行了估计。
en-mt: ECDC's sixth update to the COVID-19 rapid risk assessment models scenarios associated with healthcare capacity saturation and the prevalence and excess of intensive care beds for each EU/EEA country and the UK for hospitalized COVID-19 patients The relationship between the amount of risk > 90% was estimated.

sourceString: Since cases have so far clustered in certain regions in EU/EEA countries and the UK, and hospitals and intensive care units usually serve a defined regional catchment population, information about cases and intensive care beds should preferably be made available at the Nomenclature of territorial units for statistics 2 (NUTS-2) level.
targetString: 由于迄今为止病例聚集在 EU/EEA 国家以及 UK 的某些区域，并且医院和重症监护病房通常为确定区域的覆盖人口提供服务，因此最好在“标准统计地域单元 2” (NUTS-2) 层面提供有关病例和重症监护床位的信息。
en-mt: As cases have so far been clustered in EU/EEA countries and certain areas of the UK, and hospitals and intensive care units typically serve defined regional coverage populations, it is best to report at the 'Normal Statistical Territorial Unit 2' (NUTS-2) level Provides information on cases and intensive care beds.

sourceString: The experience from Italy and the current trends in other countries show that the COVID-19 pandemic is progressing rapidly in the EU/EEA and the UK.
targetString: 意大利的经验以及其他国家的当前趋势表明，EU/EEA 以及英国的 COVID-19 大流行病正在迅速发展。
en-mt: The experience of Italy, as well as current trends in other countries, shows that the COVID-19 pandemic is developing rapidly in the EU/EEA as well as in the UK.

sourceString: Countries, hospitals and intensive care units should thus prepare themselves for a scenario of sustained community transmission of SARS-CoV-2 and an increase in the number of patients with COVID-19 requiring healthcare, and in particular intensive care, such as the one occurring in the affected regions of Italy.
targetString: 因此，国家、医院和重症监护病房都应做好准备，以应对 SARS-CoV-2 持续社区传播以及需要医疗保健，尤其是重症监护的 COVID-19 患者人数增加的情况，例如意大利受影响地区出现的情况。
en-mt: Therefore, the country, hospitals and intensive care units should all be prepared to deal with sustained community transmission of SARS-CoV-2 and an increase in the number of COVID-19 patients requiring healthcare, especially intensive care, such as in the affected regions of Italy Case.

sourceString: As pointed out in the recent ECDC rapid risk assessment, a rapid, proactive and comprehensive approach is essential to delay the spread of SARS-COV-2, with a shift from a containment to a mitigation approach, as the anticipated rapid increase in the number of cases may not provide decision makers and hospitals enough time to comprehend, accept and adapt their response accordingly if not implemented ahead of time.
targetString: 正如最近的 ECDC 快速风险评估指出，快速、积极和全面的方法对于延缓 SARS-COV-2 的传播至关重要，需要从遏制过渡至缓解方法，因为如果不提前实施，预期病例数的快速增长可能让决策者和医院没有足够的时间来理解、接受和调整应对措施。
en-mt: As noted in the recent ECDC Rapid Risk Assessment, a rapid, aggressive and comprehensive approach is essential to slow the spread of SARS-COV-2, requiring a transition from a containment to a mitigation approach, as the expected rapid increase in case numbers could Leaving policy makers and hospitals insufficient time to understand, accept and adjust responses.

sourceString: The rapid risk assessment also lists the public health measures to mitigate the impact of the pandemic.
targetString: 快速风险评估还列出了缓解大流行病影响的公共卫生措施。
en-mt: The rapid risk assessment also lists public health measures to mitigate the impact of the pandemic.

sourceString: There is a short window of opportunity during which countries have the possibility to further increase their control efforts to slow down the spread of SARS-CoV-2 and decrease the pressure on healthcare.
targetString: 目前存在一个短暂的机会窗口，各国有可能借此进一步加大控制力度，以减缓 SARS-CoV-2 的传播速度并减轻对健康护理系统的压力。
en-mt: There is a short window of opportunity for countries to potentially further tighten containment efforts to slow the spread of SARS-CoV-2 and reduce pressure on healthcare systems.

sourceString: Failing this, it is likely that the healthcare systems of other EU/EEA countries will face a surge of patients that require intensive care within the coming days or weeks.
targetString: 否则，其他 EU/EEA 国家的医疗保健系统很可能在今后几天或几周内面临需要重症监护患者的激增。
en-mt: Otherwise, healthcare systems in other EU/EEA countries are likely to face a surge in patients requiring intensive care in the days and weeks to come.

sourceString: The outbreak of Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), has thus far killed over 3,000 people and infected over 80,000 in China and elsewhere in the world, resulting in catastrophe for humans.
targetString: 由严重急性呼吸系统综合征 (SARS) 冠状病毒 2 (SARS-CoV-2) 引起的 2019 冠状病毒疾病 (COVID-19) 爆发迄今已在中国及世界其他地区感染 80,000 多人，导致 3,000 多人死亡，造成巨大的人类灾难。
en-mt: The outbreak of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) has so far infected more than 80,000 people and killed more than 3,000 in China and elsewhere in the world , causing a huge human disaster.

sourceString: Similar to its homologous virus, SARS-CoV, which caused SARS in thousands of people in 2003, SARS-CoV-2 might also be transmitted from the bats and causes similar symptoms through a similar mechanism.
targetString: 与其同源病毒 SARS-CoV——在 2003 年导致成千上万人感染 SARS——相似，SARS-CoV-2 也可能由蝙蝠传播，并通过相仿的机制引起类似的症状。
en-mt: Similar to its homologous virus, SARS-CoV, which infected tens of thousands of people in 2003, SARS-CoV-2 may also be transmitted by bats and cause similar symptoms through similar mechanisms.

sourceString: However, COVID-19 has lower severity and mortality than SARS but is much more transmissive and affects more elderly individuals than youth and more men than women.
targetString: 虽然 COVID-19 的严重性和死亡率低于 SARS，但其传播性更强，受影响的老年人多于年轻人，男性多于女性。
en-mt: Although less severe and less fatal than SARS, COVID-19 is more transmissible, affecting more older than younger people, and more men than women.

sourceString: In response to the rapidly increasing number of publications on the emerging disease, this article attempts to provide a timely and comprehensive review of the swiftly developing research subject.
targetString: 鉴于新冠肺炎相关出版物迅速增加，本文欲对这个迅速发展的研究课题进行一次及时而全面的综述。
en-mt: Given the rapid increase in publications related to COVID-19, this article aims to provide a timely and comprehensive overview of this rapidly evolving research topic.

sourceString: We will cover the basics about the epidemiology, etiology, virology, diagnosis, treatment, prognosis, and prevention of the disease.
targetString: 我们将介绍有关该病的流行病学、病因学、病毒学、诊断、治疗、预后和预防的基本知识。
en-mt: We will cover the basics of the disease's epidemiology, etiology, virology, diagnosis, treatment, prognosis, and prevention.

sourceString: Although many questions still require answers, we hope that this review helps in the understanding and eradication of the threatening disease.
targetString: 虽然许多问题仍待解答，但我们希望本综述有助于理解和根除这种可怕的疾病。
en-mt: While many questions remain to be answered, we hope this review will contribute to the understanding and eradication of this dreadful disease.

sourceString: The Spring Festival on January 25, 2020 has become an unprecedented and unforgettable memory to all Chinese who were urged to stay indoors for all the holiday and for many weeks after due to the outbreak of a novel viral disease.
targetString: 2020 年 1 月 25 日的春节成为中国人前所未有而刻骨铭心的记忆，一种新型病毒性疾病的爆发迫使所有人在整个假期以及随后的多个星期足不出户。
en-mt: The Chinese New Year on January 25, 2020, was one of the most unprecedented and deep-rooted memories in China, when an outbreak of a new viral disease forced everyone to stay indoors for the entire holiday and the weeks that followed.

sourceString: The virus is highly homologous to the coronavirus (CoV) that caused an outbreak of severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) in 2003; thus, it was named SARS-CoV-2 by the World Health Organization (WHO) on February 11, 2020, and the associated disease was named CoV Disease-19 (COVID-19).
targetString: 这种病毒与 2003 年引起严重急性呼吸综合征 (SARS) 爆发的冠状病毒 (CoV) 具有高度同源性；因此，世界卫生组织 (WHO) 于 2020 年 2 月 11 日将其命名为 SARS-CoV-2，相关疾病被称为冠状病毒疾病-19 (COVID-19)。
en-mt: This virus has high homology to the coronavirus (CoV) that caused the severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) outbreak in 2003; therefore, the World Health Organization (WHO) named it SARS-CoV on February 11, 2020 -2, and the related disease is called Coronavirus Disease-19 (COVID-19).

sourceString: The epidemic started in Wuhan, China, and quickly spread throughout the entire country and to near 50 others all over the world.
targetString: 这场疫情始于中国武汉并迅速扩散到全国各地，然后蔓延到全球其他近 50 个国家。
en-mt: The outbreak started in Wuhan, China and quickly spread across the country and then to nearly 50 other countries around the world.

sourceString: As of March 2, 2020, the virus has resulted in over 80,000 confirmed cases of COVID-19, with more than 40,000 patients discharged and over 3,000 patients who died.
targetString: 截至 2020 年 3 月 2 日，该病毒已导致超过 80,000 名 COVID-19 确诊病例，其中 40,000 多名患者已出院，超过 3,000 名患者死亡。
en-mt: As of March 2, 2020, the virus has resulted in more than 80,000 confirmed cases of COVID-19, of whom more than 40,000 patients have been discharged from hospitals, and more than 3,000 patients have died.

sourceString: WHO warns that COVID-19 is “public enemy number 1” and potentially more powerful than terrorism.
targetString: WHO 警告 COVID-19 已成为“头号公敌”，其威胁可能超过恐怖主义。
en-mt: The WHO has warned that COVID-19 has become "public enemy number one," a threat that could surpass terrorism.

sourceString: According to PubMed (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/), in less than two months, over 200 papers have been published on COVID-19 including its virology, epidemiology, etiology, diagnosis, and treatment since the first report on January 7, 2020 that determined the sequence of the virus isolated from multiple patients.
targetString: 根据 PubMed (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/) 的数据，自 2020 年 1 月 7 日首次报告从多名患者体内分离出病毒序列以来，不到两个月的时间内已有 200 多篇有关 COVID-19 的论文发表，内容涉及病毒学、流行病学、病因学、诊断和治疗。
en-mt: According to PubMed (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/), less than two months have passed since the first reported isolation of viral sequences from multiple patients on January 7, 2020 More than 200 papers have been published on COVID-19, covering virology, epidemiology, etiology, diagnosis and treatment.

sourceString: This review attempts to summarize the research progress in the new and swiftly developing subject area.
targetString: 本文旨在总结这一新兴学科领域的研究进展。
en-mt: This article aims to summarize the research progress in this emerging discipline.

sourceString: Whenever possible, we will try to compare COVID-19 with SARS and another CoV-caused disease, Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS, an outbreak in 2012).
targetString: 人们习惯将 COVID-19 与 SARS 以及另一种由 CoV 引起的疾病——中东呼吸综合征（MERS，2012 年爆发）进行比较。
en-mt: People have traditionally compared COVID-19 to SARS and another disease caused by a CoV, the Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS, which broke out in 2012).

sourceString: We will also discuss what we have learned so far regarding the prevention and prognosis of the disease as well as some remaining yet urgent questions.
targetString: 我们还将讨论迄今为止关于该疾病预防和预后所学到的知识，以及一些尚待解决的紧迫问题。
en-mt: We'll also discuss what we've learned so far about the disease's prevention and prognosis, as well as some pressing questions that remain.

sourceString: CoVs have been traditionally considered nonlethal pathogens to humans, mainly causing approximately 15% of common colds 4.
targetString: 过去一直认为 CoV 是人类的非致命性病原体，主要引起约 15% 的普通感冒4。
en-mt: CoVs have historically been considered non-lethal pathogens in humans, primarily responsible for approximately 15% of common colds4.

sourceString: However, in this century, we have encountered highly pathogenic human CoVs twice, i.e., SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, which caused an outbreak originally in China in 2003 and Saudi Arabia in 2012, respectively, and soon spread to many other countries with horrible morbidity and mortality.
targetString: 但本世纪已经遇到了两次高致病性的人类 CoV，即 SARS-CoV 和 MERS-CoV，分别于 2003 年和 2012 年在中国和沙特阿拉伯爆发，很快扩散到许多其他国家，具有可怕的患病率和死亡率。
en-mt: But this century has already encountered two highly pathogenic human CoVs, SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, which broke out in China and Saudi Arabia in 2003 and 2012, respectively, and quickly spread to many other countries, with dire Morbidity and Mortality.

sourceString: Therefore, the current COVID-19 is the third CoV outbreak in the recorded history of humans.
targetString: 因此，此次 COVID-19 疫情是人类历史上记录的第三次 CoV 爆发。
en-mt: Therefore, this COVID-19 outbreak is the third CoV outbreak recorded in human history.

sourceString: As shown in Fig. ​Fig.1,1, clusters of pneumonia that had unknown origins were first reported from Wuhan on December 31, 2019 to the China National Health Commission.
targetString: 如图 1,1 所示，武汉市于 2019 年 12 月 31 日首先向中国国家卫生健康委员会报告了多名不明原因的肺炎病例。
en-mt: As shown in Figure 1,1, Wuhan City first reported multiple cases of pneumonia of unknown origin to the National Health Commission of China on December 31, 2019.

sourceString: Seven days later the sequence of the CoV was released.
targetString: 七天后，CoV 序列被公布。
en-mt: Seven days later, the CoV sequence was published.

sourceString: On January 15, 2020 the first fatal case from Wuhan was reported.
targetString: 2020 年 1 月 15 日，武汉报道了首例死亡病例。
en-mt: On January 15, 2020, Wuhan reported its first death.

sourceString: Meanwhile, the epidemic rapidly spread to the neighboring cities, provinces, and countries.
targetString: 与此同时，疫情迅速扩散到邻近的城市、省份和国家。
en-mt: At the same time, the outbreak spread rapidly to neighboring cities, provinces and countries.

sourceString: On January 20, the infection of health-care providers was reported, suggesting that human-to-human transmission was possible.
targetString: 1 月 20 日，报告医护人员感染，提示可能存在人传人现象。
en-mt: On January 20, the infection of medical staff was reported, suggesting that there may be human-to-human transmission.

sourceString: On January 23, the city of Wuhan was locked down with all its public transportation stopped.
targetString: 1 月 23 日，武汉市封城并关闭所有公共交通。
en-mt: On January 23, the city of Wuhan was locked down and all public transportation was closed.

sourceString: On January 24 the first clinical study on the disease reported that, out of 41 patients with confirmed cases, only 21 had direct contact with the Wuhan seafood market that was considered the starting site of the infection from an unknown animal source.
targetString: 1 月 24 日，针对新冠肺炎的第一项临床研究报告，在 41 名确诊病例中，只有 21 名与武汉华南海鲜市场有过直接接触，该市场被认为是不明动物来源感染的起点。
en-mt: On January 24, the first clinical study on COVID-19 reported that of the 41 confirmed cases, only 21 had direct contact with the Huanan Seafood Market in Wuhan, which is believed to be the starting point for infections of unknown animal origin.

sourceString: On January 30, WHO declared the outbreak a global health emergency.
targetString: 1 月 30 日，WHO 宣布此次爆发为“全球卫生紧急事件”。
en-mt: On January 30, the WHO declared the outbreak a "global health emergency."

sourceString: By the time of this report, the disease has already spread throughout China and near 50 other countries all over the world (Fig. ​(Fig.2).2).
targetString: 截至本报告发布之时，该疾病已经扩散至中国全境及全球其他近 50 个国家（图 2 ​(Fig.2)）。
en-mt: As of the publication of this report, the disease has spread throughout China and nearly 50 other countries around the world (Figure 2 ​(Fig.2)).

sourceString: As the situation is rapidly evolving, the final scope and severity of the outbreak remain to be determined.
targetString: 由于疫情迅速发展，此次爆发的最终范围和严重程度尚待确定。
en-mt: Due to the rapid development of the outbreak, the ultimate scope and severity of this outbreak has yet to be determined.

sourceString: On February 11, 2020, a multi-center study on 8,866 patients including 4,021 confirmed COVID-19 patients presented a more updated illustration of the epidemic as follows (https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/UlBi-HX_rHPXa1qHA2bhdA).
targetString: 2020 年 2 月 11 日，一项针对 8,866 名患者的多中心研究（包括 4,021 名确诊的 COVID-19 患者）提供了这种流行病的更新说明，如下所示 (https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s/UlBi-HX_rHPXa1qHA2bhdA)。
en-mt: On February 11, 2020, a multicenter study of 8,866 patients (including 4,021 patients with confirmed COVID-19) provided an updated account of the epidemic as follows (https://mp.weixin. qq.com/s/UlBi-HX_rHPXa1qHA2bhdA).

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 infected people of all ages, but mainly at the age of 30-65.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 能够感染所有年龄段人群，但主要年龄段为 30-65 岁。
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 can infect people of all ages, but the main age group is 30-65 years old.

sourceString: Almost half (47.7%) of the infected individuals were over 50 years old, very few were under 20, and only 14 infected individuals were under the age of 10.
targetString: 几乎一半 (47.7%) 的感染者年龄在 50 岁以上，极少数在 20 岁以下，只有 14 名感染者不满 10 岁。
en-mt: Almost half (47.7%) of the infected persons were over 50 years old, very few were under 20 years old, and only 14 infected persons were under 10 years old.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 infected more men (0.31/100,000) than women (0.27/100,000).
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 感染的男性（0.31/10 万）多于女性（0.27/10 万）。
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 infected more men (0.31/100,000) than women (0.27/100,000).

sourceString: COVID-19 expanded in clusters mainly in and around Hubei.
targetString: COVID-19 主要在湖北及周边地区聚集性传播。
en-mt: COVID-19 spread mainly in Hubei and surrounding areas.

sourceString: COVID-19 took an average of 5 (2-9) days from onset to diagnosis.
targetString: COVID-19 从发病到诊断平均需要 5 (2-9) 天时间。
en-mt: COVID-19 takes an average of 5 (2-9) days from onset to diagnosis.

sourceString: The average incubation period was 4.8 (3.0-7.2) days.
en-mt: The average incubation period was 4.8 (3.0-7.2) days.

sourceString: The average time from onset to death was 9.5 (4.8-13) days.
targetString: 从发病到死亡的平均时间为 9.5 (4.8-13) 天。
en-mt: The mean time from onset to death was 9.5 (4.8-13) days.

sourceString: The basic reproductive number (R0) was 3.77 (95% CI: 3.51-4.05), and the adjusted R0 was 2.23-4.82.
en-mt: The basic reproductive number (R0) was 3.77 (95% CI: 3.51-4.05), and the adjusted R0 was 2.23-4.82.

sourceString: The number of infected people increased exponentially before 23 Jan. 2020, matching the time of massive transportation before the Spring Festival in China.
targetString: 感染者数量在 2020 年 1 月 23 日之前呈指数级增长，与中国春节前的大规模人口流动时间相吻合。
en-mt: The number of infected people increased exponentially before January 23, 2020, coinciding with the timing of large-scale population movements before the Chinese New Year.

sourceString: The mortality of patients with confirmed cases was 1.44% (95% CI: 1.10-1.86%), and the adjusted mortality of all the patients was 3.06% (95% CI: 2.02-4.59%).
en-mt: The mortality rate for confirmed cases was 1.44% (95% CI: 1.10-1.86%), and the adjusted mortality rate for all patients was 3.06% (95% CI: 2.02-4.59%).

sourceString: Three major risk factors for COVID-19 were sex (male), age (≥60), and severe pneumonia.
targetString: COVID-19 的三个主要危险因素是性别（男性）、年龄（≥60 岁）和严重肺炎。
en-mt: The three main risk factors for COVID-19 are sex (male), age (≥60 years), and severe pneumonia.

sourceString: CoVs are a subfamily of large and enveloped viruses containing a single strand of sense RNA.
targetString: CoV 是一个包含单正义链 RNA 的大型包膜病毒亚家族。
en-mt: CoVs are a subfamily of large enveloped viruses that contain single-sense-strand RNA.

sourceString: They can be divided into four genera, i.e., alpha, beta, gamma, and delta, of which alpha- and beta-CoVs are known to infect humans.
targetString: 它们可分为四个属，即 α、β、γ 和 δ，其中 α-CoV 和 β-CoV 已知会感染人类。
en-mt: They can be grouped into four genera, α, β, γ, and δ, of which α-CoV and β-CoV are known to infect humans.

sourceString: The envelope spike (S) glycoprotein binds to its cellular receptors angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) and dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4) for SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, respectively, and then membrane fusion occurs.
targetString: SARS-CoV 和 MERS-CoV 的包膜刺突糖蛋白 (S) 与其细胞受体血管紧张素转换酶 2 (ACE2) 和二肽基肽酶 4 (DPP4) 结合，然后发生膜融合。
en-mt: The envelope spike glycoprotein (S) of SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV binds to its cellular receptors angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) and dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4), followed by membrane fusion.

sourceString: The viral RNA genome is released into the cytoplasm; after replication of the viral genome, genomic RNA accompanied by envelope glycoproteins and nucleocapsid proteins forms virion-containing vesicles, which then fuse with the plasma membrane to release the virus.
targetString: 病毒 RNA 基因组被释放到细胞质中；病毒基因组复制后，基因组 RNA 与包膜糖蛋白以及核衣壳蛋白一起形成含病毒体的囊泡，然后与质膜融合并释放病毒。
en-mt: The viral RNA genome is released into the cytoplasm; after viral genome replication, the genomic RNA together with the envelope glycoprotein and nucleocapsid protein form a virion-containing vesicle, which then fuses with the plasma membrane and releases the virus.

sourceString: The first genomic sequence of SARS-CoV-2 was reported on January 10, 2020.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 的第一个基因组序列已于 2020 年 1 月 10 日报道。
en-mt: The first genome sequence of SARS-CoV-2 was reported on January 10, 2020.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 was found to be a new type of beta-CoV with more than 99.98% genetic identity among 10 sequenced samples collected from the original site of the outbreak, the Huanan Seafood Market in Wuhan.
targetString: 结果发现，SARS-CoV-2 是一种新型 β-CoV，从最初爆发地点武汉市华南海鲜市场采集的 10 个测序样本中，基因一致性超过 99.98%。
en-mt: It was found that SARS-CoV-2 is a novel β-CoV with more than 99.98% genetic identity among 10 sequenced samples collected from the Huanan Seafood Market in Wuhan, where the initial outbreak occurred.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 is genetically more similar to SARS-CoV than to MERS-CoV.
targetString: 相对于 MERS-CoV，SARS-CoV-2 在基因方面与 SARS-CoV 更加相似。
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 is genetically more similar to SARS-CoV than MERS-CoV.

sourceString: Through transmission electron microscopy, SARS-CoV-2 particles were found in ultrathin sections of human airway epithelium.
targetString: 通过透射电子显微镜，已经在人气道上皮的超薄切片中发现了 SARS-CoV-2 颗粒。
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 particles have been identified in ultrathin sections of human airway epithelium by transmission electron microscopy.

sourceString: Human ACE2 was found to be a receptor for SARS-CoV-2 as well as SARS-CoV.
targetString: 研究发现，人 ACE2 是 SARS-CoV-2 以及 SARS-CoV 的受体。
en-mt: Studies have found that human ACE2 is the receptor of SARS-CoV-2 and SARS-CoV.

sourceString: However, the S protein of SARS-CoV-2 binds to human ACE2 more weakly than that of SARS-CoV, which is coincident with the fact that SARS-CoV-2 causes less severe infection in patients than SARS-CoV.
targetString: 但是，相对于 SARS-CoV，SARS-CoV-2 的 S 蛋白与人 ACE2 的结合力较弱，这与 SARS-CoV-2 导致的患者感染严重程度低于 SARS-CoV 的事实相吻合。
en-mt: However, compared with SARS-CoV, the S protein of SARS-CoV-2 has a weaker binding ability to human ACE2, which is consistent with the fact that the severity of patient infection caused by SARS-CoV-2 is lower than that of SARS-CoV.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 can also form a novel short protein encoded by orf3b and a secreted protein encoded by orf8.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 还可形成由 orf3b 编码的新型短蛋白以及由 orf8 编码的分泌蛋白。
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 also forms a novel short protein encoded by orf3b and a secreted protein encoded by orf8.

sourceString: The orf3b of SARS-CoV-2 may play a role in the viral pathogenicity and inhibit the expression of IFNβ; however, orf8 does not contain any known functional domain or motif.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 的 orf3b 可能在病毒致病性中发挥作用并抑制 IFNβ 的表达；但是，orf8 不包含任何已知的功能结构域或基序。
en-mt: orf3b of SARS-CoV-2 may play a role in viral pathogenicity and repress IFNβ expression; however, orf8 does not contain any known functional domains or motifs.

sourceString: On February 18, 2020, Zhou, et al., reported the cryo-EM structure of the full-length human ACE2 at 2.9 Å resolution in complex with the amino acid transporter B0AT1.
targetString: 2020 年 2 月 18 日，Zhou 等人报道了与氨基酸转运蛋白 B0AT1 形成复合物的全长人 ACE2 的冷冻电子显微镜 (cryo-EM) 结构，分辨率达到 2.9 Å。
en-mt: On February 18, 2020, Zhou et al. reported the cryo-electron microscopy (cryo-EM) structure of full-length human ACE2 in complex with the amino acid transporter B0AT1 at a resolution of 2.9 Å.

sourceString: They found that the complex, which had open and closed conformations, was assembled as a dimer and the ACE2-B0AT1 complex can bind two S proteins, which provides evidence for CoV recognition and infection.
targetString: 他们发现，该复合物具有开放和封闭的构象，被组装成二聚体，ACE2-B0AT1 复合物可以结合两个 S 蛋白，从而提供 CoV 识别和感染的证据。
en-mt: They found that the complex, which has an open and a closed conformation, is assembled into a dimer and that the ACE2-B0AT1 complex can bind two S proteins, providing evidence of CoV recognition and infection.

sourceString: B0AT1 may become a therapeutic target for drug screening to suppress SARS-CoV-2 infection.
targetString: B0AT1 可能成为药物筛选以抑制 SARS-CoV-2 感染的治疗靶点。
en-mt: B0AT1 may become a therapeutic target for drug screening to inhibit SARS-CoV-2 infection.

sourceString: The origin and intermediate host
targetString: 起源和中间宿主
en-mt: Origin and intermediate hosts

sourceString: It has been known that both SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV originated from bats and were transmitted to humans via civet cats and camels, respectively.
targetString: 众所周知，SARS-CoV 和 MERS-CoV 都起源于蝙蝠，并分别通过果子狸和骆驼传播给人类。
en-mt: Both SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV are known to have originated in bats and were transmitted to humans by civet cats and camels, respectively.

sourceString: Through a phylogenetic comparison of SARS-CoV-2 with other CoVs, bats were considered the native host of SARS-CoV-2 as the new virus is 96% identical to two SARS-like CoVs from bats called bat-SL-CoVZX45 and bat-SL-CoVZX21.
targetString: 通过 SARS-CoV-2 与其他 CoV 的系统发育比较，蝙蝠被认为是 SARS-CoV-2 的天然宿主，因为这种新病毒与来自蝙蝠的两种 SARS 样 CoV——分别名为 bat-SL-CoVZX45 和 bat-SL-CoVZX21——具有 96% 的一致性。
en-mt: Based on the phylogenetic comparison of SARS-CoV-2 with other CoVs, bats are considered to be the natural host of SARS-CoV-2 because this new virus is related to two SARS-like CoVs from bats—named bat-SL- CoVZX45 and bat-SL-CoVZX21 - 96% concordant.

sourceString: However, what intermediate host helped the virus cross the species barrier to infect humans remains unknown, and the transmission route is yet to be elucidated.
targetString: 但是，尚不清楚什么中间宿主帮助病毒跨越物种屏障感染人类，其传播途径也待阐明。
en-mt: However, it is not clear what intermediate host helps the virus cross the species barrier to infect humans, and its transmission route is also to be elucidated.

sourceString: Ji, et al., proposed snakes as a carrier of the virus from bats to humans which involved homologous recombination within the S protein.
targetString: Ji 等人提出蛇是从蝙蝠到人的病毒携带者，其中涉及 S 蛋白内部的同源重组。
en-mt: proposed that snakes are carriers of viruses from bats to humans, involving homologous recombination within the S protein.

sourceString: According to a study, researchers in Guangzhou, China, suggested that pangolins - long-snouted, ant-eating mammals often used in traditional Chinese medicine - are the potential intermediate host of SARS-CoV-2 based on 99% genetic homology in a CoV discovered in pangolins and SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: 根据一项研究，中国广州的研究人员认为，鉴于在穿山甲——一种长吻食蚁兽，经常用于中药——中发现的一种 CoV 与 SARS-CoV-2 具有 99% 的基因同源性，因此认为穿山甲是 SARS-CoV-2 的潜在中间宿主。
en-mt: Given that a CoV found in the pangolin — a long-nosed anteater often used in traditional Chinese medicine — is 99 percent genetically identical to SARS-CoV-2, researchers in Guangzhou, China believe, according to a study Therefore, it is considered that pangolins are potential intermediate hosts of SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: However, 1% difference spread all over two genomes is still a big difference; thus, conclusive results for concrete evidence are awaited (Fig. ​(Fig.33).
targetString: 但是，两个基因组之间 1% 的差异仍然是巨大的区别；因此，尚待具体证据提供决定性结果（图 ​(Fig.33）。
en-mt: However, a 1% difference between two genomes is still a substantial difference; therefore, concrete evidence is yet to provide conclusive results (Fig. (Fig.33).

sourceString: The physicochemical properties of SARS-CoV-2 are largely not yet known.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 的理化性质在很大程度上仍不清楚。
en-mt: The physicochemical properties of SARS-CoV-2 remain largely unknown.

sourceString: SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV can survive in vitro for 48 hours in a dry environment and up to 5 days under 20 °C and 40%-50% humidity.
targetString: SARS-CoV 和 MERS-CoV 在干燥环境中可以体外存活 48 小时，在 20 °C 和 40%-50% 湿度下最多可以存活 5 天。
en-mt: SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV can survive in vitro for 48 hours in a dry environment and up to 5 days at 20 °C and 40%-50% humidity.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 may possess similar properties.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 可能具有类似的性质。
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 may have similar properties.

sourceString: It has been reported that SARS-CoV-2 is sensitive to ultraviolet rays and heat at 56 °C for 30 minutes; ether, 75% ethanol, chlorine-containing disinfectant, peracetic acid, chloroform, and other fatty solvents, but not chlorhexidine, can effectively inactivate the virus.
targetString: 据报道，SARS-CoV-2 对紫外线以及热敏感——56 °C 30 分钟；乙醚、75% 乙醇、含氯消毒剂、过氧乙酸、氯仿和其他脂溶剂均可有效灭活病毒，但氯已定不能有效灭活病毒。
en-mt: It has been reported that SARS-CoV-2 is sensitive to ultraviolet rays as well as heat—56 °C for 30 minutes; diethyl ether, 75% ethanol, chlorine-containing disinfectants, peracetic acid, chloroform, and other lipid solvents can effectively inactivate the virus, but chlorine It has been determined that the virus cannot be effectively inactivated.

sourceString: The entire human population generally lacks immunity to SARS-CoV-2 and hence is susceptible to the novel virus.
targetString: 人类普遍缺乏对 SARS-CoV-2 的免疫力，因此对这种新型病毒易感。
en-mt: Humans generally lack immunity to SARS-CoV-2 and are therefore susceptible to this novel virus.

sourceString: Currently, no detailed study has been reported regarding the immunological response to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: 目前，尚无关于 SARS-CoV-2 的免疫应答的详细研究报道。
en-mt: Currently, there are no detailed research reports on the immune response to SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Thus, we can only refer to previous studies on other CoVs, especially SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV (Fig. ​(Fig.4).4).
targetString: 因此，我们只能参考以前关于其他 CoV 的研究，特别是 SARS-CoV 和 MERS-CoV（图 (Fig.4).4）。
en-mt: Therefore, we can only refer to previous studies on other CoVs, especially SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV (Fig. 4).

sourceString: In general, after a virus invades the host, it is first recognized by the host innate immune system through pattern recognition receptors (PRRs) including C-type lectin-like receptors, Toll-like receptor (TLR), NOD-like receptor (NLR), and RIG-I-like receptor (RLR).
targetString: 一般而言，病毒在入侵宿主后，首先会被宿主的固有免疫系统通过模式识别受体 (PRR) 识别，包括 C 型凝集素样受体、Toll 样受体 (TLR)、NOD 样受体 (NLR) 以及 RIG-I 样受体 (RLR)。
en-mt: Generally speaking, after the virus invades the host, it will first be recognized by the host's innate immune system through pattern recognition receptors (PRR), including C-type lectin-like receptors, Toll-like receptors (TLR), NOD-like receptors ( NLRs) and RIG-I-like receptors (RLRs).

sourceString: Through different pathways, the virus induces the expression of inflammatory factors, maturation of dendritic cells, and synthesis of type I interferons (IFNs) which limit the spreading of the virus and accelerate macrophage phagocytosis of viral antigens.
targetString: 病毒通过不同的通路诱导炎性因子表达、树突状细胞成熟以及 I 型干扰素 (IFN) 合成，它们会限制病毒的传播并加速病毒抗原的巨噬细胞吞噬。
en-mt: Viruses induce inflammatory cytokine expression, dendritic cell maturation, and type I interferon (IFN) synthesis through different pathways, which limit viral spread and accelerate macrophage phagocytosis of viral antigens.

sourceString: However, the N protein of SARS-CoV can help the virus escape from the immune responses.
targetString: 但是，SARS-CoV 的 N 蛋白可以帮助病毒摆脱免疫应答。
en-mt: However, the N protein of SARS-CoV helps the virus get rid of the immune response.

sourceString: Soon, the adaptive immune response joins the fight against the virus.
targetString: 适应性免疫应答会在不久之后加入抗击病毒的行列。
en-mt: The adaptive immune response joins the fight against the virus shortly thereafter.

sourceString: T lymphocytes including CD4+ and CD8+ T cells play an important role in the defense.
targetString: 包括 CD4+ 和 CD8+ T 细胞在内的 T 淋巴细胞在抗病毒防御中起着重要作用。
en-mt: T lymphocytes, including CD4+ and CD8+ T cells, play an important role in antiviral defense.

sourceString: CD4+ T cells stimulate B cells to produce virus-specific antibodies, and CD8+ T cells directly kill virus-infected cells.
targetString: CD4+ T 细胞刺激 B 细胞产生病毒特异性抗体，而 CD8+ T 细胞则直接杀死被病毒感染的细胞。
en-mt: CD4+ T cells stimulate B cells to produce virus-specific antibodies, while CD8+ T cells directly kill virus-infected cells.

sourceString: T helper cells produce proinflammatory cytokines to help the defending cells.
targetString: 辅助性 T 细胞产生促炎细胞因子来帮助上述防御细胞。
en-mt: T-helper cells produce pro-inflammatory cytokines to help the above-mentioned defense cells.

sourceString: However, CoV can inhibit T cell functions by inducing apoptosis of T cells.
targetString: 但是，CoV 可以通过诱导 T 细胞凋亡来抑制 T 细胞功能。
en-mt: However, CoV can suppress T cell function by inducing T cell apoptosis.

sourceString: The humoral immunity including complements such as C3a and C5a and antibodies is also essential in combating the viral infection.
targetString: 包括补体——例如 C3a 和 C5a——和抗体在内的体液免疫对于抵抗病毒感染也至关重要。
en-mt: Humoral immunity, including complement—such as C3a and C5a—and antibodies is also critical for resistance to viral infection.

sourceString: For example, antibodies isolated from a recovered patient neutralized MERS-CoV.
targetString: 例如，从已康复患者中分离的抗体能够中和 MERS-CoV。
en-mt: For example, antibodies isolated from recovered patients were able to neutralize MERS-CoV.

sourceString: On the other hand, an overreaction of the immune system generates a large number of free radicals locally that can cause severe damages to the lungs and other organs, and, in the worst scenario, multi-organ failure and even death.
targetString: 另一方面，免疫系统的过度反应会在局部产生大量自由基，这些自由基可能对肺和其他器官造成严重损害，在最坏的情况下，会导致多器官衰竭甚至死亡。
en-mt: On the other hand, an overreaction of the immune system can locally generate large amounts of free radicals that can cause severe damage to the lungs and other organs, and in worst cases, lead to multi-organ failure and even death.

sourceString: The SARS-CoV-2 infection, featured by clustering onset, is more likely to affect elderly people with comorbidities and pregnant women.
targetString: 以聚集性发病为特征的 SARS-CoV-2 感染更有可能影响存在多种合并症的老年人以及孕妇。
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 infection, characterized by clusters, is more likely to affect older adults with multiple comorbidities, as well as pregnant women.

sourceString: It is common that for people who are exposed to a large number of viruses or whose immune functions are compromised, they have higher chance to be infected than others.
targetString: 通常情况下，暴露于大量病毒或免疫功能受损的个体发生感染的机会要高于其他人。
en-mt: Typically, individuals who are exposed to large amounts of virus or who are immunocompromised have a higher chance of developing infection than others.

sourceString: The estimated mean incubation period of SARS-CoV-2 is 1-14 days, mostly 3-7 days based on a study of the first 425 cases in Wuhan.
targetString: 根据对武汉市最早 425 名病例进行的一项研究，SARS-CoV-2 的平均潜伏期估计为 1-14 天，大部分为 3-7 天。
en-mt: Based on a study of the earliest 425 cases in Wuhan, the average incubation period of SARS-CoV-2 was estimated to be 1-14 days, with most ranging from 3-7 days.

sourceString: However, a study on 1,099 cases demonstrates that the incubation period was 3 days on average and ranged from 0 to 24 days.
targetString: 但是，一项对 1,099 名病例的研究表明，平均潜伏期为 3 天，范围为 0 至 24 天。
en-mt: However, a study of 1,099 cases showed a mean incubation period of 3 days, with a range of 0 to 24 days.

sourceString: A more recent study, as described above, demonstrates that the incubation period was 4.8 (3.0-7.2) days based on the demography of 8,866 cases.
targetString: 如前所述，最近一项研究表明，根据 8,866 名病例的人口统计学，潜伏期为 4.8 (3.0-7.2) 天。
en-mt: As mentioned previously, a recent study showed an incubation period of 4.8 (3.0-7.2) days based on the demographics of 8,866 cases.

sourceString: It is very important for health authorities to adjust the effective quarantine time based on the most accurate incubation period, thus preventing infected but symptomless people from transmitting the virus to others.
targetString: 对于卫生部门来说，根据最准确的潜伏期调整有效的隔离时间非常重要，这样可以防止无症状感染者将病毒传播给其他人。
en-mt: It is very important for the health department to adjust the effective isolation time according to the most accurate incubation period, which can prevent asymptomatic infected persons from spreading the virus to others.

sourceString: As a common practice, individuals exposed to, or infected by, the virus are usually required to be quarantined for 14 days.
targetString: 作为惯例，病毒接触者或感染者通常需要隔离 14 天。
en-mt: As a rule, people who come into contact with or are infected with the virus usually need to quarantine for 14 days.

sourceString: Should the quarantine time be extended to 24 days?
targetString: 隔离时间是否应延长至 24 天？
en-mt: Should the quarantine period be extended to 24 days?

sourceString: Fever is often the major and initial symptom of COVID-19, which can be accompanied by no symptom or other symptoms such as dry cough, shortness of breath, muscle ache, dizziness, headache, sore throat, rhinorrhea, chest pain, diarrhea, nausea, and vomiting.
targetString: 发热通常是 COVID-19 的主要和首发症状，可以没有任何其他症状，也可以伴有干咳、气促、肌痛、头晕、头痛、咽痛、流涕、胸痛、腹泻、恶心以及呕吐等症状。
en-mt: Fever is usually the main and first symptom of COVID-19 and can be without any other symptoms or accompanied by dry cough, shortness of breath, myalgia, dizziness, headache, sore throat, runny nose, chest pain, diarrhea, nausea, and vomiting.

sourceString: Some patients experienced dyspnea and/or hypoxemia one week after the onset of the disease.
targetString: 一些患者在发病后一周出现呼吸困难和/或低氧血症。
en-mt: Some patients developed dyspnea and/or hypoxemia within a week of onset.

sourceString: In severe cases, patients quickly progressed to develop acute respiratory syndrome, septic shock, metabolic acidosis, and coagulopathy.
targetString: 严重者会迅速进展为急性呼吸窘迫综合征、脓毒性休克、代谢性酸中毒和凝血功能障碍。
en-mt: Severe cases will rapidly progress to acute respiratory distress syndrome, septic shock, metabolic acidosis and coagulation dysfunction.

sourceString: Patients with fever and/or respiratory symptoms and acute fever, even without pulmonary imaging abnormalities, should be screened for the virus for early diagnosis.
targetString: 即使没有肺部影像学异常，有发热和/或呼吸道症状和急性发热的患者也应进行病毒筛查以便进行早期诊断。
en-mt: Even without abnormal lung imaging, patients with fever and/or respiratory symptoms and acute fever should be screened for viruses for early diagnosis.

sourceString: A demographic study in late December of 2019 showed that the percentages of the symptoms were 98% for fever, 76% for dry cough, 55% for dyspnea, and 3% for diarrhea; 8% of the patients required ventilation support.
targetString: 2019 年 12 月下旬进行的一项人口统计学研究显示，各种症状的百分比为：发热 98%，干咳 76%，呼吸困难 55%，腹泻 3%；8% 的患者需要通气支持。
en-mt: In a demographic study conducted in late December 2019, the percentages for various symptoms were: fever 98%, dry cough 76%, dyspnea 55%, and diarrhea 3%; 8% of patients required ventilatory support.

sourceString: Similar findings were reported in two recent studies of a family cluster and a cluster caused by transmission from an asymptomatic individual.
targetString: 最近两项关于家庭聚集性发病以及无症状个体传播导致聚集发病的研究报道了类似的结果。
en-mt: Similar results were reported in two recent studies of familial clusters and transmission of asymptomatic individuals leading to clusters.

sourceString: Comparably, a demographic study in 2012 showed that MERS-CoV patients also had fever (98%), dry cough (47%), and dyspnea (55%) as their main symptoms.
targetString: 相比之下，2012 年进行的一项人口统计学研究显示，MERS-CoV 患者也以发热 (98%)、干咳 (47%) 和呼吸困难 (55%) 为主要症状。
en-mt: In contrast, a demographic study conducted in 2012 showed that MERS-CoV patients also had fever (98%), dry cough (47%), and dyspnea (55%) as the main symptoms.

sourceString: However, 80% of them required ventilation support, much more than COVID-19 patients and consistent with the higher lethality of MERS than of COVID-19.
targetString: 但是，其中 80% 的患者需要通气支持，远多于 COVID-19 患者，与 MERS 的致死率高于 COVID-19 相吻合。
en-mt: However, 80% of these patients required ventilatory support, much more than COVID-19 patients, consistent with the higher fatality rate of MERS than COVID-19.

sourceString: Diarrhea (26%) and sore throat (21%) were also observed with MERS patients.
targetString: 在 MERS 患者中还观察到腹泻 (26%) 和咽痛 (21%)。
en-mt: Diarrhea (26%) and sore throat (21%) were also observed in MERS patients.

sourceString: In SARS patients, it has been demonstrated that fever (99%-100%), dry cough (29%-75%), dyspnea (40%-42%), diarrhea (20-25%), and sore throat (13-25%) were the major symptoms and ventilation support was required for approximately 14%-20% of the patients.
targetString: 在 SARS 患者中，已经证明发热 (99%-100%)、干咳 (29%-75%)、呼吸困难 (40%-42%)、腹泻 (20-25%) 和咽痛 (13 -25%) 为主要症状，约 14%-20% 的患者需要通气支持。
en-mt: In SARS patients, fever (99%-100%), dry cough (29%-75%), dyspnea (40%-42%), diarrhea (20-25%), and sore throat (13-25%) have been demonstrated ) is the main symptom, and about 14%-20% of patients require ventilatory support.

sourceString: By February 14, the mortality of COVID-19 was 2% when the confirmed cases reached 66,576 globally.
targetString: 截至 2 月 14 日，全球已确诊 COVID-19 病例达到 66,576 例，死亡率为 2%。
en-mt: As of February 14, the number of confirmed COVID-19 cases worldwide reached 66,576, with a death rate of 2%.

sourceString: Comparably, the mortality of SARS by November 2002 was 10% of 8,096 confirmed cases.
targetString: 相比之下，截至 2002 年 11 月，SARS 在 8,096 名确诊病例中的死亡率为 10%。
en-mt: By comparison, as of November 2002, SARS had a 10 percent fatality rate among 8,096 confirmed cases.

sourceString: For MERS, based on a demographic study in June 2012, the mortality was 37% of 2,494 confirmed cases.
targetString: 对于 MERS，根据 2012 年 6 月进行的一项人口统计学研究，2,494 名确诊病例的死亡率为 37%。
en-mt: For MERS, based on a demographic study conducted in June 2012, the mortality rate among 2,494 confirmed cases was 37%.

sourceString: An earlier study reported that the R0 of SARS-CoV-2 was as high as 6.47 with a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 5.71-7.23, whereas the R0 of SARS-CoV only ranged from 2 to 4.
targetString: 一项早期研究报道，SARS-CoV-2 的 R0 高达 6.47，95% 置信区间 (CI) 为 5.71-7.23，而 SARS-CoV 的 R0 仅为 2 至 4。
en-mt: An earlier study reported that the R0 of SARS-CoV-2 was as high as 6.47 with a 95% confidence interval (CI) of 5.71-7.23, while the R0 of SARS-CoV was only 2 to 4.

sourceString: A comparison of SARS-CoV-2 with MERS-CoV and SARA-CoV regarding their symptoms, mortality, and R0 is presented in Table ​Table1.1.
targetString: 表 1.1 列出了 SARS-CoV-2 与 MERS-CoV 以及 SARA-CoV 在症状、死亡率和 R0 方面的比较。
en-mt: Table 1.1 lists the comparison of SARS-CoV-2 with MERS-CoV and SARA-CoV in terms of symptoms, mortality and R0.

sourceString: The above figures suggest that SARS-CoV-2 has a higher ability to spread than MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV, but it is less lethal than the latter two.
targetString: 以上数据表明，SARS-CoV-2 的扩散能力高于 MERS-CoV 和 SARS-CoV，但致死性要低于后两者。
en-mt: The above data show that SARS-CoV-2 has a higher spreading ability than MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV, but its lethality is lower than the latter two.

sourceString: Thus, it is much more challenging to control the epidemic of SARS-CoV-2 than those of MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV.
targetString: 因此，控制 SARS-CoV-2 疫情要比 MERS-CoV 和 SARS-CoV 更具挑战性。
en-mt: Therefore, controlling the SARS-CoV-2 outbreak is more challenging than MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Clustered onset often happens in the same family or from the same gathering or vehicle such as a cruise ship.
targetString: 聚集性发病通常发生在同一家庭中，或来自同一聚会或交通工具，例如游轮。
en-mt: Clusters of episodes usually occur within the same household, or from the same party or vehicle, such as a cruise ship.

sourceString: Patients often have a history of travel or residence in Wuhan or other affected areas or contact with infected individuals or patients in the recent two weeks before the onset.
targetString: 患者通常在发病前最近两周内有在武汉或其他疫情地区的旅行或居住史，或与感染者或患者有密切接触史。
en-mt: Patients usually have a history of travel or residence in Wuhan or other epidemic areas within the last two weeks before the onset of illness, or have a history of close contact with infected persons or patients.

sourceString: However, it has been reported that people can carry the virus without symptoms longer than two weeks and cured patients discharged from hospitals can carry the virus again, which sends out an alarm to increase the time for quarantine.
targetString: 然而，据报道人们可以携带这种病毒而没有症状超过两周，出院的已治愈患者可以再次携带该病毒，从而发出延长隔离时间的警报。
en-mt: However, it has been reported that people can carry the virus without symptoms for more than two weeks, and cured patients who have been discharged from hospitals can carry the virus again, raising the alarm for extended periods of isolation.

sourceString: Patients have normal or reduced number of peripheral white blood cells (especially lymphocytes) at the early stage.
targetString: 患者在发病早期的外周血白细胞（特别是淋巴细胞）数量正常或减少。
en-mt: The number of peripheral blood white blood cells (especially lymphocytes) in the early stage of the disease is normal or reduced.

sourceString: For example, lymphopenia with white blood cell count < 4×109/L including lymphocyte count < 1×109/L, and elevated aspartate aminotransferase levels and viremia were found in 1,099 COVID-19 patients.
targetString: 例如，在 1,099 名 COVID-19 患者中发现了白细胞计数 < 4×109/L——包括淋巴细胞计数 < 1×109/L——的淋巴细胞减少症、天冬氨酸氨基转移酶水平升高以及病毒血症。
en-mt: For example, lymphopenia, elevated aspartate aminotransferase levels with white blood cell counts < 4×109/L — including lymphocyte counts < 1×109/L — were found in 1,099 COVID-19 patients and viremia.

sourceString: The levels of liver and muscle enzymes and myoglobin were increased in the blood of some patients, and C-reactive protein and erythrocyte sedimentation were increased in the blood of most patients.
targetString: 部分患者可见血液中的肝酶和肌酶以及肌红蛋白水平升高，大多数患者可见血液 C 反应蛋白和血沉升高。
en-mt: In some patients, liver enzymes, muscle enzymes, and myoglobin levels in the blood increased, and in most patients, blood C-reactive protein and erythrocyte sedimentation rate increased.

sourceString: In patients with severe cases, the level of D-dimer, a fibrin degradation product present in the blood, was elevated, and lymphocyte count was progressively reduced.
targetString: 重型患者可见血液纤维蛋白降解产物 D-二聚体水平升高以及淋巴细胞计数进行性减少。
en-mt: Severe patients can see elevated levels of blood fibrin degradation product D-dimer and progressive decrease in lymphocyte count.

sourceString: Abnormalities in chest radiography are found in most COVID-19 patients and featured by bilateral patchy shadows or ground glass opacity in the lungs.
targetString: 大多数 COVID-19 患者可见胸部影像学异常，其特征为双侧斑片状阴影或肺部磨玻璃影。
en-mt: Chest imaging abnormalities, characterized by bilateral patchy opacities or ground-glass opacities in the lungs, are seen in most COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: Patients often develop an atypical pneumonia, acute lung injury, and acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).
targetString: 患者通常会出现非典型肺炎、急性肺损伤和急性呼吸窘迫综合征 (ARDS)。
en-mt: Patients often present with atypical pneumonia, acute lung injury, and acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).

sourceString: When ARDS happens, uncontrolled inflammation, fluid accumulation, and progressive fibrosis severely compromise the gas exchange.
targetString: 发生 ARDS 时，不受控制的炎症、液体积聚和进行性纤维化会严重损害气体交换。
en-mt: In ARDS, uncontrolled inflammation, fluid accumulation, and progressive fibrosis severely impair gas exchange.

sourceString: Dysfunction of type-I and type-II pneumocytes decreases the surfactant level and increases surface tension, thus reducing the ability of the lungs to expand and heightening the risk of lung collapse.
targetString: I 型和 II 型肺泡上皮细胞功能障碍会降低表面活性剂水平并增加表面张力，从而降低肺部扩张能力并增加肺部塌陷风险。
en-mt: Type I and II alveolar epithelial cell dysfunction reduces surfactant levels and increases surface tension, reducing the ability of the lungs to expand and increasing the risk of lung collapse.

sourceString: Therefore, the worst chest radiographic findings often parallel the most severe extent of the disease.
targetString: 因此，最糟糕的胸部影像学发现通常与疾病的最严重程度同时出现。
en-mt: Therefore, the worst chest imaging findings usually coincide with the most severe disease.

sourceString: On February 18, 2020, the first pathological analysis of COVID-19 demonstrated the desquamation of pneumocytes, hyaline membrane formation, and interstitial lymphocyte infiltration, and multinucleated syncytial cells in the lungs of a patient who died of the disease, consistent with the pathology of viral infection and ARDS and similar to that of SARS and MERS patients.
targetString: 2020 年 2 月 18 日，COVID-19 的首次病理学分析在死于该病的一名患者肺中发现了肺泡上皮细胞脱落、透明膜形成、间质淋巴细胞浸润以及多核合胞体细胞，与病毒感染以及 ARDS 的病理学表现一致，并且与 SARS 以及 MERS 患者相似。
en-mt: On February 18, 2020, the first pathological analysis of COVID-19 found desquamation of alveolar epithelial cells, hyaline membrane formation, interstitial lymphocyte infiltration, and multinucleated syncytial cells in the lungs of a patient who died of the disease, associated with viral The pathological manifestations of infection and ARDS were consistent and similar to those of SARS and MERS patients.

sourceString: The detection of SARS-CoV-2 RNA via reverse-transcriptase polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) was used as the major criteria for the diagnosis of COVID-19.
targetString: 通过逆转录聚合酶链反应 (RT-PCR) 检测 SARS-CoV-2 RNA 已用作诊断 COVID-19 的主要标准。
en-mt: Detection of SARS-CoV-2 RNA by reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) has been used as the main standard for the diagnosis of COVID-19.

sourceString: However, due to the high false-negative rate, which may accelerate the epidemic, clinical manifestations started to be used for diagnosis (which no longer solely relied on RT-PCR) in China on February 13, 2020.
targetString: 但是，由于较高的假阴性率可能会加速疫情，因此中国于 2020 年 2 月 13 日开始使用临床表现进行诊断（而不再单纯依靠 RT-PCR）。
en-mt: However, on February 13, 2020, China began using clinical manifestations for diagnosis (instead of relying solely on RT-PCR), as a high false-negative rate may hasten the outbreak.

sourceString: A similar situation also occurred with the diagnosis of SARS.
targetString: 诊断 SARS 时也发生了类似的情况。
en-mt: A similar situation occurred when diagnosing SARS.

sourceString: Therefore, a combination of disease history, clinical manifestations, laboratory tests, and radiological findings is essential and imperative for making an effective diagnosis.
targetString: 因此，结合病史、临床表现、实验室检查和影像学结果对于进行有效的诊断至关重要。
en-mt: Therefore, a combination of medical history, clinical presentation, laboratory tests, and imaging findings is essential for an effective diagnosis.

sourceString: On February 14, 2020, the Feng Zhang group described a protocol of using the CRISPR-based SHERLOCK technique to detect SARS-CoV-2, which detects synthetic SARS-CoV-2 RNA fragments at 20 × 10-18 mol/L to 200 × 10-18 mol/L (10-100 copies per microliter of input) using a dipstick in less than an hour without requiring elaborate instrumentation.
targetString: 2020 年 2 月 14 日，张峰团队报告了一种使用基于 CRISPR 的 SHERLOCK 技术检测 SARS-CoV-2 的方案，该方案无需复杂的仪器，使用一张试纸即可在不到一个小时的时间内检测到浓度仅为 20 × 10-18 mol/L 至 200 × 10-18 mol/L（每微升 10-100 个病毒拷贝）的合成 SARS-CoV-2 RNA 片段。
en-mt: On February 14, 2020, Zhang Feng's team reported a protocol for detecting SARS-CoV-2 using CRISPR-based SHERLOCK technology, which requires no complicated instruments and can be detected in less than an hour using a test strip Synthetic SARS-CoV-2 RNA fragments were detected at concentrations of only 20 × 10-18 mol/L to 200 × 10-18 mol/L (10-100 virus copies per microliter).

sourceString: Hopefully, the new technique can dramatically enhance the sensitivity and convenience if verified in clinical samples.
targetString: 如果在临床样本中得到验证，那么这种新技术有望大幅提高诊断的灵敏度和便利性。
en-mt: If validated in clinical samples, this new technique promises to greatly improve diagnostic sensitivity and convenience.

sourceString: Due to the lack of experience with the novel CoV, physicians can mainly provide supportive care to COVID-19 patients, while attempting a variety of therapies that have been used or proposed before for the treatment of other CoVs such as SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV and other viral diseases (Table ​(Table2).2).
targetString: 由于缺乏治疗新型 CoV 的经验，医生主要为 COVID-19 患者提供支持治疗，同时尝试曾经用于或提议用于其他 CoV——例如 SARS-CoV 和 MERS-CoV——和其他病毒性疾病的各种疗法（表 (Table2).2）。
en-mt: Due to lack of experience in treating novel CoVs, physicians are mainly providing supportive care for patients with COVID-19 while trying various treatments that have been used or proposed for other CoVs—such as SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV—and other viral diseases. Therapy (Table (Table2).2).

sourceString: These therapies include current and potential treatments with antiviral drugs, immunosuppressants, steroids, plasma from recovered patients, Chinese medicine, and psychological support.
targetString: 这些疗法包括当前和潜在的治疗方法，例如抗病毒药、免疫抑制剂、类固醇、已康复患者的血浆、中药和心理支持。
en-mt: These therapies include current and potential treatments such as antivirals, immunosuppressants, steroids, plasma from recovered patients, traditional Chinese medicine, and psychological support.

sourceString: Even plasma from recovered patients was proposed to be used for treatment.
targetString: 甚至建议将已康复患者的血浆用于治疗。
en-mt: It has even been suggested that plasma from recovered patients be used for treatment.

sourceString: Pharmaceutical companies are racing to develop antibodies and vaccines against the virus.
targetString: 制药公司正在竞相开发针对该病毒的抗体和疫苗。
en-mt: Pharmaceutical companies are racing to develop antibodies and vaccines against the virus.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 mainly attacks the lungs in the beginning and probably also attacks, to a lesser degree, other organs that express ACE2, such as the gastrointestinal system and the kidneys.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 在开始时主要攻击肺部，也可能以较低的程度攻击表达 ACE2 的其他器官，例如胃肠系统和肾脏。
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 initially attacks primarily the lungs and may also, to a lesser extent, attack other organs that express ACE2, such as the gastrointestinal system and kidneys.

sourceString: Nevertheless, respiratory dysfunction and failure are the major threat to the patients and the major cause of death.
targetString: 尽管如此，呼吸功能障碍和衰竭是对患者的主要威胁和主要死亡原因。
en-mt: Nonetheless, respiratory dysfunction and failure is a major threat to patients and a leading cause of death.

sourceString: Thus, respiratory support is critical to relieve the symptoms and save lives and includes general oxygen therapy, high-flow oxygen, noninvasive ventilation, and invasive mechanical ventilation depending on the severity of the disease.
targetString: 因此，呼吸支持对于缓解症状和挽救生命至关重要，包括常规吸氧、高流量吸氧、无创通气和有创机械通气，具体取决于疾病的严重程度。
en-mt: Therefore, respiratory support is essential to relieve symptoms and save lives, including conventional oxygen, high-flow oxygen, non-invasive ventilation, and invasive mechanical ventilation, depending on the severity of the disease.

sourceString: Patients with severe respiratory symptoms have to be supported by extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO), a modified cardiopulmonary bypass technique used for the treatment of life-threatening cardiac or respiratory failure.
targetString: 存在严重呼吸系统症状的患者必须接受体外膜氧合 (ECMO) 支持，这是一种改良的心肺旁路技术，用于治疗危及生命的心脏或呼吸衰竭。
en-mt: Patients with severe respiratory symptoms must receive extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) support, a modified cardiopulmonary bypass technique used to treat life-threatening cardiac or respiratory failure.

sourceString: In addition, the maintenance of electrolyte balance, the prevention and treatment of secondary infection and septic shock, and the protection of the functions of the vital organs are also essential for SARS-CoV-2 patients.
targetString: 此外，维持电解质平衡、预防和治疗继发感染和脓毒性休克以及保护重要器官功能对于 SARS-CoV-2 患者也是必不可少的。
en-mt: In addition, maintaining electrolyte balance, preventing and treating secondary infection and septic shock, and protecting vital organ functions are also essential for SARS-CoV-2 patients.

sourceString: It has been known that a cytokine storm results from an overreaction of the immune system in SARS and MERS patients.
targetString: 众所周知，SARS 和 MERS 患者的免疫系统反应过度会导致细胞因子风暴。
en-mt: It is well known that the immune system overreacts in patients with SARS and MERS, leading to a cytokine storm.

sourceString: Cytokine storm is a form of systemic inflammatory response featured by the release of a series of cytokines including TNFα, IL-1β, IL-2, IL-6, IFNα, IFNβ, IFNγ, and MCP-1.
targetString: 细胞因子风暴是全身炎症反应的一种形式，其特征为一系列细胞因子的释放，包括 TNFα、IL-1β、IL-2、IL-6、IFNα、IFNβ、IFNγ 和 MCP-1。
en-mt: Cytokine storm is a form of systemic inflammatory response characterized by the release of an array of cytokines, including TNFα, IL-1β, IL-2, IL-6, IFNα, IFNβ, IFNγ, and MCP-1.

sourceString: These cytokines induce immune cells to release a vast number of free radicals which are the major cause of ARDS and multiple organ failure.
targetString: 这些细胞因子会诱导免疫细胞释放大量自由基，这是 ARDS 和多器官衰竭的主要原因。
en-mt: These cytokines induce immune cells to release large amounts of free radicals, a major cause of ARDS and multi-organ failure.

sourceString: Immunosuppression is essential in the treatment of cytokine storms, especially in severe patients.
targetString: 免疫抑制在细胞因子风暴的治疗中至关重要，特别是在重症患者中。
en-mt: Immunosuppression is crucial in the treatment of cytokine storm, especially in critically ill patients.

sourceString: Corticosteroids and tocilizumab, an anti-IL6 monoclonal antibody, have been used to treat cytokine storm.
targetString: 皮质类固醇和托珠单抗——一种抗 IL6 单克隆抗体——已经被用于治疗细胞因子风暴。
en-mt: Corticosteroids and tocilizumab—an anti-IL6 monoclonal antibody—have been used to treat cytokine storms.

sourceString: Other immunosuppression treatments for cytokine storm include the modulation of T cell-directed immune response; the blockade of IFN-γ, IL-1, and TNF; JAK inhibition; blinatumomab; suppressor of cytokine signaling 4; and HDAC inhibitors.
targetString: 其他针对细胞因子风暴的免疫抑制疗法包括：调节 T 细胞定向免疫应答；阻断 IFN-γ、IL-1 和 TNF；抑制 JAK；博纳吐单抗；细胞因子信号转导抑制剂 4；以及 HDAC 抑制剂。
en-mt: Other immunosuppressive therapies for cytokine storm include: modulation of T cell-directed immune responses; blockade of IFN-γ, IL-1, and TNF; inhibition of JAK; blinatumomab; cytokine signaling inhibitor 4; and HDAC Inhibitors.

sourceString: Steroids, as immunosuppressants, were widely used in the treatment of SARS to reduce the severity of inflammatory damage.
targetString: 类固醇作为免疫抑制剂被广泛用于治疗 SARS，以减轻炎症损害的严重程度。
en-mt: Steroids were widely used in the treatment of SARS as immunosuppressants to reduce the severity of inflammatory damage.

sourceString: However, steroids at high dosages were not beneficial to severe lung injury in SARS and COVID-19 patients.
targetString: 但是，大剂量类固醇对 SARS 和 COVID-19 患者的严重肺损伤无益。
en-mt: However, high-dose steroids were not beneficial for severe lung injury in SARS and COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: Instead, they may cause severe side effects, especially avascular osteonecrosis, dramatically affecting the prognosis.
targetString: 相反，它们可能引起严重的副作用，尤其是缺血性骨坏死，从而严重影响预后。
en-mt: On the contrary, they may cause severe side effects, especially avascular osteonecrosis, which seriously affect the prognosis.

sourceString: Nevertheless, short courses of corticosteroids at low-to-moderate doses have been recommended to be used prudently for critically ill COVID-19 patients.
targetString: 尽管如此，仍然建议对危重症 COVID-19 患者谨慎使用中低剂量的皮质类固醇进行短程治疗。
en-mt: Nevertheless, it is still recommended to cautiously use low-to-moderate doses of corticosteroids for short-course treatment in critically ill COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: At the time of writing, no effective antiviral therapy has been confirmed.
targetString: 在撰写本文时，尚未证实存在有效的抗病毒疗法。
en-mt: At the time of writing, no proven effective antiviral therapy exists.

sourceString: However, intravenous administration with remdesivir, a nucleotide analog, has been found to be efficacious in an American patient with COVID-19.
targetString: 然而，已经发现瑞德西韦——一种核苷酸类似物——静脉给药对美国的一名 COVID-19 患者有效。
en-mt: However, intravenous administration of remdesivir -- a nucleotide analog -- has been found to be effective in a COVID-19 patient in the United States.

sourceString: Remdesivir is a novel antiviral drug developed by Gilead initially for the treatment of diseases caused by Ebola and Marlburg viruses.
targetString: 瑞德西韦是吉利德开发的一种新型抗病毒药物，最初用于治疗由埃博拉病毒和马尔堡病毒引起的疾病。
en-mt: Remdesivir is a new antiviral drug developed by Gilead, initially for the treatment of diseases caused by Ebola and Marburg viruses.

sourceString: Later, remdesivir also demonstrated possible inhibition of other single stranded RNA viruses including MERS and SARS viruses.
targetString: 后来，还证明瑞德西韦可能抑制其他单链 RNA 病毒，包括 MERS 和 SARS 病毒。
en-mt: Later, remdesivir was also shown to potentially inhibit other single-stranded RNA viruses, including MERS and SARS viruses.

sourceString: Based on these, Gilead has provided the compound to China to conduct a pair of trials on SARS-CoV-2-infected individuals, and the results are highly anticipated.
targetString: 基于这些原因，吉利德已将该药提供给中国，用于对 SARS-CoV-2 感染者进行两项临床试验，其结果令人期待。
en-mt: For these reasons, Gilead has provided the drug to China for two clinical trials in people infected with SARS-CoV-2, and the results are promising.

sourceString: In addition, baricitinb, interferon-α, lopinavir/ritonavir, and ribavirin have been suggested as potential therapies for patients with acute respiratory symptoms.
targetString: 另外，已经建议使用巴瑞克替尼、α-干扰素、洛匹那韦/利托那韦以及利巴韦林作为具有急性呼吸系统症状的患者的潜在疗法。
en-mt: Additionally, baricitinib, alpha-interferon, lopinavir/ritonavir, and ribavirin have been suggested as potential therapies for patients with acute respiratory symptoms.

sourceString: Diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, liver damage, and other adverse reactions can occur following combined therapy with lopinavir/ritonavir.
targetString: 洛匹那韦/利托那韦联合治疗后可能会出现腹泻、恶心、呕吐、肝损害和其他不良反应。
en-mt: Diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, liver damage and other adverse reactions may occur after lopinavir/ritonavir combination therapy.

sourceString: The interaction of these treatments with other drugs used in the patients should be monitored carefully.
targetString: 应仔细监测这些治疗方法与患者使用的其他药物之间的相互作用。
en-mt: Interactions between these treatments and other medications used by patients should be carefully monitored.

sourceString: Plasma from recovered patients and antibody generation
targetString: 已康复患者的血浆和抗体生成
en-mt: Plasma and antibody production in recovered patients

sourceString: The collection of the blood from patients who recovered from a contagious disease to treat other patients suffering from the same disease or to protect healthy individuals from catching the disease has a long history.
targetString: 从传染病中康复的患者收集血液用于治疗其他患有相同疾病的患者或保护健康个体免于感染该病已有悠久的历史。
en-mt: Patients who have recovered from an infectious disease have a long history of collecting blood to treat other patients with the same disease or to protect healthy individuals from contracting the disease.

sourceString: Indeed, recovered patients often have a relatively high level of antibodies against the pathogen in their blood.
targetString: 实际上，已康复的患者在其血液中通常含有相对较高水平针对病原体的抗体。
en-mt: In fact, recovered patients often have relatively high levels of antibodies against the pathogen in their blood.

sourceString: Antibodies are an immunoglobulin (Ig) produced by B lymphocytes to fight pathogens and other foreign objects and they recognize unique molecules in the pathogens and neutralize them directly.
targetString: 抗体是由 B 淋巴细胞产生的用于对抗病原体和其他异物的一种免疫球蛋白 (Ig)，它们可以识别病原体中的独特分子并直接中和它们。
