en-mt: As of March 3, 2020, 90,053 cases have been confirmed worldwide, with a crude case fatality rate of 3.4%.

sourceString: Notably, the case fatality in Hubei, China is 4.2%, whereas the one outside of it is 1.2%.
targetString: 值得注意的是，中国湖北的病死率为 4.2%，而湖北以外地区的病死率为 1.2%。
en-mt: It is worth noting that the case fatality rate in Hubei, China is 4.2%, while the case fatality rate outside Hubei is 1.2%.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 causes severe respiratory infection like SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, presented as fever, cough and dyspnea.
targetString: 与 SARS-CoV 和 MERS-CoV 一样，SARS-CoV-2 可导致严重的呼吸道感染，表现为发热、咳嗽和呼吸困难。
en-mt: Like SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, SARS-CoV-2 can cause a severe respiratory infection manifested by fever, cough and difficulty breathing.

sourceString: Diarrhea is also seen in some patients.
targetString: 部分患者还会出现腹泻。
en-mt: Some patients also experience diarrhea.

sourceString: Pneumonia is one of the most severe symptoms and can progress rapidly to acute respiratory distress syndrome.
targetString: 肺炎是最严重的症状之一，可迅速发展为急性呼吸窘迫综合征。
en-mt: Pneumonia is one of the most serious symptoms and can rapidly develop into acute respiratory distress syndrome.

sourceString: Although SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 are very similar due to high nucleotide sequence homology of 82%, they cluster into different branches in the phylogenetic tree.
targetString: 尽管由于 82% 的高核苷酸序列同源性，SARS-CoV 和 SARS-CoV-2 非常相似，但它们在系统发育树中聚类到不同分支。
en-mt: Although SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 are very similar due to a high 82% nucleotide sequence identity, they clustered into different clades in the phylogenetic tree.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 is apparently less pathogenic but more transmissible compared to SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV.
targetString: 与 SARS-CoV 和 MERS-CoV 相比，SARS-CoV-2 的致病性明显较低，但传染性更强。
en-mt: Compared with SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, SARS-CoV-2 is significantly less pathogenic but more infectious.

sourceString: Asymptomatic subjects infected with SARS-CoV-2 have been reported and might contribute to its rapid spreading around the world.
targetString: 据报道出现了SARS-CoV-2无症状感染者，这可能加速了该病毒在全世界的迅速传播。
en-mt: Reports of asymptomatic SARS-CoV-2 infection may have contributed to the rapid spread of the virus around the world.

sourceString: Comparing and contrasting SARS-CoV-2 with the other six HCoVs reveal similarities and differences of great interest.
targetString: 将 SARS-CoV-2 与其他 6 种 HCoV 进行比较和对照，我们可以发现非常有趣的相似性和差异性。
en-mt: Comparing and contrasting SARS-CoV-2 with the other 6 HCoVs, we can find very interesting similarities and differences.

sourceString: First, the incubation period and the duration of the course of HCoV disease are very similar.
targetString: 首先，HCoV 疾病的潜伏期和病程持续时间都非常相似。
en-mt: First, both the incubation period and the duration of the course of HCoV disease are very similar.

sourceString: In this regard, SARS-CoV-2 follows the general trend of the other six HCoVs.
targetString: 在这点上，SARS-CoV-2 与其他 6 种 HCoV 的总体趋势一致。
en-mt: In this regard, SARS-CoV-2 is consistent with the general trend of the other 6 HCoVs.

sourceString: Second, the severity of symptoms of COVID-19 lies between SARS-CoV and the four community-acquired HCoVs (i.e. HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-NL63).
targetString: 其次，COVID-19 症状的严重程度介于 SARS-CoV 与 4 种社区获得性 HCoV（即 HCoV-229E、HCoV-OC43、HCoV-HKU1 和 HCoV-NL63）之间。
en-mt: Second, the severity of COVID-19 symptoms was intermediate between SARS-CoV and 4 community-acquired HCoVs (ie, HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1, and HCoV-NL63).

sourceString: On one hand, SARS-CoV-2 infection exhibits features that are more commonly seen during infection with community-acquired HCoVs, including the presentation of non-specific, mild or even no symptoms.
targetString: 一方面，SARS-CoV-2 感染表现出的特征在社区获得性 HCoV 感染中更为常见，包括非特异性、轻度甚至无症状的表现。
en-mt: On the one hand, SARS-CoV-2 infection exhibits features more commonly seen in community-acquired HCoV infection, including nonspecific, mild or even asymptomatic presentation.

sourceString: On the other hand, a small subset of severe cases of COVID-19 can also be seen as in the case of SARS-CoV infection, although the ratio is a bit lower.
targetString: 另一方面，一小部分严重的 COVID-19 病例同样见于 SARS-CoV 感染病例中，尽管比例略低。
en-mt: On the other hand, a small proportion of severe COVID-19 cases was also seen in SARS-CoV infection cases, albeit in a slightly lower proportion.

sourceString: Third, the transmission of SARS-CoV-2 also shows interesting patterns characteristic of both community-acquired HCoVs and SARS-CoV.
targetString: 第三，SARS-CoV-2 的传播也显示出了社区获得性 HCoV 和 SARS-CoV 的有趣模式特征。
en-mt: Third, the spread of SARS-CoV-2 also showed interesting patterns characteristic of community-acquired HCoV and SARS-CoV.

sourceString: On one hand, the transmissibility of SARS-CoV-2 is at least as high as that of community-acquired HCoVs.
targetString: 一方面，SARS-CoV-2 的可传播性至少与社区获得性 HCoV 一样高。
en-mt: On the one hand, SARS-CoV-2 is at least as transmissible as community-acquired HCoV.

sourceString: On the other hand, it remains to be verified whether the transmissibility of SARS-CoV-2 decreases after passages in humans as in the cases of SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV.
targetString: 另一方面，SARS-CoV-2 的可传播性是否会像 SARS-CoV 和 MERS-CoV 一样，在人类传代后下降，仍有待验证。
en-mt: On the other hand, whether the transmissibility of SARS-CoV-2 will decline after passage in humans, like SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, remains to be verified.

sourceString: Finally, same as the other HCoVs, SARS-CoV-2 can be detected in fecal samples.
targetString: 最后，与其他 HCoV 一样，可以在粪便样本中检测到 SARS-CoV-2。
en-mt: Finally, like other HCoVs, SARS-CoV-2 can be detected in stool samples.

sourceString: Whether fecal-oral transmission of SARS-CoV-2 plays an important role as in the case of SARS-CoV at least under some circumstance remains to be clarified by future studies.
targetString: 至少在某些情况下，SARS-CoV-2 的粪-口传播是否如同在 SARS-CoV 中一样起着重要作用，仍有待未来研究的澄清。
en-mt: Whether fecal-oral transmission of SARS-CoV-2 plays an important role, at least in some cases, as in SARS-CoV, remains to be clarified by future studies.

sourceString: It is also of particularly great interest to see whether SARS-CoV-2 might exhibit seasonality as in the cases of community-acquired HCoVs.
targetString: 另外，观察 SARS-CoV-2 是否像社区获得性 HCoV 一样具有季节性也非常重要。
en-mt: Also, it will be important to see whether SARS-CoV-2 is seasonal like community-acquired HCoV.

sourceString: Nevertheless, the features of SARS-CoV-2 including its transmissibility, pathogenicity and sustainable spreading after passages in humans will be influential on the ultimate fate of the ongoing outbreak of COVID-19.
targetString: 然而，SARS-CoV-2的传播性、致病性和经人传代后的持续传播等特点，将对当前 COVID-19 疫情的最终命运产生重要影响。
en-mt: However, the characteristics of SARS-CoV-2, such as transmissibility, pathogenicity, and continuous transmission after human passage, will have an important impact on the ultimate fate of the current COVID-19 epidemic.

sourceString: All four community-acquired HCoVs causing mild symptoms have been well adapted to humans.
targetString: 所有 4 种引起轻微症状的社区获得性 HCoV 都已很好地适应了人类。
en-mt: All four community-acquired HCoVs that cause mild symptoms have adapted well to humans.

sourceString: From another perspective, it might also be true that humans have been well adapted to these four HCoVs.
targetString: 从另一个角度看，人类也已经很好地适应了这 4 种 HCoV。
en-mt: From another perspective, humans have also adapted well to these 4 HCoVs.

sourceString: In other words, both could be the survivors of ancient HCoV pandemics.
targetString: 换而言之，双方都可能是古代 HCoV 大流行的幸存者。
en-mt: In other words, both parties may be survivors of ancient HCoV pandemics.

sourceString: HCoVs that cause severe diseases in humans and humans who developed severe HCoV diseases have been eliminated.
targetString: 导致人类严重疾病的 HCoV 和患上严重 HCoV 疾病的人都已消亡。
en-mt: Both the HCoVs that caused severe disease in humans and the people who developed severe HCoV disease died out.

sourceString: For this to happen, HCoVs have to replicate in humans to sufficient extent to allow the accumulation of adaptive mutations that counteract host restriction factors.
targetString: 为此，HCoV 必须在人类中进行足够的复制，以积累适应性突变，从而对抗宿主限制因子。
en-mt: For this to happen, HCoV must replicate sufficiently in humans to accumulate adaptive mutations against host restriction factors.

sourceString: In this sense, the longer the SARS-CoV-2 outbreak persists and the more people that it infects, the greater chance that it will fully adapt to humans.
targetString: 从这个意义上而言，SARS-CoV-2 疫情持续的时间越长，感染的人数越多，它完全适应人类的可能性就越大。
en-mt: In this sense, the longer the SARS-CoV-2 outbreak lasts and the more people it infects, the more likely it is that it will fully adapt to humans.

sourceString: If it adapts well, its transmission in humans would be difficult to stop by quarantine or other infection control measures.
targetString: 如果它能良好适应，那么它在人类中的传播将很难通过隔离或其他感染控制措施来阻止。
en-mt: If it adapts well, its spread in humans will be very difficult to stop through quarantine or other infection control measures.

sourceString: For many years, the four community-acquired CoVs circulate in human populations, triggering common cold in immunocompetent subjects.
targetString: 多年来，这 4 种社区获得性冠状病毒在人群中散播，导致免疫功能正常的人患上普通感冒。
en-mt: Over the years, these 4 community-acquired coronaviruses have circulated among people, causing the common cold in immunocompetent people.

sourceString: These viruses do not need an animal reservoir.
targetString: 这些病毒不需要动物宿主。
en-mt: These viruses do not require an animal host.

sourceString: In contrast, highly pathogenic SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV have not adapted to humans well and their transmission within humans cannot be sustained.
targetString: 相比之下，高致病性 SARS-CoV 和 MERS-CoV 还没有很好地适应人类，也无法在人类中持续传播。
en-mt: In contrast, highly pathogenic SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV have not adapted well to humans and cannot sustain transmission in humans.

sourceString: They need to maintain and propagate in their zoonotic reservoirs and seek the chance to spillover to susceptible human targets, possibly via one or more intermediate and amplifying hosts.
targetString: 它们需要在人畜共患病宿主中维生及繁衍，并可能通过一个或多个中间宿主和扩大宿主，寻找机会散播给易受感染的人类目标。
en-mt: They need to survive and reproduce in a zoonotic host, and may seek opportunities to spread to susceptible human targets through one or more intermediate hosts and amplifying hosts.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 has features that are similar to both SARS-CoV/MERS-CoV and the four community-acquired HCoVs.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 具有与 SARS-CoV/MERS-CoV 和 4 种社区获得性 HCoV 相似的特征。
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 has similar characteristics to SARS-CoV/MERS-CoV and 4 community-acquired HCoVs.

sourceString: It is highly transmissible like community-acquired HCoVs, at least for the time being.
targetString: 它与社区获得性 HCoV 一样具有高度传染性，至少目前如此。
en-mt: It is as highly contagious as community-acquired HCoV, at least for now.

sourceString: However, it is more pathogenic than community-acquired HCoVs and less pathogenic than SARS-CoV or MERS-CoV.
targetString: 但是，它比社区获得性 HCoV 的致病性更高，比 SARS-CoV 或 MERS-CoV 的致病性更低。
en-mt: However, it is more pathogenic than community-acquired HCoV and less pathogenic than SARS-CoV or MERS-CoV.

sourceString: It remains to be seen whether it will adapt fully to humans and circulate within humans without a reservoir or intermediate animal host.
targetString: 它是否能完全适应人类，并在没有宿主或中间动物宿主的情况下在人类内部循环传播，仍有待观察。
en-mt: Whether it can fully adapt to humans and circulate within humans in the absence of hosts or intermediate animal hosts remains to be seen.

sourceString: Before discussing the animal origins of HCoVs, it will serve us well to discuss the definitions and characteristics of evolutionary, natural, reservoir, intermediate and amplifying hosts of HCoVs.
targetString: 在讨论 HCoV 的动物起源之前，先讨论 HCoV 的进化宿主、自然宿主、贮存宿主、中间宿主和扩大宿主的定义与特征，对我们有一定的指导意义。
en-mt: Before discussing the animal origin of HCoV, it is instructive to discuss the definitions and characteristics of the evolutionary host, natural host, storage host, intermediate host, and expanded host of HCoV.

sourceString: An animal serves as the evolutionary host of an HCoV if it harbours a closely related ancestor sharing high homology at the level of nucleotide sequence.
targetString: 如果某一动物具有在核苷酸序列水平上高度同源的密切相关祖先，则该动物将成为 HCoV 的进化宿主。
en-mt: If an animal has closely related ancestors with high homology at the nucleotide sequence level, the animal will become the evolutionary host of HCoV.

sourceString: The ancestral virus is usually well adapted and non-pathogenic in this host.
targetString: 祖先病毒通常在此宿主中适应性强且无致病性。
en-mt: The ancestral virus is usually well-adapted and non-pathogenic in this host.

sourceString: Likewise, a reservoir host harbours HCoV continuously and for long term.
targetString: 同样，贮存宿主也会长期持续地携带 HCoV。
en-mt: Similarly, reservoir hosts also carry HCoV persistently for a long time.

sourceString: In both cases, the hosts are naturally infected and are the natural hosts of HCoV or its parental virus.
targetString: 在这两种情况下，宿主都是自然感染的，并且是 HCoV 或其亲代病毒的自然宿主。
en-mt: In both cases, the host is naturally infected and is the natural host of HCoV or its parent virus.

sourceString: In contrast, if the HCoV is newly introduced to an intermediate host right before or around its introduction to humans, it is not well adapted to the new host and is often pathogenic.
targetString: 相比之下，如果 HCoV刚刚寄生于中间宿主不久后或马上又寄生于人体，那它将无法很好地适应新宿主，并且通常具有致病性。
en-mt: In contrast, if HCoV parasitizes the human body shortly after or immediately after parasitizing an intermediate host, it will not adapt well to the new host and is usually pathogenic.

sourceString: This intermediate host can serve as the zoonotic source of human infection and play the role of an amplifying host by allowing the virus to replicate transiently and then transmitting it to humans to amplify the scale of human infection.
targetString: 这种中间宿主可以充当人类感染的人畜共患病源，并通过允许病毒短暂复制，然后将其传播给人类以扩大人类感染的规模，从而发挥放大宿主的作用。
en-mt: This intermediate host can act as a zoonotic source of human infection and act as an amplification host by allowing the virus to replicate briefly and then transmit it to humans to scale up human infection.

sourceString: An HCoV can undergo a dead-end infection if it cannot sustain its transmission within the intermediate host.
targetString: 如果 HCoV 不能在中间宿主内维持其传播，则可能会发生终端感染。
en-mt: Terminal infection may occur if HCoV cannot sustain its transmission within an intermediate host.

sourceString: On the contrary, HCoVs can also adapt to the intermediate host and even establish long-term endemicity.
targetString: 相反，HCoV 也可以适应中间宿主，甚至建立长期的地方性。
en-mt: Conversely, HCoV can also adapt to intermediate hosts and even establish long-term endemicity.

sourceString: In this case, the intermediate host becomes a natural reservoir host.
targetString: 在这种情况下，中间宿主变成了自然贮存宿主。
en-mt: In this case, the intermediate host becomes the natural reservoir host.

sourceString: Epidemiological data revealed retrospectively that the index case of SARS had a contact history with game animals.
targetString: 流行病学数据回顾性分析发现，SARS 的索引病例与狩猎动物有接触史。
en-mt: A retrospective analysis of epidemiological data found that the index case of SARS had a history of contact with hunting animals.

sourceString: Subsequent seroprevalence investigations indicated that animal traders had a higher prevalence of anti-SARS-CoV IgG compared with that of the general population.
targetString: 随后的血清阳性率调查表明，与一般人群相比，动物商贩体内抗SARS-CoV的免疫球蛋白G（IgG）水平更高。
en-mt: Subsequent seropositivity surveys showed higher levels of immunoglobulin G (IgG) against SARS-CoV in animal traders compared with the general population.

sourceString: Masked palm civets (Paguma larvata) and a racoon dog in live animal markets were first identified to carry SARS-CoV-like viruses that are almost identical to SARS-CoV.
targetString: 在活体动物市场上，果子狸（花面狸）和一只狸猫首次被发现携带了与 SARS-CoV 病毒几乎完全相同的 SARS-CoV 样病毒。
en-mt: For the first time in a live animal market, civet cats (Civet cat) and a civet cat were found to carry a SARS-CoV-like virus almost identical to the SARS-CoV virus.

sourceString: This was indirectly supported by the fact that no further SARS was reported after killing all civets in the markets.
targetString: 在清除掉市场中的所有果子狸后，没有进一步的 SARS 报告，这一事实间接支持了上述观点。
en-mt: This view is indirectly supported by the fact that there were no further reports of SARS after all civet cats had been removed from the market.

sourceString: However, it has been reported that masked palm civets from the wild or farms without exposure to the live animal markets were largely negative for SARS-CoV, suggesting that masked palm civets might only serve as the intermediate amplifying host but not the natural reservoir of SARS-CoV.
targetString: 然而，报告称，野生或未接触活体动物市场的农场果子狸对 SARS-CoV 的检测基本呈阴性，这表明果子狸可能只是中间放大宿主，而不是 SARS-CoV 的自然宿主。
en-mt: However, farm civet cats that were wild or not exposed to live animal markets tested largely negative for SARS-CoV, suggesting that civet cats may be intermediate amplification hosts rather than natural reservoirs of SARS-CoV, the report said.

sourceString: Notably, since 80% of the different animals in the markets in Guangzhou have anti-SARS-CoV antibodies, the possibilities that multiple species of small mammals might also serve as intermediate amplifying hosts of SARS-CoV cannot be excluded.
targetString: 值得注意的是，由于广州市场上 80% 的不同动物都有 SARS-CoV 抗体，因此不能排除多种小型哺乳动物也可能充当 SARS-CoV 中间扩大宿主的可能。
en-mt: It is worth noting that since 80% of different animals in the Guangzhou market have antibodies to SARS-CoV, it cannot be ruled out that a variety of small mammals may also act as intermediate hosts for SARS-CoV expansion.

sourceString: All of these appear to be dead-end hosts of SARS-CoV.
targetString: 所有这些动物似乎都是 SARS-CoV 的终端宿主。
en-mt: All of these animals appear to be terminal hosts of SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Subsequent search for the natural animal host of SARS-CoV unveiled a closely related bat CoV, termed SARS-related Rhinolophus bat CoV HKU3 (SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3), which exists in Chinese horseshoe bats.
targetString: 随后对 SARS-CoV 自然动物宿主的研究发现了一种密切相关的蝙蝠冠状病毒，称为和SARS相关的菊头蝠冠状病毒HKU3 (SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3)，存活于中华菊头蝠体内。
en-mt: Subsequent studies on the natural animal host of SARS-CoV discovered a closely related bat coronavirus, called SARS-related horseshoe bat coronavirus HKU3 (SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3), which survived in Chinese horseshoe bats.

sourceString: These bats are positive for anti-SARS-CoV antibodies and genome sequence of SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3.
targetString: 这些蝙蝠对 SARS-CoV 抗体和 SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3 的基因组序列呈阳性。
en-mt: These bats were positive for SARS-CoV antibodies and the genome sequence of SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3.

sourceString: This and other bat CoVs share 88-92% nucleotide sequence homology with SARS-CoV.
targetString: 该病毒及其他蝙蝠冠状病毒与 SARS-CoV 具有 88-92% 的核苷酸序列同源性。
en-mt: This virus and other bat coronaviruses share 88-92% nucleotide sequence identity with SARS-CoV.

sourceString: These studies have laid the foundation for the new concept that bats host emerging human pathogens.
targetString: 这些研究为蝙蝠是新出现的人类病原体的宿主这一新概念奠定了基础。
en-mt: These studies provide the basis for the new concept that bats are hosts of emerging human pathogens.

sourceString: Several SARS-like CoVs (SL-CoVs) have also been identified from bats, but none except for one designated WIV1 can be isolated as live virus.
targetString: 此外，研究者还从蝙蝠中鉴定出多种 SARS 样冠状病毒 (SL-CoV)，但除一种指定的 WIV1 外，没有任何病毒可以作为活病毒分离出来。
en-mt: In addition, we identified multiple SARS-like coronaviruses (SL-CoVs) from bats, but none could be isolated as live viruses except for one designated WIV1.

sourceString: Human angiotensin converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) is known to be the receptor of SARS-CoV.
targetString: 人血管紧张素转换酶 2 (ACE2) 是已知的 SARS-CoV 的受体。
en-mt: Human angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) is a known receptor for SARS-CoV.

sourceString: WIV1 derived from fecal sample of bats was demonstrated to use bat, civet and human ACE2 as receptor for cell entry.
targetString: 实验证明，从蝙蝠粪便样本中提取的 WIV1 使用蝙蝠、果子狸和人 ACE2 作为其进入细胞的受体。
en-mt: The experiments demonstrated that WIV1 extracted from bat fecal samples uses bat, civet, and human ACE2 as its receptor for cell entry.

sourceString: Intriguingly, sera of convalescent SARS patients were capable of neutralizing WIV1.
targetString: 有趣的是， SARS 恢复期患者的血清能够中和 WIV1。
en-mt: Interestingly, serum from convalescent SARS patients was able to neutralize WIV1.

sourceString: Thus far, WIV1 represents the most closely related ancestor of SARS-CoV in bats, sharing 95% nucleotide sequence homology.
targetString: 迄今为止，WIV1 是与蝙蝠 SARS-CoV 最接近的祖先，具有 95% 的核苷酸序列同源性。
en-mt: To date, WIV1 is the closest ancestor to bat SARS-CoV, sharing 95% nucleotide sequence identity.

sourceString: Albeit the high homology between these two viruses, it is generally believed that WIV1 is not the immediate parental virus of SARS-CoV and bats are not the immediate reservoir host of SARS-CoV.
targetString: 尽管这两种病毒高度同源，但通常认为 WIV1 不是 SARS-CoV 的直接亲代病毒，蝙蝠也不是 SARS-CoV 的直接贮存宿主。
en-mt: Although the two viruses are highly homologous, it is generally believed that WIV1 is not the direct parent virus of SARS-CoV, nor is bat the direct reservoir host of SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Phylogenetic analysis clusters MERS-CoV to the same group as bat CoV-HKU4 and bat CoV-HKU5.
targetString: 系统发育分析将 MERS-CoV 与蝙蝠 CoV-HKU4 和蝙蝠 CoV-HKU5 归为同一组。
en-mt: Phylogenetic analysis placed MERS-CoV in the same group as bat CoV-HKU4 and bat CoV-HKU5.

sourceString: Bat CoV-HKU4 and MERS-CoV utilize the same host receptor, dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4), for virus entry.
targetString: 蝙蝠 CoV-HKU4 和 MERS-CoV 利用相同的宿主受体二肽基肽酶4 (DPP4) 侵入病毒。
en-mt: Bat CoV-HKU4 and MERS-CoV utilize the same host receptor dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4) for viral entry.

sourceString: RNA-dependent RNA polymerase sequences of MERS-CoV are phylogenetically closer to counterparts in bat beta-CoVs identified from Europe and Africa.
targetString: MERS-CoV 的 RNA 依赖性 RNA 聚合酶序列在系统发育上与来自欧洲和非洲的蝙蝠 β-CoV 中的对应 RNA 更接近。
en-mt: The RNA-dependent RNA polymerase sequence of MERS-CoV is phylogenetically closer to the corresponding RNA in bat β-CoVs from Europe and Africa.

sourceString: Up to now, no live MERS-CoV can be found in wild bats.
targetString: 到目前为止，未在野生蝙蝠体内发现活的 MERS-CoV。
en-mt: So far, no live MERS-CoV has been found in wild bats.

sourceString: MERS-CoV and its closest relative bat CoV-HKU25 share only 87% nucleotide sequence homology.
targetString: MERS-CoV 与它的近亲蝙蝠 CoV-HKU25 仅具有 87% 的核苷酸序列同源性。
en-mt: MERS-CoV shares only 87% nucleotide sequence identity with its close relative, bat CoV-HKU25.

sourceString: Thus, bats might not be the immediate reservoir host of MERS-CoV.
targetString: 因此，蝙蝠可能不是 MERS-CoV 的直接贮存宿主。
en-mt: Therefore, bats may not be the direct reservoir host of MERS-CoV.

sourceString: On the other hand, studies in Middle East have shown that dromedary camels are seropositive for MERS-CoV-specific neutralizing antibodies, same as camels of Middle East origin in multiple African countries.
targetString: 另一方面，中东的研究表明，单峰驼对 MERS-CoV 特异性中和抗体的血清呈阳性，与多个非洲国家的起源于中东的骆驼一样。
en-mt: On the other hand, studies in the Middle East showed that dromedary camels were seropositive for MERS-CoV-specific neutralizing antibodies, as were camels of Middle Eastern origin in several African countries.

sourceString: Live MERS-CoV identical to the virus found in humans was isolated from the nasal swabs of dromedary camels, further indicating that camels serve as the bona fide reservoir host of MERS-CoV.
targetString: 从单峰驼的鼻拭子中分离出的活 MERS-CoV与人体发现的病毒相同，这进一步表明骆驼是 MERS-CoV 真正的贮存宿主。
en-mt: Live MERS-CoV isolated from nasal swabs of dromedary camels was identical to that found in humans, further suggesting that camels are a true reservoir of MERS-CoV.

sourceString: It is also noteworthy that generally mild symptoms but massive virus shedding were observed in camels experimentally infected with MERS-CoV.
targetString: 同样需要指出的是，在实验性感染 MERS-CoV 的骆驼中，一般症状轻微，但观察到大量病毒脱落。
en-mt: It should also be noted that in camels experimentally infected with MERS-CoV, symptoms were generally mild, but substantial viral shedding was observed.

sourceString: Notably, infected camels shed viruses not only through respiratory route but also through fecal-oral route, which is also the main route for virus shedding from bats.
targetString: 值得注意的是，受感染的骆驼不仅通过呼吸道传播病毒，还通过粪口途径传播病毒，而粪口途径也是蝙蝠散发病毒的主要途径。
en-mt: It is worth noting that infected camels not only transmitted the virus through the respiratory tract, but also transmitted the virus through the fecal-oral route, which is also the main route for bats to shed the virus.

sourceString: However, questions still remain since many confirmed cases of MERS have no contact history with camels prior to symptom onset, plausibly ascribed to human-to-human transmission or unknown transmission routes involving unrecognized animal species that harbour MERS-CoV.
targetString: 然而，问题仍然存在，因为许多 MERS 确诊病例在症状出现之前并没有与骆驼的接触史，这可能归因于人传人或未知的传播途径，包括未被识别的携带 MERS-CoV 的动物物种。
en-mt: However, questions remain because many of the confirmed MERS cases had no history of exposure to camels prior to the onset of symptoms, which may be attributable to human-to-human or unknown transmission routes, including unrecognized animal species carrying MERS-CoV.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 shares 96.2% nucleotide homology with a bat CoV RaTG13 isolated from Rhinolophus affinis bats.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 与从中菊头蝠分离出的蝙蝠 CoV RaTG13 具有 96.2% 的核苷酸同源性。
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 shares 96.2% nucleotide identity with the bat CoV RaTG13 isolated from Rhizoma chinensis.

sourceString: As in the cases of SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, the sequence divergence between SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 is too great to assign parental relationship.
targetString: 与 SARS-CoV 和 MERS-CoV 的情况一样，SARS-CoV-2 和 RaTG13 之间的序列差异太大，无法确定亲代关系。
en-mt: As in the case of SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, the sequence divergence between SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 was too great to determine parental relationship.

sourceString: That is to say, bats might not be the immediate reservoir host(s) of SARS-CoV-2 unless almost identical bat CoVs are found in future.
targetString: 换言之，除非未来发现几乎相同的蝙蝠冠状病毒，否则蝙蝠可能不是 SARS-CoV-2 的直接贮存宿主。
en-mt: In other words, unless nearly identical bat coronaviruses are discovered in the future, bats may not be the immediate reservoir of SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Presumably, the intermediate animal hosts of SARS-CoV-2 should be among the wildlife species sold and killed at the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, with which many of the initial cases of COVID-19 were associated, indicative of a probable animal-to-human transmission event.
targetString: 据推测，SARS-CoV-2 的中间动物宿主应在华南海鲜批发市场出售和宰杀的野生动物物种中，许多最初的 COVID-19 病例都与之有关，这表明可能发生了动物到人类的传播事件。
en-mt: The presumed intermediate animal host of SARS-CoV-2 should be among the wild animal species sold and slaughtered at the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, which has been linked to many of the initial COVID-19 cases, suggesting a possible animal-to-human transmission event .

sourceString: Several recent studies based on metagenomic sequencing have suggested that a group of endangered small mammals known as pangolins (Manis javanica) could also harbour ancestral beta-CoVs related to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: 最近几项基于宏基因组测序的研究表明，一种被称为穿山甲（马来穿山甲）的濒危小型哺乳动物也可能携带与 SARS-CoV-2 相关的祖先 β-CoV。
en-mt: Several recent studies based on metagenomic sequencing suggest that a small endangered mammal known as the pangolin (Malayan pangolin) may also carry an ancestral β-CoV related to SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: These novel pangolin CoV genomes share 85-92% nucleotide sequence homology with SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: 这些新的穿山甲冠状病毒基因组与 SARS-CoV-2 具有 85-92% 的核苷酸序列同源性。
en-mt: These novel pangolin coronavirus genomes share 85-92% nucleotide sequence identity with SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: However, they are equally closely related to RaTG13 with about 90% identity at the level of nucleotide sequence.
targetString: 但它们与 RaTG13 的关系同样密切，在核苷酸序列水平上约有 90% 的同源性。
en-mt: But they are equally closely related to RaTG13, sharing about 90% homology at the nucleotide sequence level.

sourceString: They cluster into two sub-lineages of SARS-CoV-2-like viruses in the phylogenetic tree, one of which share a more similar receptor binding domain (RBD) with SARS-CoV-2, with 97.4% amino acid sequence identity.
targetString: 在系统发育树中，它们被归类为两个 SARS-CoV-2 样病毒亚系，其中一个与 SARS-CoV-2 有更相似的受体结合域 (RBD)，并具有 97.4% 的氨基酸序列同源性。
en-mt: In the phylogenetic tree, they were classified as two SARS-CoV-2-like virus sublineages, one of which had a receptor binding domain (RBD) more similar to SARS-CoV-2 and shared 97.4% amino acid sequence homology.

sourceString: In stark contrast, the RBDs of SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 are more divergent, albeit a higher degree of sequence homology genome-wide.
targetString: 与之形成鲜明对比的是，SARS-CoV-2 和 RaTG13 的 RBD 差异更大，尽管二者全基因组的序列同源性更高。
en-mt: In stark contrast, the RBDs of SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 were more divergent, despite higher sequence homology across their genomes.

sourceString: An earlier study on diseased pangolins also reported the detection of viral contigs from lung samples, which turn out to be similarly related to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: 早前的一项关于患病穿山甲的研究也报告了从肺样本中检测到病毒重叠群，结果也与 SARS-CoV-2 有类似的关系。
en-mt: An earlier study of diseased pangolins also reported the detection of viral contigs from lung samples that also had a similar relationship to SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: This study adopted different assembly methods and manual curation to generate a partial genome sequence comprising about 86.3% of the full-length viral genome.
targetString: 这项研究采用了不同的组装方法和人工处理，获得了约占病毒全基因组 86.3% 的部分基因组序列。
en-mt: This study used different assembly methods and manual processing to obtain a partial genome sequence accounting for about 86.3% of the virus's full genome.

sourceString: We cannot exclude the possibility that pangolin is one of the intermediate animal hosts of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: 我们无法排除穿山甲是 SARS-CoV-2 中间动物宿主之一的可能。
en-mt: We cannot rule out the possibility that pangolins are one of the intermediate animal hosts of SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: However, currently there is no evidence in support of a direct pangolin origin of SARS-CoV-2 due to the sequence divergence between SARS-CoV-2 and pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs.
targetString: 然而，由于 SARS-CoV-2 与穿山甲 SARS-CoV-2 相关的 β-CoV 序列存在差异，因此目前尚无证据表明 SARS-CoV-2 直接来源于穿山甲。
en-mt: However, there is currently no evidence that SARS-CoV-2 is directly derived from pangolins due to differences in the sequence of β-CoVs related to SARS-CoV-2 and pangolin SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: In addition, the distance between SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 is even shorter than that between SARS-CoV-2 and pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs.
targetString: 此外，SARS-CoV-2 与 RaTG13 之间的距离甚至比 SARS-CoV-2 与穿山甲 SARS-CoV-2 相关的 β-CoV 之间的距离更短。
en-mt: Furthermore, the distance between SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 is even shorter than the distance between SARS-CoV-2 and the β-CoV related to SARS-CoV-2 in pangolins.

sourceString: The evolutionary pathway of SARS-CoV-2 in bats, pangolins and other mammals remains to be established.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 在蝙蝠、穿山甲和其他哺乳动物中的进化路径仍有待确定。
en-mt: The evolutionary path of SARS-CoV-2 in bats, pangolins, and other mammals remains to be determined.

sourceString: Whereas the highest sequence homology has been found in the RBDs between SARS-CoV-2 and pangolin, SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs, SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 share the highest genome-wide sequence homology.
targetString: 尽管在 SARS-CoV-2 和穿山甲之间的 RBD 中发现了最高的序列同源性，但 SARS-CoV-2 相关的 β-CoV、SARS-CoV-2 和 RaTG13 具有最高的全基因组序列同源性。
en-mt: Although the highest sequence homology was found in the RBD between SARS-CoV-2 and pangolin, the SARS-CoV-2-related β-CoV, SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 have the highest whole-genome sequence homology sex.

sourceString: It is highly speculative that the high degree of similarity between the RBDs of pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs and SARS-CoV-2 is driven by selectivity-mediated convergent evolution.
targetString: 可以高度推测的是，穿山甲 SARS-CoV-2 相关 β-CoV 与 SARS-CoV-2 的 RBD 之间的高度相似性是由选择性介导的趋同进化引起的。
en-mt: It is highly speculative that the high similarity between pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related β-CoV and the RBD of SARS-CoV-2 is caused by selectivity-mediated convergent evolution.

sourceString: A counter-proposal is in favour of a recombination between a pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoV and RaTG13 in the third wild animal species.
targetString: 另一种相反的观点是，穿山甲 SARS-CoV-2 相关的 β-CoV 与 RaTG13 在第三种野生动物物种中重组。
en-mt: Another opposing view is that pangolin SARS-CoV-2-related β-CoV recombines with RaTG13 in a third wild animal species.

sourceString: As a driving force in evolution, recombination is widespread among beta-CoVs.
targetString: 作为进化的驱动力，重组在 β-CoV 中广泛存在。
en-mt: As a driving force of evolution, recombination is widespread in β-CoV.

sourceString: The jury is still out on the immediate zoonotic origin of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: 关于 SARS-CoV-2 的直接人畜共患病起源，目前尚无定论。
en-mt: The jury is still out on the direct zoonotic origin of SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Besides the highly pathogenic HCoVs, the zoonotic origin of HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-NL63 and HCoV-HKU1 have also been studied.
targetString: 除了高致病性 HCoV 外，研究者还研究了 HCoV-229E、HCoV-OC43、HCoV-NL63 和 HCoV-HKU1 的人畜共患病起源。
en-mt: In addition to highly pathogenic HCoVs, the researchers also investigated the zoonotic origins of HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-NL63, and HCoV-HKU1.

sourceString: Phylogenetic evidence indicated that both HCoV-NL63 and HCoV-229E might have originated from bat CoVs, while the parental viruses of HCoV-OC43 and HCoV-HKU1 have been found in rodents.
targetString: 系统发育学证据表明，HCoV-NL63 和 HCoV-229E 可能都起源于蝙蝠冠状病毒，而 HCoV-OC43 和 HCoV-HKU1 的亲代病毒也已在啮齿动物中发现。
en-mt: Phylogenetic evidence suggests that both HCoV-NL63 and HCoV-229E may have originated from bat coronaviruses, while parental viruses of HCoV-OC43 and HCoV-HKU1 have also been found in rodents.

sourceString: It has been reported that a bat CoV termed ARCoV.2 (Appalachian Ridge CoV) detected in North American tricolored bat displayed close relationship with HCoV-NL63.
targetString: 报告称，在北美三色蝙蝠中发现的称为ARCoV.2 (Appalachian Ridge CoV) 的蝙蝠冠状病毒显示与 HCoV-NL63 密切相关。
en-mt: A bat coronavirus called ARCoV.2 (Appalachian Ridge CoV) found in North American tricolor bats was shown to be closely related to HCoV-NL63, the report said.

sourceString: On the other hand, HCoV-229E was genetically related to another bat CoV, termed Hipposideros/GhanaKwam/19/2008, which was detected in Ghana, while camelids have also been suspected as its intermediate host.
targetString: 另一方面，HCoV-229E 与在加纳发现的另一种蝙蝠冠状病毒（称为Hipposideros/GhanaKwam/19/2008）有基因上的联系，而骆驼科动物也被怀疑是其中间宿主。
en-mt: On the other hand, HCoV-229E is genetically related to another bat coronavirus (known as Hipposideros/GhanaKwam/19/2008) found in Ghana, and camelids are also suspected as its intermediate host.

sourceString: For clarity, the current knowledge on animal origins of known HCoVs is summarized in Figure ​1 and Table 2.
targetString: 为清楚起见，图 1 和表 2 总结了有关已知 HCoV 的动物起源的现有知识。
en-mt: For clarity, Figure 1 and Table 2 summarize current knowledge about the animal origin of known HCoVs.

sourceString: Phylogenetic analysis has provided evidence for interspecies transmission events of HCoVs in the history.
targetString: 系统发育分析为历史上 HCoV 的种间传播事件提供了证据。
en-mt: Phylogenetic analysis provided evidence for historical HCoV interspecies transmission events.

sourceString: When HCoV-OC43 crossed species to infect humans from domestic livestock around 1890, a pandemic of respiratory infection was recorded.
targetString: 在 1890 年前后，当 HCoV-OC43 从家畜跨物种感染人类时，就出现了呼吸道传染病的大流行。
en-mt: Around 1890, when HCoV-OC43 crossed species from domestic animals to humans, a pandemic of respiratory infections occurred.

sourceString: The interspecies transmission history of HCoV-229E is less clear.
targetString: HCoV-229E 的种间传播历史尚不明朗。
en-mt: The history of interspecies transmission of HCoV-229E is unclear.

sourceString: Bat alpha-CoVs closely related to HCoV-229E have been found.
targetString: 与HCoV-229E密切相关的蝙蝠α-CoV已被发现。
en-mt: A bat α-CoV closely related to HCoV-229E has been identified.

sourceString: Between them there is an alpaca alpha-CoV.
targetString: 在二者之间出现了一种羊驼 α-CoV。
en-mt: An alpaca α-CoV emerged between the two.

sourceString: Several lines of evidence support the transmission of virus from bats to humans directly.
targetString: 有多条证据支持病毒从蝙蝠直接传播给人类。
en-mt: Multiple lines of evidence support direct transmission of the virus from bats to humans.

sourceString: First, humans but not alpacas might have contact with bats in a shared ecological niche.
targetString: 首先，人类而非羊驼，可能会在共同的生态位中与蝙蝠接触。
en-mt: First, humans, but not alpacas, likely came into contact with bats in a shared ecological niche.

sourceString: Instead, humans have close contact with alpacas.
targetString: 相反的是，人类与羊驼有着密切的接触。
en-mt: In contrast, humans have close contact with alpacas.

sourceString: Second, HCoV-229E-related bat alpha-CoVs are diverse and non-pathogenic in bats, whereas alpaca alpha-CoV caused an outbreak of respiratory disease in infected animals.
targetString: 其次，与 HCoV-229E 相关的蝙蝠 α-CoV 在蝙蝠中具有多样性和非致病性，而羊驼 α-CoV 则在受感染动物中引起了呼吸道疾病的爆发。
en-mt: Second, bat α-CoV related to HCoV-229E is diverse and non-pathogenic in bats, while alpaca α-CoV caused outbreaks of respiratory disease in infected animals.

sourceString: Finally, alpaca alpha-CoV has not been found in feral animals.
targetString: 最后，未在野生动物中发现羊驼 α-CoV。
en-mt: Finally, alpaca α-CoV was not found in wild animals.

sourceString: Thus, the possibility cannot be excluded that alpacas obtain the HCoV-229E-related alpha-CoV from humans.
targetString: 因此，不能排除羊驼从人类中获得 HCoV-229E 相关的 α-CoV 的可能性。
en-mt: Therefore, the possibility that alpacas acquired HCoV-229E-related α-CoV from humans cannot be ruled out.

sourceString: In fact, bats are the direct source of human pathogenic viruses including rabies virus, Ebola virus, Nipah virus and Hendra virus.
targetString: 事实上，蝙蝠是包括狂犬病毒、埃博拉病毒、尼帕病毒和亨德拉病毒在内的人类致病性病毒的直接来源。
en-mt: In fact, bats are the direct source of human pathogenic viruses including rabies, Ebola, Nipah and Hendra.

sourceString: It is therefore not too surprising that bats might transmit HCoV-229E to humans directly.
targetString: 因此，蝙蝠将 HCoV-229E 直接传播给人类也就不足为奇了。
en-mt: Therefore, it is not surprising that bats transmit HCoV-229E directly to humans.

sourceString: Alternatively, whereas bat alpha-CoVs serve as the gene pool of HCoV-229E, alpacas and dromedary camels might serve as intermediate hosts that transmit viruses to humans, exactly as in the case of MERS-CoV.
targetString: 或者，尽管蝙蝠 α-CoV 充当着 HCoV-229E 的基因库，但羊驼和单峰驼可能是将病毒传播给人类的中间宿主，这与 MERS-CoV 的情况完全相同。
en-mt: Alternatively, although bat α-CoV serves as the gene pool for HCoV-229E, alpacas and dromedaries may be intermediate hosts that transmit the virus to humans, exactly as is the case with MERS-CoV.

sourceString: MERS-CoV serves as an excellent example of interspecies transmission from bats to dromedary camels and from dromedary camels to humans.
targetString: MERS-CoV 很好地说明了从蝙蝠到单峰驼以及从单峰驼到人类的种间传播。
en-mt: Interspecies transmission from bats to dromedary camels and from dromedary camels to humans is well illustrated by MERS-CoV.

sourceString: The evolutionary origin of MERS-CoV from bats is known at its initial identification and has also been strengthened by subsequent findings.
targetString: 蝙蝠的 MERS-CoV 进化起源在其最初的鉴定中就已为人所知，随后的发现也强化了这一论点。
en-mt: The evolutionary origin of MERS-CoV in bats was known from its initial identification, and subsequent discoveries have strengthened this argument.

sourceString: It is obvious that bats provide a rich pool of virus species for interspecies exchange of genetic fragments and interspecies transmission.
targetString: 显然，蝙蝠为基因片段的种间交换和种间传播提供了丰富的病毒种类库。
en-mt: Apparently, bats provide a rich pool of virus species for the interspecies exchange and interspecies transmission of gene fragments.

sourceString: Longevity, densely packed colonies, close social interaction and strong ability to fly are all favourable conditions for bats to be an ideal 'virus spreader'.
targetString: 长寿且密集的群体、紧密的社会性互动和强大的飞行能力都是蝙蝠成为理想的“病毒传播者”的有利条件。
en-mt: Long-lived and dense groups, close social interaction and strong flight ability are all favorable conditions for bats to become ideal "virus spreaders".

sourceString: On the other hand, MERS-CoV has been introduced to dromedary camels for decades.
targetString: 另一方面，MERS-CoV 进入单峰驼体内已有数十年时间。
en-mt: MERS-CoV, on the other hand, has been in dromedary camels for decades.

sourceString: It is well adapted to these camels that have turned from an intermediate host to a stable and natural reservoir host.
targetString: 它很好地适应了这些骆驼，而骆驼也已从中间宿主变成稳定的自然贮存宿主。
en-mt: It has adapted well to these camels, which have also changed from intermediate hosts to stable natural storage hosts.

sourceString: MERS-CoV causes very mild disease and maintains a relatively low mutation rate in these animals.
targetString: MERS-CoV 在这些动物中引起非常轻微的疾病，并保持相对低的突变率。
en-mt: MERS-CoV causes very mild disease in these animals and maintains a relatively low mutation rate.

sourceString: Its sporadic transmission to humans is an accident and humans remain a dead-end host of MERS-CoV as its transmission cannot be sustained.
targetString: 它对人类的零星传播是一种意外，而由于无法持续传播，人类仍然是 MERS-CoV 的终端宿主。
en-mt: Its sporadic transmission to humans was an accident, and humans remain the terminal host of MERS-CoV due to unsustainable transmission.

sourceString: In contrast to the role of camels in the transmission of MERS-CoV, the role of pangolins, if there is any, in the transmission of SARS-CoV-2 is different.
targetString: 与骆驼在 MERS-CoV 传播中的作用相比，穿山甲在 SARS-CoV-2 传播中的作用（如果有）是不同的。
en-mt: The role, if any, of pangolins in the spread of SARS-CoV-2 is different than the role of camels in the spread of MERS-CoV.

sourceString: Particularly, pangolin beta-CoVs are highly pathogenic in pangolins.
targetString: 特别是，穿山甲 β-CoV 在穿山甲中具有高致病性。
en-mt: In particular, pangolin β-CoV is highly pathogenic in pangolins.

sourceString: They might be a dead-end host for SARS-CoV-2-related beta-CoVs, similar to civets in the case of SARS-CoV.
targetString: 它们可能是 SARS-CoV-2 相关的 β-CoV 的终端宿主，类似于 SARS-CoV 中的果子狸。
en-mt: They may be terminal hosts of SARS-CoV-2-related β-CoV, similar to civet cats in SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Several possibilities for interspecies transmission of SARS-CoV-2 from animals to humans have to be ruled in or ruled out in future studies.
targetString: 在未来的研究中必须确定或排除 SARS-CoV-2 从动物向人类的种间传播的几种可能。
en-mt: Several possibilities for interspecies transmission of SARS-CoV-2 from animals to humans must be identified or ruled out in future studies.

sourceString: First, bats could be the reservoir host of a SARS-CoV-2-related virus almost identical to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: 首先，蝙蝠可能是与 SARS-CoV-2 几乎完全相同的 SARS-CoV-2 相关病毒的贮存宿主。
en-mt: First, bats may be reservoir hosts for SARS-CoV-2-related viruses that are nearly identical to SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Humans might share the ecological niche with bats through butchering or coal mining.
targetString: 人类可能会通过屠宰或煤矿开采与蝙蝠共享生态位。
en-mt: Humans may share an ecological niche with bats through slaughter or coal mining.

sourceString: Second, pangolins could be one of intermediate amplifying host to which a SARS-CoV-2-related virus had been newly introduced.
targetString: 其次，穿山甲可能是 SARS-CoV-2 相关病毒新入侵的中间扩大宿主之一。
en-mt: Second, pangolins may be one of the intermediate expansion hosts for the new invasion of SARS-CoV-2-related viruses.

sourceString: Humans contract the virus through butchering and consumption of game meat.
targetString: 人类通过宰杀和食用野味而感染病毒。
en-mt: Humans are infected with the virus by slaughtering and eating wild game.

sourceString: It is possible that many mammals including domestic animals are susceptible to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: 包括家畜在内的许多哺乳动物可能都容易感染 SARS-CoV-2。
en-mt: Many mammals, including domestic animals, may be susceptible to SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: A survey of domestic and wild animals for antibodies is warranted.
targetString: 有必要对家畜和野生动物进行抗体调查。
en-mt: It is necessary to conduct antibody surveys in domestic and wild animals.

sourceString: Third, as mentioned above, recombination and adaptation of SARS-CoV-2 might have occurred in a third species that has contact with both bats and pangolins.
targetString: 第三，如上所述，SARS-CoV-2可能在与蝙蝠和穿山甲都接触过的第三个物种中进行重组和适应。
en-mt: Third, as noted above, SARS-CoV-2 may have recombined and adapted in a third species with which both bats and pangolins came into contact.

sourceString: The search for the animal origins of SARS-CoV-2 is still on.
targetString: 对 SARS-CoV-2 的动物起源的研究仍在继续。
en-mt: Research on the animal origin of SARS-CoV-2 continues.

sourceString: Apart from different types of the animal hosts, three major factors on the viral side are also important in facilitating CoVs to cross species barriers.
targetString: 除了不同类型的动物宿主外，病毒方面的三个主要因素在促进冠状病毒跨越种间屏障方面也发挥了重要作用。
en-mt: In addition to different types of animal hosts, three major factors in terms of viruses also play an important role in facilitating the crossing of interspecies barriers by coronaviruses.

sourceString: First of all, their relatively high mutation rates in RNA replication.
targetString: 首先，它们在 RNA 复制中具有较高的突变率。
en-mt: First, they have a high mutation rate in RNA replication.

sourceString: In comparison to other single-stranded RNA viruses, the estimated mutation rates of CoVs could be regarded as “moderate” to “high” with an average substitution rate being ~10-4 substitution per year per site 2, depending on the phase of CoV adaptation to novel hosts.
targetString: 与其他单链 RNA 病毒相比，冠状病毒的突变率估计为“中等”到“高”，根据冠状病毒对新宿主的适应阶段，每个位点 2 每年的平均替代率约为 10-4 次。
en-mt: Compared with other single-stranded RNA viruses, the mutation rate of coronaviruses is estimated to be "moderate" to "high", with an average substitution rate of about 10-4 times per year per locus2 depending on the stage of adaptation of the coronavirus to a new host .

sourceString: CoVs have a proof-reading exoribonuclease, deletion of which results in exceedingly high mutability and attenuation or even inviability.
targetString: 冠状病毒具有校对活性的核糖核酸外切酶，将其删除会导致非常高的可变性和衰减，甚至无法生存。
en-mt: Coronaviruses have a proofreading active exoribonuclease, whose deletion would result in very high variability and attenuation, or even non-viability.

sourceString: Interestingly, the nucleotide analogue Remdesivir is known to suppress CoV replication through inhibition of this exoribonuclease and the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase.
targetString: 有趣的是， 已知核苷类似物瑞德西韦 (Remdesivir)可通过抑制这种核糖核酸外切酶和 RNA 依赖性 RNA 聚合酶来抑制冠状病毒复制。
en-mt: Interestingly, the nucleoside analog Remdesivir is known to inhibit coronavirus replication by inhibiting this exoribonuclease and RNA-dependent RNA polymerase.

sourceString: Remdesivir is one of most promising anti-SARS-CoV-2 agents to be tested in clinical trials.
targetString: 瑞德西韦是即将在临床试验中测试的最有希望的抗 SARS-CoV-2 药物之一。
en-mt: Remdesivir is one of the most promising anti-SARS-CoV-2 drugs about to be tested in clinical trials.

sourceString: Nevertheless, mutation rates of CoVs are about a million times higher than those of their hosts.
targetString: 然而，冠状病毒的突变率比其宿主高约 100 万倍。
en-mt: However, the mutation rate of coronaviruses is about 1 million times higher than that of their hosts.

sourceString: In addition, mutation rate is often high when CoVs are not well adapted to the host.
targetString: 另外，如果冠状病毒不能很好地适应宿主，则其突变率通常会很高。
en-mt: In addition, if a coronavirus does not adapt well to its host, its mutation rate will often be high.

sourceString: Compared to SARS-CoV with a high mutation rate, the mutation rate of SARS-CoV-2 is apparently lower, suggestive of a higher level of adaptation to humans.
targetString: 与具有高突变率的 SARS-CoV 相比，SARS-CoV-2 的突变率明显更低，表明其对人类的适应性更高。
en-mt: Compared with SARS-CoV, which has a high mutation rate, SARS-CoV-2 has a significantly lower mutation rate, indicating its higher adaptability to humans.

sourceString: Presumably, it has already been adapted to another host close to humans.
targetString: 可以推测，它已经适应了另一种接近人类的宿主。
en-mt: Presumably, it has adapted to another host that is closer to humans.

sourceString: In addition to SARS-CoV-2, this also applies to MERS-CoV, which is well adapted to dromedary camels.
targetString: 除 SARS-CoV-2 外，这也适用于很好地适应了单峰驼的 MERS-CoV。
en-mt: In addition to SARS-CoV-2, this also applies to MERS-CoV, which is well adapted to dromedary camels.

sourceString: Theoretically, it is unlikely that genetic drift would render vaccines and antivirals against SARS-CoV-2 ineffective quickly.
targetString: 从理论上讲，基因漂变不大可能会使针对 SARS-CoV-2 的疫苗和抗病毒药迅速失效。
en-mt: In theory, genetic drift is unlikely to render vaccines and antivirals against SARS-CoV-2 quickly ineffective.

sourceString: Second, the large RNA genome in CoVs exerts extra plasticity in genome modification for mutations and recombination, thereby increasing the probability for interspecies co-evolution, which is advantageous for the emergence of novel CoVs when the conditions become appropriate.
targetString: 其次，冠状病毒中较大的 RNA 基因组在基因突变和重组的修饰中具有额外的可塑性，从而增加了种间协同进化的可能，这在条件合适时有利于新型冠状病毒的出现。
en-mt: Second, the larger RNA genome in coronaviruses has additional plasticity in the modification of gene mutation and recombination, which increases the possibility of co-evolution among species, which is conducive to the emergence of novel coronaviruses when conditions are right.

sourceString: This is supported by the copious unique open reading frames and protein functions encoded towards the 3′ end of the genome.
targetString: 朝向基因组 3' 末端编码的大量独特的开放阅读框和蛋白质功能为此提供了证据。
en-mt: Evidence for this is provided by a large number of unique open reading frames and protein functions encoded towards the 3' end of the genome.

sourceString: Third, CoVs randomly and frequently switch templates during RNA replication through a unique “copy-choice” mechanism.
targetString: 第三，冠状病毒在 RNA 复制过程中通过独特的“复制选择”机制随机且频繁地切换模板。
en-mt: Third, coronaviruses randomly and frequently switch templates through a unique "replication selection" mechanism during RNA replication.

sourceString: In a host that serves as the mixing vessel, strand switching occurs frequently during CoV RNA transcription.
targetString: 在作为混合容器的宿主中，CoV RNA 转录过程中会频繁发生链交换。
en-mt: In hosts that act as mixing vessels, strand exchanges frequently occur during CoV RNA transcription.

sourceString: Highly homologous full-length and subgenomic RNAs could recombine to generate new CoVs.
targetString: 高度同源的全长和亚基因组 RNA 可以重组产生新的冠状病毒。
en-mt: Highly homologous full-length and subgenomic RNAs can be recombined to generate novel coronaviruses.

sourceString: Phylogenetic evidence of natural recombination has been found in both HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-OC43, as well as animal CoVs such as bat SL-CoV and batCoV-HKU9.
targetString: 在 HCoV-HKU1 和 HCoV-OC43 以及蝙蝠 SL-CoV 和蝙蝠 CoV-HKU9 等动物冠状病毒中都发现了自然重组的系统发育学证据。
en-mt: Phylogenetic evidence for natural recombination has been found in HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-OC43, as well as in animal coronaviruses such as bat SL-CoV and bat CoV-HKU9.

sourceString: Virus-host interaction in relation to transmission
targetString: 与传播相关的病毒-宿主相互作用
en-mt: Virus-host interactions associated with transmission

sourceString: Besides three viral factors stated above, viral interaction with host receptor is another key factor influential on interspecies transmission.
targetString: 除上述三个病毒因素外，病毒与宿主受体的相互作用是影响种间传播的另一个关键因素。
en-mt: In addition to the above three viral factors, the interaction between viruses and host receptors is another key factor affecting interspecies transmission.

sourceString: Herein, recombination of SARS-CoV is taken as a typical example, which also showed evidence of positive selection during interspecies transmission events.
targetString: 本文以 SARS-CoV 的重组为典型例子，显示了在种间传播事件中存在正向选择的证据。
en-mt: Taking the recombination of SARS-CoV as a typical example, this paper shows evidence of positive selection in interspecies transmission events.

sourceString: Based on the comparative analysis between isolates of human and civet SARS-CoVs, SARS-CoV is thought to undergo rapid adaptation in different hosts, particularly with mutations at the RBD of the S protein.
targetString: 基于对人与果子狸 SARS-CoV 分离菌株的比较分析，研究人员认为SARS-CoV可以快速适应不同宿主，特别是通过S 蛋白RBD的突变来实现这一过程。
en-mt: Based on the comparative analysis of isolated strains of SARS-CoV from humans and civet cats, the researchers believe that SARS-CoV can quickly adapt to different hosts, especially through the mutation of the S protein RBD.

sourceString: Generally, the RBD in the S protein of a CoV interacts with the cellular receptor and is intensely selected by the host antibody response.
targetString: 通常，冠状病毒 S 蛋白中的 RBD 会与细胞受体相互作用，并会受到宿主抗体反应的严密筛选。
en-mt: Typically, the RBD in the coronavirus S protein interacts with cellular receptors and is tightly screened for host antibody responses.

sourceString: In SARS-CoV, the RBD is in the 318th to 510th amino acids on the S1 fragment, which binds to the human ACE2 as well as its coreceptors for viral entry.
targetString: 在 SARS-CoV 中，RBD 位于 S1 片段的第 318 至 510 个氨基酸中，它与人 ACE2 及其共受体结合，以使病毒进入。
en-mt: In SARS-CoV, the RBD is located in amino acids 318 to 510 of the S1 fragment, which binds to human ACE2 and its co-receptor for viral entry.

sourceString: The RBD of SARS-CoV is capable of recognizing the ACE2 receptors of various animals, including bat, civet, mouse and raccoon dog, allowing interspecies transmission of the virus.
targetString: SARS-CoV 的 RBD 能够识别各种动物的 ACE2 受体，包括蝙蝠、果子狸、老鼠和狸猫，从而使病毒在种间传播。
en-mt: The RBD of SARS-CoV recognizes the ACE2 receptors of various animals, including bats, civet cats, mice, and civet cats, allowing the virus to spread between species.

sourceString: In fact, only 6 amino acid residues were observed to be different from human and civet viral isolates in the RBD and 4 of them locate in the receptor-binding motif for interaction with the ACE2 receptor.
targetString: 事实上，在 RBD 中只观察到 6 个与人和果子狸病毒分离株不同的氨基酸残基，其中 4 个残基位于与 ACE2 受体相互作用的受体结合基序中。
en-mt: In fact, only 6 amino acid residues were observed in the RBD that differed from human and civet virus isolates, 4 of which were located in the receptor binding motif that interacts with the ACE2 receptor.

sourceString: Civet SARS-CoV has K479N and S487T mutations in its RBD, which might increase the affinity of the interaction of spike protein with human ACE2 receptor.
targetString: 果子狸 SARS-CoV 的 RBD 中存在 K479N 和 S487T 突变，这可能会增加纤突蛋白与人 ACE2 受体相互作用的亲和力。
en-mt: The K479N and S487T mutations in the RBD of civet cat SARS-CoV may increase the affinity of spike protein to interact with the human ACE2 receptor.

sourceString: In other words, these two amino acid substitutions might be critical to viral adaption to humans.
targetString: 换句话说，这两种氨基酸的置换可能对病毒适应人类至关重要。
en-mt: In other words, these two amino acid substitutions may be critical for the virus to adapt to humans.

sourceString: It is noteworthy that SARS-CoV-2 shares the same cellular receptor with SARS-CoV.
targetString: 值得注意的是，SARS-CoV-2 与 SARS-CoV 具有相同的细胞受体。
en-mt: Notably, SARS-CoV-2 shares the same cellular receptors as SARS-CoV.

sourceString: A 30% difference between SARS-CoV-2 and SARS-CoV in the S1 unit of the S protein implicates that the binding affinity of its S protein with human ACE2 might have altered.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 和 SARS-CoV 在 S 蛋白 S1 单元的差异为 30%，这意味着其 S 蛋白与人 ACE2 的结合亲和力可能发生了改变。
en-mt: The difference between SARS-CoV-2 and SARS-CoV in the S1 unit of the S protein is 30%, which means that the binding affinity of the S protein to human ACE2 may have changed.

sourceString: Indeed, a cryo-EM study indicates a 10- to 20-fold higher affinity of this binding than that between human ACE2 and SARS-CoV S protein.
targetString: 的确，一项冷冻电镜研究表明，这种结合的亲和力比人 ACE2 和 SARS-CoV S 蛋白之间的亲和力高 10 至 20 倍。
en-mt: Indeed, a cryo-EM study showed that the binding affinity was 10 to 20 times higher than that between human ACE2 and the SARS-CoV S protein.

sourceString: It will also be of interest to determine whether any other coreceptor might be required for SARS-CoV-2 transmission.
targetString: 确定在 SARS-CoV-2 传播中是否需要任何其他共受体也将很有意义。
en-mt: It will also be interesting to determine whether any other co-receptors are required in SARS-CoV-2 transmission.

sourceString: Intriguingly, HCoV-NL63 also binds to ACE2 but with a different part of S.
targetString: 有趣的是，HCoV-NL63 也与 ACE2 结合，但是与 S 的不同部分结合。
en-mt: Interestingly, HCoV-NL63 also binds to ACE2, but to a different part of S.

sourceString: There exist many other HCoV receptors, such as aminopeptidase N for HCoV-229E, and 9-O-acetylated sialic acid for HCoV-OC43.
targetString: 此外，还有许多其他 HCoV 受体，例如 HCoV-229E 的氨基肽酶 N 和 HCoV-OC43 的 9-O-乙酰化唾液酸。
en-mt: In addition, there are many other HCoV receptors, such as aminopeptidase N of HCoV-229E and 9-O-acetylated sialic acid of HCoV-OC43.

sourceString: They might also account for successful adaptation of these CoVs in humans after interspecies transmission from their animal hosts.
targetString: 它们也可能解释了上述冠状病毒在从动物宿主跨种传播后成功适应人类的原因。
en-mt: They may also explain the successful adaptation of the aforementioned coronaviruses to humans after cross-species transmission from animal hosts.

sourceString: In addition to cellular receptors, the outcome of interspecies transmission of HCoVs is also governed by other host dependency and restriction factors.
targetString: 除细胞受体外，HCoV 种间传播的结果还受其他宿主依赖性和限制性因素的影响。
en-mt: In addition to cellular receptors, the outcome of HCoV interspecies transmission is influenced by other host-dependent and restrictive factors.

sourceString: The divergence of these host proteins between humans and natural reservoir hosts of HCoVs such as bats, dromedary camels and rodents might constitute a barrier to interspecies transmission.
targetString: 这些宿主蛋白在人类与蝙蝠、单峰驼和啮齿动物等 HCoV 自然宿主之间的差异可能构成了种间传播的障碍。
en-mt: Differences in these host proteins between humans and HCoV natural hosts such as bats, dromedary camels, and rodents may constitute a barrier to interspecies transmission.

sourceString: HCoVs have to usurp host dependency factors and subvert host restriction factors for a successful interspecies transmission.
targetString: HCoV 必须剥夺宿主依赖因素并打破宿主限制因素，才能成功实现种间传播。
en-mt: HCoV must be deprived of host-dependent factors and break host-restricted factors to successfully achieve interspecies transmission.

sourceString: In this regard, molecular determinants in this important area of virus-host interaction remain to be identified and characterized.
targetString: 在此方面，病毒-宿主相互作用这一重要领域中的分子决定因素仍有待确定和表征。
en-mt: In this regard, the molecular determinants in this important area of virus-host interaction remain to be identified and characterized.

sourceString: An unbiased genome-wide screening of host dependency and restriction factors for SARS-CoV-2 using the state-of-the-art technology of CRISPR might be fruitful.
targetString: 利用最新的 CRISPR 技术对 SARS-CoV-2 的宿主依赖性和限制性因素进行无偏倚的全基因组筛选可能会取得成果。
en-mt: An unbiased genome-wide screen for host-dependence and restriction factors of SARS-CoV-2 using the latest CRISPR technology may bear fruit.

sourceString: Emergence of novel HCoVs: back to ground zero
targetString: 新型 HCoV 的出现：回到原点
en-mt: Emergence of novel HCoVs: back to square one

sourceString: The diversity of bat CoVs provides ample opportunities for the emergence of novel HCoVs.
targetString: 蝙蝠冠状病毒的多样性为新型 HCoV 的出现提供了充足的机会。
en-mt: The diversity of bat coronaviruses provides ample opportunity for the emergence of novel HCoVs.

sourceString: In this sense, bat CoVs serve as the gene pool of HCoVs.
targetString: 从这个意义上说，蝙蝠冠状病毒充当了 HCoV 的基因库。
en-mt: In this sense, bat coronaviruses act as a gene pool for HCoVs.

sourceString: In addition, rapid mutation and genetic recombination also drive HCoV evolution and serve as two important steps in this process.
targetString: 此外，快速突变和基因重组也是 HCoV 进化的驱动因素，也是此过程的两个重要步骤。
en-mt: In addition, rapid mutation and genetic recombination are also drivers of HCoV evolution and are two important steps in this process.

sourceString: For example, the acquisition or loss of novel protein-coding genes has the potential to drastically modify viral phenotypes.
targetString: 例如，新蛋白质编码基因的获得或丢失可能会彻底改变病毒的表型。
en-mt: For example, the gain or loss of new protein-coding genes can drastically alter the phenotype of a virus.

sourceString: Among SARS-CoV accessory proteins, ORF8 has been thought to be important in adaptation to humans, as SARS-CoV-related bat viruses were isolated but found to encode divergent ORF8 proteins.
targetString: 在 SARS-CoV 辅助蛋白中，由于分离出了 SARS-CoV 相关的蝙蝠病毒，但发现它们可以编码不同的 ORF8 蛋白，因此认为 ORF8 对适应人类很重要。
en-mt: Among the SARS-CoV accessory proteins, ORF8 was thought to be important for adaptation to humans since SARS-CoV-related bat viruses were isolated but found to encode different ORF8 proteins.

sourceString: A 29-nucleotide deletion characteristic of SARS-CoVs has been found in strains isolated at the beginning of the human epidemic.
targetString: 在人类流行病开始时，于分离的病毒株中发现了 SARS-CoV 的 29 个核苷酸缺失特征。
en-mt: A 29-nucleotide deletion characteristic of SARS-CoV was found in isolated strains at the onset of human epidemics.

sourceString: This deletion splits ORF8 into ORF8a and ORF8b and is thought to be an adaptive mutation that promotes the switch of hosts.
targetString: 这种缺失将 ORF8 分为 ORF8a 和 ORF8b，并被认为是促进宿主转换的适应性突变。
en-mt: This deletion divides ORF8 into ORF8a and ORF8b and is thought to be an adaptive mutation that promotes host switching.

sourceString: Besides, SARS-CoV has a possible recombination history with lineages of alpha- and gamma-CoVs, where a large number of smaller recombinant regions were identified in the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase.
targetString: 此外，SARS-CoV 可能与 α- 和 γ-CoV 谱系发生过重组，其中在 RNA 依赖性 RNA 聚合酶中发现了大量较小的重组区域。
en-mt: In addition, SARS-CoV may have recombined with α- and γ-CoV lineages, in which a large number of smaller recombination regions were found in RNA-dependent RNA polymerase.

sourceString: Recombination locations were also identified in the nsp9, most of nsp10, and parts of nsp14.
targetString: 在 nsp9、大部分 nsp10 和部分 nsp14 中也发现了重组位点。
en-mt: Recombination sites were also found in nsp9, most of nsp10 and some of nsp14.

sourceString: Likewise, it has been shown that the epidemic MERS-CoV experienced recombination events between different lineages, which occurred in dromedary camels in Saudi Arabia.
targetString: 同样，已有研究表明，MERS-CoV 的流行经历了不同谱系间的重组事件，这发生在沙特阿拉伯的单峰驼中。
en-mt: Likewise, it has been shown that MERS-CoV epidemics undergo recombination events between different lineages, which occurred in dromedary camels in Saudi Arabia.

sourceString: Besides SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, recombination events have also been observed in other HCoVs, in which the HCoVs recombine with other animal CoVs in their non-structural genes.
targetString: 除 SARS-CoV 和 MERS-CoV 外，在其他 HCoV 中也观察到重组事件，其中 HCoV 与其他动物冠状病毒在其非结构基因中重组。
en-mt: In addition to SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, recombination events have also been observed in other HCoVs, where HCoVs recombine with other animal coronaviruses in their nonstructural genes.

sourceString: It should also be cautioned that artificial selection can contribute to unintended changes in viral genomes, most likely resulting from relieving viruses from selection pressures exerted, such as by the host immune system.
targetString: 还应注意的是，人工选择可能会导致病毒基因组发生意外变化，这很可能是由于减轻了病毒面对的宿主免疫系统等施加的选择压力。
en-mt: It should also be noted that artificial selection may lead to unintended changes in the viral genome, most likely due to the mitigation of selection pressure on the virus by, inter alia, the host's immune system.

sourceString: An example of these effects is the loss of a full-length ORF4 in the HCoV-229E prototype strain, owing to a two-nucleotide deletion.
targetString: 这些作用的一个例子是在 HCoV-229E 原型病毒株中，双核苷酸的缺失导致了全长 ORF4的缺失。
en-mt: An example of these effects is the loss of full-length ORF4 due to a dinucleotide deletion in the HCoV-229E prototype strain.

sourceString: While intact ORF4 could be observed in bat and camel viruses related to HCoV-229E, the alpaca alpha-CoV displays a single nucleotide insertion, resulting in a frameshift.
targetString: 尽管在与 HCoV-229E 相关的蝙蝠和骆驼病毒中可以观察到完整的 ORF4，但羊驼 α-CoV 显示单个核苷酸插入，引起了移码突变。
en-mt: While intact ORF4 can be observed in bat and camel viruses related to HCoV-229E, alpaca α-CoV showed a single nucleotide insertion, causing a frameshift mutation.

sourceString: Last but not least, the evolution of novel HCoVs is also driven by the selection pressure in their reservoir hosts.
targetString: 最后但同样重要的是，新型 HCoV 的进化还受到贮存宿主选择压力的驱动。
en-mt: Last but not least, the evolution of novel HCoVs is also driven by selective pressure on reservoir hosts.

sourceString: Asymptomatic or only mild symptoms were detected when bats were infected with CoVs, indicating the mutual adaptation between CoVs and bats.
targetString: 在蝙蝠感染冠状病毒后，检测到无症状或仅有轻微症状，表明冠状病毒和蝙蝠之间相互适应。
en-mt: After bats were infected with the coronavirus, asymptomatic or only mild symptoms were detected, indicating mutual adaptation between the coronavirus and bats.

sourceString: It appeared that bats are well adapted to CoVs anatomically and physiologically.
targetString: 从解剖学和生理学的角度来看，蝙蝠似乎很好地适应了冠状病毒。
en-mt: From an anatomical and physiological standpoint, bats appear to be well adapted to coronaviruses.

sourceString: For example, defects in the activation of pro-inflammatory response in bats efficiently reduce the pathology triggered by CoVs.
targetString: 例如，蝙蝠促炎反应激活的缺陷有效地减少了冠状病毒引发的病理变化。
en-mt: For example, defects in the activation of pro-inflammatory responses in bats effectively reduce coronavirus-induced pathological changes.

sourceString: Besides, the natural killer cell activity in bats is suppressed due to upregulation of inhibitory natural killer cell receptor NKG2/CD94 and low expression level of major histocompatibility complex class I molecules.
targetString: 此外，由于抑制性自然杀伤细胞受体 NKG2/CD94 的正调控，而且主要组织相容性复合体 I 类分子表达水平较低，因此蝙蝠的自然杀伤细胞活动受到抑制。
en-mt: Furthermore, natural killer cell activity in bats is suppressed due to positive regulation of the inhibitory natural killer cell receptor NKG2/CD94 and lower expression of major histocompatibility complex class I molecules.

sourceString: Moreover, the high level of reactive oxygen species (ROS) generated from high metabolic activity of bats could both suppress CoV replication and affects proofreading by exoribonuclease, thus providing the selection pressure for the generation of virus strains highly pathogenic when introduced into a new host.
targetString: 而且，蝙蝠高代谢活性产生的高水平活性氧 (ROS) 既可抑制冠状病毒复制，又可通过核糖核酸外切酶影响校对，从而为病毒株进入新宿主时产生高致病性提供选择压力。
en-mt: Moreover, the high level of reactive oxygen species (ROS) produced by the high metabolic activity of bats can not only inhibit the replication of coronaviruses, but also affect proofreading through exoribonucleases, thereby providing selection pressure for the high pathogenicity of virus strains when they enter new hosts.

sourceString: More pathogenic CoV strains might also evolve by recombination, leading to the acquisition of novel proteins or protein features for host adaptation.
targetString: 更多致病性冠状病毒菌株也可能通过重组进化，导致获得新的蛋白质或蛋白质特征以适应宿主。
en-mt: More pathogenic coronavirus strains may also evolve through recombination, resulting in the acquisition of new proteins or protein features to adapt to the host.

sourceString: Thus, it is not by chance that three novel HCoVs have emerged in the past two decades.
targetString: 因此，在过去二十年中出现了三种新型 HCoV 并非偶然。
en-mt: Therefore, it is no accident that three novel HCoVs have emerged in the past two decades.

sourceString: CoVs are non-pathogenic or cause mild symptoms in their reservoir hosts such as bats and camels.
targetString: 冠状病毒在蝙蝠和骆驼等贮存宿主中不致病或引起轻微症状。
en-mt: Coronaviruses do not cause disease or cause mild symptoms in reservoir hosts such as bats and camels.

sourceString: They replicate robustly without eliciting a strong host immune response.
targetString: 它们进行大量的复制，且不会引起强烈的宿主免疫反应。
en-mt: They replicate profusely without eliciting a strong host immune response.

sourceString: Herein lie the secrets of why asymptomatic carriers are seen and what causes the severe cases in human infection.
targetString: 这就是为什么会出现无症状携带者以及导致人类严重感染病例的原因。
en-mt: This is why asymptomatic carriers can occur and lead to severe cases of infection in humans.

sourceString: The severe symptoms are mainly due to the hyperactivation of immune response and the cytokine storm wherein the stronger the immune response, the more severe the lung damage.
targetString: 出现严重症状主要是由于免疫反应的过度激活和细胞因子风暴，因此免疫反应越强，肺部损伤就会越严重。
en-mt: Severe symptoms are mainly due to overactivation of the immune response and cytokine storm, so the stronger the immune response, the more severe the lung damage will be.

sourceString: In contrast, in asymptomatic carriers, the immune response has been de-coupled from CoV replication.
targetString: 相比之下，在无症状携带者中，免疫反应已经从冠状病毒复制中脱耦。
en-mt: In contrast, in asymptomatic carriers, the immune response has been decoupled from coronavirus replication.

sourceString: The same strategy of delinking the immune response might have beneficial effects in anti-SARS-CoV-2 therapy.
targetString: 使免疫反应脱链的相同策略可能会在抗 SARS-CoV-2 治疗中有积极的作用。
en-mt: The same strategy of taking the immune response off-chain may have positive effects in anti-SARS-CoV-2 therapy.

sourceString: The interferon response is particularly strong in bats.
targetString: 蝙蝠中的干扰素反应尤为强烈。
en-mt: The interferon response was particularly strong in bats.

sourceString: Thus, administration of type I interferon at least in the early phase of SARS-CoV-2 infection in humans should be beneficial.
targetString: 因此，至少在人类 SARS-CoV-2 感染的早期阶段使用 I 型干扰素应该有益。
en-mt: Therefore, the use of type I interferons should be beneficial, at least in the early stages of human SARS-CoV-2 infection.

sourceString: In addition, NLRP3 inflammasome activation in bats is defective.
targetString: 此外，蝙蝠中的 NLRP3 炎性体激活也存在缺陷。
en-mt: Furthermore, NLRP3 inflammasome activation is also defective in bats.

sourceString: By this reasoning, inhibition of NLRP3 inflammasome with MCC950 might be useful in the treatment of COVID-19.
targetString: 基于此推理，使用 MCC950 抑制 NLRP3 炎性体可能对 COVID-19 的治疗有用。
en-mt: Based on this reasoning, inhibition of the NLRP3 inflammasome using MCC950 might be useful for the treatment of COVID-19.

sourceString: The emergence of SARS-CoV-2 follows the general theme by which SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV arose.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 的出现遵循着 SARS-CoV 和 MERS-CoV 产生所依据的一般主题。
en-mt: The emergence of SARS-CoV-2 follows the general themes upon which the emergence of SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV was based.

sourceString: Whereas a bat beta-CoV sharing 95% nucleotide homology with SARS-CoV has been found, there also exists a bat-CoV sharing 96% nucleotide homology with SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: 尽管已经发现与 SARS-CoV 具有 95% 核苷酸同源性的蝙蝠 β-CoV，但还有一种蝙蝠冠状病毒与 SARS-CoV-2的核苷酸同源性高达96%。
en-mt: Although bat β-CoV with 95% nucleotide identity to SARS-CoV has been found, there is another bat coronavirus with 96% nucleotide identity to SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Whereas civets and other animals in the markets have been found to harbour viruses identical to SARS-CoV, immediate intermediate hosts for SARS-CoV-2 have not been identified.
targetString: 虽然已发现市场中的果子狸和其他动物携带与 SARS-CoV 相同的病毒，但尚未确定 SARS-CoV-2 的直接中间宿主。
en-mt: Although civet cats and other animals in markets have been found to carry the same virus as SARS-CoV, the immediate intermediate host of SARS-CoV-2 has not been identified.

sourceString: Pangolin beta-CoVs strikingly homologous to SARS-CoV-2 have been found, indicating that pangolins might serve as one of intermediate hosts or pangolin beta-CoVs could contribute gene fragments to the final version of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: 目前已发现与 SARS-CoV-2 明显同源的穿山甲 β-CoV，这表明穿山甲可能是中间宿主之一，或穿山甲 β-CoV 可能为最终版的 SARS-CoV-2 贡献了基因片段。
en-mt: A pangolin β-CoV that is apparently homologous to SARS-CoV-2 has been found, suggesting that pangolin may be one of the intermediate hosts, or that pangolin β-CoV may have contributed gene fragments to the final version of SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Although questions remain, there is no evidence that SARS-CoV-2 is man-made either deliberately or accidentally.
targetString: 尽管仍有疑问，但没有证据表明 SARS-CoV-2 是有意或无意人为制造的。
en-mt: While doubts remain, there is no evidence that SARS-CoV-2 was man-made, intentionally or accidentally.

sourceString: CoVs have returned to the limelight due to the recent outbreak of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: 由于近期 SARS-CoV-2 的爆发，冠状病毒重新成为人们关注的焦点。
en-mt: Due to the recent outbreak of SARS-CoV-2, coronaviruses are back in the spotlight.

sourceString: The study of CoVs in bats and other animals has drastically changed our perception of the importance of zoonotic origins and animal reservoirs of HCoVs in human transmission.
targetString: 对蝙蝠和其他动物中冠状病毒的研究极大地改变了我们对 HCoV 人畜共患病起源和在人类传播中的动物宿主重要性的认识。
en-mt: Studies of coronaviruses in bats and other animals have dramatically changed our understanding of the zoonotic origin of HCoV and the importance of animal reservoirs in human transmission.

sourceString: Pervasive evidence has shown that SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 have a bat origin and are transmitted to humans via intermediate hosts.
targetString: 大量证据表明，SARS-CoV、MERS-CoV 和 SARS-CoV-2 起源于蝙蝠，并通过中间宿主传播给人类。
en-mt: Substantial evidence indicates that SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV, and SARS-CoV-2 originated in bats and were transmitted to humans through intermediate hosts.

sourceString: Given that SARS-CoV infection originates from the contact between humans and civets in the markets, closing wet markets and killing civets therein could have effectively ended the SARS epidemic.
targetString: 鉴于 SARS-CoV 感染源自市场上人类与果子狸之间的接触，关闭湿货市场并杀死果子狸可以有效地结束 SARS 的流行。
en-mt: Given that SARS-CoV infection arose from contact between humans and civet cats at the market, closing the wet market and killing the civet cats could effectively end the SARS epidemic.

sourceString: By the same reasoning, pangolins should be removed from wet markets to prevent zoonotic transmission, in view of the discovery of multiple lineages of pangolin beta-CoVs closely related to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: 同理，鉴于发现了与 SARS-CoV-2 密切相关的穿山甲 β-CoV 的多个谱系，因此应将穿山甲从湿货市场中清除，以防止人畜共患疾传播。
en-mt: Similarly, given the discovery of multiple lineages of pangolin β-CoV closely related to SARS-CoV-2, pangolins should be removed from wet markets to prevent zoonotic transmission.

sourceString: However, whether and how SARS-CoV-2 is transmitted to humans through pangolins and other mammals remain to be clarified in future investigations.
targetString: 但 SARS-CoV-2 是否以及如何通过穿山甲和其他哺乳动物传播给人类，仍有待进一步研究。
en-mt: But whether and how SARS-CoV-2 was transmitted to humans by pangolins and other mammals remains to be further studied.

sourceString: On the other hand, MERS-CoV has existed in dromedary camels for a long time.
targetString: 另一方面，MERS-CoV 在单峰驼中已经存在了很长时间。
en-mt: On the other hand, MERS-CoV has been present in dromedary camels for a long time.

sourceString: These camels serve as an important tool for transportation as well as a main source of meat, milk, leather and wool products for the local people.
targetString: 这些骆驼是重要的交通工具，也是当地人的肉、奶、皮革和毛线产品的主要来源。
en-mt: These camels are an important means of transportation and a major source of meat, milk, leather and woolen products for the local people.

sourceString: They are widely distributed across the Middle East and Africa.
targetString: 它们广泛分布在中东和非洲。
en-mt: They are widely distributed in the Middle East and Africa.

sourceString: It is therefore impossible to sacrifice all camels for the control of MERS, as what was done in wild animal markets in China to prevent the spreading of SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: 因此，不可能效仿中国野生动物市场为防止SARS-CoV和SARS-CoV-2传播的做法，为控制 MERS 而牺牲掉所有骆驼。
en-mt: Therefore, it is impossible to sacrifice all camels to control MERS, as the Chinese wild animal market did to prevent the spread of SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: To stop the recurrent outbreaks of MERS, a comprehensive approach should be taken to develop effective vaccines against MERS-CoV for camels, in combination with other infection control measures.
targetString: 为制止 MERS 的再次暴发，应结合其他感染控制措施，采取综合举措，为骆驼研制有效的抗 MERS-CoV 疫苗。
en-mt: To stop the resurgence of MERS, a comprehensive approach should be taken in conjunction with other infection control measures to develop an effective vaccine against MERS-CoV for camels.

sourceString: As we are not able to eliminate these viruses, new genotypes might emerge to cause outbreaks.
targetString: 由于我们无法消灭这些病毒，新的基因型可能会出现，进而引起疫情爆发。
en-mt: Since we cannot eradicate these viruses, new genotypes may emerge, causing outbreaks.

sourceString: A variety of zoonotic CoVs are circulating in the wild.
targetString: 各种人畜共患病冠状病毒在野生环境中循环流动。
en-mt: Various zoonotic coronaviruses circulate in the wild.

sourceString: Particularly, bat CoVs with zoonotic potential are so diverse.
targetString: 特别是，具有人畜共患病潜力的蝙蝠冠状病毒多样性颇高。
en-mt: In particular, bat coronaviruses with zoonotic potential are highly diverse.

sourceString: There are plenty of opportunities that these zoonotic CoVs evolve and recombine, resulting in the emergence of new CoVs that are more transmissible and/or deadly in humans in future.
targetString: 这些人畜共患病冠状病毒有很多进化和重组的机会，从而导致未来出现在人类中更容易传播和/或致命的新冠状病毒。
en-mt: These zoonotic coronaviruses have many opportunities to evolve and recombine, resulting in future novel coronaviruses that are more transmissible and/or deadly in humans.

sourceString: The culture of eating wild animals in some places of China should be abandoned to reduce unnecessary contact between humans and animals.
targetString: 在中国的一些地方，应摒弃食用野生动物的文化，以减少人类和动物之间不必要的接触。
en-mt: In some parts of China, the culture of eating wild animals should be abandoned to reduce unnecessary contact between humans and animals.

sourceString: With the ordeals of SARS, MERS and COVID-19, a better preparedness and response plan should be in place.
targetString: 经过 SARS、MERS 和 COVID-19 的严峻考验，我们应制定更好的防范和应对计划。
en-mt: After the severe test of SARS, MERS and COVID-19, we should develop better prevention and response plans.

sourceString: In fact, many viruses have existed in the planet for a very long time.
targetString: 事实上，许多病毒都已在地球上存在了很长时间。
en-mt: In fact, many viruses have existed on Earth for a long time.

sourceString: They stay in their own natural reservoirs until there is a chance for spillover.
targetString: 它们待在自己的自然宿主中，直至出现溢出机会。
en-mt: They stay in their natural hosts until the opportunity to overflow arises.

sourceString: Although bats have many features that favours the spreading of viruses, the chance for humans to be in contact with bats and other wildlife species can be minimized if people are educated to stay away from them.
targetString: 尽管蝙蝠有很多有利于病毒传播的特征，但如果人们受到教育而远离蝙蝠和其他野生物种，那么人类接触蝙蝠和其他野生物种的机会就会极大程度地减少。
en-mt: Although bats have many characteristics that facilitate virus transmission, human exposure to bats and other wild species is greatly reduced if people are educated to stay away from them.

sourceString: Continuous surveillance in mammals is necessary for better understanding of the ecology of CoVs and their natural hosts, which will prove useful in preventing animal-to-human transmission and future outbreaks.
targetString: 为了更好地了解冠状病毒及其自然宿主的生态状况，有必要对哺乳动物进行连续监测，事实将证明，这对于预防动物向人类传播以及未来的爆发非常有用。
en-mt: To better understand the ecological status of coronaviruses and their natural hosts, continuous surveillance of mammals is necessary and will prove useful in preventing animal-to-human transmission and future outbreaks.

sourceString: To conclude, the most effective way to prevent viral zoonosis is for humans to stay away from the ecological niches of the natural reservoirs of the zoonotic viruses.
targetString: 总而言之，预防病毒性人畜共患病最有效的方法是人类应远离人畜共患病毒自然宿主的生态位。
en-mt: All in all, the most effective way to prevent viral zoonotic diseases is that humans should stay away from the ecological niche of the natural host of zoonotic viruses.
