sourceString: Several pieces in the puzzle of the zoonotic origin of SARS-CoV-2 are still missing.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 的人畜共患病起源之谜中仍有几处缺失。
en-mt: Several pieces are still missing in the puzzle of the zoonotic origins of SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: First, if bats transmit an ancestral virus of SARS-CoV-2 to pangolins, it will be of interest to see under what circumstances bats and pangolins could share the same ecological niche.
targetString: 首先，如果蝙蝠将一种古老的 SARS-CoV-2 病毒传播给穿山甲，那么考察蝙蝠和穿山甲在什么情况下可以共享同一个生态位是有意义的。
en-mt: First, if bats transmitted an ancient SARS-CoV-2 virus to pangolins, it would be interesting to examine under what circumstances bats and pangolins could share the same ecological niche.

sourceString: Second, if bats play a more direct role in human transmission, how humans get into contact with bats should be determined.
targetString: 第二，如果蝙蝠在人类传播中发挥更直接的作用，那么人类如何与蝙蝠接触还有待确定。
en-mt: Second, if bats play a more direct role in human transmission, how humans come into contact with bats remains to be determined.

sourceString: Third, if a third mammal acts as the true intermediate host, how it interacts with the different species including humans, bats and pangolins has to be clarified.
targetString: 第三，如果第三种哺乳动物充当真正的中间宿主，则必须明确它是如何与包括人类、蝙蝠和穿山甲在内的不同物种相互作用的。
en-mt: Third, if a third mammal acts as a true intermediate host, it must be clarified how it interacts with different species, including humans, bats and pangolins.

sourceString: Finally, since many mammals including domestic animals might be susceptible to SARS-CoV-2, both surveillance and experimental infection should be conducted.
targetString: 最后，由于包括家畜在内的许多哺乳动物都可能容易感染 SARS-CoV-2，因此应进行监测和实验性感染研究。
en-mt: Finally, because many mammals, including domestic animals, may be susceptible to SARS-CoV-2, surveillance and experimental infection studies should be undertaken.

sourceString: Should it be a bat, a pangolin or another mammal, it is expected that SARS-CoV-2 or its parental viruses that are almost identical will be identified in its natural hosts in future.
targetString: 如果是蝙蝠、穿山甲或其他哺乳动物，预计未来将会在自然宿主中发现SARS-CoV-2或者与其几乎相同的亲代病毒。
en-mt: In the case of bats, pangolins or other mammals, it is expected that SARS-CoV-2 or its nearly identical parent virus will be found in natural hosts in the future.

sourceString: Continued investigations in this area will elucidate the evolutionary pathway of SARS-CoV-2 in animals, with important implications in the prevention and control of COVID-19 in humans.
targetString: 在这一领域的继续研究将揭示 SARS-CoV-2 在动物中的进化途径，这对人类 COVID-19 的预防和控制具有重要意义。
en-mt: Continued research in this area will reveal the evolutionary pathway of SARS-CoV-2 in animals, which has important implications for the prevention and control of COVID-19 in humans.

sourceString: Updating the diagnostic criteria of COVID-19 “suspected case” and “confirmed case” is necessary
targetString: 有必要更新 COVID-19 “疑似病例”和“确诊病例”的诊断标准
en-mt: There is a need to update the diagnostic criteria for COVID-19 "suspected cases" and "confirmed cases"

sourceString: On 6 February 2020, our team had published a rapid advice guideline for diagnosis and treatment of 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) infection, and this guideline provided our experience and make well reference for fighting against this pandemic worldwide.
targetString: 2020 年 2 月 6 日，我们团队发布了《2019 新型冠状病毒 (2019-nCoV) 感染的诊断和治疗快速建议指南》，我们通过该指南为全球应对疫情提供了经验和借鉴。
en-mt: On February 6, 2020, our team released the "Rapid Advice Guideline for Diagnosis and Treatment of 2019 Novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV) Infection", through which we provide experience and reference for the global response to the outbreak.

sourceString: However, the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is a new disease, our awareness and knowledge are gradually increasing based on the ongoing research findings and clinical practice experience; hence, the strategies of diagnosis and treatment are also continually updated.
targetString: 然而，2019 冠状病毒疾病 (COVID-19) 是一种新型疾病，基于正在进行的研究成果和临床实践经验，我们对该疾病的认知在逐步提高；因此，诊断和治疗策略也在不断更新。
en-mt: However, coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is a novel disease, and our understanding of the disease is gradually improving based on ongoing research and clinical experience; therefore, diagnostic and therapeutic strategies are constantly being updated.

sourceString: In this letter, we answered one comment on our guideline and provided the newest diagnostic criteria of “suspected case” and “confirmed case” according to the latest Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 (seventh version) that issued by the National Health Committee of the People’s Republic of China.
targetString: 在本函中，我们回应了关于上述指南的一条意见，并根据中华人民共和国国家卫生健康委员会发布的最新《COVID-19 诊疗方案（第七版）》，提供了最新的“疑似病例”和“确诊病例”诊断标准。
en-mt: In this letter, we respond to a comment on the above guidelines and provide the latest "suspected cases" and " Confirmed cases” diagnostic criteria.

sourceString: In December 2019, the 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) has caused an outbreak, which is now officially named as the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and the virus has been named severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: 2019 年 12 月，2019 新型冠状病毒 (2019-nCoV) 爆发，目前，该疾病已被正式命名为 2019 冠状病毒疾病 (COVID-19)，该病毒曾被命名为严重急性呼吸综合征 2 型冠状病毒 (SARS-CoV-2)。
en-mt: In December 2019, the outbreak of 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) has now been officially named as coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), which was previously named severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: On 11 March 2020, WHO characterized COVID-19 as a pandemic.
targetString: 2020 年 3 月 11 日，WHO（世界卫生组织）将 COVID-19 列为全球性大流行病。
en-mt: On March 11, 2020, WHO (World Health Organization) listed COVID-19 as a global pandemic.

sourceString: In order to fight against the SARS-CoV-2 infection, our team has developed a rapid advice guideline and that has been published online in Military Medical Research on 06 February 2020.
targetString: 为对抗 SARS-CoV-2 感染，我们的团队制定了快速建议指南，并于 2020 年 2 月 06 日将该指南在线发布到《军事医学研究》杂志上。
en-mt: To combat SARS-CoV-2 infection, our team developed a rapid recommendation guideline and published it online in the Journal of Military Medical Research on February 06, 2020.

sourceString: It has attracted a great attention since published.
targetString: 自发布以来，它引起了广泛的关注。
en-mt: Since its release, it has attracted a lot of attention.

sourceString: Note however that COVID-19 is a new disease, our awareness and knowledge is gradually increasing based on the ongoing research findings and clinical practice experience; hence, the strategies of diagnosis and treatment are also continually updated.
targetString: 但请注意，COVID-19 是一种新型疾病，基于正在进行的研究成果和临床实践经验，我们对该疾病的认知在逐步提高；因此，诊断和治疗策略也在不断更新。
en-mt: Note, however, that COVID-19 is a new disease and our understanding of it is gradually improving based on ongoing research and clinical experience; therefore, diagnostic and treatment strategies are constantly being updated.

sourceString: For instance the Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 issued by the National Health Committee of the People’s Republic of China (http://www.nhc.gov.cn/), among 16 January 2020 to 3 March 2020, has issued a total of seven editions with some contexts being substantively changed.
targetString: 例如，中华人民共和国国家卫生健康委员会 (http://www.nhc.gov.cn/) 在 2020 年 1 月 16 日至 2020 年 3 月 3 日期间共发布了 7 版《COVID-19 诊疗方案》，其中部分内容已经发生了实质性的变化。
en-mt: For example, the National Health Commission of the People's Republic of China (http://www.nhc.gov.cn/) released a total of 7 editions of the "COVID-19 Diagnosis and Treatment Protocol" between January 16, 2020 and March 3, 2020 , some of which have been substantially changed.

sourceString: Now our guideline received a comment by Zhou et al., they introduced a simple scoring proposal based on their clinical experience.
targetString: 现在，我们的指南收到了 Zhou 等人的意见，他们根据自己的临床经验提出了一种简单的评分方案。
en-mt: Our guidelines now receive comments from Zhou et al., who proposed a simple scoring scheme based on their clinical experience.

sourceString: Their work added new evidence for our guideline and also make valuable reference for this pandemic worldwide.
targetString: 他们的工作为我们的指南提供了新的证据，也为这个全球性大流行病提供了有价值的参考。
en-mt: Their work provides new evidence for our guidelines and a valuable reference for this global pandemic.

sourceString: We endorse their significant work and express our thanks.
targetString: 我们认可他们所做的这一重要工作并表示感谢。
en-mt: We recognize and thank them for this important work.

sourceString: However, their work also needs update according to the latest Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 (Trial seventh version) and recently studies.
targetString: 不过，他们的提案也需要根据最新的《COVID-19 诊疗方案（试行第七版）》以及最近的研究进行更新。
en-mt: However, their proposals also need to be updated with the latest COVID-19 Treatment Protocol (Trial Seventh Edition) as well as recent research.

sourceString: According to the seventh edition (3 March 2020), to confirm the suspected case needs to combine any one item of epidemiological history features with two items of clinical manifestations to make a comprehensive analysis, or needs to meet three items of clinical manifestations if without clear epidemiological history:
targetString: 根据第七版（2020 年 3 月 3 日），疑似病例的确诊需要将一项流行病学史特征与两项临床表现相结合以进行综合分析，如果没有明确的流行病学史，则需要满足三项临床表现：
en-mt: According to the seventh edition (March 3, 2020), the diagnosis of a suspected case needs to combine one epidemiological history feature with two clinical manifestations for comprehensive analysis, and if there is no clear epidemiological history, it needs to meet Three clinical manifestations:

sourceString: Epidemiological history: (1) a history of travel or residence in Wuhan city and surrounding areas, or other communities where COVID-19 cases had been reported in the last 14 days before symptom onset; (2) a history of contact with SARS-CoV-2 infectious cases (with positive nucleic acid test); (3) a history of contacting with patients with fever or respiratory symptoms from Wuhan city and surrounding areas, or other communities where COVID-19 had been reported in the last 14 days before symptom onset; (4) a history of contacting with cluster of confirmed cases (≥ 2 cases with fever and/or respiratory symptoms occurred within 2 weeks in small areas, such as home, office, class of school, etc).
targetString: 流行病学史：(1) 在症状出现前 14 天内曾在武汉市及周边地区或其他报告有 COVID-19 病例的社区有旅行或居住史；(2) 与 SARS-CoV-2 感染病例（核酸检测呈阳性）有接触史；(3) 在症状出现前 14 天内曾与来自武汉市及周边地区或其他报告有 COVID-19 的社区的发热或呼吸道症状患者有接触史；(4) 与聚集性确诊病例（在症状出现前 2 周内，于小范围内接触 ≥ 2 例发热和/或呼吸道症状患者，如家中、办公室、学校班级等）有接触史。
en-mt: Epidemiological history: (1) Travel or residence history in Wuhan and surrounding areas or other communities with reported COVID-19 cases within 14 days before the onset of symptoms; (3) had a history of contact with patients with fever or respiratory symptoms from Wuhan City and surrounding areas or other communities reporting COVID-19 within 14 days before the onset of symptoms; (4) had a history of contact with clustered Confirmed cases (contact with ≥ 2 patients with fever and/or respiratory symptoms in a small area within 2 weeks before the onset of symptoms, such as home, office, school class, etc.) have a contact history.

sourceString: Clinical manifestations: (1) fever and/ or respiratory symptoms; (2) with imaging features of COVID-19 infection; (3) total white blood cell counts showing normal, decreased, or reduced lymphocyte count in the early onset stage.
targetString: 临床表现：(1) 发热和/或呼吸道症状；(2) 具有 COVID-19 感染的影像学特征；(3) 发病早期白细胞总数正常或减少，淋巴细胞计数减少。
en-mt: Clinical manifestations: (1) fever and/or respiratory symptoms; (2) imaging features of COVID-19 infection; (3) normal or decreased total white blood cell count and decreased lymphocyte count in the early stage of onset.

sourceString: Diagnosing the confirmed case should base on suspected case with any one item of pathogenic or serological evidence as following: (1) real-time PCR test positive for SARS-CoV-2; (2) viral whole genome sequencing showing high homogeneity to the known novel coronaviruses; (3) positive for the specific IgM antibody and IgG antibody to SARS-CoV-2 in serum test; or a change of the SARS-CoV-2-specific IgG antibody from negative to positive, or titer rising ≥4 times in the recovery phase above that in the acute phase.
targetString: 对确诊病例的诊断应以疑似病例为依据，并有下列任何一项病原学或血清学证据：(1) SARS-CoV-2 的实时 PCR 检测呈阳性；(2) 病毒全基因组测序显示与已知的新型冠状病毒高度同源；(3) 血清试验中针对 SARS-CoV-2 的特异性 IgM 抗体和 IgG 抗体呈阳性；或 SARS-CoV-2 特异性 IgG 抗体由阴性变为阳性，或在恢复期中滴度上升 ≥4 倍，高于急性期。
en-mt: Diagnosis of confirmed cases should be based on suspected cases with any of the following etiological or serological evidence: (1) positive real-time PCR test for SARS-CoV-2; (3) The specific IgM antibody and IgG antibody against SARS-CoV-2 in the serum test are positive; or the specific IgG antibody of SARS-CoV-2 changes from negative to positive, or The titer increased ≥ 4 times in the recovery period, which was higher than that in the acute period.

sourceString: We can see that the real-time PCR test for nucleic acid in respiratory tract or blood samples was added to the second (18 January 2020) and third (22 January 2020) editions.
targetString: 我们可以看到，第二版（2020 年 1 月 18 日）和第三版（2020 年 1 月 22 日）增加了呼吸道或血液标本中的实时 PCR 核酸检测。
en-mt: We can see that the second edition (January 18, 2020) and third edition (January 22, 2020) added real-time PCR nucleic acid detection in respiratory or blood specimens.

sourceString: The pathogenic detection of blood sample was added to the fourth (27 January 2020) and fifth (8 February 2020) editions; and then the serological evidence was added to the seventh edition.
targetString: 第四版（2020 年 1 月 27 日）和第五版（2020 年 2 月 8 日）增加了血液标本病原学检测；之后第七版增加了血清学证据。
en-mt: The fourth edition (January 27, 2020) and fifth edition (February 8, 2020) added pathogenic testing of blood specimens; later, the seventh edition added serological evidence.

sourceString: These modifications based on the researchers continued work that to search for an optimal nucleic acid detection kit for rapid diagnosis, as well as the samples from respiratory tract including blood sampling, which increased the availability of different specimens, and supported bringing the specific antibody positive result into the confirmed criteria.
targetString: 这些修改基于研究人员为实现快速诊断而研究最佳核酸检测试剂盒的持续工作，以及包括采血在内的呼吸道标本，这增加了不同标本的可用性，并为将特异性抗体的阳性结果纳入确诊标准提供了证据。
en-mt: These modifications are based on the ongoing work of researchers to develop optimal nucleic acid testing kits for rapid diagnosis, and respiratory specimens, including blood collection, which increases the availability of different specimens and provides the basis for the inclusion of positive results for specific antibodies as diagnostic criteria Evidence provided.

sourceString: Besides, there are more and more evidence that remind us to caution with the atypical symptomatic and asymptomatic patients.
targetString: 此外，越来越多的证据提醒我们注意非典型症状和无症状患者。
en-mt: In addition, accumulating evidence alerts us to atypical symptoms and asymptomatic patients.

sourceString: Hence, the flow chart of Zhou et al. should be updated, as they classified the person without clinical symptoms as “low risk”.
targetString: 因此，应更新 Zhou 等人的流程图，因为他们将没有临床症状的人员归类为“低风险”。
en-mt: Therefore, the algorithm of Zhou et al. should be updated, as they classify persons without clinical symptoms as 'low risk'.

sourceString: The score system also needs to be verified in further clinical practice and studies.
targetString: 另外，评分系统还需要在进一步的临床实践和研究中得到验证。
en-mt: In addition, the scoring system needs to be validated in further clinical practice and research.

sourceString: To conclude, we hope more direct evidence coming up and call for readers to provide their comments.
targetString: 最后，我们希望出现更多直接的证据，并呼吁读者提出意见。
en-mt: Finally, we hope that more direct evidence will emerge and call for comments from readers.

sourceString: For the diagnosis of “suspected case” and “confirmed case”, we suggest to trace and obey the newest guidelines of their home countries.
targetString: 对于“疑似病例”和“确诊病例”的诊断，我们建议参考并遵循病例所在国的最新指南。
en-mt: For the diagnosis of "suspected cases" and "confirmed cases", we recommend to refer to and follow the latest guidelines of the country where the case is located.

sourceString: Our team will also timely update our guideline to offer help.
targetString: 我们团队也会及时更新我们的指南以提供帮助。
en-mt: Our team will also update our guides to help.

sourceString: Bangladesh reports five new deaths due to COVID-19, a daily highest
targetString: 孟加拉国报告新增COVID-19死亡病例5例，创单日新高
en-mt: Bangladesh reports 5 new COVID-19 deaths, single-day high

sourceString: Yesterday, Bangladesh has confirmed five new deaths due to COVID-19 on the day.
targetString: 昨日，孟加拉国证实当日新增COVID-19死亡病例5例。
en-mt: Bangladesh confirmed five new deaths from COVID-19 yesterday.

sourceString: This is the highest number of fatalities in a day due to the virus.
targetString: 这创下该病毒所致单日死亡病例新高。
en-mt: This marks a new high for the number of deaths from the virus in a single day.

sourceString: As of yesterday, Bangladesh's Institute of Epidemiology, Disease Control and Research (IEDCR) reported the number of recorded infected cases included 114 active cases and 33 recovered cases who were staying home.
targetString: 截止到昨天，孟加拉国流行病学、疾病控制和研究所(IEDCR)报告的感染病例记录中，现有确诊病例114例，家中休息后治愈33例。
en-mt: As of yesterday, among the infection case records reported by the Bangladesh Institute of Epidemiology, Disease Control and Research (IEDCR), there are 114 confirmed cases and 33 recovered after resting at home.

sourceString: A total of 17 deaths have been recorded.
targetString: 累计死亡17例。
en-mt: A total of 17 cases died.

sourceString: In an online news briefing, the director of IEDCR, Dr Meerjady Sabrina Flora, said the fatalities included four males and one female.
targetString: 在线上新闻发布会上，IEDCR负责人Meerjady Sabrina Flora博士称，这些死亡病例中包括4名男性和1名女性。
en-mt: In an online news conference, IEDCR head Dr Meerjady Sabrina Flora said the deaths included four men and one woman.

sourceString: According to Dr Meerjady, two cases were aged above 60, two between 51 and 60, and one 41-50 years old.
targetString: 据Meerjady博士所说，有2例的年龄在60岁以上，2例在51-60岁之间，还有1例在41-50岁之间。
en-mt: According to Dr. Meerjady, two cases were aged over 60, two cases were between the ages of 51-60 and one case was between the ages of 41-50.

sourceString: She also said two of the victims were from Dhaka.
targetString: 她还表示，其中有2名死亡患者来自达卡。
en-mt: She also said that two of the deceased patients were from Dhaka.

sourceString: The World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a pandemic on March 11.
targetString: 世界卫生组织(WHO)于3月11日宣布COVID-19为全球大规模流行疾病（pandemic）。
en-mt: The World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a global pandemic on March 11.

sourceString: A hospital official told Anadolu Agency, a local news outlet, that one of the deceased was Jalal Saifur Rahman, a director of Bengali Anti-Corruption Commission, who was cared for at the Kuwait Maitree Hospital.
targetString: 一位医院官员向当地新闻媒体Anadolu Agency透露，其中一名死亡患者是孟加拉反腐败委员会主任Jalal Saifur Rahman，他曾在Kuwait Maitree医院接受治疗。
en-mt: One of the patients who died was Bangladesh Anti-Corruption Commission chief Jalal Saifur Rahman, who had been treated at Kuwait Maitree Hospital, a hospital official told local news outlet Anadolu Agency.

sourceString: On Saturday, in an online video announcement, Bangladeshi Road Transport and Bridges Minister Obaidul Quader said public transport would be shut down for longer than initially planned, until this coming Saturday.
targetString: 星期六，孟加拉国公路运输和桥梁部长Obaidul Quader通过在线视频宣布，公共交通停运时间将超出最初计划，延长至本周六。
en-mt: On Saturday, Bangladesh's Minister of Road Transport and Bridges Obaidul Quader announced via online video that the suspension of public transport will be extended beyond the initial plan until this Saturday.

sourceString: This public transport shutdown had initially started on March 26 and was planned to end on Saturday, April 4.
targetString: 此次公共交通停运始于3月26日，原计划于4月4日星期六结束。
en-mt: The public transit shutdown began on March 26 and was originally scheduled to end on Saturday, April 4.

sourceString: Transport of essential goods -- medical, fuel and food -- was still allowed.
targetString: 医疗、燃料和食物等基本物资仍然可正常运输。
en-mt: Essential supplies such as medical care, fuel and food can still be shipped as normal.

sourceString: The first recorded incidents of COVID-19 infection in Bangladesh were on March 8, in two people who returned from Italy and also the wife of one of them.
targetString: 3月8日，孟加拉国首次记录的COVID-19确诊病例中，2人从意大利返回，另外1名患者为其中1名确诊患者的妻子。
en-mt: On March 8, among the first confirmed cases of COVID-19 recorded in Bangladesh, 2 returned from Italy, and the other patient was the wife of one of the confirmed patients.

sourceString: As of March 19, these three had already recovered.
targetString: 截止到3月19日，这3名患者均已康复。
en-mt: As of March 19, all three patients have recovered.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 surpasses one million infections worldwide
targetString: SARS-CoV-2在全球的感染人数超过百万
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 infects more than one million people worldwide

sourceString: On Thursday, the total number of cases of the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus infections surpassed one million worldwide, Johns Hopkins University data indicated.
targetString: 约翰-霍普金斯大学的数据显示，全球SARS-CoV-2冠状病毒感染病例总数在星期四已超过100万。
en-mt: The total number of global cases of the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus surpassed 1 million on Thursday, according to data from Johns Hopkins University.

sourceString: At least 52 thousand deaths were linked to COVID-19, the disease caused by the coronavirus.
targetString: 至少5.2万例死亡与由冠状病毒引发的疾病 - COVID-19有关。
en-mt: At least 52,000 deaths have been linked to COVID-19, the disease caused by the coronavirus.

sourceString: The milestone came the same day Malawi confirmed its first coronavirus infections and Zambia had its first coronavirus-related death.
targetString: 在发生该里程碑事件的同一天，马拉维证实了该国首例冠状病毒感染，赞比亚出现首例与冠状病毒相关的死亡病例。
en-mt: The milestone came on the same day that Malawi confirmed the country's first coronavirus infection and Zambia recorded its first coronavirus-related death.

sourceString: North Korea claimed, as of Thursday, it was one of the few countries remaining free of coronavirus infections.
targetString: 朝鲜宣称，截止到星期四，该国是少数没有冠状病毒感染的国家之一。
en-mt: North Korea claimed it was one of the few countries free of coronavirus infections as of Thursday.

sourceString: By yesterday, the World Health Organization reported 1,051,635 confirmed cases, including 79,332 cases in the twenty four hours preceding 10 a.m. Central European Time (0800 UTC) on April 4.
targetString: 截至到昨天，世界卫生组织已报告1051635例确诊病例，包括欧洲中部时间4月4日上午10点(0800 UTC)之前24小时内的79332例。
en-mt: As of yesterday, the World Health Organization had reported 1,051,635 confirmed cases, including 79,332 in the 24 hours to 10:00 AM CET (0800 UTC) on 4 April.

sourceString: In the United States, over 244 thousand coronavirus cases were recorded, linking to at least 5,900 deaths.
targetString: 在美国，据记载已有超过24.4万例冠状病毒病例，至少造成5900人死亡。
en-mt: In the United States, there have been more than 244,000 recorded cases of coronavirus and at least 5,900 deaths.

sourceString: CBS News reported, citing Johns Hopkins University data, there were over 1,000 US deaths on Wednesday caused by coronavirus infections.
targetString: CBS新闻援引约翰-霍普金斯大学的数据报道，在星期三，冠状病毒感染导致美国1000多人死亡。
en-mt: Coronavirus infections killed more than 1,000 people in the United States on Wednesday, CBS News reported, citing data from Johns Hopkins University.

sourceString: Around the world, countries announced stricter measures to inhibit the disease from spreading.
targetString: 在全世界，各个国家都宣布了更为严格的措施来抑制疾病扩散。
en-mt: Around the world, countries have announced stricter measures to curb the spread of the disease.

sourceString: On Thursday, Sergei Sobyanin, the mayor of Moscow, extended the city lockdown to May 1.
targetString: 星期四，莫斯科市长Sergei Sobyanin将封城日期延长至5月1日。
en-mt: On Thursday, Moscow Mayor Sergei Sobyanin extended the lockdown until May 1.

sourceString: Nationally, President Vladimir Putin declared Russians would continue to be paid without going to work until April 30.
targetString: 总统弗拉基米尔·普京宣布，在全国范围内俄罗斯人将在停工期间继续获得报酬，直到4月30日。
en-mt: Russians across the country will continue to be paid during the shutdown until April 30, President Vladimir Putin announced.

sourceString: The parliament of Portugal voted to extend the national state of emergency by 15 days; the vote passed with 215 votes in favor, ten abstentions, and one vote against.
targetString: 葡萄牙议会投票决定将国家紧急状态延长15天；投票以215票赞成、10票弃权和1票反对获得通过。
en-mt: Portugal's parliament voted to extend the state of emergency for 15 days; the vote was adopted by 215 in favour, 10 abstentions and 1 against.

sourceString: Saudi Arabia extended curfews in the holy cities of Mecca and Medina to last the entire day; previously, the curfew was only in effect between 3 p.m. and 6 a.m.
targetString: 沙特阿拉伯延长了圣城麦加和麦地那的宵禁，改为全天宵禁；之前，宵禁仅在下午3点至凌晨6点之间有效。
en-mt: Saudi Arabia extended the curfew in the holy cities of Mecca and Medina to a full-day curfew; previously, the curfew was only in effect between 3pm and 6am.

sourceString: Thailand planned to implement a curfew between 10 p.m. and 4 a.m.
targetString: 泰国计划在晚上10点至凌晨4点之间实施宵禁。
en-mt: Thailand plans to impose a curfew between 10pm and 4am.

sourceString: The governor of Ohio, Mike DeWine, announced the state had extended its stay-at-home order until May 1.
targetString: 俄亥俄州州长Mike DeWine宣布，该州已将居家令延长至5月1日。
en-mt: Ohio Governor Mike DeWine announced that the state has extended the stay-at-home order until May 1.

sourceString: Stores in Australia lower toilet paper limits per transaction
targetString: 澳大利亚的商店降低了每次交易的卫生纸数量上限
en-mt: Australia's stores lower cap on toilet paper per transaction

sourceString: On Sunday and Saturday evening, Australian store chains Woolworths and Coles lowered their purchase restrictions on toilet paper to two and one package per transaction in all stores on national level, respectively.
targetString: 在星期天和星期六晚上，澳大利亚的连锁商店Woolworths和Coles在全国范围内分别将其所有商店的每次交易卫生纸购买上限降低至两包和一包。
en-mt: On Sunday and Saturday night, Australian store chains Woolworths and Coles across the country reduced the per-transaction limit on toilet paper purchases to two packs and one pack respectively in all of their stores.

sourceString: ALDI also introduced a one-pack limit, on Monday.
targetString: ALDI也在星期一推出了限购一包的限制。
en-mt: ALDI also introduced a one-pack limit on Monday.

sourceString: These limitations were posted as messages on the checkouts, and on the chains' Facebook pages.
targetString: 这些限制以消息的形式张贴在收银台或发布到连锁店的Facebook页面上。
en-mt: The restrictions are posted in the form of messages posted at the checkout counter or posted to the chain's Facebook page.

sourceString: Buyers were reportedly stocking up due to fears of COVID-19 in case people need to self-isolate.
targetString: 报道称，买家由于害怕COVID-19而囤积货物，以防他们需要自我隔离。
en-mt: Reports say buyers are stockpiling goods due to fear of COVID-19 in case they need to self-isolate.

sourceString: On Wednesday, Woolworths also limited toilet paper purchases for home delivery to one pack per order.
targetString: 星期三，Woolworths还将送货上门的卫生纸购买数量限制为每单一包。
en-mt: On Wednesday, Woolworths will also limit purchases of toilet paper for home delivery to a single pack.

sourceString: These changes followed the previous four-pack per transaction restriction introduced by Woolworths and Coles on March 4 and 5 respectively.
targetString: 在这些变更之前，Woolworths和Coles分别于3月4日和5日推出了每次交易限购4包的限制。
en-mt: The changes follow Woolworths and Coles, which introduced limits of four packs per transaction on March 4 and 5 respectively.

sourceString: Coles, in its March 8 media release, reported that with the four-pack restriction in place, "many stores are still selling out within an hour of delivery", and called the demand "unprecedented", while ALDI, in a Facebook post on Tuesday, called it "unexpected".
targetString: Coles在其3月8日的新闻稿中报告，实施限购4包的限制后，“许多商店仍然在到货后一小时内就售罄了”，并称需求是“前所未有的”，同时，ALDI在星期二的Facebook帖子中称其“始料不及”。
en-mt: Coles reported in its March 8 press release that "many stores were still sold out within an hour of arrival" after the four-pack limit was imposed, saying demand was "unprecedented", while ALDI Called it "unexpected" in a Facebook post on Tuesday.

sourceString: Sales went up in a "sharp increase" last week, according to a Woolworths spokesperson.
targetString: 据一位Woolworths发言人所说，上周的销售额“急剧增加”。
en-mt: According to a Woolworths spokesman, sales had "increased dramatically" last week.

sourceString: Costco's store in Canberra also limited the allowed amount to two packs last week.
targetString: 上周，堪培拉的Costco商店也将允许的数量限制为两包。
en-mt: Last week, Costco stores in Canberra also limited the quantities allowed to two packs.

sourceString: To further alleviate the shortage, Coles ordered bigger packages from suppliers and increased delivery frequency, Woolworths ordered extra stock, while ALDI made stocks for a planned Wednesday special available early.
targetString: 为了进一步缓解短缺，Coles向供应商订购了更大的包装，并提高了交货频率，Woolworths订购了额外的库存，而ALDI则提前为计划的星期三特惠准备好库存。
en-mt: To further alleviate shortages, Coles ordered larger packs from suppliers and increased the frequency of deliveries, Woolworths ordered extra stock and ALDI stocked ahead for planned Wednesday specials.

sourceString: Russell Zimmerman, executive director of the Australian Retailers Association, said that retailers try to raise stock, but local council restrictions on the timing of truck-deliveries make it hard.
targetString: 澳大利亚零售商协会执行董事Russell Zimmerman表示，零售商试图增加库存，但地方议会对卡车送货时间的限制让这变得困难。
en-mt: Russell Zimmerman, executive director of the Australian Retailers Association, said retailers were trying to stock up but local council restrictions on truck delivery times were making that difficult.

sourceString: He expects rising production costs, as suppliers try to meet demand, and fewer specials.
targetString: 他预计，随着供应商尽力满足需求，生产成本将上升，而特惠活动则会减少。
en-mt: He expects production costs to rise and special offers to dwindle as suppliers struggle to meet demand.

sourceString: On Tuesday, ALDI announced that following the early release of stock, some stores can't run the Wednesday special.
targetString: 星期二，ALDI宣布，在提前释放库存后，一些商店将无法举行星期三特惠活动。
en-mt: On Tuesday, ALDI announced that some stores would not be able to hold their Wednesday specials after an early release of stock.

sourceString: In a News.com.au report, Dr Gary Mortimer, retail expert from Queensland University of Technology, said the stores fill the stock every night.
targetString: 在News.com.au的一份报告中，昆士兰科技大学的零售专家Gary Mortimer博士称，商店每晚都会补充库存。
en-mt: In a report by News.com.au, Queensland University of Technology retail expert Dr Gary Mortimer said stores were restocking every night.

sourceString: He remarked toilet paper is a bulky item, leading to low quantity of stocks in numbers, and, when sold out, leaves vast shelf spaces empty, hardening the feeling of a shortage.
targetString: 他说，卫生纸是大件物品，因此库存数量较少，而且，一旦售罄，会留下巨大的货架空间，加剧了物资短缺的感觉。
en-mt: Toilet paper is a big-ticket item, so there are fewer stocks in stock and, once sold out, it leaves huge shelf space, exacerbating the feeling of shortage, he said.

sourceString: "Coles and Woolworths have a view [that] if there was plenty of stuff on the shelf, if product like toilet rolls and sanitiser could be [bought] and are there in quantities, you would probably minimise the panic" said Russell Zimmerman per ABC News.
targetString: “Coles和Woolworths的观点是，如果货架上有许多东西，像卷筒纸和洗手液等商品可以[买到]并且数量充足，您可能不会那么恐慌。”Russell Zimmerman对ABC新闻说。
en-mt: "The point of Coles and Woolworths is that if there's a lot of stuff on the shelves, and things like roll paper and hand sanitizer are [available] and in sufficient quantities, you're probably less panicked," Russell Zimmerman told ABC News.

sourceString: Recycled toilet paper producer Who Gives a Crap said on last Wednesday they'd run out of stock.
targetString: 再生卫生纸制造商Who Gives a Crap上个星期三表示，他们已经没有库存了。
en-mt: Recycled toilet paper maker Who Gives a Crap said last Wednesday it was out of stock.

sourceString: Kimberly-Clark, which makes Kleenex Toilet Tissue, and Solaris Paper which makes Sorbent, emphasized they were working 24/7 to maintain the supply, according to the News.com.au report.
targetString: 据News.com.au报道，制造舒洁卫生纸的Kimberly-Clark和制造Sorbent卫生纸的Solaris Paper都强调，他们正在全天候工作，周末无休，以保证供应。
en-mt: Kimberly-Clark, which makes Kleenex toilet paper, and Solaris Paper, which makes Sorbent toilet paper, both stressed they were working around the clock, including weekends, to ensure supplies, News.com.au reported.

sourceString: Domain.com, a real estate site, reported some property sellers offering free toilet paper to the first bidder on auctions in Melbourne, when fewer auctions were held because of buyers having time off on the long weekend of Labour Day.
targetString: 房地产网站Domain.com报道称，由于买家在劳动节长周末休息，举行的拍卖数量较少，因此一些房地产商在墨尔本举行的拍卖会上会向第一位竞标者提供免费卫生纸。
en-mt: Real estate website Domain.com has reported that some real estate developers are offering free toilet paper to the first bidder at auctions in Melbourne as buyers take a break over the Labor Day long weekend and fewer auctions are being held.

sourceString: The Thursday edition of NT News, a daily printed in Darwin, included an eight-page insert meant to be cut up and used as toilet paper.
targetString: NT新闻是在达尔文市印刷的日报，在其星期四版的报纸中包含8页的插页，旨在供裁剪后用作卫生纸。
en-mt: NT News, a daily newspaper printed in Darwin, contains 8 page inserts in its Thursday edition, intended to be cut and used as toilet paper.

sourceString: The stores were originally reluctant to impose restrictions, according to a report from ABC Australia on March 3 in which they said they had no plans to introduce restrictions on the purchases.
targetString: 据ABC Australia 3月3日的报道，商店最初并不愿意实施限购，他们说他们并没有计划实施购买限制。
en-mt: Stores were initially reluctant to impose purchase limits, saying they had no plans to impose them, ABC Australia reported on March 3.

sourceString: Russell Zimmerman added that other products are also in high demand, including masks, sanitiser, dried goods, handwash and flour.
targetString: Russell Zimmerman补充说，其他商品的需求也很高，包括口罩、洗手液、干货、洗手液和面粉。
en-mt: Russell Zimmerman added that other commodities were also in high demand, including face masks, hand sanitizer, dry goods, hand sanitizer and flour.

sourceString: Similarly, outside of Australia, on Sunday evening online British supermarket Ocado was observed limiting purchases of Andres toilet paper to two 12-roll packs.
targetString: 同样，在澳大利亚以外，英国网上超市Ocado在星期天晚上将Andres卫生纸的购买数量限制为2包，每包12卷。
en-mt: Similarly, outside Australia, British online supermarket Ocado limited purchases of Andres toilet paper to two packs of 12 rolls on Sunday night.

sourceString: World Health Organization declares COVID-19 pandemic
targetString: 世界卫生组织宣布COVID-19为大流行
en-mt: WHO declares COVID-19 a pandemic

sourceString: On Wednesday, the World Health Organization (WHO) declared the ongoing outbreak of COVID-19 — the disease caused by coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 — to be a pandemic.
targetString: 星期三，世界卫生组织(WHO)宣布，持续爆发的COVID-19（由冠状病毒SARS-CoV-2引发的疾病）为大流行。
en-mt: On Wednesday, the World Health Organization (WHO) declared the ongoing outbreak of COVID-19, the disease caused by the coronavirus SARS-CoV-2, a pandemic.

sourceString: Although the word "pandemic" only refers to how widely a disease has spread, not how dangerous specific cases are, the WHO noted the need to drive governments to action:
targetString: 尽管“大流行”一词仅指疾病的扩散程度，而并非特定病例的危险程度，但WHO指出需要敦促政府采取措施：
en-mt: Although the term "pandemic" refers only to how widespread the disease is, not how dangerous a particular case is, the WHO says it needs to urge governments to take action:

sourceString: "All countries can still change the course of this pandemic.
targetString: “所有国家/地区仍然可以改变本次大流行的进程。
en-mt: "All countries can still change the course of this pandemic.

sourceString: If countries detect, test, treat, isolate, trace and mobilize their people in the response," said Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, the Director-General of the WHO.
targetString: 如果各个国家/地区对其人民进行检测、测试、治疗、隔离、追踪和动员作为应对措施，”WHO总干事Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus说道。
en-mt: If countries test, test, treat, isolate, trace and mobilize their people as a response," said WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus.

sourceString: "We are deeply concerned both by the alarming levels of spread and severity and by the alarming levels of inaction."
targetString: “我们对于扩散和严重性的惊人程度以及不作为的惊人程度深感担忧。”
en-mt: "We are deeply concerned by the alarming level of proliferation and severity, and the alarming level of inaction."

sourceString: According to Dr. Tom Frieden, formerly the director of the United States' Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, the pandemic is "unprecedented."
targetString: 据美国疾病控制与预防中心前主任Tom Frieden博士所说，这次大流行是“空前的”。
en-mt: According to Dr. Tom Frieden, former director of the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, the pandemic is "unprecedented."

sourceString: He said, in remarks published by CNN in February, "other than influenza, no other respiratory virus has been tracked from emergence to continuous global spread."
targetString: 他于2月在CNN发表评论说，“除了流感之外，还没有发现哪种呼吸道病毒在出现以后持续扩散到全球。”
en-mt: He commented on CNN in February that "except for influenza, no respiratory virus has been identified that has emerged and continued to spread globally."

sourceString: Ghebreyesus expressed a similar view, saying "we have never before seen a pandemic sparked by a coronavirus."
targetString: Ghebreyesus表达了类似的观点，并且说“我们以前从未见过冠状病毒引发的大流行。”
en-mt: Ghebreyesus echoed similar sentiments, saying "we've never seen a coronavirus-induced pandemic before."

sourceString: He continued, "and we have never before seen a pandemic that can be controlled at the same time."
targetString: 他继续说道，“同样，我们以前也从未见过可以控制的病毒大流行。”
en-mt: He continued, "Again, we've never seen a controllable pandemic before."

sourceString: The new status as a pandemic follows the WHO's decision in January to declare the outbreak a public health emergency of international concern.
targetString: 进入大流行的新状态之前，WHO在1月确定此次爆发为国际关注的突发公共卫生事件。
en-mt: Before entering the new status of a pandemic, the WHO declared the outbreak a Public Health Emergency of International Concern in January.

sourceString: The United States' National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Disease's director, Dr. Anthony Fauci, said of the outbreak, "bottom line, it's going to get worse."
targetString: 美国国家过敏症和传染病研究所主任Anthony Fauci博士说到此次爆发，“最重要的是，它仍在恶化。”
en-mt: Dr. Anthony Fauci, director of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases, said of the outbreak, "The bottom line is, it's still getting worse."

sourceString: As of Thursday, Associated Press reported there were at least 126,000 cases of COVID-19 worldwide, resulting in over 4,600 deaths.
targetString: 截止到星期四，美联社报道全球的COVID-19病例至少为126000例，导致4600多人死亡。
en-mt: As of Thursday, The Associated Press reported at least 126,000 cases of COVID-19 worldwide, with more than 4,600 deaths.

sourceString: The 2019–20 coronavirus pandemic is an ongoing pandemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: 2019-2020 冠状病毒疫情是持续蔓延的 2019 新型冠状病毒疾病 (COVID-19)，由严重急性呼吸综合征冠状病毒 2 型 (SARS-CoV-2) 引起。
en-mt: The 2019-2020 coronavirus outbreak is the ongoing 2019 novel coronavirus disease (COVID-19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: The outbreak was identified in Wuhan, China, in December 2019, declared to be a Public Health Emergency of International Concern on 30 January 2020, and recognized as a pandemic on 11 March 2020.
targetString: 本次爆发于 2019 年 12 月在中国武汉确认，2020 年 1 月 30 日被列为国际关注的公共卫生突发事件，2020 年 3 月 11 日被认定为流行病。
en-mt: The outbreak was confirmed in Wuhan, China in December 2019, declared a Public Health Emergency of International Concern on January 30, 2020, and an epidemic on March 11, 2020.

sourceString: As of 10 April 2020, approximately 1.61 million cases of COVID-19 have been reported in 210 countries and territories, resulting in approximately 97,000 deaths.
targetString: 截至 2020 年 4 月 10 日，全球 210 个国家和地区累计报告约 161 万 COVID-19 病例，死亡约 9.7 万人，
en-mt: As of April 10, 2020, a total of 1.61 million COVID-19 cases and 97,000 deaths have been reported in 210 countries and regions around the world.

sourceString: About 364,000 people have recovered.
targetString: 治愈约 36.4 万人。
en-mt: About 364,000 people were cured.

sourceString: The case fatality rate has been estimated to be 4% in China, while globally ranging from 13.04% in Algeria to .08% in New Zealand.
targetString: 中国病死率约 4%，而全球各地区病死率则介于 0.08%（新西兰）到 13.04%（阿尔及利亚）之间。
en-mt: The case fatality rate in China is about 4%, while the case fatality rate in various regions of the world ranges from 0.08% (New Zealand) to 13.04% (Algeria).

sourceString: Common symptoms include fever, cough and shortness of breath.
targetString: 常见症状包括发热、咳嗽和气促。
en-mt: Common symptoms include fever, cough, and shortness of breath.

sourceString: Complications may include pneumonia and acute respiratory distress syndrome.
targetString: 并可能伴有肺炎、急性呼吸窘迫综合征等并发症。
en-mt: And may be accompanied by pneumonia, acute respiratory distress syndrome and other complications.

sourceString: The time from exposure to onset of symptoms is typically around five days, but may range from two to fourteen days.
targetString: 从接触病患到发病的潜伏期为 2-14 天不等，通常为 5 天左右。
en-mt: The incubation period from contact with a sick person to onset of symptoms ranges from 2 to 14 days, usually about 5 days.

sourceString: There is no known vaccine or specific antiviral treatment.
targetString: 目前尚无疫苗或特效抗病毒治疗方案。
en-mt: There is currently no vaccine or specific antiviral treatment options.

sourceString: Primary treatment is symptomatic and supportive therapy.Recommended preventive measures include hand washing, covering one's mouth when coughing, maintaining distance from other people, and monitoring and self-isolation for people who suspect they are infected.
targetString: 临床治疗以对症支持治疗为主。推荐采取的预防措施包括勤洗手、咳嗽时遮挡口部、与他人保持安全距离、对疑似感染者进行监控和自我隔离等。
en-mt: Clinical treatment is mainly symptomatic and supportive. Recommended preventive measures include washing hands frequently, covering coughs, keeping a safe distance from others, monitoring suspected infected persons and self-isolation.

sourceString: Authorities worldwide have responded by implementing travel restrictions, quarantines, curfews, workplace hazard controls, and facility closures.
targetString: 各国官方机构已采取旅行限制、隔离、宵禁、工作场所危险防控和设施关闭等应对措施。
en-mt: Authorities around the world have responded with travel restrictions, quarantines, curfews, workplace hazard prevention and facility closures.

sourceString: The pandemic has led to severe global socioeconomic disruption, the postponement or cancellation of sporting, religious, political and cultural events, and widespread shortages of supplies exacerbated by panic buying.
targetString: 此次疫情导致全球社会经济遭受严重冲击，体育、宗教、政治和文化活动纷纷推迟或取消，而恐慌性购物更是加剧了大范围供应短缺。
en-mt: The epidemic has caused severe social and economic shocks around the world. Sports, religious, political and cultural activities have been postponed or canceled, and panic shopping has exacerbated widespread supply shortages.

sourceString: Schools and universities have closed either on a nationwide or local basis in 193 countries, affecting approximately 99.4 percent  of the world's student population.
targetString: 全球 193 个国家和地区实行全国或地方性的停学措施，约 99.4% 的中小学和高校学生受到影响。
en-mt: 193 countries and regions around the world have implemented national or local school suspension measures, and about 99.4% of primary, secondary and college students have been affected.

sourceString: Misinformation about the virus has spread online, and there have been incidents of xenophobia and discrimination against Chinese people, other people of East and Southeast Asian descent and appearance, and others from areas with significant virus cases.
targetString: 由于虚假病毒信息在网上传播，出现了针对中国人、其他东亚和东南亚血统和外貌群体以及疫情严重地区群体的仇外与歧视事件。
en-mt: Due to the spread of false virus information online, there have been incidents of xenophobia and discrimination against Chinese people, other groups of East and Southeast Asian ancestry and appearance, and groups in severely affected areas.

sourceString: Due to reduced travel and closures of heavy industry, there has been a decrease in air pollution and carbon emissions.
targetString: 不过，出行减少和重工业关闭使得空气污染指数下降，碳排放减少。
en-mt: However, reduced travel and the closure of heavy industry have led to lower air pollution and lower carbon emissions.

sourceString: Health authorities in Wuhan, China (the capital of Hubei province) reported a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on 31 December 2019, and an investigation was launched in early January 2020.
targetString: 2019 年 12 月 31 日，中国武汉（湖北省省会）卫生部门通报了一批不明原因肺炎病例，并于 2020 年 1 月初启动调查。
en-mt: On December 31, 2019, health authorities in Wuhan, China (capital of Hubei Province) notified a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown etiology and initiated investigations in early January 2020.

sourceString: The cases mostly had links to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market and so the virus is thought to have a zoonotic origin.
targetString: 这些病例大部分与华南海鲜批发市场有关，因此新冠病毒被认为是人畜共患病。
en-mt: Most of these cases are related to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, so the new coronavirus is considered a zoonotic disease.

sourceString: The virus that caused the outbreak is known as SARS-CoV-2, a newly discovered virus closely related to bat coronaviruses, pangolin coronaviruses, and SARS-CoV.The earliest known person with symptoms was later discovered to have fallen ill on 1 December 2019, and that person did not have visible connections with the later wet market cluster.
targetString: 引发这次爆发的病毒称为 SARS-CoV-2，是一种新发现的病毒，与蝙蝠冠状病毒、穿山甲冠状病毒和 SARS-CoV 密切相关。最早发现的患者后被证实 2019 年 12 月 1 日发病，且与后面出现的一批华南海鲜市场病例无明显联系。
en-mt: The virus that caused the outbreak, called SARS-CoV-2, is a newly identified virus that is closely related to bat coronaviruses, pangolin coronaviruses, and SARS-CoV. The patient who was first discovered was later confirmed to have the onset of the disease on December 1, 2019, and had no obvious connection with the subsequent batch of Huanan Seafood Market cases.

sourceString: Of the early cluster of cases reported in December 2019, two-thirds were found to have a link with the market.
targetString: 在 2019 年 12 月通报的这批早期病例中，三分之二被证实与华南海鲜市场有关。
en-mt: Of this batch of early cases notified in December 2019, two-thirds were confirmed to be linked to the Huanan Seafood Market.

sourceString: On 13 March 2020, an unverified report from the South China Morning Post suggested that a case traced back to 17 November 2019, in a 55-year-old from Hubei province, may have been the first.On 26 February 2020, the WHO reported that, as new cases reportedly declined in China but suddenly increased in Italy, Iran, and South Korea, the number of new cases outside China had exceeded the number of new cases within China for the first time.
targetString: 2020 年 3 月 13 日，《南华早报》发表了一篇未经证实的报道，称第一例病例可能要追溯到 2019 年 11 月 17 日，患者为 55 岁男性，来自湖北省。2020 年 2 月 26 日，据世界卫生组织报告，中国新增报告病例出现下降，但意大利、伊朗和韩国新增报告病例却突然大增，中国境外的新增病例数首次超过境内。
en-mt: On March 13, 2020, the South China Morning Post published an unconfirmed report that the first case may have been traced back to November 17, 2019 in a 55-year-old male from Hubei province. On February 26, 2020, according to the report of the World Health Organization, the number of new reported cases in China declined, but the number of new reported cases in Italy, Iran and South Korea suddenly increased sharply, and the number of new cases outside China exceeded that inside China for the first time.

sourceString: There may be substantial underreporting of cases, particularly among those with milder symptoms.
targetString: 可能存在大量未报告病例，尤其是轻症病例。
en-mt: There may be a large number of unreported cases, especially mild cases.

sourceString: By 26 February, relatively few cases had been reported among youths, with those 19 and under making up 2.4% of cases worldwide.The United Kingdom's chief scientific adviser, Patrick Vallance, estimated that 60% of the British population would need to become infected before effective herd immunity could be achieved.
targetString: 截至 2 月 26 日，报告的青少年病例相对较少，全球 19 岁及以下的青少年病例占比仅为 2.4%。英国首席科学顾问帕特里克·瓦兰斯估计，英国需要有大约 60% 的人口感染新冠病毒才能获得有效群体免疫。
en-mt: As of February 26, there were relatively few reported cases among adolescents, accounting for only 2.4% of cases globally among adolescents aged 19 and younger. The UK's chief scientific adviser, Patrick Vallance, estimated that around 60% of the UK's population would need to be infected with the virus to achieve effective herd immunity.

sourceString: Cases refers to the number of people who have been tested for COVID-19, and whose test has been confirmed positive according to official protocols.
targetString: 病例数是指已接受 COVID-19 检测且根据官方方案确认检测结果为阳性的人数。
en-mt: The number of cases is the number of people who have been tested for COVID-19 and confirmed positive according to official protocols.

sourceString: As of 23 March, no country had tested more than 3% of its population, and many countries have had official policies not to test those with only mild symptoms, such as Italy, the Netherlands, Spain, and Switzerland.
targetString: 截至 3 月 23 日，世界各国接受检测的群体占比均未超过总人口的 3%，很多国家还都发布了不检测轻症人群的官方政策，包括意大利、荷兰、西班牙和瑞士等国。
en-mt: As of March 23, the proportion of people tested in all countries in the world has not exceeded 3% of the total population. Many countries have also issued official policies not to test people with mild symptoms, including Italy, the Netherlands, Spain and Switzerland.

sourceString: A study published on 16 March found that in China, up to 23 January, an estimated 86% of COVID-19 infections had not been detected, and that these undocumented infections were the infection source for 79% of documented cases.
targetString: 3 月 16 日发表的一项研究指出，截至 1 月 23 日，中国估计有 86% 的 COVID-19 感染者未得到检测，而这些未记录的感染者是 79% 已记录病例的感染源。
en-mt: A study published on March 16 noted that an estimated 86% of people infected with COVID-19 in China had not been tested as of January 23, and these undocumented infections were the source of infection for 79% of recorded cases.

sourceString: A statistical analysis published 30 March estimated that numbers of infections in Italy were considerably greater than the reported cases.
targetString: 据 3 月 30 日公布的一项统计分析估计，意大利实际感染人数远超报告病例数。
en-mt: According to a statistical analysis released on March 30, it is estimated that the actual number of infected people in Italy far exceeds the number of reported cases.

sourceString: The initial estimates of the basic reproduction number (R0) for COVID-19 were 1.4 to 2.4.
targetString: COVID-19 的基本传染数 (R0) 最初估计介于 1.4 到 2.4 之间。
en-mt: The basic reproduction number (R0) for COVID-19 was initially estimated to be between 1.4 and 2.4.

sourceString: A study published by the US Center for Disease Control and Prevention has concluded that it may be 5.7.
targetString: 美国疾控中心发表的一项研究表明 R0 可能为 5.7。
en-mt: A study published by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention suggests that the R0 may be 5.7.

sourceString: Most people with COVID-19 recover.
targetString: 大部分 COVID-19 患者可以康复。
en-mt: Most people with COVID-19 recover.

sourceString: For those who do not, the time from development of symptoms to death has been between 6 and 41 days, with the most common being 14 days.
targetString: 无法康复的患者从发病到死亡的时间为 6-41 天，14 天最常见。
en-mt: The time from illness onset to death in patients who did not recover ranged from 6 to 41 days, with 14 days being the most common.

sourceString: As of 10 April 2020, approximately 97,000 deaths had been attributed to COVID-19.
targetString: 截至 2020 年 4 月 10 日，约有 9.7 万人死于 COVID-19。
en-mt: As of April 10, 2020, approximately 97,000 people have died from COVID-19.

sourceString: In China, as of 5 February about 80% of deaths were in those over 60, and 75% had pre-existing health conditions including cardiovascular diseases and diabetes.Official tallies of deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic generally refer to dead people who tested positive for COVID according to official protocols.
targetString: 截至 2 月 5 日，中国约 80% 的死亡病例为 60 岁以上人群，75% 的死亡病例同时伴有心血管疾病和糖尿病等基础疾病。COVID-19 死亡病例的官方统计数据通常指根据官方方案，新冠病毒检测结果呈阳性的死亡患者。
en-mt: As of February 5, about 80% of the deaths in China were people over the age of 60, and 75% of the deaths were accompanied by underlying diseases such as cardiovascular disease and diabetes. Official tallies of COVID-19 deaths usually refer to patients who died who tested positive for the new coronavirus according to official protocols.

sourceString: The number of true fatalities from COVID-19 may be much higher, as it may not include people who die without testing - e.g. at home, in nursing homes, etc.
targetString: 实际的 COVID-19 死亡人数可能远超统计数据，因为该数据可能不包含未接受检测的患者，如在家中、疗养院等地死亡的患者。
en-mt: The actual number of COVID-19 deaths may far exceed the statistics, because the data may not include patients who were not tested, such as patients who died at home, nursing homes, etc.

sourceString: Partial data from Italy found that the number of excess deaths during the pandemic exceeded the official COVID death tally by a factor of 4-5x.
targetString: 来自意大利的部分数据显示，疫情期间的实际死亡人数是官方统计的新冠病毒肺炎死亡人数的 4-5 倍。
en-mt: Some data from Italy show that the actual death toll during the epidemic was 4-5 times the official death toll from the novel coronavirus pneumonia.

sourceString: A spokeswoman for the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) acknowledged "We know that [the stated death toll] is an underestimation", a statement corroborated by anecdotal reports of undercounting in the U.S. Such underestimation often occurs in pandemics, such as the 2009 H1N1 swine flu epidemic.The first confirmed death was in Wuhan on 9 January 2020.
targetString: 美国疾控中心 (CDC) 一名女发言人坦言：“我们知道[公布的死亡人数]低于实际数值”，而关于美国数据被低估的传闻也印证了这一言论。低估在流行病领域经常发生，如 2009 年 H1N1 猪流感疫情。2020 年 1 月 9 日，武汉出现中国首例确诊死亡病例。
en-mt: A spokeswoman for the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said frankly: "We know that the [reported death toll] is lower than the actual number", and rumors that the US data is underestimated also corroborate this statement. Underestimation often occurs in the field of epidemics, such as the 2009 H1N1 swine flu epidemic. On January 9, 2020, the first confirmed death in China occurred in Wuhan.

sourceString: The first death outside mainland China occurred on 1 February in the Philippines, and the first death outside Asia was in France on 14 February.
targetString: 2 月 1 日，中国境外首例死亡病例出现在菲律宾，2 月 14 日，亚洲以外首例死亡病例出现在法国。
en-mt: On February 1, the first death case outside China appeared in the Philippines, and on February 14, the first death case outside Asia appeared in France.

sourceString: By 28 February, outside mainland China, more than a dozen deaths each were recorded in Iran, South Korea, and Italy.
targetString: 截至 2 月 28 日，中国境外，伊朗、韩国和意大利各出现十多例死亡病例。
en-mt: As of February 28, outside China, Iran, South Korea and Italy each had more than ten deaths.

sourceString: By 13 March, more than forty countries and territories had reported deaths, on every continent except Antarctica.Several measures are commonly used to quantify mortality.
targetString: 截至 3 月 13 日，除南极洲以外的各大洲有 40 多个国家和地区报告了死亡病例。有几种方法常用来量化死亡率。
en-mt: As of March 13, more than 40 countries and territories on all continents except Antarctica have reported deaths. Several methods are commonly used to quantify mortality.

sourceString: These numbers vary by region and over time, and are influenced by the volume of testing, healthcare system quality, treatment options, time since initial outbreak, and population characteristics such as age, sex, and overall health.The death-to-case ratio reflects the number of deaths divided by the number of diagnosed cases within a given time interval.
targetString: 这些数字因地区而异，会随时间发生变化，并受检测量、卫生系统质量、治疗方案、疫情首次爆发时间以及年龄、性别和总体健康状况等人口特征的影响。病死率为给定时间段内的死亡人数除以确诊人数得出的结果。
en-mt: These numbers vary by region, change over time, and are influenced by the volume of testing, the quality of the health system, treatment options, when the outbreak first occurred, and demographic characteristics such as age, sex, and general health status. The case fatality rate is the result of dividing the number of deaths by the number of confirmed cases in a given period of time.

sourceString: Based on Johns Hopkins University statistics, the global death-to-case ratio is 6.0% (97,039/1,617,204) as of 10 April 2020.
targetString: 根据约翰·霍普金斯大学的统计数据，截至 2020 年 4 月 10 日，全球病死率为 6.0% (97,039/1,617,204)。
en-mt: According to statistics from Johns Hopkins University, as of April 10, 2020, the global case fatality rate was 6.0% (97,039/1,617,204).

sourceString: The number varies by region.
targetString: 不同地区的病死率也不同。
en-mt: The case fatality rate varies from region to region.

sourceString: In China, estimates for the death-to-case ratio decreased from 17.3% (for those with symptom onset 1–10 January 2020) to 0.7% (for those with symptom onset after 1 February 2020).Other measures include the case fatality rate (CFR), which reflects the percent of diagnosed people who die from a disease, and the infection fatality rate (IFR), which reflects the percent of infected (diagnosed and undiagnosed) who die from a disease.
targetString: 在中国，病死率估计值从 17.3%（2020 年 1 月 1 日至 10 日发病的患者）下降到 0.7%（2020 年 2 月 1 日以后发病的患者）。其他一些衡量标准还包括病例死亡率 (CFR) 和感染死亡率 (IFR)，前者反映的是疾病死亡人数占确诊人数的百分比，后者反映的是疾病死亡人数占感染人数（包括确诊和未确诊人数）的百分比。
en-mt: In China, the case fatality rate estimate decreased from 17.3% (patients with onset between January 1 and 10, 2020) to 0.7% (patients with onset after February 1, 2020). Other measures include the case fatality rate (CFR), which reflects the percentage of deaths from a disease as a percentage of confirmed cases, and the infection fatality rate (IFR), which reflects the percentage of deaths from a disease as a percentage of the number of infections (both confirmed and undiagnosed). number of people).

sourceString: These statistics are not timebound and follow a specific population from infection through case resolution.
targetString: 这些统计数据没有时间限制，并且跟踪的是特定人群从感染到病例解决的全过程。
en-mt: These statistics are not time-bound and track a specific population from infection to case resolution.

sourceString: A number of academics have attempted to calculate these numbers for specific populations.
targetString: 很多学者尝试针对特定人群计算上述数据。
en-mt: Many scholars try to calculate the above data for specific groups of people.

sourceString: The University of Oxford's Centre for Evidence-Based Medicine estimates that the infection fatality rate for the pandemic as a whole is between 0.1% and 0.39%.
targetString: 据牛津大学循证医学中心估计，此次疫情整体的感染死亡率介于 0.1% 到 0.39% 之间。
en-mt: The Oxford University Center for Evidence-Based Medicine estimated that the overall infection fatality rate for the outbreak ranged from 0.1% to 0.39%.

sourceString: The upper estimate of this range is consistent with the results from the first random testing for COVID-19 in Germany, and a statistical study analysing the impact of testing on CFR estimates.
targetString: 该范围的估计值上限符合德国对 COVID-19 进行的首次随机检测，以及一项关于检测对 CFR 估计值影响的统计分析研究。
en-mt: The upper estimate of the range is consistent with the first randomized testing for COVID-19 in Germany and a study of the statistical analysis of the impact of testing on CFR estimates.

sourceString: The WHO asserts that the pandemic can be controlled.
targetString: 世界卫生组织声称此次疫情是可控的。
en-mt: The World Health Organization claims the outbreak is controllable.

sourceString: The peak and ultimate duration of the outbreak are uncertain and may differ by location.
targetString: 爆发高峰和最终持续时间无法确定且因地区而异。
en-mt: The peak and final duration of the outbreak cannot be determined and varies by region.

sourceString: Maciej Boni of Penn State University stated, "Left unchecked, infectious outbreaks typically plateau and then start to decline when the disease runs out of available hosts.
targetString: 来自宾州州立大学的 Maciej Boni 指出：“如果不加以控制，传染病爆发通常会在现有宿主耗尽后进入停滞期，然后开始趋于缓解。
en-mt: Maciej Boni from Penn State University noted: "If left unchecked, infectious disease outbreaks typically plateau after existing reservoirs are exhausted, and then start to level off.

sourceString: But it's almost impossible to make any sensible projection right now about when that will be".
targetString: 但是目前我们几乎不可能合理预测拐点何时会出现。”
en-mt: But at present it is almost impossible to reasonably predict when the inflection point will occur. "

sourceString: The Chinese government's senior medical adviser Zhong Nanshan argued that "it could be over by June" if all countries can be mobilized to follow the WHO's advice on measures to stop the spread of the virus.
targetString: 中国政府高级医疗顾问钟南山认为，如果所有国家动员起来，采纳世界卫生组织关于采取措施阻止病毒传播的建议，那么“6 月份结束疫情是可以期待的”。
en-mt: Zhong Nanshan, a senior medical adviser to the Chinese government, believes that if all countries mobilize and adopt the World Health Organization's recommendations on measures to stop the spread of the virus, "the end of the epidemic in June can be expected".

sourceString: On 17 March, Adam Kucharski of the London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine stated that SARS-CoV-2 "is going to be circulating, potentially for a year or two".
targetString: 3 月 17 日，来自伦敦卫生与热带医学院的 Adam Kucharski 表示，SARS-CoV-2“可能会反复爆发，持续一到两年。”
en-mt: On March 17, Adam Kucharski from the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine said that SARS-CoV-2 "is likely to have recurring outbreaks that last one to two years."

sourceString: According to the Imperial College study led by Neil Ferguson, physical distancing and other measures will be required "until a vaccine becomes available (potentially 18 months or more)".
targetString: Neil Ferguson 在帝国理工学院牵头开展的研究表明，“在疫苗投入使用之前（可能需要 18 个月或更长时间）”，务必要采取保持物理距离和其他措施。
en-mt: Research led by Neil Ferguson at Imperial College suggests that physical distancing and other measures must be in place "until a vaccine becomes available, which could be 18 months or more away".

sourceString: William Schaffner of Vanderbilt University stated, "I think it's unlikely that this coronavirus—because it's so readily transmissible—will disappear completely" and it "might turn into a seasonal disease, making a comeback every year".
targetString: 来自范德堡大学的 William Schaffner 表示：“这种冠状病毒传播性很强，我认为其不太可能完全消失”，“可能会演变成一种季节性疾病，每年爆发一次。”
en-mt: "This coronavirus is very transmissible, and I don't think it's likely to go away completely," said William Schaffner from Vanderbilt University. "It may evolve into a seasonal disease with an annual outbreak."

sourceString: The virulence of the comeback would depend on herd immunity and the extent of mutation.
targetString: 再次爆发的致病力取决于群体免疫力和突变程度。
en-mt: The virulence of another outbreak depends on herd immunity and the degree of mutation.

sourceString: Symptoms of COVID-19 can be relatively non-specific and infected people may be asymptomatic.
targetString: COVID-19 的症状相对具有非特异性，有些感染者可能无症状。
en-mt: Symptoms of COVID-19 are relatively nonspecific, and some infected people may be asymptomatic.

sourceString: The two most common symptoms are fever (88%) and dry cough (68%).
targetString: 两种最常见症状表现为发热 (88%) 和干咳 (68%)。
en-mt: The two most common symptoms were fever (88%) and dry cough (68%).

sourceString: Less common symptoms include fatigue, respiratory sputum production (phlegm), loss of the sense of smell, shortness of breath, muscle and joint pain, sore throat, headache, chills, vomiting, hemoptysis, diarrhea, or cyanosis.The WHO states that approximately one person in six becomes seriously ill and has difficulty breathing.
targetString: 较不常见的症状包括疲劳、呼吸道痰液（痰）、嗅觉丧失、气促、肌肉和关节痛、喉咙痛、头痛、发冷、呕吐、咯血、腹泻或发绀。据世界卫生组织称，约六分之一的患者会转为重症，并出现呼吸困难。
en-mt: Less common symptoms include fatigue, mucus (phlegm) in the airways, loss of smell, shortness of breath, muscle and joint pain, sore throat, headache, chills, vomiting, hemoptysis, diarrhea, or cyanosis. According to the World Health Organization, about one in six patients becomes severely ill and develops breathing difficulties.

sourceString: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) lists emergency symptoms as difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain or pressure, sudden confusion, difficulty waking, and bluish face or lips; immediate medical attention is advised if these symptoms are present.Further development of the disease can lead to severe pneumonia, acute respiratory distress syndrome, sepsis, septic shock and death.
targetString: 美国疾控中心 (CDC) 将呼吸困难、持续胸痛或压力、突然意识模糊、难以清醒及脸部或嘴唇发青列为紧急症状；如果出现这些症状，建议立即就医。该病进一步发展可导致重症肺炎、急性呼吸窘迫综合征、败血症、感染性休克和死亡。
en-mt: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) lists difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain or pressure, sudden confusion, difficulty waking up, and bluish face or lips as emergency symptoms; immediate medical attention is advised if these symptoms occur. Progression of the disease can lead to severe pneumonia, acute respiratory distress syndrome, sepsis, septic shock, and death.

sourceString: Some of those infected may be asymptomatic, with no clinical symptoms but with test results that confirm infection, so researchers have issued advice that those with close contact to confirmed infected people should be closely monitored and examined to rule out infection.
targetString: 有些感染者可能无症状，无任何临床表现，但检测结果呈阳性，因此研究人员建议对确诊患者的密切接触者进行密切观察和检查，排除感染可能。
en-mt: Some infected people may be asymptomatic and without any clinical manifestations, but the test results are positive. Therefore, the researchers recommend close observation and examination of close contacts of confirmed patients to rule out the possibility of infection.

sourceString: Chinese estimates of the asymptomatic ratio range from few to 44%.
targetString: 中国估计无症状感染者的比率从极低到 44% 不等。
en-mt: Estimates of the rate of asymptomatic infection in China range from extremely low to 44%.

sourceString: The usual incubation period (the time between infection and symptom onset) ranges from one to 14 days; it is most commonly five days.As an example of uncertainty, the estimate of the fraction of people with COVID-19 who lost their sense of smell was initially 30% and later fell to 15%.
targetString: 潜伏期（从感染到发病的时间间隔）一般为 1-14 天；5 天最常见。关于不确定性，可以通过一个例子来说明：COVID-19 患者中丧失嗅觉的患者占比最初估计为 30%，后来降至 15%。
en-mt: The incubation period (time interval from infection to onset) typically ranges from 1 to 14 days; 5 days is most common. The uncertainty can be illustrated by an example: the proportion of patients with COVID-19 who lost their sense of smell was initially estimated at 30%, but was later reduced to 15%.

sourceString: Some details about how the disease is spread are still being determined.
targetString: 有关该病传播途径的一些细节还尚未确定。
en-mt: Some details about how the disease spreads have yet to be determined.

sourceString: The disease is believed to be primarily spread during close contact and by small droplets produced during coughing, sneezing, or talking; with close contact being within 1 to 2 metres (3 to 6 feet).
targetString: 目前认为该病主要通过近距离接触以及咳嗽、打喷嚏或说话时产生的飞沫传播；近距离接触是指间隔 1-2 米（3-6 英尺）内。
en-mt: The disease is currently thought to spread primarily through close contact and droplets produced when coughing, sneezing or talking; close contact is defined as being within 1-2 meters (3-6 feet) of each other.

sourceString: Studies have found that an uncovered coughing can lead to droplets travelling up to 4.5 metres (15 feet) to 8.2 metres (27 feet).
targetString: 研究发现，无遮挡咳嗽可能导致飞沫最远传播 4.5 米（15 英尺）-8.2 米（15-27 英尺）。
en-mt: The study found that an uncovered cough could cause droplets to travel as far as 4.5 meters (15 feet) to 8.2 meters (15-27 feet).

sourceString: Some have proposed that the virus may also be transmitted by small droplets that stay for more prolonged periods in the air, that may be generated during speech.Respiratory droplets may also be produced during breathing out, including when talking, though the virus is not generally airborne.
targetString: 还有人提出，人们说话时产生的飞沫在空气中停留较长时间也可能导致该病毒的传播。尽管病毒通常无法通过空气传播，但人们在呼气或说话时，也可能会产生飞沫。
en-mt: It has also been suggested that droplets produced by people talking that stay in the air for a long time may also contribute to the spread of the virus. Although the virus is not usually airborne, droplets can also be produced when people exhale or talk.

sourceString: The droplets can land in the mouths or noses of people who are nearby or possibly be inhaled into the lungs.
targetString: 这种飞沫可能会落到周围人的口鼻部，甚至被吸入肺部。
en-mt: This droplet may land on the mouth and nose of those around you, or even be inhaled into the lungs.

sourceString: Some medical procedures such as intubation and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) may cause respiratory secretions to be aerosolized and thus result in airborne spread.
targetString: 插管和心肺复苏 (CPR) 等医疗程序可能会使呼吸道分泌物雾化，进而造成空气传播。
en-mt: Medical procedures such as intubation and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) may aerosolize respiratory secretions, resulting in airborne transmission.

sourceString: It may also spread when one touches a contaminated surface, including skin, and then touches their eyes, nose, or mouth.
targetString: 另外，如果一个人触摸了受病毒污染的表面（包括皮肤），然后再触摸自己的眼鼻口部，也可能导致病毒传播。
en-mt: Also, if a person touches a virus-contaminated surface, including skin, and then touches their own eyes, nose, or mouth, the virus can also spread.

sourceString: While there are concerns it may spread by faeces, this risk is believed to be low.
targetString: 还有人担心病毒可能会通过粪便传播，但这种风险被认为较低。
en-mt: There are also concerns that the virus could be transmitted through feces, but the risk is considered low.

sourceString: The Government of China denied the possibility of faecal-oral transmission of SARS-CoV-2.The virus is most contagious during the first three days after onset of symptoms, although spread may be possible before symptoms appear and in later stages of the disease.
targetString: 中国政府否认了 SARS-CoV-2 粪口传播的可能性。这种病毒在发病后前三天的传染性最强，但发病前和患病后期也具有传染性。
en-mt: The Chinese government has denied the possibility of fecal-oral transmission of SARS-CoV-2. The virus is most contagious during the first three days of illness, but is also contagious before and later in the illness.

sourceString: People have tested positive for the disease up to three days before onset of symptoms suggesting transmission is possible before developing significant symptoms.
targetString: 最早可在发病前三天检测出阳性结果，这表明新冠病毒在出现明显症状之前已经具有传染性。
en-mt: Positive results can be detected as early as three days before the onset of symptoms, indicating that the new coronavirus is contagious before the onset of obvious symptoms.

sourceString: Only few reports of laboratory-confirmed asymptomatic cases exist, but asymptomatic transmission has been identified by some countries during contact tracing investigations.
targetString: 尽管实验室确诊的无症状病例报告很少，但一些国家在进行接触者追踪调查的过程中，已经发现了无症状感染的现象。
en-mt: Although laboratory-confirmed asymptomatic cases have been rarely reported, some countries have detected asymptomatic infections during contact tracing investigations.

sourceString: The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) states that while it is not entirely clear how easily the disease spreads, one person generally infects two to three others.The virus survives for hours to days on surfaces.
targetString: 欧洲疾控中心 (ECDC) 表示，虽然新冠病毒的传播力尚不完全明确，但一般 1 人会传染 2-3 人。该病毒在物体表面的存活时间从几小时到几天不等。
en-mt: The European Center for Disease Control and Prevention (ECDC) stated that although the transmission of the new coronavirus is not yet fully understood, generally one person can infect 2-3 others. The virus can survive on surfaces for anywhere from a few hours to a few days.

sourceString: Specifically, the virus was found to be detectable for up to three days on plastic (polypropylene) and 304 stainless steel, for one day on cardboard, and for up to four hours on copper.
targetString: 具体来说，已知新冠病毒在塑料（聚丙烯）和 304 不锈钢上最长可存活三天，在纸板上可存活一天，在铜上最多可存活四小时。
en-mt: Specifically, COVID-19 is known to survive for up to three days on plastic (polypropylene) and 304 stainless steel, one day on cardboard, and up to four hours on copper.

sourceString: This, however, varies based on the humidity and temperature.Pets and other animals have tested positive for COVID-19.
targetString: 不过，其存活时间也受湿度和温度的影响。目前已出现宠物和其他动物 COVID-19 检测呈阳性的病例。
en-mt: However, its survival time is also affected by humidity and temperature. There have been cases of pets and other animals testing positive for COVID-19.

sourceString: There is no evidence animals can pass the virus on to humans, though British authorities advise washing one's hands after contact with animals, like after contact with other surfaces infected people could have touched.
targetString: 目前没有证据表明动物会将病毒再传染给人类，但英国官方机构还是建议人们在接触动物后洗手，就像接触其他可能被感染者触摸过的表面一样。
en-mt: There is no evidence that animals can retransmit the virus to humans, but officials in the UK advise people to wash their hands after touching animals, as they would any other surface that may have been touched by an infected person.

sourceString: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a novel virus, first isolated from three people with pneumonia connected to the cluster of acute respiratory illness cases in Wuhan.
targetString: 严重急性呼吸综合征冠状病毒 2 型 (SARS-CoV-2) 是一种新型病毒，最先是从武汉一批急性呼吸系统疾病病例的 3 名肺炎患者身上分离出的。
en-mt: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a novel virus that was first isolated from 3 pneumonia patients in a cluster of acute respiratory disease cases in Wuhan.

sourceString: All features of the novel SARS-CoV-2 virus occur in related coronaviruses in nature.Outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which dissolves its protective envelope.SARS-CoV-2 is closely related to the original SARS-CoV.
targetString: 这种新型 SARS-CoV-2 病毒的所有特征在自然界的相关冠状病毒中均有呈现。病毒未进入人体之前，可用家用肥皂将其杀灭，因为肥皂能够溶解病毒的保护囊膜。SARS-CoV-2 与最初的 SARS-CoV 密切相关。
en-mt: All the features of this novel SARS-CoV-2 virus are present in related coronaviruses in nature. Before the virus enters the body, household soap can be used to kill it, because soap can dissolve the protective envelope of the virus. SARS-CoV-2 is closely related to the original SARS-CoV.

sourceString: It is thought to have a zoonotic origin.
targetString: 目前它被视为人畜共患病。
en-mt: It is currently considered a zoonotic disease.

sourceString: Genetic analysis has revealed that the coronavirus genetically clusters with the genus Betacoronavirus, in subgenus Sarbecovirus (lineage B) together with two bat-derived strains.
targetString: 遗传分析显示，这种冠状病毒在遗传学上与 β 冠状病毒属 Sarbecovirus 亚属（B 簇）和两种蝙蝠来源病毒株集群。
en-mt: Genetic analysis revealed that this coronavirus is genetically clustered with the betacoronavirus subgenus Sarbecovirus (cluster B) and two strains of bat origin.

sourceString: It is 96% identical at the whole genome level to other bat coronavirus samples (BatCov RaTG13).
targetString: 新冠病毒与其他蝙蝠冠状病毒样本 (BatCov RaTG13) 在全基因组水平上的一致性达 96%。
en-mt: The genome-wide identity of the new coronavirus and other bat coronavirus samples (BatCov RaTG13) was 96%.

sourceString: In February 2020, Chinese researchers found that there is only one amino acid difference in certain parts of the genome sequences between the viruses from pangolins and those from humans.
targetString: 2020 年 2 月，中国研究人员发现，穿山甲体内的病毒与人体上的病毒在基因组序列的某些部分只差一个氨基酸。
en-mt: In February 2020, Chinese researchers discovered that the virus in pangolins differs from the virus in humans by just one amino acid in some parts of the genome sequence.

sourceString: Whole-genome comparison to date has found at most 92% of genetic material shared between pangolin coronavirus and SARS-CoV-2, which is insufficient to prove pangolins to be the intermediate host.
targetString: 截至目前的全基因组对比发现，穿山甲冠状病毒和 SARS-CoV-2 之间最多有 92% 的遗传物质相同，还不足以证明穿山甲就是中间宿主。
en-mt: Up to now, the genome-wide comparison has found that up to 92% of the genetic material between the pangolin coronavirus and SARS-CoV-2 is the same, which is not enough to prove that the pangolin is an intermediate host.

sourceString: Infection by the virus can be provisionally diagnosed on the basis of symptoms, though confirmation is ultimately by reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) of infected secretions or CT imaging.
targetString: 是否感染了病毒可根据症状初步诊断，但最终还是要通过被感染分泌物的逆转录聚合酶链反应 (rRT-PCR) 或 CT 成像才能确诊。
en-mt: Viral infection is initially diagnosed based on symptoms, but is ultimately confirmed by reverse transcription-polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) or CT imaging of infected secretions.

sourceString: A study comparing PCR to CT in Wuhan has suggested that CT is significantly more sensitive than PCR, though less specific, with many of its imaging features overlapping with other pneumonias and disease processes.
targetString: 在武汉进行的一项 PCR 与 CT 对比研究表明，CT 明显比 PCR 更敏感，但特异性较低，很多成像特征会与其他肺炎和疾病发展过程重合。
en-mt: A comparison study of PCR and CT in Wuhan showed that CT is significantly more sensitive than PCR, but has lower specificity, and many imaging features will overlap with other pneumonia and disease progression.

sourceString: As of March 2020, the American College of Radiology recommends that "CT should not be used to screen for or as a first-line test to diagnose COVID-19".
targetString: 截至 2020 年 3 月，美国放射学会建议，“CT 不宜用于筛查 COVID-19 或作为诊断该病的第一道检测。”
en-mt: As of March 2020, the American College of Radiology recommends that "CT should not be used to screen for COVID-19 or as a first-line test to diagnose the disease."

sourceString: The WHO has published several RNA testing protocols for SARS-CoV-2, with the first issued on 17 January.
targetString: 世界卫生组织目前已公布多个针对 SARS-CoV-2 的核酸检测方案，首个方案发布于 1 月 17 日。
en-mt: The World Health Organization has announced multiple nucleic acid detection protocols for SARS-CoV-2, the first of which was released on January 17.

sourceString: The test uses real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).
targetString: 核酸检测采用实时逆转录聚合酶链反应 (rRT-PCR)。
en-mt: Nucleic acid detection using real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).

sourceString: The test can be done on respiratory or blood samples.
targetString: 呼吸道样本或血样均可用于检测。
en-mt: Respiratory samples or blood samples can be used for testing.

sourceString: Results are generally available within a few hours to days.
targetString: 结果一般可在几小时到几天内得出。
en-mt: Results are generally available within hours to days.

sourceString: Generally this test is carried out on a nasopharyngeal swab though a throat swab may also be used.A number of laboratories and companies are developing serological tests, which detect antibodies.
targetString: 一般来说，这种检测通过鼻咽拭子进行，也可通过咽拭子进行。很多实验室和公司正在开发用于检测抗体的血清学试验。
en-mt: Generally, this test is done with a nasopharyngeal swab, but it can also be done with a throat swab. Serological tests to detect antibodies are being developed by many laboratories and companies.

sourceString: As of 6 April 2020, none of these has been proved sufficiently accurate to be approved for widespread use.
targetString: 截至 2020 年 4 月 6 日，这些检测方法均未证实足够准确，还无法批准广泛使用。
en-mt: As of April 6, 2020, none of these tests has proven accurate enough to be approved for widespread use.

sourceString: In the US a serological test developed by Cellex has been approved for emergency use by certified laboratories only.
targetString: 在美国，由 Cellex 开发的血清学试验已获批，仅供认证实验室在紧急情况下使用。
en-mt: In the US, the serology test developed by Cellex has been approved for emergency use by accredited laboratories only.

sourceString: Characteristic imaging features on radiographs and computed tomography (CT) of people who are symptomatic include asymmetric peripheral ground glass opacities and absent pleural effusions.
targetString: 发病患者的 X 片和计算机断层扫描 (CT) 的典型成像特征包括外周磨玻璃影不对称和无胸腔积液。
en-mt: Typical imaging features on radiographs and computed tomography (CT) in diseased patients include asymmetric peripheral ground-glass opacity and absence of pleural effusion.
