sourceString: The Italian Radiological Society is compiling an international online database of imaging findings for confirmed cases.
targetString: 意大利放射学会正在针对确诊病例的影像表现汇编国际在线数据库。
en-mt: The Italian Society of Radiology is compiling an international online database of imaging findings of confirmed cases.

sourceString: Due to overlap with other infections such as adenovirus, imaging without confirmation by PCR is of limited specificity in identifying COVID-19.
targetString: 因与其他病毒感染（如腺病毒）重合，所以未经 PCR 确认的影像在鉴定 COVID-19 方面的特异性有限。
en-mt: Images without PCR confirmation have limited specificity in identifying COVID-19 due to overlap with other viral infections such as adenovirus.

sourceString: A large study in China compared chest CT results to PCR and demonstrated that though imaging is less specific for the infection, it is faster and more sensitive, suggesting its consideration as a screening tool in epidemic areas.
targetString: 中国一项大型研究将胸部 CT 结果与 PCR 结果对比后发现，尽管影像对于识别感染的特异性较低，但检测速度更快、更灵敏，因此可以考虑将其作为流行地区的一种筛查手段。
en-mt: A large Chinese study comparing chest CT results with PCR results found that although imaging was less specific for identifying infection, it was faster and more sensitive and could therefore be considered as a screening tool in endemic areas .

sourceString: Artificial intelligence-based convolutional neural networks have been developed to detect imaging features of the virus with both radiographs and CT.
targetString: 目前已开发出基于人工智能的卷积神经网络，可联合使用 X 片和 CT 来检测病毒的影像特征。
en-mt: At present, an artificial intelligence-based convolutional neural network has been developed that can jointly use X-rays and CT to detect image features of viruses.

sourceString: Strategies for preventing transmission of the disease include maintaining overall good personal hygiene, washing hands, avoiding touching the eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands, and coughing or sneezing into a tissue and putting the tissue directly into a waste container.
targetString: 预防疾病传播的措施包括良好的个人卫生习惯、勤洗手、避免未洗手直接触摸眼鼻口部、咳嗽或打喷嚏时用纸巾捂住口鼻，用过的纸巾直接丢进垃圾桶。
en-mt: Measures to prevent the spread of disease include good personal hygiene habits, frequent hand washing, avoiding touching eyes, nose and mouth without washing hands, covering mouth and nose with tissues when coughing or sneezing, and throwing used tissues directly into the trash can.

sourceString: Those who may already have the infection have been advised to wear a surgical mask in public.
targetString: 疑似感染者在进入公共场所时应佩戴医用外科口罩。
en-mt: Suspected infected persons should wear medical surgical masks when entering public places.

sourceString: Physical distancing measures are also recommended to prevent transmission.Many governments have restricted or advised against all non-essential travel to and from countries and areas affected by the outbreak.
targetString: 另外建议采取保持物理距离的措施以防止病毒传播。很多政府已限制或建议避免在非必要的情况下往返受疫情影响的国家和地区。
en-mt: Physical distancing measures are also recommended to prevent the spread of the virus. Many governments have restricted or advised against non-essential travel to and from affected countries and regions.

sourceString: However, the virus has reached the stage of community spread in large parts of the world.
targetString: 然而，该病毒目前已在全球大部分地区达到社区传播阶段。
en-mt: However, the virus has now reached community transmission in most parts of the world.

sourceString: This means that the virus is spreading within communities, and some community members don't know where or how they were infected.Health care providers taking care of someone who may be infected are recommended to use standard precautions, contact precautions, and eye protection.Contact tracing is an important method for health authorities to determine the source of an infection and to prevent further transmission.
targetString: 这意味着病毒正在社区内传播，一些社区居民无从知晓他们是在哪里或者是怎样被感染的。接触疑似感染者的医护人员应采取标准预防措施、接触预防措施和眼部防护。追踪接触者是卫生监管部门确定传染源和防止进一步传播的重要手段。
en-mt: This means that the virus is spreading in the community, and some community residents have no way of knowing where or how they were infected. Healthcare workers who come into contact with suspected infected individuals should use standard precautions, contact precautions, and eye protection. Contact tracing is an important tool for health regulators to identify the source of infection and prevent further spread.

sourceString: The use of location data from mobile phones by governments for this purpose has prompted privacy concerns, with Amnesty International and over 100 other organizations issuing a statement calling for limits on this kind of surveillance.
targetString: 政府出于追踪目的使用手机定位数据引发了人们对隐私的担忧，大赦国际等 100 多家组织发表声明，呼吁对这种监督加以限制。
en-mt: The government's use of mobile phone location data for tracking purposes has raised privacy concerns, with Amnesty International and more than 100 organizations issuing statements calling for limits on such surveillance.

sourceString: Various mobile apps have been implemented or proposed for voluntary use, and as of April 7, 2020, over a dozen expert groups were working on privacy-friendly solutions, such as using Bluetooth to log a user's proximity to other cellphones.
targetString: 目前有各种移动应用已投入使用或进入提案，供人们自愿使用，截至 2020 年 4 月 7 日，共有十多个专家组正致力于研究具备隐私保护功能的解决方案，如使用蓝牙记录用户与其他手机之间的距离。
en-mt: Various mobile applications are currently in use or proposed for voluntary use, and as of April 7, 2020, a total of more than a dozen expert groups are working on solutions with privacy protection functions, such as using Bluetooth to record user contact information. The distance between other phones.

sourceString: Users then receive a message if they've been in close contact with someone who has tested positive for COVID-19.Misconceptions are circulating about how to prevent infection; for example, rinsing the nose and gargling with mouthwash are not effective.
targetString: 用户一旦与 COVID-19 检测结果呈阳性的患者有过密切接触，便会收到信息提醒。关于预防感染的错误言论持续传播；如冲洗鼻子和用漱口水漱口是无效的。
en-mt: Users will receive information alerts once they have been in close contact with a patient who has tested positive for COVID-19. Misinformation about infection prevention continues to spread; such as rinsing the nose and rinsing the mouth with mouthwash is ineffective.

sourceString: There is no COVID-19 vaccine, though many organizations are working to develop one.
targetString: 目前尚无 COVID-19 疫苗，但很多组织都在积极研发。
en-mt: There is currently no vaccine for COVID-19, but many organizations are actively working on it.

sourceString: Hand washing is recommended to prevent the spread of the disease.
targetString: 建议通过勤洗手来阻止疾病传播。
en-mt: Frequent hand washing is recommended to stop the spread of disease.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that people wash hands often with soap and water for at least twenty seconds, especially after going to the toilet or when hands are visibly dirty; before eating; and after blowing one's nose, coughing, or sneezing.
targetString: 美国疾控中心建议人们经常用肥皂和自来水洗手至少 20 秒，尤其是在如厕后或手上有明显污物时、饭前以及擤鼻涕、咳嗽或打喷嚏后。
en-mt: The CDC recommends that people wash their hands frequently with soap and running water for at least 20 seconds, especially after using the toilet or when hands are visibly soiled, before eating, and after blowing their nose, coughing or sneezing.

sourceString: This is because outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which bursts its protective bubble.
targetString: 这是因为病毒在进入人体之前，只需使用家用肥皂即可破坏其保护囊膜，从而起到杀灭病毒的作用。
en-mt: This is because the virus can be killed by simply using household soap to destroy its protective envelope before it enters the body.

sourceString: CDC further recommended using an alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol by volume when soap and water are not readily available.
targetString: 美国疾控中心 (CDC) 还建议，如果身边没有肥皂和自来水，可使用酒精含量至少达 60% 的含酒精洗手液洗手。
en-mt: The CDC also recommends using an alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol if soap and running water are not nearby.

sourceString: The WHO advises people to avoid touching the eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands.
targetString: 世界卫生组织建议人们避免在未洗手的情况下触摸眼睛、鼻子或嘴巴。
en-mt: The World Health Organization recommends that people avoid touching their eyes, nose or mouth without washing their hands.

sourceString: Surfaces may be decontaminated with a number of solutions (within one minute of exposure to the disinfectant for a stainless steel surface), including 62–71% ethanol, 50–100% isopropanol, 0.1% sodium hypochlorite, 0.5% hydrogen peroxide, and 0.2–7.5% povidone-iodine.
targetString: 物体表面可使用多种溶液消毒（消毒液在不锈钢表面作用一分钟以内即可起效），包括 62-71% 乙醇、50-100% 异丙醇、0.1% 次氯酸钠、0.5% 过氧化氢和 0.2-7.5% 聚维酮碘。
en-mt: Surfaces can be disinfected with a variety of solutions (disinfectants are effective within one minute on stainless steel surfaces), including 62-71% ethanol, 50-100% isopropanol, 0.1% sodium hypochlorite, 0.5% hydrogen peroxide, and 0.2 -7.5% Povidone Iodine.

sourceString: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chrohexidine gluconate, are less effective.
targetString: 其他溶液（如苯扎氯铵和氯己定葡萄糖酸盐）效果较差。
en-mt: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chlorhexidine gluconate, are less effective.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that if a COVID case is suspected or confirmed at a facility such as an office or day care, all areas such as offices, bathrooms, common areas, shared electronic equipment like tablets, touch screens, keyboards, remote controls, and ATM machines used by the ill persons, should be disinfected.
targetString: 美国疾控中心建议，如果在办公室或日托所等设施出现新型冠状病毒肺炎疑似病例或确诊病例，则应对所有区域进行消毒，包括办公室、浴室、公共区域、共用电子设备，如平板电脑、触摸屏、键盘、遥控器和患者用过的自动取款机等。
en-mt: The CDC recommends that if there is a suspected or confirmed case of COVID-19 in a facility such as an office or day care, all areas should be disinfected, including offices, bathrooms, common areas, shared electronic devices such as tablets, touch screens , keyboards, remote controls, and ATMs used by patients.

sourceString: Health organizations recommended that people cover their mouth and nose with a bent elbow or a tissue when coughing or sneezing, and disposing of any tissue immediately.
targetString: 卫生组织建议人们在咳嗽或打喷嚏时用弯曲的手肘或纸巾捂住口鼻，并立即处理掉所有受污染纸巾。
en-mt: The health organization advises people to cover their mouth and nose with a bent elbow or a tissue when coughing or sneezing, and to dispose of any contaminated tissues immediately.

sourceString: Surgical masks are recommended for those who may be infected, as wearing a mask can limit the volume and travel distance of expiratory droplets dispersed when talking, sneezing, and coughing.
targetString: 建议疑似感染者佩戴医用外科口罩，因为佩戴口罩可以减少说话、打喷嚏和咳嗽时呼出的飞沫量并缩短传播距离。
en-mt: It is recommended that suspected infected persons wear medical surgical masks, because wearing masks can reduce the amount of droplets exhaled when talking, sneezing and coughing and shorten the transmission distance.

sourceString: The WHO has issued instructions on when and how to use masks.
targetString: 世界卫生组织已发布关于口罩使用场合与使用方法的说明。
en-mt: The World Health Organization has issued instructions on where and how to use masks.

sourceString: According to Stephen Griffin, a virologist at the University of Leeds, "Wearing a mask can reduce the propensity [of] people to touch their faces, which is a major source of infection without proper hand hygiene."Masks have also been recommended for use by those taking care of someone who may have the disease.
targetString: 利兹大学病毒学家 Stephen Griffin 认为:“戴口罩可减少人们摸脸的倾向，在手部卫生不到位的情况下，摸脸也是一大感染源”。此外，还建议负责照料疑似感染者的人员佩戴口罩。
en-mt: Stephen Griffin, a virologist at the University of Leeds, believes: "Wearing a mask can reduce people's tendency to touch their faces, which is also a major source of infection when hand hygiene is not in place." In addition, it is also recommended that those responsible for caring for suspected infected persons wear masks.

sourceString: The WHO has recommended the wearing of masks by healthy people only if they are at high risk, such as those who are caring for a person with COVID-19, although they also acknowledge that wearing masks may help people avoid touching their face.
targetString: 世界卫生组织建议健康人群只有在高风险区域才需戴口罩，如负责照料 COVID-19 患者的人员，不过该组织也认可戴口罩有助于避免摸脸。
en-mt: The World Health Organization recommends that healthy people wear masks only in high-risk areas, such as those responsible for caring for COVID-19 patients, but the organization also recognizes that wearing masks can help avoid touching your face.

sourceString: Several countries have started to encourage the use of face masks by members of the public.
targetString: 一些国家和地区已经开始鼓励普通大众戴口罩。
en-mt: Some countries and regions have begun to encourage the general public to wear masks.

sourceString: In the U.S., the CDC recommends wearing non-medical face mask made out of cloth.China has specifically recommended the use of disposable medical masks by healthy members of the public, particularly when coming into close contact (1 metre (3 ft) or less) with other people.
targetString: 美国疾控中心 (CDC) 建议佩戴用布料制成的非医用口罩。中国则明确建议健康公民也要佩戴一次性医用口罩，尤其是在（1 米（3 英尺）范围内）与他人近距离接触时。
en-mt: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) recommends wearing non-medical masks made of cloth. China explicitly recommends that healthy citizens also wear disposable surgical masks, especially when in close contact (within 1 meter (3 feet)) with others.

sourceString: Hong Kong recommends wearing a surgical mask when taking public transport or staying in crowded places.
targetString: 中国香港建议乘坐公共交通工具或进入人群密集场所时需戴口罩。
en-mt: Hong Kong, China recommends wearing a mask when taking public transportation or entering crowded places.

sourceString: Thailand's health officials are encouraging people to make cloth facemasks at home and wash them daily.
targetString: 泰国卫生官员建议人们自制口罩，并每天清洗。
en-mt: Thai health officials advise people to make their own face masks and wash them daily.

sourceString: The Czech Republic and Slovakia banned going out in public without wearing a mask or covering one's nose and mouth.
targetString: 捷克共和国和斯洛伐克严禁不戴口罩或不遮挡口鼻进入公共场所。
en-mt: Entering public places without a mask or covering the nose and mouth is strictly prohibited in the Czech Republic and Slovakia.

sourceString: On 16 March, Vietnam requested everyone to wear a face mask when going to public areas in order to protect themselves and others.
targetString: 3 月 16 日，越南要求所有人需戴口罩才可进入公共场所，以保护自己和他人。
en-mt: On March 16, Vietnam required everyone to wear a mask before entering public places to protect themselves and others.

sourceString: The Austrian government mandated that everyone entering a grocery store must wear a face mask.
targetString: 奥地利政府规定，所有人进入杂货店均需戴口罩。
en-mt: The Austrian government stipulates that everyone entering a grocery store must wear a mask.

sourceString: Israel has asked all residents to wear face masks when in public.
targetString: 以色列要求所有居民在公共场合均需戴口罩。
en-mt: Israel requires all residents to wear masks in public.

sourceString: Taiwan, which has been producing ten million masks per day since mid-March, required passengers on trains and intercity buses to wear face masks on 1 April.
targetString: 中国台湾自 3 月中旬以来的口罩日产量达 1,000 万只，4 月 1 日开始要求必须戴口罩乘坐火车和城际巴士。
en-mt: Since mid-March, Taiwan has produced 10 million masks a day, and since April 1 it has been required to wear masks on trains and intercity buses.

sourceString: Panama has made it obligatory to wear a face mask whenever going outside, while also recommending the manufacture of a homemade face mask for those who cannot purchase face masks.
targetString: 巴拿马规定外出必须戴口罩，并建议买不到口罩的居民自制口罩。
en-mt: Panama stipulates that masks must be worn when going out, and residents who cannot buy masks are advised to make their own masks.

sourceString: Face masks have also been widely used in Japan, South Korea, Malaysia, and Singapore.
targetString: 口罩在日本、韩国、马来西亚和新加坡也已广泛使用。
en-mt: Masks are also widely used in Japan, South Korea, Malaysia and Singapore.

sourceString: Social distancing (also known as physical distancing) includes infection control actions intended to slow the spread of disease by minimizing close contact between individuals.
targetString: 有关保持社交距离（也称保持物理距离）的感染防控措施旨在尽量减少人与人之间的密切接触，从而减缓疾病传播。
en-mt: Infection prevention and control measures involving social distancing (also known as physical distancing) aim to minimize close contact between people, thereby slowing the spread of disease.

sourceString: Methods include quarantines; travel restrictions; and the closing of schools, workplaces, stadiums, theatres, or shopping centres.
targetString: 措施包括隔离；出行限制；停学、停工以及关闭体育场、剧院或购物中心。
en-mt: Measures include quarantines; travel restrictions; suspensions of schools, work and closures of stadiums, theaters or shopping malls.

sourceString: Individuals may apply social distancing methods by staying at home, limiting travel, avoiding crowded areas, using no-contact greetings, and physically distancing themselves from others.
targetString: 在保持社交距离方面，个人可采取的措施包括呆在家中、限制出行、避开进入人群密集区域、改用非接触式问候方式以及与他人保持物理距离等。
en-mt: In terms of social distancing, measures that individuals can take include staying home, limiting travel, avoiding crowded areas, switching to non-contact greetings, and maintaining physical distance from others.

sourceString: Many governments are now mandating or recommending social distancing in regions affected by the outbreak.
targetString: 现在，很多政府均已强制要求或建议受疫情影响的地区保持社交距离。
en-mt: Many governments have now mandated or recommended social distancing in areas affected by the outbreak.

sourceString: The maximum gathering size recommended by US government bodies and health organizations was swiftly reduced from 250 people (if there was no known COVID-19 spread in a region) to 50 people, and later to 10 people.
targetString: 关于最大人群聚集规模，美国政府机构和卫生组织最初的建议是 250 人（在无 COVID-19 传播的地区），随后很快减少到 50 人，后来又减少到 10 人。
en-mt: U.S. government agencies and health organizations initially recommended 250 people (in areas free of COVID-19 transmission) for maximum crowd size, which was quickly reduced to 50 and later to 10.

sourceString: On 22 March 2020, Germany banned public gatherings of more than two people.Older adults and those with underlying medical conditions such as diabetes, heart disease, respiratory disease, hypertension, and compromised immune systems face increased risk of serious illness and complications and have been advised by the CDC to stay home as much as possible in areas of community outbreak.In late March 2020, the WHO and other health bodies began to replace the use of the term "social distancing" with "physical distancing", to clarify that the aim is to reduce physical contact while maintaining social connections, either virtually or at a distance.
targetString: 2020 年 3 月 22 日，德国禁止两人以上的公共集会。老年人和患有糖尿病、心脏病、呼吸系统疾病、高血压和免疫系统受损等基础性疾病的群体患重症和并发症的风险较高。德国疾控中心建议身居疫情区域的这类人群尽可能不要外出。2020 年 3 月下旬，世界卫生组织和其他卫生机构开始用“保持物理距离”取代“保持社交距离”的说法，以澄清其目的是要减少身体接触，同时仍要保持社交联系，包括虚拟联系和远距离联系。
en-mt: On March 22, 2020, Germany banned public gatherings of more than two people. Older adults and groups with underlying medical conditions such as diabetes, heart disease, respiratory disease, high blood pressure, and a compromised immune system are at higher risk for severe illness and complications. The German Center for Disease Control and Prevention recommends that such people living in the epidemic area try not to go out as much as possible. In late March 2020, the World Health Organization and other health agencies began replacing the phrase "social distancing" with "physical distancing" to clarify that the intent was to reduce physical contact while still maintaining social connections, including virtual and Connect at a distance.

sourceString: The use of the term "social distancing" had led to implications that people should engage in complete social isolation, rather than encouraging them to stay in contact with others through alternative means.Some authorities have issued sexual health guidelines for use during the pandemic.
targetString: 使用“保持社交距离”的说法蕴含着要求人们完全与社会隔离的含义，没有鼓励人们采用其他方式保持人与人之间的联系。一些权威机构还发布了大流行期间适用的性健康指导方针。
en-mt: The use of the phrase "social distancing" has the implication that people are asked to completely isolate from society, and people are not encouraged to use other ways to maintain human connection. Several authorities have also issued sexual health guidelines applicable during the pandemic.

sourceString: These include recommendations to only have sex with someone you live with, who does not have the virus or symptoms of the virus.
targetString: 其中的建议包括仅与生活在一起且未感染病毒或无症状的伴侣发生性关系。
en-mt: Among the recommendations is to only have sex with partners who live with you and who do not have the virus or are asymptomatic.

sourceString: Self-isolation at home has been recommended for those diagnosed with COVID-19 and those who suspect they have been infected.
targetString: 建议 COVID-19 确诊患者和疑似感染者居家进行自我隔离。
en-mt: It is recommended that patients with confirmed COVID-19 and those suspected of infection should self-isolate at home.

sourceString: Health agencies have issued detailed instructions for proper self-isolation.Many governments have mandated or recommended self-quarantine for entire populations living in affected areas.
targetString: 卫生机构已发布关于正确自我隔离的详细说明。很多政府已强制或建议疫区的全体居民进行自我隔离。
en-mt: Health agencies have issued detailed instructions on proper self-isolation. Many governments have mandated or recommended self-isolation for all residents in affected areas.

sourceString: The strongest self-quarantine instructions have been issued to those in high risk groups.
targetString: 另外还向高危人群发布了最严厉的自我隔离指示。
en-mt: The strictest self-isolation instructions have also been issued to high-risk groups.

sourceString: Those who may have been exposed to someone with COVID-19 and those who have recently travelled to a country or region with widespread transmission have been advised to self-quarantine for 14 days from the time of last possible exposure.
targetString: 如有可能接触过 COVID-19 患者，或者近期去过大范围传播的国家或地区，会被建议自最后可能接触病毒的时间起自我隔离 14 天。
en-mt: Anyone who may have been in contact with someone with COVID-19, or has recently traveled to a country or region with widespread transmission, is advised to self-isolate for 14 days from the time of their last possible exposure to the virus.

sourceString: Strategies in the control of an outbreak are containment or suppression, and mitigation.
targetString: 疫情防控策略包括遏制/抑制和缓解。
en-mt: Epidemic prevention and control strategies include containment/suppression and mitigation.

sourceString: Containment is undertaken in the early stages of the outbreak and aims to trace and isolate those infected as well as introduce other measures of infection control and vaccinations to stop the disease from spreading to the rest of the population.
targetString: 遏制适用于爆发早期阶段，目的是要追踪和隔离感染者，同时采取其他感染防控和疫苗接种措施，以阻止疾病向其他人群传播。
en-mt: Containment applies to the early stages of an outbreak to trace and isolate infected people, along with other infection prevention and control and vaccination measures to stop the spread of the disease to other populations.

sourceString: When it is no longer possible to contain the spread of the disease, efforts then move to the mitigation stage: measures are taken to slow the spread and mitigate its effects on the healthcare system and society.
targetString: 如果已经无法遏制疾病的传播，则要努力过渡到缓解阶段：采取措施减缓疾病传播，降低疾病对卫生系统和社会的影响。
en-mt: If it is no longer possible to contain the spread of the disease, work to transition to the mitigation phase: taking steps to slow the spread of the disease and reduce the impact of the disease on the health system and society.

sourceString: A combination of both containment and mitigation measures may be undertaken at the same time.
targetString: 遏制和缓解措施可同时进行。
en-mt: Containment and mitigation measures can be carried out simultaneously.

sourceString: Suppression requires more extreme measures so as to reverse the pandemic by reducing the basic reproduction number to less than 1.Part of managing an infectious disease outbreak is trying to decrease the epidemic peak, known as flattening the epidemic curve.
targetString: 抑制则需要采取更极端的防控措施，通过将基本再生数减少到 1 以下来扭转大流行局面。控制传染病爆发的部分工作是要努力降低疫情峰值，也就是我们所知的拉平流行病学曲线。
en-mt: Suppression requires more extreme containment measures to reverse the pandemic by reducing the basic reproductive number below 1. Part of controlling an infectious disease outbreak is trying to reduce the peak of the epidemic, known as flattening the epidemiological curve.

sourceString: This decreases the risk of health services being overwhelmed and provides more time for vaccines and treatments to be developed.
targetString: 这样可降低卫生服务系统的崩溃风险，并为疫苗和治疗方案的开发争取更多时间。
en-mt: This reduces the risk of collapse of the health delivery system and buys more time for the development of vaccines and treatments.

sourceString: Non-pharmaceutical interventions that may manage the outbreak include personal preventive measures, such as hand hygiene, wearing face-masks, and self-quarantine; community measures aimed at physical distancing such as closing schools and cancelling mass gathering events; community engagement to encourage acceptance and participation in such interventions; as well as environmental measures such surface cleaning.More drastic actions aimed at containing the outbreak were taken in China once the severity of the outbreak became apparent, such as quarantining entire cities and imposing strict travel bans.
targetString: 可控制住疫情的非药物干预措施包括个人预防措施，如保持手部卫生、戴口罩和自我隔离；旨在保持物理距离的社区措施，如停学和取消大规模集会活动；旨在鼓励接受和参与此类干预的社区行动；以及表面清洁等环境措施。面对明显加重的疫情，中国立即采取了更加严厉的疫情遏制措施，如封城和实施严格的出行禁令。
en-mt: Non-pharmaceutical interventions that can bring the outbreak under control include personal preventive measures such as hand hygiene, mask wearing, and self-isolation; community measures aimed at maintaining physical distancing, such as school closures and cancellations of mass gatherings; measures aimed at encouraging acceptance and participation community action for such interventions; and environmental measures such as surface cleaning. Faced with a significantly worsened epidemic, China immediately adopted more stringent epidemic containment measures, such as closing down cities and imposing strict travel bans.

sourceString: Other countries also adopted a variety of measures aimed at limiting the spread of the virus.
targetString: 其他国家和地区也采取了各种措施来限制病毒传播。
en-mt: Other countries and regions have also taken various measures to limit the spread of the virus.

sourceString: South Korea introduced mass screening and localized quarantines, and issued alerts on the movements of infected individuals.
targetString: 韩国引入了大规模筛查与局部隔离措施，并就感染者的活动轨迹发布了警报。
en-mt: South Korea introduced mass screening and localized quarantines, and issued alerts on the movements of infected people.

sourceString: Singapore provided financial support for those infected who quarantined themselves and imposed large fines for those who failed to do so.
targetString: 新加坡为自我隔离感染者提供财政支持，对拒绝自我隔离的感染者处以巨额罚款。
en-mt: Singapore provides financial support for self-isolation of infected people, imposing hefty fines for those who refuse to self-isolate.

sourceString: Taiwan increased face mask production and penalized hoarding of medical supplies.Simulations for Great Britain and the United States show that mitigation (slowing but not stopping epidemic spread) and suppression (reversing epidemic growth) have major challenges.
targetString: 中国台湾增加了口罩产量，对捂货惜售的医疗物资供应商施加处罚。对英国和美国的模拟显示，缓解（减缓但不阻止流行病的蔓延）和抑制（扭转流行病蔓延态势）均面临重大挑战。
en-mt: Taiwan has increased production of face masks and imposed penalties on suppliers of medical supplies who are reluctant to sell them. Simulations for the UK and US show significant challenges in both mitigation (slowing but not stopping the spread of an epidemic) and containment (reversing the spread of an epidemic).

sourceString: Optimal mitigation policies might reduce peak healthcare demand by 2/3 and deaths by half, but still result in hundreds of thousands of deaths and health systems being overwhelmed.
targetString: 最佳缓解政策可能将高峰医疗需求减少 2/3，将死亡人数减少一半，但仍会导致数十万人死亡，造成卫生系统崩溃。
en-mt: Optimal mitigation policies might reduce peak medical demand by 2/3 and halve deaths, but still kill hundreds of thousands and collapse the health system.

sourceString: Suppression can be preferred but needs to be maintained for as long as the virus is circulating in the human population (or until a vaccine becomes available, if that comes first), as transmission otherwise quickly rebounds when measures are relaxed.
targetString: 抑制可能为首选措施，但需要维持到病毒在人群中停止传播（或直至疫苗推出，以先到者为准），否则一旦放松措施，传播便会迅速反弹。
en-mt: Suppression is likely to be the preferred measure, but it needs to be maintained until the virus stops circulating in the population (or until a vaccine is introduced, whichever comes first), otherwise transmission will rebound rapidly once measures are relaxed.

sourceString: Long-term intervention to suppress the pandemic causes social and economic costs.
targetString: 旨在抑制大流行病的长期干预会带来社会和经济成本。
en-mt: Long-term interventions aimed at suppressing pandemics have social and economic costs.

sourceString: There are no specific antiviral medications approved for COVID-19, but development efforts are underway, including testing of existing medications.
targetString: 目前尚未针对 COVID-19 批准任何特效抗病毒药物，但研发工作还在进行，包括对现有药物的试验。
en-mt: There are currently no specific antiviral drugs approved for COVID-19, but research and development is ongoing, including trials of existing drugs.

sourceString: Taking over-the-counter cold medications, drinking fluids, and resting may help alleviate symptoms.
targetString: 服用非处方感冒药、补液和休息可能有助于缓解症状。
en-mt: Taking over-the-counter cold medicines, fluids, and rest may help relieve symptoms.

sourceString: Depending on the severity, oxygen therapy, intravenous fluids, and breathing support may be required.
targetString: 根据病情的严重程度，可能需要氧疗、静脉输液和呼吸支持。
en-mt: Depending on the severity of the condition, oxygen therapy, intravenous fluids, and respiratory support may be needed.

sourceString: The use of steroids may worsen outcomes.
targetString: 使用类固醇可能会导致情况恶化。
en-mt: Steroid use may make the condition worse.

sourceString: Several compounds that were previously approved for treatment of other viral diseases are being investigated for use in treating COVID-19.
targetString: 目前正在研究先前获批用于治疗其他病毒性疾病的若干化合物，确定其是否适用于治疗 COVID-19。
en-mt: Several compounds previously approved for the treatment of other viral diseases are currently being investigated for use in the treatment of COVID-19.

sourceString: The WHO also stated that some "traditional and home remedies" can provide relief of the symptoms caused by SARS-CoV-19.
targetString: 世界卫生组织还指出，一些“传统和家庭疗法”可以缓解由 SARS-CoV-19 引起的症状。
en-mt: The World Health Organization also states that some "traditional and home remedies" can relieve symptoms caused by SARS-CoV-19.

sourceString: Increasing capacity and adapting healthcare for the needs of COVID-19 patients is described by the WHO as a fundamental outbreak response measure.
targetString: 世界卫生组织指出，提高处理能力和调整医疗系统以满足 COVID-19 患者的需求是基本的疫情应对措施。
en-mt: The World Health Organization states that increasing capacity and adapting healthcare systems to meet the needs of COVID-19 patients are essential outbreak responses.

sourceString: The ECDC and the European regional office of the WHO have issued guidelines for hospitals and primary healthcare services for shifting of resources at multiple levels, including focusing laboratory services towards COVID-19 testing, cancelling elective procedures whenever possible, separating and isolating COVID-19 positive patients, and increasing intensive care capabilities by training personnel and increasing the number of available ventilators and beds.
targetString: ECDC 和世界卫生组织欧洲区域办事处发布了医院和初级卫生保健服务指南，用于在多个层面转移资源，包括将实验室服务集中于 COVID-19 检测，尽可能取消选择性程序，分隔和隔离 COVID-19 阳性患者，以及通过培训人员和增加可用呼吸机和病床数量来提高重症监护能力。
en-mt: ECDC and the WHO Regional Office for Europe have published guidance for hospitals and primary health care services to divert resources at multiple levels, including focusing laboratory services on COVID-19 testing, removing elective procedures where possible, separation and isolation COVID-19 positive patients, and increasing critical care capacity by training staff and increasing the number of ventilators and hospital beds available.

sourceString: There are various theories about where the very first case (the so-called patient zero) may have originated.
targetString: 关于第一病例（即所谓零号病人）起源地的猜测众说纷纭。
en-mt: There have been many speculations about the origin of the first case, the so-called patient zero.

sourceString: The first known case of the novel coronavirus may trace back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan, Hubei, China.
targetString: 目前已知的第一例新型冠状病毒肺炎病例可能追溯到 2019 年 12 月 1 日，位于中国湖北武汉。
en-mt: The first known case of novel coronavirus pneumonia may be traced back to December 1, 2019, in Wuhan, Hubei, China.

sourceString: Within a month, the number of coronavirus cases in Hubei gradually increased.
targetString: 一个月内，湖北省新型冠状病毒病例逐渐增加。
en-mt: Within a month, the number of new coronavirus cases in Hubei Province has gradually increased.

sourceString: These were mostly linked to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, which also sold live animals, and one theory is that the virus came from one of these kinds of animals; or, in other words, has a zoonotic origin.A pneumonia cluster of unknown cause was observed on 26 December and treated by the doctor Zhang Jixian in Hubei Provincial Hospital, who informed the Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.
targetString: 这些患者大多与华南海鲜批发市场有关，该市场同时还出售活体动物，一种理论认为新型冠状病毒便来源于其中某种动物；或者换句话说，起源于人畜共患病。12 月 26 日，湖北省中西医结合医院的医生张继先最先发现并收治了一批不明原因的肺炎患者，并于 12 月 27 日上报至武汉市江汉区疾病预防控制中心。
en-mt: Most of these patients are related to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, which also sells live animals. One theory is that the new coronavirus originated from one of these animals; or in other words, it originated from a zoonotic disease. On December 26, Zhang Jixian, a doctor at Hubei Provincial Hospital of Integrated Traditional Chinese and Western Medicine, first discovered and admitted a group of patients with pneumonia of unknown cause, and reported it to the Jianghan District Center for Disease Control and Prevention of Wuhan City on December 27.

sourceString: On 30 December, a group of doctors at Wuhan Central Hospital alerted their colleagues of a "SARS-like coronavirus".
targetString: 12 月 30 日，武汉中心医院的一群医生提醒其同事警惕一种“类似 SARS 的冠状病毒”。
en-mt: On December 30, a group of doctors at Wuhan Central Hospital alerted their colleagues to a "SARS-like coronavirus."

sourceString: Eight of these doctors, including Li Wenliang, were admonished by the police for spreading false rumours, and another, Ai Fen, was reprimanded by her superiors for raising the alarm.
targetString: 包括李文亮在内的八名医生因散布“谣言”而受到警方训诫，另一名医生艾芬则因拉响警报而被其上级训诫。
en-mt: Eight doctors, including Li Wenliang, were reprimanded by the police for spreading "rumors," while another doctor, Ai Fen, was reprimanded by her superiors for sounding the alarm.

sourceString: The Wuhan Municipal Health Commission later released a public notice on 31 December and informed the WHO.
targetString: 武汉市卫生健康委员会随后于 12 月 31 日发布公告，并上报至世界卫生组织。
en-mt: The Wuhan Municipal Health Commission subsequently issued an announcement on December 31 and reported it to the World Health Organization.

sourceString: Enough cases of unknown pneumonia had been reported to health authorities in Wuhan to trigger an investigation in early January.During the early stages of the outbreak, the number of cases doubled approximately every seven and a half days.
targetString: 武汉卫生部门收到众多不明原因肺炎病例报告后，于 1 月初启动了一项调查。在疫情爆发早期，病例数量大约每七天半翻一倍。
en-mt: Wuhan health authorities launched an investigation in early January after receiving numerous reports of pneumonia cases of unknown origin. Early in the outbreak, the number of cases doubled roughly every seven and a half days.

sourceString: In early and mid-January 2020, the virus spread to other Chinese provinces, helped by the Chinese New Year migration and Wuhan being a transport hub and major rail interchange.
targetString: 在 2020 年 1 月初至 1 月中旬，受中国春节人口大流动和武汉作为交通枢纽和主要铁路枢纽的影响，病毒传播到了中国其他省份。
en-mt: In early to mid-January 2020, the virus spread to other provinces in China due to the large population movement during the Chinese New Year and Wuhan's role as a transportation hub and a major railway hub.

sourceString: On 20 January, China reported nearly 140 new cases in one day, including two people in Beijing and one in Shenzhen.
targetString: 1 月 20 日，中国在一天内报告新增确诊病例近 140 例，包括北京 2 例和深圳 1 例。
en-mt: On January 20, China reported nearly 140 new confirmed cases in one day, including 2 in Beijing and 1 in Shenzhen.

sourceString: Later official data shows that 6,174 people had already developed symptoms by 20 January 2020.As of 26 March, the United States has overtaken China and Italy with the highest number of confirmed cases in the world.As of 9 April 2020, more than 1.61 million cases have been reported worldwide; more than 97,000 people have died and more than 364,000 have recovered.
targetString: 后来的官方数据显示，截至 2020 年 1 月 20 日，已有 6,174 人出现症状。截至 3 月 26 日，美国确诊病例超过中国和意大利，成为全球确诊病例最多的国家。截至 2020 年 4 月 9 日，全球累计报告的确诊病例超过 161 万例；死亡超过 9.7 万例，治愈超过 36.4 万例。
en-mt: Later official figures showed that as of 20 January 2020, 6,174 people had developed symptoms. As of March 26, the number of confirmed cases in the United States surpassed that of China and Italy, becoming the country with the largest number of confirmed cases in the world. As of April 9, 2020, there have been more than 1.61 million confirmed cases reported worldwide; more than 97,000 deaths and more than 364,000 cured cases.

sourceString: Around 200 countries and territories have had at least one case.
targetString: 全球约 200 个国家和地区均有报告确诊病例。
en-mt: Confirmed cases have been reported in about 200 countries and regions around the world.

sourceString: Due to the pandemic in Europe, many countries in the Schengen Area have restricted free movement and set up border controls.
targetString: 受欧洲大流行的影响，申根区很多国家均采取了限制人口自由流动和设立边境管制的防控措施。
en-mt: Affected by the pandemic in Europe, many countries in the Schengen Area have adopted prevention and control measures to restrict the free movement of people and establish border controls.

sourceString: National reactions have included containment measures such as quarantines (known as stay-at-home orders, shelter-in-place orders, or lockdown) and curfews.As of 2 April, nearly 300 million people, or about 90% of the population, are under some form of lockdown in the United States, more than 50 million people are in lockdown in the Philippines, about 59 million people are in lockdown in South Africa, and 1.3 billion people are in lockdown in India.
targetString: 国家级应对措施包括遏制，如隔离（也称居家令、就地避难令或封锁）和宵禁。截至 4 月 2 日，美国有近 3 亿人，即人口总数的约 90% 处于某种形式的封锁状态，菲律宾有 5,000 多万人处于封锁状态，南非有约 5,900 万人处于封锁状态，印度有 13 亿人处于封锁状态。
en-mt: National-level responses include containment, such as quarantines (also known as stay-at-home orders, shelter-in-place orders, or lockdowns) and curfews. As of April 2, nearly 300 million people, or about 90 percent of the population, were in some form of lockdown in the United States, more than 50 million in the Philippines, about 59 million in South Africa, and 100 million in India. 1.3 billion people are in lockdown.

sourceString: On 26 March, 1.7 billion people worldwide were under some form of lockdown, which increased to 2.6 billion people two days later—around a third of the world's population.
targetString: 3 月 26 日，全球有 17 亿人处于某种形式的封锁状态，两天后这一数字增至 26 亿，约占全球人口的三分之一。
en-mt: On March 26, 1.7 billion people worldwide were in some form of lockdown, a figure that had risen to 2.6 billion two days later, roughly a third of the world's population.

sourceString: The first confirmed case of COVID-19 has been traced back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan; one unconfirmed report suggests the earliest case was on 17 November.
targetString: 第一例 COVID-19 确诊病例已追溯到 2019 年 12 月 1 日，位于武汉；一份未经证实的报告推测最早病例可追溯到 11 月 17 日。
en-mt: The first confirmed case of COVID-19 has been traced back to December 1, 2019, in Wuhan; an unconfirmed report speculates that the earliest case dates back to November 17.

sourceString: Doctor Zhang Jixian observed a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on 26 December, upon which her hospital informed Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.
targetString: 张继先医生于 12 月 26 日发现了一批不明原因的肺炎病例，其所在医院于 12 月 27 日将这一情况上报到武汉市江汉区疾病预防控制中心。
en-mt: Dr. Zhang Jixian discovered a batch of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on December 26, and his hospital reported the situation to the Wuhan Jianghan District Center for Disease Control and Prevention on December 27.

sourceString: Initial genetic testing of patient samples on 27 December 2019 indicated the presence of a SARS-like coronavirus.
targetString: 2019 年 12 月 27 日，在对患者样本进行的初步基因检测中发现一组类似 SARS 的冠状病毒。
en-mt: On December 27, 2019, a group of SARS-like coronaviruses were identified in preliminary genetic testing of patient samples.

sourceString: A public notice was released by Wuhan Municipal Health Commission on 31 December.
targetString: 武汉市卫生健康委员会于 12 月 31 日发布公告，
en-mt: Wuhan Municipal Health Commission issued an announcement on December 31,

sourceString: The WHO was informed on the same day.
targetString: 同日上报至世界卫生组织。
en-mt: Reported to the World Health Organization on the same day.

sourceString: As these notifications occurred, doctors in Wuhan were warned by police for "spreading rumours" about the outbreak.
targetString: 这些通知发出后，武汉市几名医生因散步疫情“谣言”而受到警方训诫。
en-mt: After these notices were issued, several doctors in Wuhan were reprimanded by the police for spreading "rumors" about the outbreak.

sourceString: The Chinese National Health Commission initially claimed that there was no "clear evidence" of human-to-human transmission.
targetString: 中国国家卫生健康委员会最初声称没有出现人传人的“明确证据”。
en-mt: China's National Health Commission initially claimed there was no "clear evidence" of human-to-human transmission.

sourceString: In late January, the Chinese government launched a radical campaign later described by the Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping as a "people's war" to contain the spread of the virus.
targetString: 1 月下旬，中国政府发起了一场激进运动，后来，中共中央总书记习近平称这是一场遏制病毒传播的“人民战争”。
en-mt: In late January, the Chinese government launched an aggressive campaign that Xi Jinping, the Communist Party chief, later called a "people's war" to curb the spread of the virus.

sourceString: In what has been described as "the largest quarantine in human history", a cordon sanitaire was announced on 23 January stopping travel in and out of Wuhan, which was extended to a total of 15 cities in Hubei, affecting a total of about 57 million people.
targetString: 1 月 23 日政府宣布在武汉拉起一道防疫线，禁止人员出入武汉，这条防疫线后来又延伸至湖北其他 15 个城市，总计约 5,700 万人受影响，堪称“人类史上最大规模的隔离事件”。
en-mt: On January 23, the government announced the establishment of an epidemic prevention line in Wuhan, prohibiting people from entering and leaving Wuhan. This epidemic prevention line was later extended to 15 other cities in Hubei, affecting a total of about 57 million people. It can be called "the largest quarantine in human history." event".

sourceString: Private vehicle use was banned in the city.
targetString: 市内禁止使用私家车。
en-mt: Private cars are prohibited in the city.

sourceString: Chinese New Year (25 January) celebrations were cancelled in many places.
targetString: 很多地方还取消了中国农历新年（1 月 25 日）的庆祝活动。
en-mt: Chinese New Year (January 25) celebrations have also been canceled in many places.

sourceString: The authorities also announced the construction of a temporary hospital, Huoshenshan Hospital, which was completed in 10 days.
targetString: 政府部门还宣布建造一所临时医院，即火神山医院，该医院于 10 天内完工交付使用。
en-mt: The government also announced the construction of a temporary hospital, Huoshenshan Hospital, which was completed and put into use within 10 days.

sourceString: Another hospital was built afterwards, Leishenshan Hospital, to handle additional patients.
targetString: 随后又建造了另一所医院，即雷神山医院，用于接诊更多患者。
en-mt: Another hospital, Leishenshan Hospital, was then built to see more patients.

sourceString: In addition to newly constructed hospitals, China also converted 14 other facilities in Wuhan, such as convention centers and stadiums, into temporary hospitals.On 26 January, the government instituted further measures to contain the COVID-19 outbreak, including issuing health declarations for travellers and extending the Spring Festival holiday.
targetString: 除了新建医院外，中国还将武汉其他 14 个场所，如会议中心和体育场，改造成方舱医院。1 月 26 日，政府采取了进一步措施来遏制 COVID-19 疫情，包括向出行人员发放健康申报表和延长春节假期。
en-mt: In addition to building new hospitals, China has converted 14 other venues in Wuhan, such as convention centers and stadiums, into shelter hospitals. On January 26, the government took further measures to contain the COVID-19 outbreak, including issuing health declaration forms to travelers and extending the Lunar New Year holiday.

sourceString: Universities and schools around the country were also closed.
targetString: 全国高校和中小学也全面停学。
en-mt: Colleges and primary and secondary schools across the country are also fully suspended.

sourceString: The regions of Hong Kong and Macau instituted several measures, particularly in regard to schools and universities.
targetString: 中国香港和澳门地区也采取了若干措施，特别是针对中小学和高校的措施。
en-mt: Hong Kong and Macau have also taken several measures, especially for primary and secondary schools and universities.

sourceString: Remote working measures were instituted in several Chinese regions.
targetString: 中国多地实行了远程居家办公措施。
en-mt: Many places in China have implemented remote home office measures.

sourceString: Travel restrictions were enacted in and outside of Hubei.
targetString: 除湖北省外，其他身份也实行了旅行限制。
en-mt: In addition to Hubei province, other identities have also imposed travel restrictions.

sourceString: Public transport was modified, and museums throughout China were temporarily closed.
targetString: 公共交通经过了调整，中国各地的博物馆也临时闭馆。
en-mt: Public transport has been adjusted and museums across China are temporarily closed.

sourceString: Control of public movement was applied in many cities, and it has been estimated that about 760 million people (more than half the population) faced some form of outdoor restriction.After the outbreak entered its global phase in March, Chinese authorities took strict measures to prevent the virus from "importing" from other countries.
targetString: 很多城市实行了公共活动设施管制，据估计，约有 7.6 亿人（超过一半人口）受到了某种形式的户外活动限制。3 月疫情进入全球阶段后，中国当局采取严格措施，防止病毒从其他国家和地区“输入”。
en-mt: Many cities have instituted public event facility restrictions, and an estimated 760 million people (more than half the population) are subject to some form of outdoor activity restrictions. After the outbreak entered a global phase in March, Chinese authorities took strict measures to prevent the virus from being "imported" from other countries and regions.

sourceString: For example, Beijing has imposed a 14-day mandatory quarantine for all international travellers entering the city.On 23 March, mainland China only one case had transmitted domestically in the five days prior, in this instance via a traveller returning to Guangzhou from Istanbul.
targetString: 例如，北京对所有境外入京人员实行为期 14 天的强制隔离。在 3 月 23 日前的 5 天内，中国大陆仅出现一例本土病例，该病例系由一名从伊斯坦布尔返回广州的旅行者传播。
en-mt: For example, Beijing imposes a 14-day mandatory quarantine on all foreign arrivals. In the 5 days before March 23, there was only one indigenous case in mainland China, which was transmitted by a traveler returning to Guangzhou from Istanbul.

sourceString: On 24 March 2020, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang reported that the spread of domestically transmitted cases has been basically blocked and the outbreak has been controlled in China.
targetString: 2020 年 3 月 24 日，中国总理李克强报告称，本土病例传播已基本得到遏制，中国疫情已得到控制。
en-mt: On March 24, 2020, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang reported that the spread of local cases had been largely contained and that the epidemic in China had been brought under control.

sourceString: The same day travel restrictions were eased in Hubei, apart from Wuhan, two months after the lockdown was imposed.The Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced on 26 March 2020 that entry for visa or residence permit holders would be suspended from 28 March onwards, with no specific details on when this policy will end.
targetString: 同日，除武汉以外的其他湖北地区在实施封锁整整两个月后开始放开出行限制。中国外交部于 2020 年 3 月 26 日宣布，自 3 月 28 日起，暂停持有效中国签证、居留许可的外国人入境，关于该政策何时结束，未披露相关细节。
en-mt: On the same day, the rest of Hubei except Wuhan began to relax travel restrictions after a full two-month lockdown. The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of China announced on March 26, 2020 that the entry of foreigners holding valid Chinese visas and residence permits will be suspended from March 28. No details were disclosed about when the policy will end.

sourceString: Those who wish to enter China will have to apply for visas in Chinese embassies or consulates.
targetString: 想要入华的人员需向中国大使馆或领事馆申请签证。
en-mt: People who want to enter China need to apply for a visa at the Chinese embassy or consulate.

sourceString: The Chinese government encouraged businesses and factories to re-open on 30 March, and provided monetary stimulus packages for firms.The State Council declared a day of mourning to begin with a national three-minute moment of silence on 10:00 4 April, coinciding with Qingming Festival, although the central government asked families to pay their respects online in observance of physical distancing as to avoid a renewed COVID-19 outbreak.
targetString: 中国政府鼓励企业和工厂于 3 月 30 日复工，并为企业提供了货币刺激计划。国务院宣布将 4 月 4 日定为全国哀悼日，并于当日 10:00 点启动三分钟的全国默哀活动。这一天恰逢清明节，中央政府提倡各家庭通过网络共同悼念逝去的亲人，以保持物理距离，避免 COVID-19 疫情的二次爆发。
en-mt: The Chinese government encouraged businesses and factories to resume work on March 30 and provided a monetary stimulus package for businesses. The State Council announced April 4 as a national day of mourning and started a three-minute national silence at 10:00 on that day. This day coincides with the Ching Ming Festival, and the central government encourages families to mourn the loss of their loved ones online to maintain physical distance and avoid a second outbreak of the COVID-19 epidemic.

sourceString: COVID-19 was confirmed to have spread to South Korea on 20 January 2020 from China.
targetString: 2020 年 1 月 20 日，韩国出现 COVID-19 确诊病例。
en-mt: On January 20, 2020, a confirmed case of COVID-19 appeared in South Korea.

sourceString: The nation's health agency reported a significant increase in confirmed cases on 20 February, largely attributed to a gathering in Daegu of a new religious movement known as the Shincheonji Church of Jesus.
targetString: 韩国卫生机构报告称，2 月 20 日确诊病例显著增加，这主要源于在韩国大邱举行了一场新的宗教运动集会——新天地耶稣教会。
en-mt: South Korean health agencies reported a significant increase in confirmed cases on February 20, largely due to the gathering of a new religious movement, the Shincheonji Church of Jesus, held in Daegu, South Korea.

sourceString: Shincheonji devotees visiting Daegu from Wuhan were suspected to be the origin of the outbreak.
targetString: 从武汉前往大邱的新天地信徒被怀疑为疫情爆发的源头。
en-mt: Shincheonji believers traveling from Wuhan to Daegu are suspected to be the source of the outbreak.

sourceString: As of 22 February, among 9,336 followers of the church, 1,261 or about 13% reported symptoms.South Korea declared the highest level of alert on 23 February 2020.
targetString: 截至 2 月 22 日，在 9,336 名教会信徒中，有 1,261 人，也就是大约 13%报告出现症状。韩国于 2020 年 2 月 23 日宣布进入最高警戒级别。
en-mt: As of Feb. 22, 1,261 of the 9,336 church members, or about 13 percent, reported symptoms. South Korea announced its highest alert level on February 23, 2020.

sourceString: On 28 February, more than 2,000 confirmed cases were reported in Korea, rising to 3,150 on 29 February.
targetString: 2 月 28 日，韩国累计报告 2,000 多例确诊病例，2 月 29 日增至 3,150 例。
en-mt: South Korea reported more than 2,000 confirmed cases on Feb. 28, rising to 3,150 on Feb. 29.

sourceString: All South Korean military bases were quarantined after tests confirmed that three soldiers were positive for the virus.
targetString: 有三名士兵的病毒检测结果确认呈阳性，此后韩国所有军事基地均进入隔离状态。
en-mt: All South Korean military bases have since been quarantined after three soldiers tested positive for the virus.

sourceString: Airline schedules were also affected and therefore they were changed.South Korea introduced what was considered the largest and best-organized programme in the world to screen the population for the virus, and isolate any infected people as well as tracing and quarantining those who contacted them.
targetString: 航班时刻表也因疫情影响而调整。韩国推出了被认为全球规模最大、组织最好的病毒防控计划，即对大量人口进行病毒筛查，隔离所有感染者，并追踪和隔离感染者的密切接触人员。
en-mt: The flight schedule has also been adjusted due to the impact of the epidemic. South Korea has launched what is considered the world's largest and best-organized virus prevention and control plan, which is to screen a large number of people for the virus, isolate all infected people, and trace and isolate close contacts of infected people.

sourceString: Screening methods included mandatory self-reporting of symptoms by new international arrivals through mobile application, drive-thru testing for the virus with the results available the next day, and increasing testing capability to allow up to 20,000 people to be tested every day.
targetString: 筛查办法包括强制要求从境外新近入境者通过移动应用程序自行报告症状，进行免下车病毒检测，第二天即可获得结果，同时提高检测能力，每天最多可容纳 20,000 人接受检测。
en-mt: Screening measures include mandatory self-reporting of symptoms through a mobile app for recent arrivals from abroad, drive-through virus testing with results available the next day, and increased testing capacity to accommodate up to 20,000 people per day.

sourceString: South Korea's programme is considered to be a success in controlling the outbreak despite not quarantining entire cities.The South Korean society was initially polarized on President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.
targetString: 尽管没有隔离整座城市，但韩国的计划被认为是疫情防控的成功之举。韩国社会最初对总统文在寅的危机反应表现出两极分化的态度。
en-mt: South Korea's plan was seen as a success in containment of the outbreak, despite not quarantining entire cities. South Korean society was initially polarized by President Moon Jae-in's crisis response.

sourceString: Many Koreans signed petitions either calling for the impeachment of Moon over what they claimed to be government mishandling of the outbreak, or praising his response.
targetString: 很多韩国人在请愿书上签字，有的呼吁弹劾文在寅，指责政府对疫情的处理不当，有的则赞扬他的应对策略。
en-mt: Many South Koreans signed the petition, some calling for the impeachment of Moon Jae-in, accusing the government of mishandling the epidemic, while others praised his response strategy.

sourceString: On 23 March, it was reported that South Korea had the lowest one-day case total in four weeks.
targetString: 3 月 23 日，据报道韩国出现四周以来的最低单日新增病例总数。
en-mt: On March 23, South Korea reported its lowest daily total of new cases in four weeks.

sourceString: On 29 March it was reported that beginning 1 April all new overseas arrivals will be quarantined for two weeks.
targetString: 3 月 29 日报道称，从 4 月 1 日起，所有新抵达的海外人员均将被隔离两周。
en-mt: It was reported on March 29 that from April 1, all new arrivals from overseas will be quarantined for two weeks.

sourceString: Per media reports on 1 April, South Korea has received requests for virus testing assistance from 121 different countries.
targetString: 据媒体 4 月 1 日报道，韩国已收到来自 121 个不同国家和地区的病毒检测援助请求。
en-mt: According to media reports on April 1, South Korea has received requests for virus testing assistance from 121 different countries and regions.

sourceString: Iran reported its first confirmed cases of SARS-CoV-2 infections on 19 February in Qom, where, according to the Ministry of Health and Medical Education, two people died later that day.
targetString: 2 月 19 日，伊朗宣布库姆出现首批 SARS-CoV-2 确诊病例，后来据伊朗卫生部称，两名患者已于当天死亡。
en-mt: On February 19, Iran announced the first confirmed cases of SARS-CoV-2 in Qom, and later, according to the Iranian Ministry of Health, two patients died that day.

sourceString: Early measures announced by the government included the cancellation of concerts and other cultural events, sporting events, and Friday prayers, and closures of universities, higher education institutions, and schools.
targetString: 政府宣布的早期措施包括取消音乐会和其他文化活动、体育赛事和周五祈祷，大学、高等教育机构及中小学全面停学。
en-mt: Early measures announced by the government included the cancellation of concerts and other cultural events, sporting events and Friday prayers, and the general closure of universities, higher education institutions and primary and secondary schools.

sourceString: Iran allocated five trillion rials to combat the virus.
targetString: 伊朗拨款五万亿里亚尔用于抗击病毒。
en-mt: Iran allocates 5 trillion riyals to fight virus.

sourceString: President Hassan Rouhani said on 26 February 2020 that there were no plans to quarantine areas affected by the outbreak, and only individuals would be quarantined.
targetString: 2020 年 2 月 26 日，伊朗总统哈桑·鲁哈尼称未计划封锁受疫情影响的地区，而只会隔离被感染的个人。
en-mt: On February 26, 2020, Iranian President Hassan Rouhani stated that there is no plan to lock down the affected areas, but only to isolate infected individuals.

sourceString: Plans to limit travel between cities were announced in March, although heavy traffic between cities ahead of the Persian New Year Nowruz continued.
targetString: 三月，伊朗宣布了旨在限制城际出行的计划，但城际交通拥挤现象一直持续到波斯新年。
en-mt: In March, Iran announced plans to limit intercity travel, but intercity congestion persisted until the Persian New Year.

sourceString: Shia shrines in Qom remained open to pilgrims until 16 March 2020.Iran became a centre of the spread of the virus after China during February.
targetString: 库姆地区什叶派圣地在 2020 年 3 月 16 日之前一直对朝圣者开放。二月份，伊朗成为继中国之后的病毒传播中心。
en-mt: Shiite shrines in the Qom region remain open to pilgrims until March 16, 2020. In February, Iran became the epicenter of the virus after China.

sourceString: Amidst claims of a cover-up of the extent of the outbreak in Iran, more than ten countries had traced their cases back to Iran by 28 February, indicating that the extent of the outbreak may be more severe than the 388 cases reported by the Iranian government by that date.
targetString: 多方认为伊朗疫情的爆发程度受到了掩盖，这其中包括，截至 2 月 28 日，十多个国家的病例追溯结果指向伊朗，由此表明伊朗实际疫情比政府截至该日报告的 388 例病例要严重。
en-mt: Many parties believe that the extent of the outbreak in Iran has been covered up, including that, as of February 28, the traceability results of cases in more than a dozen countries point to Iran, which shows that the actual outbreak in Iran is worse than the 388 cases reported by the government as of that date .

sourceString: The Iranian Parliament was shut down, with 23 of its 290 members reported to have had tested positive for the virus on 3 March.
targetString: 伊朗议会被迫关闭，据报告其 290 名议员中有 23 名于 3 月 3 日检测出病毒结果呈阳性。
en-mt: Iran's parliament was forced to close and 23 of its 290 lawmakers reportedly tested positive for the virus on March 3.

sourceString: On 12 March, the Human Rights Watch urged the Iranian prison authorities to unconditionally release the human rights defenders detained for peaceful dissent, and to also temporarily release all the eligible prisoners.
targetString: 3 月 12 日，人权观察组织敦促伊朗监狱无条件释放因和平表达异议而被拘留的人权捍卫者，并临时释放所有符合条件的囚犯。
en-mt: On March 12, Human Rights Watch urged Iranian prisons to unconditionally release human rights defenders detained for peacefully expressing dissent and temporarily release all eligible prisoners.

sourceString: It stated that there is a greater risk of the virus to spread in closed institutions like detention centres, which also lack adequate medical care.
targetString: 该组织指出，病毒在拘留中心等封闭机构中的传播风险更大，且这些机构缺乏足够的医疗保健措施。
en-mt: The group pointed out that the risk of virus transmission is greater in closed institutions such as detention centers, which lack adequate health care measures.

sourceString: On 15 March, the Iranian government reported 100 deaths in a single day, the most recorded in the country since the outbreak began.
targetString: 3 月 15 日，伊朗政府报告一天内死亡 100 人，这是自疫情爆发以来该国报告的最高单日死亡数。
en-mt: On March 15, the Iranian government reported 100 deaths in one day, the highest single-day death toll reported in the country since the outbreak began.

sourceString: At least 12 sitting or former Iranian politicians and government officials had died from the disease by 17 March.
targetString: 截至 3 月 17 日，至少有 12 名现任或前任伊朗政治家和政府官员死于该病。
en-mt: As of March 17, at least 12 current or former Iranian politicians and government officials had died from the disease.

sourceString: By 23 March, Iran was experiencing 50 new cases every hour and one new death every ten minutes due to coronavirus.
targetString: 截至 3 月 23 日，伊朗每小时新增 50 例确诊病例，每 10 分钟就会新增 1 例因冠状病毒死亡的病例。
en-mt: As of March 23, Iran was seeing 50 new confirmed cases every hour and one new death from the coronavirus every 10 minutes.

sourceString: According to a WHO official, there may be five times more cases in Iran than what is being reported.
targetString: 据世界卫生组织官员称，伊朗实际病例数可能比报道数高出 5 倍。
en-mt: According to World Health Organization officials, the actual number of cases in Iran may be five times higher than reported.

sourceString: It is also suggested that U.S. sanctions on Iran may be affecting the country's financial ability to respond to the viral outbreak.
targetString: 还有观点认为，美国对伊朗的制裁可能会影响该国在应对疫情方面的财力。
en-mt: There is also a view that U.S. sanctions on Iran may affect the country's financial resources to deal with the epidemic.

sourceString: The UN High Commissioner for Human Rights has demanded economic sanctions to be eased for nations most affected by the pandemic, including Iran.
targetString: 联合国人权事务高级专员要求对包括伊朗在内受本次大流行病影响最严重的国家放松经济制裁。
en-mt: The UN High Commissioner for Human Rights has called for the easing of economic sanctions on countries hardest hit by the pandemic, including Iran.

sourceString: The outbreak was confirmed to have spread to Italy on 31 January, when two Chinese tourists tested positive for SARS-CoV-2 in Rome.
targetString: 1 月 31 日，两名中国游客在罗马被检测出 SARS-CoV-2 结果呈阳性，疫情确认蔓延到了意大利。
en-mt: On January 31, two Chinese tourists were tested positive for SARS-CoV-2 in Rome, and the outbreak was confirmed to have spread to Italy.

sourceString: Cases began to rise sharply, which prompted the Italian government to suspend all flights to and from China and declare a state of emergency.
targetString: 随后该国病例数急剧上升，促使意大利政府暂停所有往返中国的航班，并宣布进入紧急状态。
en-mt: A sharp rise in the number of cases in the country followed, prompting the Italian government to suspend all flights to and from China and declare a state of emergency.

sourceString: An unassociated cluster of COVID-19 cases was later detected, starting with 16 confirmed cases in Lombardy on 21 February.On 22 February, the Council of Ministers announced a new decree-law to contain the outbreak, including quarantining more than 50,000 people from 11 different municipalities in northern Italy.
targetString: 从 2 月 21 日在伦巴第确诊的 16 例病例开始，后来发现了一批无关联的 COVID-19 病例。2 月 22 日，内阁会议宣布了遏制疫情蔓延的新法令，包括对意大利北部 11 个不同城市的 5 万多人进行隔离。
en-mt: Starting with 16 cases confirmed in Lombardy on February 21, a cluster of unlinked COVID-19 cases was later identified. On February 22, a cabinet meeting announced new decrees to curb the spread of the epidemic, including the quarantine of more than 50,000 people in 11 different cities in northern Italy.

sourceString: Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said, "In the outbreak areas, entry and exit will not be provided.
targetString: 总理朱塞佩·孔特宣布：“严禁出入疫区。
en-mt: Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte declared: "Entering and leaving the affected area is strictly prohibited.

sourceString: Suspension of work activities and sports events has already been ordered in those areas."On 4 March, the Italian government ordered the full closure of all schools and universities nationwide as Italy reached 100 deaths.
targetString: 疫区已下令停工和暂停体育赛事”。3 月 4 日，因国内死亡病例达到 100 例，意大利政府下令全国各级学校全面停课。
en-mt: The affected areas have ordered the suspension of work and sports events". On March 4, the Italian government ordered the closure of schools at all levels across the country as the number of deaths in the country reached 100.

sourceString: All major sporting events, including Serie A football matches, were to be held behind closed doors until April, but on 9 March, all sport was suspended completely for at least one month.
targetString: 包括意大利足球甲级联赛在内的所有重大体育赛事 4 月前均将以无观众模式举办，但在 3 月 9 日，所有体育赛事均已完全暂停至少一个月。
en-mt: All major sporting events, including Serie A, had been held without spectators until April, but on March 9, all sporting events were completely suspended for at least a month.

sourceString: On 11 March, Prime Minister Conte ordered stoppage of nearly all commercial activity except supermarkets and pharmacies.On 6 March, the Italian College of Anaesthesia, Analgesia, Resuscitation and Intensive Care (SIAARTI) published medical ethics recommendations regarding triage protocols that might be employed.
targetString: 3 月 11 日，总理孔特下令停止除超市和药店以外的几乎所有商业活动。3 月 6 日，意大利麻醉镇痛重症医学学会 (SIAARTI) 公布了关于可能采用的分诊方案的医学伦理建议。
en-mt: On March 11, Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte ordered the suspension of almost all business activities except supermarkets and pharmacies. On March 6, the Italian Society of Anesthesiology and Analgesia for Intensive Care Medicine (SIAARTI) published medical ethics recommendations for possible triage protocols.

sourceString: On 19 March, Italy overtook China as the country with the most coronavirus-related deaths in the world after reporting 3,405 fatalities from the pandemic.
targetString: 3 月 19 日，意大利报告有 3,405 人死于这场大流行病，至此超过中国，成为全球新型冠状病毒死亡病例最多的国家。
en-mt: Italy reported 3,405 deaths from the pandemic on March 19, surpassing China as the country with the most deaths from the novel coronavirus in the world.

sourceString: On 22 March, it was reported that Russia had sent nine military planes with medical equipment to Italy.
targetString: 3 月 22 日，据报道称，俄罗斯向意大利派出了九架载有医疗设备的军用飞机。
en-mt: On March 22, it was reported that Russia sent nine military aircraft carrying medical equipment to Italy.

sourceString: As of 5 April, there were 128,948 confirmed cases, 15,887 deaths, and 21,815 recoveries in Italy, with the majority of those cases occurring in the Lombardy region.
targetString: 截至 4 月 5 日，意大利累计确诊病例达 128,948 例，死亡 15,887 例，治愈 21,815 例，其中大部分病例出现在伦巴第地区。
en-mt: As of April 5, the cumulative number of confirmed cases in Italy reached 128,948, with 15,887 deaths and 21,815 cured cases, most of which were in the Lombardy region.

sourceString: A CNN report indicated that the combination of Italy's large elderly population and inability to test all who have the virus to date may be contributing to the high fatality rate.
targetString: 美国有线电视新闻网曾报告称意大利庞大的老年人口和迄今无法检测所有病毒感染者的双重因素可能是引发高死亡率的部分原因。
en-mt: CNN has reported that Italy's large elderly population and the inability to test all those infected with the virus so far may be partly responsible for the high death rate.

sourceString: The United Kingdom's response to the virus first emerged as one of the most relaxed of the affected countries, and until 18 March 2020, the British government did not impose any form of social distancing or mass quarantine measures on its citizens.
targetString: 英国对该病毒的最初反应被认为是受影响国家中最松弛的一个。直至 2020 年 3 月 18 日，英国政府才开始对其公民实施各种形式的保持社会距离或大规模隔离措施。
en-mt: Britain's initial response to the virus was thought to be one of the most lax of the countries affected. It was not until March 18, 2020 that the UK government began to implement various forms of social distancing or mass isolation measures for its citizens.

sourceString: As a result, the government received criticism for the perceived lack of pace and intensity in its response to concerns faced by the public.On 16 March, Prime Minister Boris Johnson made an announcement advising against all non-essential travel and social contact, suggesting people work from home where possible and avoid venues such as pubs, restaurants, and theatres.
targetString: 英国政府因此受到批评，被指责在应对公众担忧方面缺乏速度和力度。3 月 16 日，英国首相鲍里斯·约翰逊发表声明，建议取消任何非必要的出行和社交接触，建议人们尽可能居家办公，避免去酒吧、餐馆和剧院等场所。
en-mt: The British government has been criticized for lacking speed and strength in responding to public concerns. On March 16, British Prime Minister Boris Johnson issued a statement proposing to cancel any non-essential travel and social contact, recommending that people work from home as much as possible and avoid going to bars, restaurants and theaters.

sourceString: On 20 March, the government announced that all leisure establishments such as pubs and gyms were to close as soon as possible, and promised to pay up to 80% of workers' wages to a limit of £2,500 per month to prevent unemployment in the crisis.On 23 March, the Prime Minister announced tougher social distancing measures, banning gatherings of more than two people and restricting travel and outdoor activity to that deemed strictly necessary.
targetString: 3 月 20 日，政府宣布应尽快关闭包括酒吧和健身房在内的所有休闲场所，并承诺最高可承担 80% 的工人工资，每月最高限额 2,500 英镑，以防止造成危机下的失业情况。3 月 23 日，英国首相宣布了更严厉的关于保持社会距离的措施，禁止两人以上的集会，而且除非绝对必要，不得进行任何出行和户外活动。
en-mt: On March 20, the government announced that all leisure venues, including bars and gyms, should be closed as soon as possible, and promised to cover up to 80% of workers' wages, with a maximum limit of 2,500 pounds per month, to prevent unemployment under the crisis. On March 23, the UK Prime Minister announced tougher social distancing measures, banning gatherings of more than two people and banning any travel and outdoor activities unless absolutely necessary.

sourceString: Unlike previous measures, these restrictions were enforceable by police through the issuing of fines and the dispersal of gatherings.
targetString: 不同于以往措施，此次宣布的限制规定由警方通过罚款和驱散集会的方式强制执行。
en-mt: Unlike previous measures, the announced restrictions were enforced by the police through fines and dispersal of gatherings.

sourceString: Most businesses were ordered to close, with exceptions for businesses deemed "essential", including supermarkets, pharmacies, banks, hardware shops, petrol stations, and garages.
targetString: 除了超市、药店、银行、五金店、加油站和车库等被认定为“必不可少”的业务外，其他大部分业务均被勒令停工。
en-mt: Except for businesses deemed "essential" such as supermarkets, pharmacies, banks, hardware stores, petrol stations and garages, most other businesses have been ordered to close.

sourceString: On 20 January, the first known case of COVID-19 was confirmed in the Pacific Northwest state of Washington in a man who had returned from Wuhan on 15 January.
targetString: 太平洋西北部华盛顿州于 1 月 20 日发现了美国首例 COVID-19 确诊病例，患者于 1 月 15 日从武汉回到当地。
en-mt: The first confirmed case of COVID-19 in the United States was detected on January 20 in Washington state in the Pacific Northwest, and the patient returned from Wuhan on January 15.

sourceString: The White House Coronavirus Task Force was established on 29 January.
targetString: 1 月 29 日，白宫成立冠状病毒特别工作组。
en-mt: On January 29, the White House established a coronavirus task force.

sourceString: On 31 January, the Trump administration declared a public health emergency, and placed restrictions on entry for travellers from China.
targetString: 1 月 31 日，特朗普政府宣布进入公共卫生紧急状态，并对来自中国的旅行者实施入境限制。
en-mt: On January 31, the Trump administration declared a public health emergency and imposed entry restrictions on travelers from China.

sourceString: On 28 January 2020, the Center for Disease Control—the leading public health institute of the U.S. government—announced they had developed their own testing kit.
targetString: 2020 年 1 月 28 日，美国疾控中心（美国政府下设的主要公共卫生机构）宣布已自行开发出检测试剂盒。
en-mt: On January 28, 2020, the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (the main public health agency under the US government) announced that it had developed its own test kit.

sourceString: Despite doing so, the United States had a slow start in testing, which obscured the true extent of the outbreak at the time.
targetString: 尽管如此，美国在检测方面的起步仍然较慢，掩盖了当时的疫情真实情况。
en-mt: Still, the U.S.’s slow start in testing obscured the true state of the epidemic at the time.

sourceString: Testing was marred by defective test kits produced by the federal government in February, a lack of federal government approval for non-government test kits (by academia, companies and hospitals) until the end of February, and restrictive criteria for people to qualify for a test until early March (a doctor's order was required thereafter).
targetString: 联邦政府 2 月份生产的试剂盒存在缺陷，直到 2 月底联邦政府才批准使用（来自学术界、公司和医院的）非政府试剂盒，直到 3 月初才确定检测资格限制性标准（此后需要医嘱），所有这些因素均导致美国前期检测受阻。
en-mt: Flawed kits produced by the federal government in February, non-government kits (from academia, companies and hospitals) not approved for use by the federal government until late February, restrictive criteria for testing eligibility not established until early March (doctoral order required after that), All of these factors have contributed to the obstruction of early detection in the United States.

sourceString: By 27 February, The Washington Post reported fewer than 4,000 tests had been conducted in the United States.
targetString: 2 月 27 日，《华盛顿邮报》报道称美国执行的检测总数不足 4,000 次。
en-mt: On February 27, The Washington Post reported that the total number of tests performed in the United States was less than 4,000.

sourceString: By 13 March, The Atlantic reported that less than 14,000 tests had been conducted.
targetString: 3 月 13 日，《大西洋报》报道称美国执行的检测总数不足 14,000 次。
en-mt: On March 13, The Atlantic reported that the total number of tests performed in the United States was less than 14,000.

sourceString: On 22 March, the Associated Press reported: "Many people who have symptoms and a doctor's order have waited hours or days for a test."After the first death in the United States was reported in Washington state on 29 February, Governor Jay Inslee declared a state of emergency, an action that was soon followed by other states.
targetString: 3 月 22 日，美联社报道：“很多有症状和医嘱的患者等了几个小时或几天才接受检测”。2 月 29 日，华盛顿州报道了美国首例死亡病例后，州长杰伊·英斯利随即宣布进入紧急状态，其他州也很快跟进。
en-mt: On March 22, the Associated Press reported: "Many patients with symptoms and medical orders waited hours or days for testing." After Washington state reported its first U.S. death on Feb. 29, Gov. Jay Inslee declared a state of emergency, and other states soon followed.

sourceString: Schools in the Seattle area cancelled classes on 3 March, and by mid-March, schools across the country were shutting down.On 6 March 2020, the United States was advised of projections for the impact of the new coronavirus on the country by a group of epidemiologists at Imperial College London.
targetString: 3 月 3 日，西雅图地区学校停课。3 月中旬，全国各级学校全面停课。2020 年 3 月 6 日，伦敦帝国学院的一些流行病学家就新型冠状病毒对美国的影响给出了预测建议。
en-mt: On March 3, Seattle-area schools closed. In mid-March, schools at all levels across the country were completely closed. On March 6, 2020, a group of epidemiologists at Imperial College London gave forecast recommendations for the impact of the new coronavirus on the United States.

sourceString: On the same day President Trump signed the Coronavirus Preparedness and Response Supplemental Appropriations Act, which provided $8.3 billion in emergency funding for federal agencies to respond to the outbreak.
targetString: 同一天，特朗普总统签署了《冠状病毒预防和应对补充拨款法案》，为联邦机构应对疫情提供了 83 亿美元的紧急资金。
en-mt: On the same day, President Trump signed the Coronavirus Prevention and Response Supplemental Appropriations Act, providing $8.3 billion in emergency funding for federal agencies responding to the outbreak.

sourceString: Corporations imposed employee travel restrictions, cancelled conferences, and encouraged employees to work from home.
targetString: 企业对员工实施出行限制，取消会议，并鼓励员工居家办公。
en-mt: Businesses have imposed travel restrictions on employees, canceled meetings and encouraged employees to work from home.

sourceString: Sports events and seasons were cancelled.On 11 March, Trump announced travel restrictions for most of Europe, excluding the United Kingdom, for 30 days, effective 13 March.
targetString: 体育赛事和赛季被迫取消。3 月 11 日，特朗普宣布将从 3 月 13 日起对除英国外的大部分欧洲国家实施为期 30 天的旅行禁令。
en-mt: Sporting events and seasons have been canceled. On March 11, Trump announced that he would impose a 30-day travel ban on most European countries except the United Kingdom from March 13.

sourceString: The following day, he expanded the restrictions to include the United Kingdom and Ireland.
targetString: 第二天，特朗普又将限制范围扩大到包括英国和爱尔兰。
en-mt: The next day, Trump expanded the restrictions to include the United Kingdom and Ireland.

sourceString: On 13 March, he declared a national emergency, which made federal funds available to respond to the crisis.
targetString: 3 月 13 日，特朗普宣布进入国家紧急状态，开始动用联邦资金应对疫情危机。
en-mt: On March 13, Trump declared a national emergency and began to use federal funds to respond to the epidemic crisis.

sourceString: Beginning on 15 March, many businesses closed or reduced hours throughout the U.S. to try to reduce the spread of the virus.
targetString: 从 3 月 15 日起，美国各地很多企业关闭或缩短营业时间，以期缓解病毒传播。
en-mt: Beginning March 15, many businesses across the United States closed or shortened their hours in an attempt to mitigate the spread of the virus.

sourceString: By 17 March, the epidemic had been confirmed in all 50 states and in the District of Columbia.On 23 March, it was reported that New York City had 10,700 cases of the coronavirus, more than the total number of cases in South Korea.
targetString: 截至 3 月 17 日，全美 50 个州和哥伦比亚特区均报告出现确诊病例。3 月 23 日，据报道称纽约市新型冠状病毒确诊病例达 10,700 例，超过了韩国病例总数。
en-mt: As of March 17, all 50 states and the District of Columbia have reported confirmed cases. On March 23, New York City reported 10,700 confirmed cases of the novel coronavirus, surpassing the total number of cases in South Korea.

sourceString: On 25 March, the governor said that social distancing seemed to be working, as estimates of case doubling slowed from 2.0 days to 4.7 days.
targetString: 3 月 25 日，纽约州州长称保持社交距离似乎已开始发挥作用，病例翻倍间隔估值从 2.0 天延长至 4.7 天。
en-mt: On March 25, the governor of New York State stated that social distancing appears to be working, with the estimated case doubling interval extending from 2.0 days to 4.7 days.

sourceString: As of 28 March, there were 32,308 confirmed cases in New York City, and 672 people had died from the virus.On 26 March, the United States was reported to have more confirmed coronavirus infection cases than any other country in the world, including China and Italy.As of 8 April, 400,335 cases have been confirmed in the United States, and 12,841 people have died.
targetString: 截至 3 月 28 日，纽约市累计确诊病例达 32,308 例，因病毒死亡 672 例。3 月 26 日，据报道称美国确诊的新型冠状病毒感染病例数超过包括中国和意大利在内的任何其他国家。截至 4 月 8 日，美国累计确诊病例达 400,335 例，死亡 12,841 例。
en-mt: As of March 28, New York City had 32,308 confirmed cases and 672 deaths from the virus. On March 26, it was reported that the United States had more confirmed cases of novel coronavirus infection than any other country, including China and Italy. As of April 8, the cumulative number of confirmed cases in the United States reached 400,335, with 12,841 deaths.

sourceString: Per media reports on 30 March, U.S. President Trump has decided to extend social distancing guidelines until 30 April.
targetString: 根据媒体 3 月 30 日的报道，美国总统特朗普决定将社交距离准则的施行时间延长至 4 月 30 日。
en-mt: According to media reports on March 30, US President Trump decided to extend the implementation of social distance guidelines to April 30.

sourceString: On the same day, the USNS Comfort, a hospital ship with about 1000 beds, made anchor in New York.
targetString: 同日，共设约 1,000 张床位的安慰号医务船在纽约抛锚。
en-mt: On the same day, the hospital ship Comfort, with a total of about 1,000 beds, broke down in New York.

sourceString: On 3 April, the U.S. had a record 884 deaths due to the coronavirus in a 24-hour period.
targetString: 4 月 3 日，美国 24 小时内新增 884 例冠状病毒死亡病例，创下最高记录。
en-mt: On April 3, the United States recorded a record 884 new coronavirus deaths in 24 hours.

sourceString: In the state of New York the cases have exceeded 100,000 people on 3 April.The White House has been criticized for downplaying the threat and controlling the messaging by directing health officials and scientists to coordinate public statements and publications related to the virus with the office of Vice-President Mike Pence.
