targetString: 4 月 3 日，纽约州病例总数已超 10 万例。白宫指示卫生官员和科学家与副总统迈克·彭斯办公室协调病毒相关公开声明和出版物，以此来淡化威胁和控制信息传递，此举遭到民众指责。
en-mt: On April 3, the total number of cases in New York State surpassed 100,000. The White House has directed health officials and scientists to coordinate public statements and publications about the virus with Vice President Mike Pence's office as a way to downplay the threat and control messaging, a move that has drawn criticism.

sourceString: Overall approval of Trump's management of the crisis has been polarized along partisan lines.
targetString: 民众对特朗普危机防控措施的总体认可已经因党派分歧而出现两极分化。
en-mt: The public's overall approval of Trump's crisis prevention and control measures has been polarized by partisan differences.

sourceString: Some U.S. officials and commentators criticized the U.S. reliance on importation of critical materials, including essential medical supplies, from China.
targetString: 一些美国官员和评论员批评美国依赖从中国进口基本医疗用品等关键物资。
en-mt: Some U.S. officials and commentators have criticized the U.S. for relying on imports of critical supplies such as basic medical supplies from China.

sourceString: An analysis of air travel patterns was used to map and predict patterns of spread and was published in The Journal of Travel Medicine in mid-January 2020.
targetString: 航空出行模式分析被用于绘制和预测传播模式，并于 2020 年 1 月中旬刊登到了《旅行医学杂志》杂志上。
en-mt: Air travel pattern analysis was used to map and predict transmission patterns and was published in the Journal of Travel Medicine in mid-January 2020.

sourceString: Based on 2018 information from the International Air Transport Association, Bangkok, Hong Kong, Tokyo, and Taipei had the largest volume of travellers from Wuhan.
targetString: 根据国际航空运输协会 2018 年发布的信息，从武汉出发前往曼谷、香港、东京和台北的旅客量最大。
en-mt: According to information released by the International Air Transport Association in 2018, the largest number of passengers departed from Wuhan to Bangkok, Hong Kong, Tokyo and Taipei.

sourceString: Dubai, Sydney, and Melbourne were also reported as popular destinations for people travelling from Wuhan.
targetString: 另据报道，迪拜、悉尼和墨尔本也是从武汉出发的旅客热门目的地。
en-mt: It was also reported that Dubai, Sydney and Melbourne were also popular destinations for travelers departing from Wuhan.

sourceString: Bali was reported as least able among the 20 most popular destination cities in terms of preparedness, while cities in Australia were considered most able.Australia released its Emergency Response Plan for Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) on 7 February.
targetString: 据报道，在 20 个最受欢迎的目的地城市中，巴厘岛的预备状态最差，澳大利亚各城市的预备状态最佳。澳大利亚于 2 月 7 日发布了新型冠状病毒 (COVID-19) 应急计划。
en-mt: Of the 20 most popular destination cities, Bali is reported to be the least prepared, with Australian cities the most prepared. Australia released its Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) contingency plan on 7 February.

sourceString: It stated that much was yet to be discovered about COVID-19, and that Australia would emphasize border control and communication in its response to the pandemic.
targetString: 报道指出人们对 COVID-19 的了解还不够深入，澳大利亚在应对这一流行病方面将重点关注边境管控和沟通。
en-mt: The report pointed out that people's understanding of COVID-19 is not deep enough, and Australia's response to the epidemic will focus on border control and communication.

sourceString: On 21 March, a human biosecurity emergency was declared in Australia.
targetString: 3 月 21 日，澳大利亚宣布进入“人类生物安全紧急状态”。
en-mt: On March 21, Australia declared a "human biosecurity emergency".

sourceString: Owing to the effective quarantine of public transport in Wuhan and Hubei, several countries have planned to evacuate their citizens and diplomatic staff from the area, primarily through chartered flights of the home nation, with Chinese authorities providing clearance.
targetString: 因武汉和湖北其他地区的公共交通被有效隔离，一些国家和地区已计划将侨居在这些地区本国公民和外交人员撤回本国，主要通过本国包机并由中国有关当局提供许可来实现。
en-mt: Due to the effective isolation of public transportation in Wuhan and other parts of Hubei, some countries and regions have planned to withdraw their citizens and diplomatic personnel living in these areas back to their own countries, mainly through their own chartered flights and permission from relevant Chinese authorities.

sourceString: Canada, the United States, Japan, India, Sri Lanka, Australia, France, Argentina, Germany, and Thailand were among the first to plan the evacuation of their citizens.
targetString: 其中最先计划撤侨的国家有加拿大、美国、日本、印度、斯里兰卡、澳大利亚、法国、阿根廷、德国和泰国。
en-mt: Among the first countries planning to evacuate their citizens are Canada, the United States, Japan, India, Sri Lanka, Australia, France, Argentina, Germany and Thailand.

sourceString: Pakistan has said that it will not be evacuating any citizens from China.
targetString: 巴基斯坦表示不会从中国撤侨。
en-mt: Pakistan says it will not evacuate citizens from China.

sourceString: On 7 February, Brazil evacuated 34 Brazilians or family members in addition to four Poles, a Chinese person, and an Indian citizen.
targetString: 2 月 7 日，巴西撤回了 34 名巴西人或家庭成员，另外还撤回了 4 名波兰人、1 名中国人和 1 名印度人。
en-mt: On February 7, Brazil withdrew 34 Brazilians or family members, along with four Poles, one Chinese and one Indian.

sourceString: The citizens of Poland, China, and India deplaned in Poland, where the Brazilian plane made a stopover before following its route to Brazil.
targetString: 巴西飞机在飞往巴西之前途径波兰并做短暂停留，波兰、中国和印度公民在此下飞机。
en-mt: Before flying to Brazil, the Brazilian plane stopped over in Poland, where Polish, Chinese and Indian citizens disembarked.

sourceString: Brazilian citizens who went to Wuhan were quarantined at a military base near Brasília.
targetString: 到过武汉的巴西公民被送到巴西利亚附近的一个军事基地接受隔离。
en-mt: Brazilian citizens who had been to Wuhan were sent to a military base near Brasilia for quarantine.

sourceString: On the same day, 215 Canadians (176 from the first plane, and 39 from a second plane chartered by the U.S. government) were evacuated from Wuhan to CFB Trenton to be quarantined for two weeks.
targetString: 同日，215 名加拿大人（其中第一架飞机撤回 176 人，由美国政府包租的第二架飞机撤回 39 人）从武汉撤回并被送到特伦顿加军基地接受为期两周的隔离。
en-mt: On the same day, 215 Canadians (176 on the first plane and 39 on the second plane chartered by the U.S. government) were evacuated from Wuhan and sent to Canadian military base Trenton for a two-week quarantine.

sourceString: On 11 February, another plane of 185 Canadians from Wuhan landed at CFB Trenton.
targetString: 2 月 11 日，另一架载有 185 名加拿大人的飞机从武汉起飞，降落特伦顿加军基地。
en-mt: On February 11, another plane carrying 185 Canadians took off from Wuhan and landed at Canadian Army Base Trenton.

sourceString: Australian authorities evacuated 277 citizens on 3 and 4 February to the Christmas Island Detention Centre, which had been repurposed as a quarantine facility, where they remained for 14 days.
targetString: 澳大利亚当局于 2 月 3 日和 4 日撤回 277 名公民并送到了已改作隔离场所的圣诞岛拘留中心，接受为期 14 天的隔离。
en-mt: Australian authorities evacuated 277 citizens on February 3 and 4 and sent them to the Christmas Island Detention Center which had been converted into an isolation facility, for a 14-day quarantine.

sourceString: A New Zealand evacuation flight arrived in Auckland on 5 February; its passengers (including some from Australia and the Pacific) were quarantined at a naval base in Whangaparoa, north of Auckland.
targetString: 新西兰一架疏散飞机于 2 月 5 日降落奥克兰；机上乘客（包括一些来自澳大利亚和太平洋的乘客）被送到奥克兰北部的一个海军基地接受隔离。
en-mt: An evacuation plane from New Zealand landed in Auckland on February 5; its passengers, including some from Australia and the Pacific Ocean, were taken to a naval base north of Auckland for quarantine.

sourceString: On 15 February, the United States announced that it would evacuate Americans aboard the cruise ship Diamond Princess.
targetString: 2 月 15 日，美国宣布撤回钻石公主号邮轮上的美国人。
en-mt: On February 15, the United States announced the withdrawal of Americans from the Diamond Princess cruise ship.

sourceString: On 21 February, a plane carrying 129 Canadian passengers who had been evacuated from Diamond Princess landed in Trenton, Ontario.
targetString: 2 月 21 日，一架载有 129 名加拿大乘客的飞机降落安大略省特伦顿，这些从自钻石公主号邮轮撤回的乘客。
en-mt: On February 21, a plane carrying 129 Canadian passengers evacuated from the Diamond Princess cruise ship landed in Trenton, Ontario.

sourceString: In early March, the Indian government began evacuating its citizens from Iran.On 14 March a South African Airways aircraft chartered by the South African Government repatriated 112 South African citizens.
targetString: 3 月初，印度政府开始从伊朗撤侨。3 月 14 日，南非政府包租一架南非航空公司飞机撤回 112 名南非公民。
en-mt: In early March, the Indian government began evacuating citizens from Iran. On March 14, the South African government chartered a South African Airways plane to evacuate 112 South African citizens.

sourceString: Medical screening was performed prior to departure, and four South Africans who were showing signs of coronavirus were left behind to mitigate risk.
targetString: 飞机起飞前对乘客进行了医学排查，四名出现新型冠状病毒迹象的南非人被留下以降低传播风险。
en-mt: Passengers were medically screened before the flight, and four South Africans who showed signs of the novel coronavirus were left behind to reduce the risk of transmission.

sourceString: Only South Africans who tested negative were repatriated.
targetString: 只有检测结果呈阴性的南非人被撤回。
en-mt: Only South Africans who tested negative were withdrawn.

sourceString: Test results cleared all the South Africans, including the flight crew, pilots, hotel staff, police and soldiers involved in the humanitarian mission who, as a precautionary measure, all remained under observation and in quarantine for a 14-day period at The Ranch Resort.
targetString: 所有南非人（包括机组人员、飞行员、酒店工作人员、警察和参与人道主义任务的士兵）检测结果均为阴性，作为预防措施，他们被送到 The Ranch Resort 接受为期 14 天的观察与隔离。
en-mt: All South Africans (including cabin crew, pilots, hotel staff, police officers and soldiers on humanitarian missions) tested negative and were sent to The Ranch Resort for 14 days of observation and quarantine as a precaution.

sourceString: On 20 March, the United States began to partially withdrawal its troops from Iraq due to the pandemic.
targetString: 3 月 20 日，受这一流行病的影响，美国开始从伊拉克撤回部分军队。
en-mt: On March 20, affected by the epidemic, the United States began to withdraw some troops from Iraq.

sourceString: On 5 February, the Chinese foreign ministry stated that 21 countries (including Belarus, Pakistan, Trinidad and Tobago, Egypt, and Iran) had sent aid to China.
targetString: 2 月 5 日，中国外交部表示，有 21 个国家（包括白俄罗斯、巴基斯坦、特立尼达和多巴哥、埃及和伊朗）向中国提供了援助。
en-mt: On Feb. 5, China's foreign ministry said 21 countries, including Belarus, Pakistan, Trinidad and Tobago, Egypt and Iran, had provided assistance to China.

sourceString: Some Chinese students at American universities joined together to help send aid to virus-stricken parts of China, with a joint group in the greater Chicago area reportedly managing to send 50,000 N95 masks to hospitals in the Hubei province on 30 January.The humanitarian aid organization Direct Relief, in coordination with FedEx, sent 200,000 face masks along with other personal protective equipment, including gloves and gowns, by emergency airlift to the Wuhan Union Hospital by 30 January.
targetString: 在美国上大学一些中国留学生也联合起来，帮助向中国遭受病毒袭击的地区运送救援物资。据报道，大芝加哥地区的一个联合小组于 1 月 30 日向湖北省多家医院运送了 5 万只 N95 口罩。人道主义援助组织 Direct Relief 经过与联邦快递协调，在 1 月 30 日前通过紧急空运向武汉协和医院运送了 20 万只口罩和其他个人防护装备，包括手套和防护服。
en-mt: Some Chinese students studying in the United States have also joined forces to help deliver relief supplies to virus-hit areas in China. A joint team in the greater Chicago area reportedly shipped 50,000 N95 masks to hospitals in Hubei province on Jan. 30. Direct Relief, a humanitarian aid organization, coordinated with FedEx to deliver 200,000 masks and other personal protective equipment, including gloves and gowns, to Wuhan Union Hospital by emergency airlift by Jan. 30.

sourceString: On 5 February, Bill and Melinda Gates announced a $100 million donation to the WHO to fund vaccine research and treatment efforts along with protecting "at-risk populations in Africa and South Asia".
targetString: 2 月 5 日，盖茨夫妇宣布向世界卫生组织捐赠 1 亿美元，资助疫苗研发和治疗工作，同时保护“非洲和南亚地区的高危人群”。
en-mt: On February 5, the Gateses announced a $100 million donation to the World Health Organization to fund vaccine development and treatment while protecting "high-risk populations in Africa and South Asia."

sourceString: Interaksyon reported that the Chinese government donated 200,000 masks to the Philippines on 6 February, after Senator Richard Gordon shipped 3.16 million masks to Wuhan.
targetString: 据 Interaksyon 报道，在菲律宾参议员 Richard Gordon 向武汉运送了 316 万只口罩后，中国政府又于 2 月 6 日向菲律宾捐赠了 20 万只口罩。
en-mt: According to Interaksyon, the Chinese government donated 200,000 masks to the Philippines on February 6 after Philippine Senator Richard Gordon sent 3.16 million masks to Wuhan.

sourceString: On 19 February, the Singapore Red Cross announced that it would send $2.26 million worth of aid to China.
targetString: 2 月 19 日，新加坡红十字会宣布将向中国提供价值 226 万美元的援助。
en-mt: On February 19, the Singapore Red Cross Society announced that it would provide aid worth US$2.26 million to China.

sourceString: Japan donated one million face masks to Wuhan, Turkey dispatched medical equipment, Russia sent more than 13 tonnes of medical supplies to Wuhan, Malaysia announced a donation of 18 million medical gloves to China, Germany delivered various medical supplies including 10,000 Hazmat suits, and the United States donated 17.8 tons of medical supplies to China and promised an additional $100 million in financial support to affected countries.After cases in China seemed to stabilize, the country has been sending aid to various nations hit by the pandemic.
targetString: 日本向武汉捐赠了 100 万只口罩，土耳其向武汉派发了医疗设备，俄罗斯向武汉运送了超过 13 吨医疗物资，马来西亚宣布向中国捐赠 1,800 万副医疗手套，德国向中国运送了 1 万套防护服及其他各种医疗物资，美国向中国捐赠了 17.8 吨医疗物资，并承诺向受影响国家和地区额外提供 1 亿美元的财政支持。待中国病例似乎稳定下来后，中国也一直在向受疫情影响的其他国家和地区提供援助。
en-mt: Japan donated 1 million masks to Wuhan, Turkey sent medical equipment to Wuhan, Russia sent more than 13 tons of medical supplies to Wuhan, Malaysia announced the donation of 18 million medical gloves to China, and Germany sent 10,000 protective suits to China As well as various other medical supplies, the United States donated 17.8 tons of medical supplies to China and promised to provide an additional $100 million in financial support to affected countries and regions. China has also been sending aid to other countries and regions affected by the outbreak after cases in China appear to have stabilized.

sourceString: In March, China, Cuba and Russia sent medical supplies and experts to help Italy deal with its coronavirus outbreak.
targetString: 3 月，中国、古巴和俄罗斯向意大利派遣了专家并送出了医疗物资来帮助意大利应对新型冠状病毒爆发。
en-mt: In March, China, Cuba and Russia sent experts and medical supplies to Italy to help Italy deal with the novel coronavirus outbreak.

sourceString: Businessman Jack Ma sent 1.1 million testing kits, 6 million face masks, and 60,000 protective suits to Addis Ababa, Ethiopia for distribution by the African Union.
targetString: 企业家马云向埃塞俄比亚首都亚的斯亚贝巴运送了 110 万套试剂盒、600 万只口罩和 6 万套防护服，由非洲联盟发放。
en-mt: Entrepreneur Jack Ma shipped 1.1 million test kits, 6 million masks and 60,000 protective suits to Addis Ababa, the capital of Ethiopia, to be distributed by the African Union.

sourceString: He later sent 5,000 testing kits, 100,000 face masks and 5 ventilators to Panama.
targetString: 马云后来又向巴拿马运送了 5,000 套检测工具、10 万只口罩和 5 台呼吸机。
en-mt: Ma later shipped another 5,000 testing kits, 100,000 masks and five ventilators to Panama.

sourceString: Ma also donated medical supplies to Canada.The Netherlands, Spain, Turkey, Georgia, and the Czech Republic expressed their concerns over Chinese-made masks and test kits.
targetString: 除此之外，马云还向加拿大捐赠了医疗物资。荷兰、西班牙、土耳其、格鲁吉亚和捷克共和国对中国制造的口罩和试剂盒表示担忧。
en-mt: In addition, Jack Ma also donated medical supplies to Canada. The Netherlands, Spain, Turkey, Georgia and the Czech Republic have expressed concern about masks and test kits made in China.

sourceString: For instance, Spain withdrew 58,000 Chinese-made coronavirus testing kits with an accuracy rate of just 30%, meanwhile, the Netherlands recalled 600,000 Chinese face masks which were defective.
targetString: 例如，西班牙撤回了 5.8 万套中国制造的准确率仅达 30% 的冠状病毒检测试剂盒，同时荷兰也召回了 60 万只存在缺陷的中国口罩。
en-mt: Spain, for example, recalled 58,000 Chinese-made coronavirus test kits that were only 30% accurate, while the Netherlands recalled 600,000 defective Chinese masks.

sourceString: Belgium recalled 100,000 unusable masks, thought to be from China, but were in fact from Colombia.
targetString: 比利时召回了 10 万只无法使用的口罩，这些口罩被认为来自中国，但其实来自哥伦比亚。
en-mt: Belgium recalled 100,000 unusable masks thought to be from China but actually from Colombia.

sourceString: On the other hand, Chinese aid has been well-received in parts of Latin America and Africa.On 2 April, the World Bank launched emergency support operations for developing countries.
targetString: 另一方面，中国的援助在拉丁美洲和非洲部分地区广受欢迎。4 月 2 日，世界银行启动了对发展中国家的紧急支持行动。
en-mt: Chinese aid, on the other hand, is popular in Latin America and parts of Africa. On April 2, the World Bank launched an emergency support operation for developing countries.

sourceString: The WHO has commended the efforts of Chinese authorities in managing and containing the epidemic.
targetString: 世界卫生组织赞扬了中国当局在疫情防控方面做出的努力。
en-mt: The World Health Organization praised the efforts of Chinese authorities in containing the outbreak.

sourceString: The WHO noted the contrast between the 2002–2004 SARS outbreak, where Chinese authorities were accused of secrecy that impeded prevention and containment efforts, and the current crisis where the central government "has provided regular updates to avoid panic ahead of Lunar New Year holidays".
targetString: 世界卫生组织注意到了 2002-2004 年非典疫情与本次危机之间的反差。在非典疫情中，中国当局被指控隐瞒实情，妨碍了预防和遏制工作，而在本次危机中，中央政府“在农历新年假期前便已开始定期更新情况，以避免恐慌”。
en-mt: The World Health Organization has noted the contrast between the 2002-2004 SARS epidemic and the current crisis. In the case of the SARS outbreak, where Chinese authorities were accused of concealment that hampered prevention and containment efforts, in this crisis the central government "began regular updates before the Lunar New Year holiday to avoid panic".

sourceString: On 23 January, in reaction to the central authorities' decision to implement a transportation ban in Wuhan, WHO representative Gauden Galea remarked that while it was "certainly not a recommendation the WHO has made", it was also "a very important indication of the commitment to contain the epidemic in the place where it is most concentrated" and called it "unprecedented in public health history".On 30 January, following confirmation of human-to-human transmission outside China and the increase in the number of cases in other countries, the WHO declared the outbreak a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC), the sixth PHEIC since the measure was first invoked during the 2009 swine flu pandemic.
targetString: 1 月 23 日，针对中央政府对武汉实施封城措施的决定，世界卫生组织代表高力表示，虽然这“肯定不是世界卫生组织提出的建议”，但这也“充分体现了从疫情最集中的地区遏制疫情蔓延的决心”，并将此举称为“公共卫生史上前所未有的”举措。1 月 30 日，中国境外确认出现人传人现象且其他国家病例数有所增加，世界卫生组织随即宣布此次爆发构成国际关注的突发公共卫生事件 (PHEIC)，这是继 2009 年猪流感大流行期间首次实行该措施以来的第六个国际关注的公共卫生突发事件。
en-mt: On January 23, in response to the central government’s decision to impose a lockdown on Wuhan, Gao Li, a representative of the World Health Organization, stated that although this was “certainly not a recommendation from the World Health Organization,” it also “full reflected the fact that the most concentrated outbreak of the epidemic The region's determination to contain the spread of the epidemic", calling the move "unprecedented in the history of public health". On January 30, human-to-human transmission was confirmed outside of China and the number of cases in other countries increased. The World Health Organization immediately declared the outbreak to be a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC), following the 2009 swine flu pandemic. It is the sixth public health emergency of international concern since the measure was first introduced during the epidemic.

sourceString: WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom said that the PHEIC was due to "the risk of global spread, especially to low- and middle-income countries without robust health systems.
targetString: 世界卫生组织总干事谭德塞指出国际关注的突发公共卫生事件的确定依据的是“全球传播风险，特别是向卫生系统不健全的中低收入国家传播的风险”。
en-mt: WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus pointed out that a public health emergency of international concern is determined based on "the risk of global transmission, especially to low- and middle-income countries with weak health systems".

sourceString: In response to the implementations of travel restrictions, Tedros stated that "there is no reason for measures that unnecessarily interfere with international travel and trade" and that the "WHO doesn't recommend limiting trade and movement."
targetString: 在回应实施旅行限制的问题上，谭德塞表示，“没有理由采取措施对国际旅行与贸易进行不必要的干预”，并且“世界贸易组织不建议限制贸易与流动”。
en-mt: In response to the imposition of travel restrictions, Tedros said there was "no justification for taking measures that would interfere unnecessarily with international travel and trade" and that "the World Trade Organization does not recommend restrictions on trade and movement".

sourceString: On 5 February, the WHO appealed to the global community for a $675 million contribution to fund strategic preparedness in low-income countries, citing the urgency to support those countries which "do not have the systems in place to detect people who have contracted the virus, even if it were to emerge".
targetString: 2 月 5 日，世界卫生组织呼吁国际社会捐款 6.75 亿美元，为低收入国家战略预备状态提供资助，称迫切需要为那些“没有配套系统对病毒感染者进行检测”的国家提供支持。
en-mt: On Feb. 5, the World Health Organization appealed to the international community for $675 million to fund strategic preparedness in low-income countries, saying there was an urgent need to support countries that "do not have systems in place to test people infected with the virus."

sourceString: Tedros further made statements declaring that "we are only as strong as our weakest link" and urged the international community to "invest today or pay more later".On 11 February, the WHO in a press conference established COVID-19 as the name of the disease.
targetString: 谭德塞进一步发表声明，宣称“最弱的环节决定了我们有多强大”，并敦促国际社会“立即投入，否则日后代价更大”。2 月 11 日，世界卫生组织在新闻发布会上确定将该病命名为 COVID-19。
en-mt: Tedros further issued a statement, declaring that "the weakest link determines how strong we are", and urged the international community to "invest now, or the cost will be greater later". On February 11, the World Health Organization decided to name the disease COVID-19 at a press conference.

sourceString: On the same day, Tedros stated that UN Secretary-General António Guterres had agreed to provide the "power of the entire UN system in the response".
targetString: 同日，谭德塞表示，联合国秘书长安东尼奥·古特雷斯已同意“联合国将全力应对疫情”。
en-mt: On the same day, Tan Desai said that UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres had agreed that "the United Nations will fully respond to the epidemic."

sourceString: A UN Crisis Management Team was activated as a result, allowing coordination of the entire United Nations response, which the WHO states will allow them to "focus on the health response while the other agencies can bring their expertise to bear on the wider social, economic and developmental implications of the outbreak".
targetString: 为此联合国启动了联合国危机管理小组，协调整个联合国的应对措施。世界卫生组织表示，这样世卫组织便可“专注于卫生应对措施，而其他机构也可将其专业知识用于应对疫情对社会、经济和发展造成的更广泛影响”。
en-mt: To this end, the United Nations launched the United Nations Crisis Management Team to coordinate the response across the United Nations. This would allow WHO to "focus on the health response while other agencies bring their expertise to bear on the wider social, economic and developmental impacts of the outbreak," the World Health Organization said.

sourceString: On 14 February, a WHO-led Joint Mission Team with China was activated to provide international and WHO experts on the ground in China to assist in the domestic management and evaluate "the severity and the transmissibility of the disease" by hosting workshops and meetings with key national-level institutions and to conduct field visits to assess the "impact of response activities at provincial and county levels, including urban and rural settings".On 25 February, the WHO declared that "the world should do more to prepare for a possible coronavirus pandemic," stating that while it was still too early to call it a pandemic, countries should nonetheless be "in a phase of preparedness".
targetString: 2 月 14 日，由世界卫生组织牵头的中国联合特派团启动，向中国实地派遣国际和世界卫生组织专家，通过召开研讨会并与国家级重要机构开会来协助应对本土疫情并评估“疾病的严重性和传染性”，并通过实地考察来评估“省级和县级应对活动的影响，包括城市和农村地区的不同情况”。2 月 25 日，世界卫生组织宣布“全球应做出更大的努力，为可能出现的冠状病毒大流行做好充分准备”，并指出，尽管称之为大流行还为时过早，但各国仍应“进入预备状态”。
en-mt: On February 14, a joint mission to China led by the World Health Organization was launched, sending international and World Health Organization experts on the ground in China to help respond to the local outbreak and assess the "severity of the disease" by holding seminars and meetings with key national institutions. sex and contagion” and conducted fieldwork to assess the “impact of provincial and county-level responses, including different contexts in urban and rural areas”. On February 25, the World Health Organization announced that "increased global efforts should be made to adequately prepare for a possible coronavirus pandemic," noting that while it was too early to call it a pandemic, countries Should still be "into readiness".

sourceString: In response to a developing outbreak in Iran, the WHO sent a Joint Mission Team there to assess the situation.On 28 February, WHO officials said that the coronavirus threat assessment at the global level would be raised from "high" to "very high", its highest level of alert and risk assessment.
targetString: 为了应对伊朗不断发展的疫情，世界卫生组织派出联合特派团前往该国评估局势。2 月 28 日，世界卫生组织官员称已将冠状病毒疫情的全球风险级别从“高”上调至“很高”，这也是该评估方法的最高警戒和风险级别。
en-mt: In response to the growing outbreak in Iran, the World Health Organization sent a joint mission to the country to assess the situation. On February 28, World Health Organization officials said they had raised the global risk level of the coronavirus outbreak from "high" to "very high," the highest alert and risk level in the assessment methodology.

sourceString: Mike Ryan, executive director of the WHO's health emergencies program, warned in a statement that "This is a reality check for every government on the planet: Wake up.
targetString: 世界卫生组织卫生应急项目执行董事 Mike Ryan 在一份声明中警告称：“这是对全球各国政府的现实检查：清醒一下。
en-mt: Mike Ryan, executive director of the World Health Organization's health emergencies program, warned in a statement: "This is a reality check for governments around the world: Sober up.

sourceString: This virus may be on its way and you need to be ready," urging that the right response measures could help the world avoid "the worst of it".
targetString: 病毒可能正在逼近，请做好准备”，并敦促各国政府采取正确的应对措施，避免全球出现“最坏的情况”。
en-mt: The virus may be approaching, get ready," and urged governments to get the right response to avoid a "worst-case scenario" globally.

sourceString: Ryan further stated that the current data did not warrant public health officials to declare a global pandemic, saying that such a declaration would mean "we're essentially accepting that every human on the planet will be exposed to that virus."
targetString: Ryan 进一步指出，目前的数据并不足以让公共卫生官员宣布进入全球大流行，这样宣布将意味着“我们基本上认可地球上的所有人都可能接触到这种病毒。”
en-mt: Ryan further pointed out that the current data is not enough for public health officials to declare a global pandemic, and such a declaration would mean that "we basically accept that everyone on the planet may be exposed to this virus."

sourceString: On 11 March, the WHO declared the coronavirus outbreak a pandemic.
targetString: 3 月 11 日，世界卫生组织宣布新型冠状病毒爆发构成全球大流行。
en-mt: On March 11, the World Health Organization declared the novel coronavirus outbreak a global pandemic.

sourceString: The Director-General said that the WHO was "deeply concerned both by the alarming levels of spread and severity, and by the alarming levels of inaction".The WHO has faced significant criticism for what is seen as inadequate handling of the pandemic, including the late declaration of a public health emergency and the classification of the virus as a pandemic.
targetString: 世界卫生组织总干事称“对发人深省的扩散和严重程度以及无所作为的现实深表关切”。世界卫生组织因被认为对全球大流行的处理不当而受到严重批评，包括延迟宣布突发公共卫生事件和将病毒归类为全球大流行。
en-mt: The director-general of the World Health Organization said he was "deeply concerned about the sobering spread and severity and the reality of inaction". The World Health Organization has come under heavy criticism for its perceived mishandling of the global pandemic, including delays in declaring a public health emergency and classifying the virus as a global pandemic.

sourceString: The backlash included a petition for the WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom to tender his resignation, signed by 733,000 people as of 6 April.
targetString: 其中比较强烈的反对声音包括请愿要求世界卫生组织总干事 Tedros Adhanom 递交辞呈，截至 4 月 6 日，已有 73.3 万人签署这份请愿书。
en-mt: Some of the more vocal opposition included a petition demanding the resignation of World Health Organization Director-General Tedros Adhanom, which had been signed by 733,000 people as of April 6.

sourceString: On 26 March 2020, dozens of UN human rights experts emphasized respecting the rights of every individual during the COVID-19 pandemic.
targetString: 2020 年 3 月 26 日，数十名联合国人权专家强调在 COVID-19 大流行期间要尊重每个人的权利。
en-mt: On March 26, 2020, dozens of UN human rights experts emphasized the need to respect the rights of everyone during the COVID-19 pandemic.

sourceString: The expert group stated that everyone is entitled to life-saving interventions and the government holds this responsibility.
targetString: 专家组指出，每个人都有权享受生命拯救干预措施，而政府应承担起这项责任。
en-mt: Everyone has the right to life-saving interventions, and governments should shoulder this responsibility, the panel noted.

sourceString: The group stressed that the lack of resources or health insurance should never serve as a justification for discrimination against a specific group.
targetString: 该专家组强调，缺乏资源或健康保险绝不应成为歧视特定群体的理由。
en-mt: The panel emphasized that lack of resources or health insurance should never be a reason for discrimination against certain groups.

sourceString: The experts underscored that every individual has the right to health, including people with disabilities, belonging to minority groups, older people, internally displaced people, the homeless, those living in extremely poor conditions, people in detention, as well as refugees and other unspecified groups in need of government support.
targetString: 专家强调，每个人都享有健康权，包括残疾人、未成年人、老年人、境内流离失所者、无家可归者、生活条件极其恶劣的群体、被拘留者以及需要政府支持的难民和其他未指明群体。
en-mt: Experts emphasized that everyone has the right to health, including persons with disabilities, minors, older persons, internally displaced persons, homeless persons, groups living in extreme conditions, detainees, and refugees and other unknown persons in need of government support. specify the group.

sourceString: International governmental organizations are addressing the economic and social impacts of the COVID-19 crisis.
targetString: 国际政府组织正在积极应对 COVID-19 危机所造成的经济和社会影响。
en-mt: International government organizations are actively responding to the economic and social impact of the COVID-19 crisis.

sourceString: The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development has launched a platform to provide timely and comprehensive information on policy responses in countries around the world, as well as viewpoints and advice.
targetString: 经济合作与发展组织推出了一个平台，旨在及时提供有关世界各国政策反应的全面信息及观点和建议。
en-mt: The Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development has launched a platform aimed at providing timely and comprehensive information, views and advice on policy responses around the world.

sourceString: From policies to strengthen health systems and the world economy to addressing the effects of lockdown and restrictions on travel, the digital hub includes a Country Policy Tracker, and aims to help countries learn from each other and to facilitate a co-ordinated global response to the coronavirus challenge.
targetString: 从加强卫生系统和世界经济的政策到应对封锁和出行限制的影响，这一数字中心内设国家政策跟踪系统，旨在帮助各国相互学习，促进全球协力应对新型冠状病毒挑战。
en-mt: From policies to strengthen health systems and the world economy, to addressing the impact of lockdowns and travel restrictions, the digital hub features a national policy tracker designed to help countries learn from each other and foster a global effort to tackle the novel coronavirus challenge.

sourceString: The Chinese government has been criticized by the United States, UK Minister for the Cabinet Office Michael Gove, and Brazil President Jair Bolsonaro's son Eduardo Bolsonaro for its handling of the pandemic, which began in the Chinese province of Hubei.
targetString: 因本次大流行最初爆发于中国湖北省，美国、英国内阁办公室大臣迈克尔·戈夫和巴西总统雅伊尔·博索纳罗的儿子爱德华多·博索纳罗对中国政府的处理方式提出了批评。
en-mt: The U.S., U.K. Cabinet Office minister Michael Gove and Eduardo Bolsonaro, son of Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro, have raised concerns about the Chinese government's handling of the pandemic, which first erupted in China's Hubei province. criticize.

sourceString: A number of provincial-level administrators of the Communist Party of China (CPC) were dismissed over their handling of the quarantine efforts in Central China, a sign of discontent with the political establishment's response to the outbreak in those regions.
targetString: 数名中共 (CPC) 省级行政官员因对华中地区防疫工作处理不当而被免职，反映了中央对当地政治机构的疫情应对措施不满。
en-mt: Several Communist Party of China (CPC) provincial administrators have been dismissed for mishandling the epidemic prevention efforts in central China, reflecting the central government's dissatisfaction with the local political establishment's response to the outbreak.

sourceString: Some commentators believe that this move was intended to protect Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping from the public's anger over the coronavirus outbreak.
targetString: 一些评论员认为，此举旨在避免公众因新型冠状病毒爆发而对中共中央总书记习近平不满。
en-mt: Some commentators believe the move is aimed at avoiding public displeasure with Chinese Communist Party chief Xi Jinping over the novel coronavirus outbreak.

sourceString: Some Chinese officials, e.g. Zhao Lijian rejected an earlier acknowledgement of the coronavirus outbreak starting in Wuhan, in favour of conspiracy theories about the COVID-19 originating from the U.S. or Italy.
targetString: 一些中国官员（如赵立坚）否认此前承认的 COVID-19 爆发始于武汉的言论，并支持关于新型冠状病毒肺炎源自美国或意大利的阴谋论。
en-mt: Some Chinese officials, such as Zhao Lijian, have denied previous acknowledgments that the COVID-19 outbreak began in Wuhan and supported conspiracy theories that the novel coronavirus pneumonia originated in the United States or Italy.

sourceString: The U.S. administration of Donald Trump has referred to the coronavirus as "Chinese virus" or "Wuhan virus" saying that China's "censorship supercharged a virus that has now turned into a global pandemic", which has in turn been criticized by some critics as racism and "distract[ing] from his administration's failure to contain the disease".
targetString: 美国总统唐纳德·特朗普曾将新型冠状病毒称为“中国病毒”或“武汉病毒”，称中国的“审查制度加剧了病毒传播，使其演变成了现在的全球大流行”，这反过来又被一些批评人士认为是一种种族歧视，并“转移了人们对其政府未能遏制住该病毒的关注”。
en-mt: U.S. President Donald Trump has referred to the novel coronavirus as the “Chinese virus” or the “Wuhan virus,” saying China’s “censorship exacerbated the spread of the virus to what it is now a global pandemic,” which in turn It was also seen by some critics as a form of racism and "diverted attention from his government's failure to contain the virus".

sourceString: The Daily Beast obtained a U.S. government cable outlining a communications stratagem with apparent origins in the National Security Council, with the strategy being quoted as "Everything is about China.
targetString: 《每日野兽》获得了美国政府的一份电报，该电报概述了一项明显由国家安全委员会发出的通信战略，该战略称“这一切都和中国脱不了干系。
en-mt: A U.S. government cable obtained by The Daily Beast outlines a communications strategy apparently issued by the National Security Council that says "it's all about China.

sourceString: We're being told to try and get this messaging out in any way possible, including press conferences and television appearances."Outlets such as Politico, Foreign Policy, and Bloomberg have claimed that China's efforts to send aid to virus-stricken countries is part of a propaganda push for global influence.
targetString: 我们被告知以任何方式，包括新闻发布会和电视露面，尽可能将这一信息传播出去”。《政客》、《外交政策》和彭博社等媒体声称，中国向疫情国家提供援助是为了宣扬其全球影响力。
en-mt: We were told to get this message out in any way we could, including press conferences and TV appearances." Media outlets such as Politico, Foreign Policy, and Bloomberg claimed that China's aid to countries affected by the outbreak was an attempt to promote its global Influence.

sourceString: EU foreign policy chief Josep Borrell warned that there is "a geo-political component including a struggle for influence through spinning and the 'politics of generosity'".
targetString: 欧盟外交政策负责人 Josep Borrell 警告称，有一种“地缘政治因素包括通过斡旋和“慷慨政治”来争夺影响力”。
en-mt: EU foreign policy chief Josep Borrell warned there was a "geopolitical element including competition for influence through good offices and the "politics of generosity"".

sourceString: Borrell also said that "China is aggressively pushing the message that, unlike the US, it is a responsible and reliable partner."
targetString: Borrel 还表示，“中国正在大力宣传其与美国不同，是一位负责任且可靠的伙伴。”
en-mt: Borrel also said, “China is making a big splash about being a responsible and reliable partner, unlike the United States.”

sourceString: China has also called for the US to lift its sanctions off of Syria, Venezuela and Iran, while reportedly sending aid to the latter two countries.
targetString: 中国还呼吁美国解除对叙利亚、委内瑞拉和伊朗的制裁，据称还向后两个国家提供了援助。
en-mt: China has also called on the United States to lift sanctions on Syria, Venezuela and Iran, and is said to have provided aid to the latter two countries.

sourceString: Jack Ma's donation of 100,000 masks to Cuba was blocked by US sanctions on 3 April.
targetString: 4 月 3 日，马云向古巴捐赠的 10 万只口罩因美国制裁而受阻。
en-mt: On April 3, Jack Ma's donation of 100,000 masks to Cuba was blocked by US sanctions.

sourceString: US authorities have also been accused of diverting aid meant for other nations to their own country.
targetString: 美国当局还被指控将发往其他国家的援助转移到了本国。
en-mt: U.S. authorities have also been accused of diverting aid destined for other countries.

sourceString: And there have been mask-related disputes reported between other countries, such as Germany, Austria and Switzerland; and the Czech Republic and Italy.
targetString: 据报道，德国、奥地利与瑞士以及捷克共和国与意大利等其他国家之间也存在口罩纠纷。
en-mt: Mask disputes have also been reported among other countries, including Germany, Austria and Switzerland, and the Czech Republic and Italy.

sourceString: In addition, Turkey seized hundreds of ventilators destined for Spain.
targetString: 此外，土耳其截获了数百台运往西班牙的呼吸机。
en-mt: In addition, Türkiye intercepted hundreds of ventilators destined for Spain.

sourceString: In early March, the Italian government criticized the European Union's lack of solidarity with coronavirus-affected Italy.
targetString: 3 月初，意大利政府批评欧盟对受新型冠状病毒影响的意大利的支持力度不够。
en-mt: In early March, the Italian government criticized the European Union for not supporting Italy affected by the new coronavirus for not doing enough.

sourceString: Maurizio Massari, Italy's ambassador to the EU, said that "Only China responded bilaterally.
targetString: 意大利驻欧盟大使 Maurizio Massari 表示：“只有中国做出了双边回应。
en-mt: "Only China responded bilaterally," said Maurizio Massari, Italy's ambassador to the EU.

sourceString: Certainly, this is not a good sign of European solidarity."
targetString: 当然，这不是欧洲团结的好迹象。”
en-mt: Of course, this is not a good sign of European unity. "

sourceString: On 22 March, after a phone call with Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte, Russian president Vladimir Putin arranged the Russian army to send military medics, special disinfection vehicles, and other medical equipment to Italy.
targetString: 3 月 22 日，俄罗斯总统普京在与意大利总理孔特通话后，安排俄罗斯军队向意大利派遣军医、特种消毒车和其他医疗设备。
en-mt: On March 22, Russian President Vladimir Putin arranged for the Russian army to send military doctors, special disinfection vehicles and other medical equipment to Italy after speaking with Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte.

sourceString: Italy's La Stampa newspaper cited an anonymous "high-level political source" that 80 percent of Russia's aid was "useless or of little use to Italy".
targetString: 意大利《新闻报》引用一位匿名“高层政治官员”的话说，俄罗斯 80% 的援助“对意大利几乎毫无用处”。
en-mt: Italian newspaper La Stampa quoted an anonymous "high-ranking political official" as saying that 80 percent of Russia's aid was "virtually useless for Italy".

sourceString: The source accused Russia of embarking on a "geopolitical and diplomatic" charm offensive.
targetString: 该消息人士指责俄罗斯发起了“地缘政治和外交”魅力攻势。
en-mt: The source accused Russia of launching a "geopolitical and diplomatic" charm offensive.

sourceString: The President of Lombardy, Attilio Fontana, and Italian Foreign Minister Luigi Di Maio dismissed the media reports and expressed their gratitude.
targetString: 伦巴第区长 Attilio Fontana 和意大利外交部长 Luigi Di Maio 驳回了媒体的报道，并表达了自己的谢意。
en-mt: Lombardy Governor Attilio Fontana and Italian Foreign Minister Luigi Di Maio dismissed the media reports and expressed their gratitude.

sourceString: Russia also sent a cargo plane with medical aid to the United States.
targetString: 俄罗斯还向美国派出了一架载有医疗援助物资的货运飞机。
en-mt: Russia also sent a cargo plane carrying medical aid to the United States.

sourceString: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said that "when offering assistance to US colleagues, [Putin] assumes that when US manufacturers of medical equipment and materials gain momentum, they will also be able to reciprocate if necessary."
targetString: 克里姆林宫发言人 Dmitry Peskov 称：“[普京]在向美国同僚提供援助时，认为一旦美国医疗设备和材料制造商恢复产能，将在必要情况下做出回报。”
en-mt: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said: "[Putin] provided aid to his American counterparts with the assumption that once American manufacturers of medical equipment and materials resume production capacity, they will reciprocate if necessary."

sourceString: The planned NATO "Defender 2020" military exercise in Germany, Poland, and the Baltic states, the largest NATO war exercise since the end of the Cold War, will be held on a reduced scale.
targetString: 计划在德国、波兰和波罗的海举行的北约“捍卫者 2020”军事演习是冷战结束以来规模最大的北约军事演习，演习时规模将有所缩小。
en-mt: NATO's Defender 2020 military exercises, planned for Germany, Poland and the Baltic Sea, are the largest NATO military exercises since the end of the Cold War and will be scaled down.

sourceString: The Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament's general secretary Kate Hudson criticized the Defender 2020 exercise: "In the current public-health crisis, it jeopardizes the lives not only of the troops from the US and the many European countries participating but the inhabitants of the countries in which they are operating."The Iranian government has been heavily affected by the virus, with around two dozen parliament members infected as well as fifteen other current or former political figures.
targetString: 核裁军运动秘书长 Kate Hudson 批评了“捍卫者 2020”演习：“在全球面临公共卫生危机的当下，演习不仅危及美国及很多欧洲参与国家军人的生命，还会危及演习所在国的居民。”伊朗政府受疫情影响严重，约有 24 名议员及 15 名其他现任或前任政治人物被感染。
en-mt: Kate Hudson, secretary-general of the Nuclear Disarmament Campaign, criticized the "Defender 2020" exercise: "At a time when the world is facing a public health crisis, the exercise not only endangers the lives of soldiers in the United States and many European participating countries, but also endangers the residents of the country where the exercise is hosted." Iran The government has been severely affected by the outbreak, with about 24 MPs and 15 other current or former politicians infected.

sourceString: Iran's President Hassan Rouhani wrote a public letter to world leaders asking for help on 14 March 2020, saying that his country is struggling to fight the outbreak due to lack of access to international markets as a result of the United States sanctions against Iran.The outbreak has prompted calls for the United States to adopt social policies common in other wealthy countries, including universal health care, universal child care, paid family leave, and higher levels of funding for public health.
targetString: 2020 年 3 月 14 日，伊朗总统哈桑·鲁哈尼给世界各国领导人写了一封公开信，请求援助。信中指出，美国对伊朗的制裁导致伊朗无法进入国际市场，让伊朗在抗击疫情方面困难重重。疫情爆发促使各方呼吁美国采取其他富裕国家常见的社会政策，包括全民医疗保健、全民儿童保健、带薪探亲假以及提高公共卫生资金水平。
en-mt: On March 14, 2020, Iranian President Hassan Rouhani wrote an open letter to world leaders requesting assistance. The letter pointed out that the US sanctions on Iran have prevented Iran from entering the international market, making it difficult for Iran to fight the epidemic. The outbreak has prompted calls for the United States to adopt social policies common in other rich countries, including universal health care, universal child care, paid family leave and higher levels of public health funding.

sourceString: Political analysts anticipated it may negatively affect Donald Trump's chances of re-election in the 2020 presidential election.Diplomatic relations between Japan and South Korea worsened due to the pandemic.
targetString: 政治分析人士预计，此次疫情可能会对唐纳德·特朗普能否在 2020 年总统大选中获得连任产生负面影响。日本和韩国之间的外交关系也因全球大流行而恶化。
en-mt: Political analysts predict that the outbreak could have a negative impact on Donald Trump's re-election in the 2020 presidential election. Diplomatic relations between Japan and South Korea have also soured due to the global pandemic.

sourceString: South Korea criticized Japan's "ambiguous and passive quarantine efforts" after Japan announced anybody coming from South Korea will be placed in two weeks' quarantine at government-designated sites.
targetString: 日本宣布从韩国入境的所有人均需在政府指定地点接受为期两周的检疫隔离，韩国随后批评日本的此项“检疫措施模糊且被动”。
en-mt: Japan announced that everyone entering from South Korea will be required to undergo a two-week quarantine at a location designated by the government. South Korea subsequently criticized Japan's "ambiguous and passive quarantine measures."

sourceString: The South Korean society was initially polarized on President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.
targetString: 韩国社会最初对总统文在寅的危机应对措施表现出两极分化的态度。
en-mt: South Korean society initially showed polarized attitudes toward President Moon Jae-in's crisis response.

sourceString: Many Koreans signed petitions either calling for the impeachment of Moon over what they claimed to be government mishandling of the outbreak, or praising his response.The pandemic has allowed countries to pass emergency legislation in response.
targetString: 很多韩国人在请愿书上签字，有的呼吁弹劾文在寅，指责政府对疫情的处理不当，有的则赞扬他的应对策略。这场大流行促使很多国家通过了紧急立法作为应对。
en-mt: Many South Koreans signed the petition, some calling for the impeachment of Moon Jae-in, accusing the government of mishandling the epidemic, while others praised his response strategy. The pandemic has prompted many countries to pass emergency legislation in response.

sourceString: Some commentators have expressed concerns that it could allow governments to strengthen their grip on power.
targetString: 一些评论家担心这可能会使政府强化对权力的控制。
en-mt: Some critics worry that this could allow the government to tighten its grip on power.

sourceString: In Hungary, its parliament voted to allow the prime minister, Viktor Orbán, to rule by decree indefinitely, suspend parliament as well as elections and punish those deemed to have spread false information about the virus and the government's handling of the crisis.
targetString: 在匈牙利，议会投票支持总理欧尔班·维克托通过法令无限期执政，暂停议会和选举，如果有人被认定传播了有关病毒和政府危机处理方面的虚假信息，也可对其进行处罚。
en-mt: In Hungary, parliament voted in favor of Prime Minister Viktor Orbán's indefinite decree to suspend parliament and elections and punish people found to have spread false information about the virus and the government's handling of the crisis.

sourceString: The coronavirus outbreak has been blamed for several instances of supply shortages, stemming from globally increased usage of equipment to fight the outbreaks, panic buying, and disruption to factory and logistic operations.
targetString: 多方面的供应短缺可归咎于新型冠状病毒爆发，这源于全球为对抗疫情而增加了设备使用，恐慌性购物，以及工厂和物流运营中断。
en-mt: The multifaceted supply shortages can be blamed on the novel coronavirus outbreak, which stems from increased equipment use, panic buying, and disruptions to factory and logistics operations around the world to fight the outbreak.

sourceString: The United States Food and Drug Administration has issued warnings about shortages of drugs and medical equipment due to increased consumer demand and supplier disruption.
targetString: 美国食品药品监督管理局发布了关于药品和医疗设备短缺的警告，原因是消费者需求增加和供应中断。
en-mt: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration has issued warnings about shortages of drugs and medical equipment due to increased consumer demand and supply disruptions.

sourceString: Several localities also witnessed panic buying that led to shelves being cleared of grocery essentials such as food, toilet paper, and bottled water, inducing supply shortages.
targetString: 多地出现恐慌性购物现象，导致货架上的食品、卫生纸和瓶装水等必需品被清空，造成供应短缺。
en-mt: Panic buying has emptied shelves of essentials like food, toilet paper and bottled water, creating shortages in supply.

sourceString: The technology industry in particular has been warning about delays to shipments of electronic goods.
targetString: 尤其科技行业也一直在警告电子产品发货延迟。
en-mt: The tech industry, in particular, has also been warning of delays in electronics shipments.

sourceString: According to WHO director-general Tedros Adhanom, the demand for personal protection equipment has risen 100-fold.
targetString: 世界卫生组织总干事谭德塞称，大众对个人防护设备的需求增加了 100 倍。
en-mt: World Health Organization Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said that the public's demand for personal protective equipment has increased by 100 times.

sourceString: This demand has led to the increase in prices of up to twenty times the normal price and also induced delays on the supply of medical items for four to six months.
targetString: 这种需求导致这类产品的价格比平时最高上涨了 20 倍，医疗用品供应也延迟了 4 至 6 个月，
en-mt: This demand has caused the prices of such products to increase by up to 20 times than usual, and the supply of medical supplies has also been delayed by 4 to 6 months.

sourceString: It has also caused a shortage of personal protective equipment worldwide, with the WHO warning that this will endanger health workers.
targetString: 此外还导致全球个人防护设备短缺。世界卫生组织警告称，这将对医护人员造成威胁。
en-mt: It has also led to a global shortage of personal protective equipment. The World Health Organization has warned that this poses a threat to healthcare workers.

sourceString: In Australia, the pandemic provided a new opportunity for daigou shoppers to sell Australian products into China.
targetString: 在澳大利亚，大流行为代购人员提供了向中国销售澳大利亚产品的新机会。
en-mt: In Australia, the pandemic has opened up new opportunities for daigou to sell Australian products to China.

sourceString: The activity has created a shortage of baby formula in some supermarkets and was subsequently banned by the Australian government.Despite the high prevalence of COVID-19 cases in Northern Italy and the Wuhan region, and the ensuing high demand for food products, both areas have been spared from acute food shortages.
targetString: 这一活动导致一些超市婴儿配方奶粉出现短缺，随即被澳大利亚政府禁止。尽管意大利北部和武汉地区的 COVID-19 非常严重，但这两地并没有出现严重的食品短缺。
en-mt: The campaign led to shortages of baby formula in some supermarkets and it was banned by the Australian government. Despite the severity of COVID-19 in northern Italy and Wuhan, there are no serious food shortages in these two places.

sourceString: Measures by China and Italy against the hoarding and illicit trade of critical products have been successful, avoiding acute food shortages that were anticipated in Europe as well as in North America.
targetString: 中国和意大利针对关键产品囤积和非法贸易行为采取的措施非常成功，避免了严重食品短缺问题，而欧洲和北美则预计会出现此类问题。
en-mt: Measures against hoarding and illegal trade practices in key products have been successful in China and Italy, avoiding severe food shortages that were expected in Europe and North America.

sourceString: Northern Italy with its significant agricultural production has not seen a large reduction, but prices may increase according to industry representatives.
targetString: 意大利北部的农业产量并未大幅下降，但业界代表认为，价格可能会上涨。
en-mt: Agricultural production in northern Italy has not fallen significantly, but industry representatives believe that prices may rise.

sourceString: Empty food shelves were only encountered temporarily, even in Wuhan city, while Chinese government officials released pork reserves to assure sufficient nourishment of the population.
targetString: 食品货架清空现象只是暂时性出现，即使在武汉也是如此，中国政府官员还释放了猪肉储备，以保障居民的充分营养。
en-mt: The emptying of food shelves was only temporary, even in Wuhan, where Chinese government officials also released pork reserves to keep residents well-nourished.

sourceString: Similar laws exist in Italy requiring food producers to keep reserves for such emergencies.
targetString: 意大利也有类似法律规定，要求食品生产商针对这类紧急情况储备供应。
en-mt: Italy has similar laws requiring food producers to stockpile supplies for such emergencies.

sourceString: Damage to the global economy has been felt in China: according to a media report on 16 March, the economy in China was very hard hit in the first two months of 2020 due to the measures taken by the government to curtail virus spread, and retail sales plunged 20.5%.
targetString: 全球经济受损已对中国产生影响：3 月 16 日的一份媒体报道称，2020 年前两个月，受政府采取的疫情遏制措施的影响，中国经济遭受巨大冲击，零售额暴跌 20.5%。
en-mt: The damage to the global economy is already affecting China: A media report on March 16 said that the first two months of 2020 saw a huge hit to the Chinese economy, with retail sales plunging 20.5% as a result of the government's efforts to contain the outbreak.

sourceString: As mainland China is a major economy and manufacturing hub, the viral outbreak has been seen to pose a major destabilizing threat to the global economy.
targetString: 由于中国大陆是全球主要的经济和制造业中心，所以病毒爆发被视为对全球经济稳定性构成重大威胁。
en-mt: The virus outbreak is seen as a major threat to global economic stability as mainland China is a major global economic and manufacturing hub.

sourceString: Agathe Demarais of the Economist Intelligence Unit has forecast that markets will remain volatile until a clearer image emerges on potential outcomes.
targetString: 据《经济学人》情报组的 Agathe Demarais 预测，在对可能的后果有更清晰的认识之前，市场将一直处于不稳定状态。
en-mt: Agathe Demarais of the Economist Intelligence Unit predicts that markets will remain volatile until there is a clearer picture of the likely fallout.

sourceString: In January 2020, some analysts estimated that the economic fallout of the epidemic on global growth could surpass that of the 2002–2004 SARS outbreak.
targetString: 2020 年 1 月，一些分析师估计，此次爆发对全球经济增长的负面影响可能超过 2002-2004 年的非典疫情。
en-mt: In January 2020, some analysts estimated that the negative impact of this outbreak on global economic growth could exceed that of the 2002-2004 SARS epidemic.

sourceString: One estimate from an expert at Washington University in St. Louis gave a $300+ billion impact on the world's supply chain that could last up to two years.
targetString: 圣路易斯华盛顿大学的一位专家估计，疫情对全球供应链产生的影响将达 3,000 多亿美元，持续时间可能长达两年。
en-mt: An expert at Washington University in St. Louis estimates that the outbreak's impact on global supply chains will be more than $300 billion and could last as long as two years.

sourceString: The Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) reportedly "scrambled" after a steep decline in oil prices due to lower demand from China.
targetString: 据报道，因中国需求下降，石油输出国组织 (OPEC) 在油价大幅下跌后“处境艰难”。
en-mt: The Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) is reportedly "struggling" after a sharp drop in oil prices due to falling demand from China.

sourceString: Global stock markets fell on 24 February due to a significant rise in the number of COVID-19 cases outside mainland China.
targetString: 2 月 24 日，因中国大陆以外的 COVID-19 病例大幅增加，导致全球股市下跌。
en-mt: Global stock markets fell on Feb. 24 as COVID-19 cases rose sharply outside mainland China.

sourceString: On 27 February, due to mounting worries about the coronavirus outbreak, various U.S. stock indexes including the NASDAQ-100, the S&P 500 Index, and the Dow Jones Industrial Average posted their sharpest falls since 2008, with the Dow falling 1,191 points, the largest one-day drop since the financial crisis of 2007–08.
targetString: 2 月 27 日，因民众对新型冠状病毒疫情的担忧日益加剧，包括纳斯达克 100 指数、标准普尔 500 指数和道琼斯工业平均指数在内的各类美股指数均出现自 2008 年以来的最大跌幅，道指下跌 1,191 点，为 2007-08 年金融危机以来最大单日跌幅。
en-mt: U.S. stock indexes including the Nasdaq 100, S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average posted their worst losses since 2008 on Feb. 27 amid growing concerns over the novel coronavirus outbreak , the Dow fell 1,191 points, its biggest one-day drop since the 2007-08 financial crisis.

sourceString: All three indexes ended the week down more than 10%.
targetString: 三大指数当周均下跌了 10% 以上。
en-mt: All three major indexes fell more than 10% for the week.

sourceString: On 28 February, Scope Ratings GmbH affirmed China's sovereign credit rating, but maintained a Negative Outlook.
targetString: 2 月 28 日，Scope Ratings GmbH 确认了中国的主权信用评级，但仍保持负面展望。
en-mt: On February 28, Scope Ratings GmbH affirmed China's sovereign credit rating, but maintained a negative outlook.

sourceString: Stocks plunged again based on coronavirus fears, the largest fall being on 16 March.
targetString: 民众对新型冠状病毒的担忧导致股市再次暴跌，最大跌幅出现在 3 月 16 日。
en-mt: Fears over the novel coronavirus sent stocks plummeting again, with the steepest drop on March 16.

sourceString: Many consider an economic recession to be likely.
targetString: 多方认为经济衰退是大概率事件。
en-mt: Many parties believe that an economic recession is a high probability event.

sourceString: Economist Mohamed El-Erian praised central banks' and states' timely emergency measures.
targetString: 经济学家 Mohamed El-Erian 称赞各国央行和各州均及时采取了紧急措施。
en-mt: Economist Mohamed El-Erian praised central banks and states for their timely emergency measures.

sourceString: Central banks are reacting more quickly than they did to the 2008 financial crash.
targetString: 相比 2008 年的金融危机，央行反应更快了。
en-mt: Compared with the 2008 financial crisis, the central bank reacted more quickly.

sourceString: Tourism is one of the worst affected sectors due to travel bans, closing of public places including travel attractions, and advice of governments against any travel all over the world.
targetString: 受旅行禁令、旅游景点等公共场所关闭，以及各国政府建议避免出行的影响，旅游业成为遭受影响最严重的行业之一。
en-mt: Tourism has been one of the hardest-hit sectors by travel bans, closures of public places such as tourist attractions, and governments advising people to avoid travel.

sourceString: As a consequence, numerous airlines have cancelled flights due to lower demand, including British Airways, China Eastern Airlines, and Qantas, while British regional airline Flybe collapsed.
targetString: 受此影响，很多航空公司因需求下降而取消了航班，包括英国航空公司、中国东方航空公司和澳洲航空公司，而英国支线航空公司 Flybe 则不幸倒闭。
en-mt: As a result, many airlines, including British Airways, China Eastern and Qantas, have canceled flights due to falling demand, while British regional airline Flybe has unfortunately collapsed.

sourceString: The impact on the cruise line industry was at a level never seen before.
targetString: 邮轮行业所受重创更是前所未有。
en-mt: The cruise industry has been hit hard like never before.

sourceString: Several train stations and ferry ports have also been closed.
targetString: 多个火车站和轮渡港口也被迫关闭。
en-mt: Several train stations and ferry ports were also forced to close.

sourceString: The epidemic coincided with the Chunyun, a major travel season associated with the Chinese New Year holiday.
targetString: 疫情恰逢春运期间，因中国春节放假，这原本是一个重要的旅游季。
en-mt: The epidemic coincided with the Spring Festival travel season, which was originally an important tourist season due to the Chinese New Year holiday.

sourceString: A number of events involving large crowds were cancelled by national and regional governments, including annual New Year festivals, with private companies also independently closing their shops and tourist attractions such as Hong Kong Disneyland and Shanghai Disneyland.
targetString: 国家和地方政府取消了一系列会涉及人群聚集的活动，包括一年一度的春节，私营企业也自行关闭了店铺和旅游景点，如香港迪士尼乐园和上海迪士尼乐园。
en-mt: National and local governments have canceled a series of events involving crowds, including the annual Spring Festival, and private businesses have also shut down stores and tourist attractions, such as Hong Kong Disneyland and Shanghai Disneyland, on their own.

sourceString: Many Lunar New Year events and tourist attractions have been closed to prevent mass gatherings, including the Forbidden City in Beijing and traditional temple fairs.
targetString: 很多农历新年活动和旅游景点（包括北京故宫和传统庙会）一律取消和关闭，以防止大规模人群聚集。
en-mt: Many Lunar New Year events and tourist attractions, including the Forbidden City in Beijing and traditional temple fairs, were canceled and closed to prevent large crowds from gathering.

sourceString: In 24 of China's 31 provinces, municipalities and regions, authorities extended the New Year's holiday to 10 February, instructing most workplaces not to re-open until that date.
targetString: 在中国 31 个省、直辖市和自治区当中，有 24 个地区将新年假期延长到了 2 月 10 日，要求大多数企业在该日期之前不得复工。
en-mt: Twenty-four of China's 31 provinces, municipalities and autonomous regions extended the New Year's holiday to Feb. 10, requiring most businesses not to resume work until that date.

sourceString: These regions represented 80% of the country's GDP and 90% of exports.
targetString: 这些地区的国内生产总值占全国的 80%，出口占 90%。
en-mt: These regions account for 80% of the country's GDP and 90% of exports.

sourceString: Hong Kong raised its infectious disease response level to the highest and declared an emergency, closing schools until March and cancelling its New Year celebrations.The retail sector has been impacted globally, with reductions in store hours or temporary closures.
targetString: 中国香港将传染病应对级别提高至最高级，并宣布进入紧急状态，学校停课至 3 月，新年庆祝活动取消。零售业受到全球影响，店铺营业时间缩短或临时关闭。
en-mt: Hong Kong raised its infectious disease response to the highest level and declared a state of emergency, with schools closed until March and New Year celebrations cancelled. The retail industry has been impacted globally, with store opening hours shortened or temporary closures.

sourceString: Visits to retailers in Europe and Latin America declined by 40%.
targetString: 欧洲和拉丁美洲的零售店光顾量下降了 40%。
en-mt: Retail store visits fell 40% in Europe and Latin America.

sourceString: North America and Middle East retailers saw a 50–60% drop.
targetString: 北美和中东地区零售店光顾量下降了 50-60%。
en-mt: Visits to retail stores in North America and the Middle East are down 50-60%.

sourceString: This also resulted in a 33–43% drop in foot traffic to shopping centres in March compared to February.
targetString: 此外，疫情还导致购物中心 3 月份的客流量比 2 月份下降了 33-43%。
en-mt: In addition, the epidemic also caused the traffic of shopping malls to drop by 33-43% in March compared to February.

sourceString: Shopping mall operators around the world imposed additional measures, such increased sanitation, installation of thermal scanners to check the temperature of shoppers, and cancellation of events.According to a United Nations Economic Commission for Latin America estimate, the pandemic-induced recession could leave between 14 and 22 million more people in extreme poverty in Latin America than would have been in that situation without the pandemic.
targetString: 世界各地的购物中心经营者均采取了额外措施，如增加卫生设施，安装热扫描仪来测量购物者体温，同时还取消了一些活动。根据联合国拉丁美洲经济委员会的估计，大流行引发的经济衰退可能会导致拉丁美洲的极贫人口比未发生大流行时多出 1,400 万至 2,200 万。
en-mt: Mall operators around the world have taken extra measures, such as increasing sanitation facilities and installing thermal scanners to take shoppers' temperatures, while canceling some events. The recession triggered by the pandemic could leave 14 million to 22 million more people in extreme poverty in Latin America than it would have been without the pandemic, according to estimates by the United Nations Economic Commission for Latin America.

sourceString: In January and February 2020, during the height of the epidemic in Wuhan, about 5 million people in China lost their jobs.
targetString: 2020 年 1 月和 2 月，在武汉疫情高峰期，中国大约有 500 万人失业。
en-mt: In January and February 2020, at the height of the outbreak in Wuhan, approximately 5 million people in China lost their jobs.

sourceString: Many of China's nearly 300 million rural migrant workers have been stranded at home in inland provinces or trapped in Hubei province.In March 2020, more than 10 million Americans lost their jobs and applied for government aid.
targetString: 中国有近 3 亿农民工，其中很多均被滞留在内陆省份家中或湖北省。2020 年 3 月，超过 1,000 万美国人失业，并申请了政府援助。
en-mt: China has nearly 300 million migrant workers, many of whom are stranded at home in the interior provinces or in Hubei province. In March 2020, more than 10 million Americans were unemployed and applied for government assistance.

sourceString: The coronavirus outbreak could cost 47 million jobs in the United States and unemployment rate may hit 32%, according to estimates by the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis.The lockdown in India has left tens of millions of Indian migrant workers (who are paid through daily wages) unemployed.The survey from the Angus Reid Institute found that 44% of Canadian households have experienced some type of unemployment.Nearly 900,000 workers lost their jobs in Spain since it went into lockdown in mid-March 2020.
targetString: 根据圣路易斯联邦储备银行的估计，新型冠状病毒疫情可能导致美国 4,700 万人失业，失业率可能达到 32%。印度的封锁已导致数千万（按日计薪的）印度农民工失业。安格斯里德研究所调查发现，44% 的加拿大家庭经历过某种形式的失业。自 2020 年 3 月中旬西班牙实施封锁以来，近 90 万工人失业。
en-mt: According to estimates from the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis, the novel coronavirus outbreak could result in 47 million U.S. job losses, and the unemployment rate could reach 32%. India's lockdown has left tens of millions of (daily wage) Indian migrant workers out of work. The Angus Reed Institute survey found that 44 per cent of Canadian households have experienced some form of unemployment. Since Spain imposed its lockdown in mid-March 2020, nearly 900,000 workers have lost their jobs.

sourceString: During the second half of March, 4 million French workers applied for temporary unemployment benefits and 1 million British workers applied for a universal credit scheme.Almost half a million companies in Germany have sent their workers on a government-subsidized short-time working schemes known as Kurzarbeit.
targetString: 3 月下半月，400 万法国工人申请了临时失业救济，100 万英国工人申请了通用福利金。德国近 50 万家公司对员工采用了由政府补贴的缩时工作制。
en-mt: In the second half of March, 4 million French workers applied for temporary unemployment benefits, and 1 million British workers applied for Universal Benefit. Nearly 500,000 companies in Germany use government-subsidized shortened working hours for their employees.

sourceString: The German short-time work compensation scheme has been adopted by France and Britain.
targetString: 法国和英国也都采用了德国的缩时工作补偿制。
en-mt: Germany's time-short work compensation system has also been adopted by France and the United Kingdom.

sourceString: The performing arts and cultural heritage sectors have been profoundly affected by the pandemic, impacting organizations' operations as well as individuals—both employed and independent—globally.
targetString: 演艺和文化产业也因疫情受到重创，全球范围内的组织运作以及受雇员工和个体均未能幸免。
en-mt: The performing arts and cultural industries have also been hit hard by the epidemic, and the operations of organizations and employees and individuals around the world have not been spared.

sourceString: Arts and culture sector organizations attempted to uphold their (often publicly funded) mission to provide access to cultural heritage to the community, maintain the safety of their employees and the public, and support artists where possible.
targetString: 艺术和文化产业组织努力坚持其使命（通常由政府资助），向社区展示文化遗产，维护其雇员和公众的安全，并尽可能为艺术家提供支持。
en-mt: Arts and cultural industry organizations strive to uphold their mission (often funded by the government) to showcase cultural heritage to the community, keep their employees and the public safe, and support artists wherever possible.

sourceString: By March 2020, across the world and to varying degrees, museums, libraries, performance venues, and other cultural institutions had been indefinitely closed with their exhibitions, events and performances cancelled or postponed.
targetString: 到 2020 年 3 月，世界各地的博物馆、图书馆、演艺场所和其他文化机构均在不同程度上被无限期关闭，原定展览、活动和表演也被迫取消或推迟。
en-mt: In March 2020, museums, libraries, performing arts venues, and other cultural institutions around the world were closed indefinitely to varying degrees, and scheduled exhibitions, events, and performances were canceled or postponed.

sourceString: In response there were intensive efforts to provide alternative services through digital platforms.Another recent and rapidly accelerating fallout of the disease is the cancellation of religious services, major events in sports, and other social events, such as music festivals and concerts, technology conferences, and fashion shows.
targetString: 为应对这一状况，各方开始大力通过数字平台提供替代性服务。此次疫情近期还会导致很多宗教服务、重大体育活动和其他社会活动（如音乐节、音乐会、技术研讨会和时装表演）被迫取消，而且这一负面影响会迅速加剧。
en-mt: In response to this situation, various parties have begun to vigorously provide alternative services through digital platforms. The pandemic will also lead to the cancellation of many religious services, major sporting events, and other social events (such as music festivals, concerts, technical seminars, and fashion shows) in the near term, and this negative impact will quickly intensify.

sourceString: The film industry has also experienced disruption.The Vatican announced that Holy Week observances in Rome, which occur during the last week of the Christian penitential season of Lent, have been cancelled.
targetString: 电影业同样受到了冲击。梵蒂冈宣布取消将于基督教四旬斋最后一周在罗马举行的圣周纪念活动。
en-mt: The film industry has also been hit. The Vatican has announced the cancellation of Holy Week commemorations to be held in Rome during the final week of Christian Lent.

sourceString: Many dioceses have recommended older Christians to stay at home rather than attending Mass on Sundays; some churches have made church services available via radio, online live streaming or television while others are offering drive-in worship.
targetString: 很多教区建议年长的基督徒呆在家中，礼拜日也不用参加弥撒；一些教堂通过广播、在线直播或电视举行礼拜仪式，还有些教堂则允许车内敬拜。
en-mt: Many dioceses are advising older Christians to stay at home and not attend mass on Sunday; some churches hold services over the radio, live online or on television, while others allow worship in vehicles.

sourceString: With the Roman Catholic Diocese of Rome closing its churches and chapels and St. Peter's Square emptied of Christian pilgrims, other religious bodies also cancelled services and limited public gatherings in churches, mosques, synagogues, temples and gurdwaras.
targetString: 因罗马天主教管区关闭了其大小教堂，圣彼得广场上不见基督教朝圣者踪影，其他宗教团体也取消或限制了在教堂、清真寺、犹太教堂、寺庙和谒师所的礼拜或有限的公共集会。
en-mt: As the Roman Catholic diocese closed its churches and churches, Christian pilgrims were nowhere to be found in St. Peter's Square, and other religious groups also canceled or restricted worship or limited public gatherings in churches, mosques, synagogues, temples and gurdwaras.

sourceString: Iran's Health Ministry announced the cancellation of Friday prayers in areas affected by the outbreak and shrines were later closed, while Saudi Arabia banned the entry of foreign pilgrims as well as its residents to holy sites in Mecca and Medina.
targetString: 伊朗卫生部宣布取消受疫情影响地区的周五祈祷，祈祷圣地后来也被迫关闭，沙特阿拉伯则禁止外国朝圣者及其居民进入麦加和麦地那圣地。
en-mt: Iran's health ministry announced the cancellation of Friday prayers in areas affected by the outbreak, and the shrines were later forced to close, while Saudi Arabia banned foreign pilgrims and their residents from entering the holy sites of Mecca and Medina.

sourceString: The pandemic has caused the most significant disruption to the worldwide sporting calendar since the Second World War.
targetString: 这场大流行给世界体育日程造成了自第二次世界大战以来最严重的破坏。
en-mt: The pandemic has caused the worst disruption to the world sports calendar since World War II.

sourceString: Most major sporting events have been either cancelled or postponed, including the 2019–20 UEFA Champions League, 2019–20 Premier League, UEFA Euro 2020, 2019–20 NBA season, and 2019–20 NHL season.
targetString: 大部分重大体育赛事被迫取消或推迟，其中包括 2019-20 欧洲冠军联赛、2019-20 英超联赛、2020 欧洲冠军联赛、2019-20 NBA 赛季和 2019-20 全美曲棍球联合会赛季。
en-mt: Most major sporting events have been canceled or postponed, including the 2019-20 UEFA Champions League, 2019-20 Premier League, 2020 UEFA Champions League, 2019-20 NBA season and 2019-20 NHL season.

sourceString: The outbreak disrupted plans for the 2020 Summer Olympics, which were originally scheduled to start at the end of July; the International Olympic Committee announced on 24 March that the event will be "rescheduled to a date beyond 2020 but not later than summer 2021".Casinos and other gaming venues worldwide have closed and live poker tournaments have been either postponed or cancelled.
targetString: 此次爆发打乱了原定于 7 月底举行的 2020 年夏季奥运会计划；国际奥委会于 3 月 24 日宣布，该赛事将“重新安排到 2020 年以后，但不得晚于 2021 年夏季”。世界各地的赌场和其他博彩场所均遭关闭，现场扑克比赛也被迫推迟或取消。
en-mt: The outbreak disrupted plans for the 2020 Summer Olympics, originally scheduled for late July; the International Olympic Committee announced on March 24 that the event would be "rescheduled to a date beyond 2020, but no later than summer 2021". Casinos and other gaming venues around the world have been closed, and live poker events have been postponed or canceled.

sourceString: This has led many gamblers to move online, with many online gambling sites reporting significant increases in their rates of new sign-ups.The entertainment industry has also been affected, with various music groups suspending or cancelling concert tours.
targetString: 这进而导致很多赌博者转向网上赌博，多家网上赌博网站报告称其新注册率显著增加。娱乐业也受到了影响，各种音乐团体均暂停或取消了巡回演唱会。
en-mt: This, in turn, has led many gamblers to turn to online gambling, with several online gambling sites reporting significant increases in new registrations. The entertainment industry has also been affected, with various music groups suspending or canceling concert tours.

sourceString: Many large theatres such as those on Broadway also suspended all performances.
targetString: 很多大型剧院，如百老汇剧院，也暂停了所有演出。
en-mt: Many large theaters, such as Broadway theaters, have also suspended all performances.

sourceString: Some artists have explored ways to continue to produce and share work over the internet as an alternative to traditional live performance, such as live streaming concerts or creating web-based "festivals" for artists to perform, distribute, and publicize their work.
targetString: 一些艺人也设法通过互联网继续创作和分享作品，以替代传统现场演出，如现场直播音乐会，或创建网络“节日”供艺人表演、发行和宣传其作品。
en-mt: Some artists have also managed to continue creating and sharing work via the Internet as an alternative to traditional live performances, such as live streaming concerts, or creating online "festivals" for artists to perform, distribute, and promote their work.

sourceString: Online, numerous coronavirus-themed Internet memes have spread as many turn to humour and distraction amid uncertainty.
targetString: 在网上，众多以新型冠状病毒为主题的网络迷因传播开来，在不确定性蔓延的当下，很多人开始转向以幽默和转移注意力的方式应对。
en-mt: With numerous coronavirus-themed memes circulating online, many are turning to humor and distraction as uncertainty spreads.

sourceString: Since the outbreak of COVID-19, heightened prejudice, xenophobia, and racism have been noted toward people of Chinese and East Asian descent, and against people from hotspots in Europe, the United States and other countries.
targetString: 自 COVID-19 爆发以来，针对中国人、东亚裔及来自欧洲、美国和其他国家热点地区人群的偏见、仇外心理和种族歧视日益加剧。
en-mt: Since the outbreak of COVID-19, prejudice, xenophobia, and racial discrimination against Chinese, East Asians, and people from hot spots in Europe, the United States, and other countries have intensified.

sourceString: Incidents of fear, suspicion, and hostility have been observed in many countries, particularly in Europe, East Asia, North America, and the Asia-Pacific region.
targetString: 很多国家和地区，尤其是在欧洲、东亚、北美和亚太地区，均出现了恐惧、怀疑和仇视事件。
en-mt: Incidents of fear, suspicion and hatred have emerged in many countries and regions, especially in Europe, East Asia, North America and the Asia-Pacific region.

sourceString: Reports from February (when the majority of the cases had still been confined to China) have documented racist sentiments expressed in various groups worldwide of Chinese people deserving the virus or receiving what has been claimed as justified retribution.
targetString: 今年 2 月的诸多报道（当时大部分病例仍局限于中国）记录了世界范围内不同群体对中国人表现出的种族主义情绪，认为中国人就应该感染病毒或接受所谓的正当报复。
en-mt: Numerous reports in February of this year (when most cases were still confined to China) documented racist sentiments displayed by different groups around the world towards Chinese people, arguing that Chinese people should contract the virus or accept so-called legitimate retaliation.

sourceString: Some countries in Africa have also seen a rise in anti-Chinese sentiment.
targetString: 一些非洲国家也出现了反华情绪上升现象。
en-mt: Anti-China sentiment has also risen in some African countries.

sourceString: Many residents of Wuhan and Hubei have reported discrimination based on their regional origin.
targetString: 据报道称，武汉和湖北地区的很多居民受到了地域歧视。
en-mt: According to reports, many residents in Wuhan and Hubei have been discriminated against based on their geographical location.

sourceString: There has been support for the Chinese, both on and offline, and towards those in virus-stricken areas.
targetString: 无论在线下还是线上，都有声音支持中国人以及疫情严重地区的居民。
en-mt: Whether offline or online, there are voices supporting the Chinese people and residents of severely affected areas.

sourceString: Following the progression of the outbreak to new hotspot countries, people from Italy, the first country in Europe to experience a serious outbreak of COVID-19, could also be subjected to suspicion and xenophobia.Citizens in countries including Malaysia, New Zealand, Singapore, and South Korea initially signed petitions lobbying to ban Chinese people from entering their countries in an effort to stop the disease.
targetString: 随着疫情蔓延至其他热点国家，意大利成为欧洲首个 COVID-19 严重爆发的国家，来自该国的人群也可能受到怀疑和仇外心理的影响。马来西亚、新西兰、新加坡、韩国等国的一些公民最初签署了请愿书，请求禁止中国人进入本国，以试图阻止疾病传播。
en-mt: People from Italy, the first country in Europe to experience a serious outbreak of COVID-19, may also be affected by suspicion and xenophobia as the outbreak spreads to other hot spots. Some citizens of Malaysia, New Zealand, Singapore, South Korea and other countries initially signed petitions asking that Chinese people be banned from entering their countries in an attempt to stop the spread of the disease.

sourceString: In Japan, the hashtag #ChineseDontComeToJapan trended on Twitter.
targetString: 在日本，有人推特上发起的 #ChineseDontComeToJapan（中国人别来日本）话题广泛传播。
en-mt: In Japan, the hashtag #ChineseDontComeToJapan (Chinese Don't Come to Japan) was widely spread on Twitter.

sourceString: Chinese people as well as other Asians in the United Kingdom and the United States have reported increasing levels of racist abuse, as well as assaults.
targetString: 中国人以及身在英国和美国的其他亚洲人报告称，种族虐待和攻击日渐增多。
en-mt: Chinese and other Asians in the UK and US have reported increasing racial abuse and assault.

sourceString: U.S. president Donald Trump has faced criticism for referring to the coronavirus as the "Chinese Virus", a term considered by critics to be racist and anti-Chinese.
targetString: 美国总统唐纳德·特朗普因将新型冠状病毒称为“中国病毒”而饱受批评，批评者认为其言论存在种族歧视和反华倾向。
en-mt: U.S. President Donald Trump has come under fire for referring to the novel coronavirus as the "Chinese virus," which critics see as racist and anti-Chinese.

sourceString: Protesters in Ukraine attacked buses carrying Ukrainian and foreign evacuees from Wuhan to Novi Sanzhary.
targetString: 乌克兰抗议者袭击了从武汉开往新桑扎里的公共汽车，里面载有乌克兰和外国撤离者。
en-mt: Ukrainian protesters attacked a bus carrying Ukrainian and foreign evacuees from Wuhan to Novi Sanzari.

sourceString: Students who come from Northeast India, which shares a border with China, and study in major Indian cities have reportedly experienced harassment related to the coronavirus outbreak.
targetString: 据报道，来自印度东北部（与中国接壤）并在印度主要城市就读的学生也因新型冠状病毒爆发而受到骚扰。
