en-mt: Students from northeastern India (on the border with China) and studying in major Indian cities have also reportedly been harassed due to the novel coronavirus outbreak.

sourceString: The Bharatiya Janata Party's State unit president in West Bengal Dilip Ghosh stated that the Chinese had destroyed nature and "that's why the God took revenge against them."
targetString: 印度人民党西孟加拉邦主席迪利普·戈什称，中国人破坏了自然，“所以上帝要报复他们。”
en-mt: Dilip Ghosh, chairman of the Bharatiya Janata Party's West Bengal state, said the Chinese have destroyed nature, "so God will take revenge on them."

sourceString: The remarks were later condemned by the Chinese consulate in Kolkata, calling it "erroneous".In China, xenophobia and racism agains non-Chinese residents has been inflamed by the pandemic, with foreigners described as "foreign garbage" and targeted for "disposal".
targetString: 这些言论后来遭到中国驻加尔各答领事馆的谴责，称其“错误”。在中国，非中国居民受到的仇外心理和种族歧视也因大流行而加剧，外国人被描述为“外国垃圾”，应成为“垃圾处理”的目标。
en-mt: The remarks were later condemned by the Chinese consulate in Kolkata, calling them "wrong". In China, xenophobia and racial discrimination against non-Chinese residents has also been exacerbated by the pandemic, with foreigners described as "foreign garbage" who should be targeted for "garbage disposal".

sourceString: Many newspapers with paywalls have removed them for some or all of their coronavirus coverage.
targetString: 很多设有付费墙的报纸为部分或全部有关新型冠状病毒的报道取消了付费墙的限制。
en-mt: Many newspapers with paywalls have removed their paywalls for some or all of their coverage of the novel coronavirus.

sourceString: Many scientific publishers made scientific papers related to the outbreak available with open access.
targetString: 很多科学出版商公开发表了一些疫情相关科学论文。
en-mt: Many scientific publishers have publicly published some scientific papers related to the epidemic.

sourceString: Some scientists chose to share their results quickly on preprint servers such as bioRxiv.
targetString: 还有些科学家选择在 bioRxiv 等预印本服务器上快速分享其研究结果。
en-mt: Other scientists choose to quickly share their findings on preprint servers such as bioRxiv.

sourceString: Emerging infectious disease – Infectious disease of emerging pathogen, often novel in its outbreak range or transmission mode
targetString: 新出现的传染病——由新出现的病原体引发的传染病，其爆发范围或传播方式通常也与以往不同
en-mt: Emerging Infectious Diseases – Infectious diseases caused by pathogens that have emerged and often have outbreaks that are different in scope or spread than in the past

sourceString: Globalization and disease – Overview of globalization and disease transmission
targetString: 全球化与疾病——全球化与疾病传播概述
en-mt: Globalization and disease - an overview of globalization and the spread of disease

sourceString: List of epidemics and pandemics – A list of death tolls due to infectious disease
targetString: 流行病和大流行病清单——传染病死亡人数清单
en-mt: List of Epidemics and Pandemics - List of Infectious Disease Deaths

sourceString: Wildlife smuggling and zoonoses – Health risks associated with the trade in exotic wildlife
targetString: 野生动物走私与人畜共患病——与外来野生动物买卖相关的健康风险
en-mt: Wildlife Trafficking and Zoonoses - Health Risks Associated with Exotic Wildlife Trading

sourceString: Laboratory testing for the respiratory coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and the associated SARS-CoV-2 virus includes methods that detect the presence of virus and those that detect antibodies produced in response to infection.
targetString: 2019 呼吸道冠状病毒疾病 (COVID-19) 及相关 SARS-CoV-2 病毒的实验室检测方法包括：检测病毒是否存在以及检测感染后是否产生抗体。
en-mt: Laboratory tests for respiratory coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and the related SARS-CoV-2 virus include testing for the presence of the virus and testing for antibody production following infection.

sourceString: The presence of viruses in samples is confirmed by RT-PCR, which detects the coronavirus'  RNA.
targetString: RT-PCR 可检测冠状病毒的 RNA，并由此确定样本中是否存在病毒。
en-mt: RT-PCR detects the RNA of a coronavirus and thereby determines the presence of the virus in a sample.

sourceString: This test is specific and is designed to only detect the RNA of the SARS-CoV-2 virus.
targetString: 这项检测是 SARS-CoV-2 病毒 RNA 的特异性检测。
en-mt: This test is specific for SARS-CoV-2 viral RNA.

sourceString: It is used to confirm very recent or active infections.
targetString: 可用来确定最近是否受到感染或是否有活动性感染。
en-mt: Can be used to determine if you have recently been infected or if you have an active infection.

sourceString: Detection of antibodies (serology) can be used both for diagnosis and population surveillance.
targetString: 抗体检测（血清测试）可用于诊断和群体监测。
en-mt: Antibody detection (serum testing) can be used for diagnosis and population monitoring.

sourceString: Antibody tests show how many people have had the disease, including those whose symptoms were too minor to report or who were asymptomatic.
targetString: 抗体检测显示有多少人已感染病毒，包括症状轻微而没有报告或无症状的感染者。
en-mt: Antibody tests show how many people have been infected with the virus, including those with mild symptoms that have not been reported or are asymptomatic.

sourceString: An accurate mortality rate of the disease and the level of herd immunity in the population can be determined from the results of this test.
targetString: 这项检测结果可确定疾病的准确致死率，以及人口中的群体免疫水平。
en-mt: The results of this test determine the exact fatality rate of the disease, as well as the level of herd immunity in the population.

sourceString: Due to limited testing, as of March 2020 no countries had reliable data on the prevalence of the virus in their population.
targetString: 由于检测数量有限，截至 2020 年 3 月，没有任何国家/地区能够就病毒在其人口中的流行情况提供可靠的数据。
en-mt: Due to limited testing, no country was able to provide reliable data on the prevalence of the virus in its population as of March 2020.

sourceString: By 23 March, no country had tested more than 3% of their population, and there are massive variations in how much testing has been done across countries.
targetString: 截至 3 月 23 日，没有一个国家/地区的检测人数超过其人口的 3%，各个国家/地区完成的检测量差异巨大。
en-mt: As of March 23, no country had tested more than 3% of its population, and the amount of testing done varied widely across countries.

sourceString: This variability is also likely to be significantly affecting reported case fatality rates, which are likely to be significantly over-estimated in some countries.
targetString: 这种差异还可能严重影响报告的病例死亡率，在部分国家，这个比率可能被严重高估。
en-mt: This discrepancy may also significantly affect the reported case-fatality rate, which may be significantly overestimated in some countries.

sourceString: Using real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) the test can be done on respiratory samples obtained by various methods, including nasopharyngeal swab or sputum sample.
targetString: 采用咽喉拭子进行实时逆转录聚合酶链反应（rRT-PCR）检测，只有在感染病毒后的第一周内完成，才能得到可靠结果。
en-mt: Real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) testing using throat swabs is only reliable if done within the first week after infection with the virus.

sourceString: Results are generally available within a few hours to 2 days.
targetString: 一般情况下，几个小时至 2 天内即可得到结果。
en-mt: Typically, results are available within a few hours to 2 days.

sourceString: The RT-PCR test performed with throat swabs is only reliable in the first week of the disease.
targetString: 采用咽拭子进行的 RT-PCR 检测，只有在感染病毒后的第一周内完成，才能得到可靠结果。
en-mt: RT-PCR tests using throat swabs are only reliable if done within the first week after infection with the virus.

sourceString: Later on the virus can disappear in the throat while it continues to multiply in the lungs.
targetString: 之后，病毒在咽喉中消失，但在肺部继续繁殖。
en-mt: Afterwards, the virus disappears in the throat but continues to multiply in the lungs.

sourceString: For infected people tested in the second week, alternatively sample material can then be taken from the deep airways by suction catheter or coughing up material (sputum) can be used.
targetString: 对于在感染后第二周进行检测的感染者，样本物可替换为通过吸痰管获得的深呼吸道提取物，或可以使用咳出物（痰液）。
en-mt: For infected persons who are tested in the second week after infection, the sample material can be replaced by a deep respiratory extract obtained through a suction tube, or coughed up (phlegm) can be used.

sourceString: One of the early PCR tests was developed at Charité in Berlin in January 2020 using real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR), and formed the basis of 250,000 kits for distribution by the World Health Organization (WHO).
targetString: 2020 年 1 月在柏林查瑞特 (Charité) 医院发布了 rRT-PCR， 这是早期 PCR 检测法之一，并成为世界卫生组织 (World Health Organization, WHO) 分发的 250,000 个检测试剂盒的依据。
en-mt: Released in January 2020 at the Charité hospital in Berlin, rRT-PCR was one of the early PCR assays and became the basis for 250,000 test kits distributed by the World Health Organization (WHO).

sourceString: The United Kingdom had also developed a test by 23 January 2020.The South Korean company Kogenebiotech developed a clinical grade, PCR-based SARS-CoV-2 detection kit (PowerChek Coronavirus) on 28 January 2020.
targetString: 2020 年 1 月 23 日，英国也开发出一种检测法。2020 年 1 月 28 日，韩国公司 Kogenebiotech 开发出一种临床级、基于 PCR 的 SARS-CoV-2 检测试剂盒（PowerChek Coronavirus）。
en-mt: On January 23, 2020, a test was also developed in the UK. On January 28, 2020, the Korean company Kogenebiotech developed a clinical-grade, PCR-based SARS-CoV-2 detection kit (PowerChek Coronavirus).

sourceString: It looks for the "E" gene shared by all beta coronaviruses, and the RdRp gene specific to SARS-CoV-2.In China, BGI Group was one of the first companies to receive emergency use approval from China's National Medical Products Administration for a PCR-based SARS-CoV-2 detection kit.In the United States, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) is distributing its 2019-Novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV) Real-Time RT-PCR Diagnostic Panel to public health labs through the International Reagent Resource.
targetString: 它寻找所有 β 冠状病毒共有的“E”基因，以及 SARS-CoV-2 特有的 RdRp 基因。在中国，华大基因 (BGI Group) 是首批获得中国国家药品监督管理局关于生产基于 PCR 的 SARS-CoV-2 检测试剂盒的紧急使用批准的公司之一。在美国，疾病控制与预防中心 (CDC) 通过国际试剂资源部门向公共卫生实验室分发了 2019 新型冠状病毒 (2019-nCoV) 实时 RT-PCR 诊断面板。
en-mt: It looks for the "E" gene common to all betacoronaviruses, and the RdRp gene unique to SARS-CoV-2. In China, BGI Group was one of the first companies to receive emergency use approval from China's National Medical Products Administration for the production of a PCR-based SARS-CoV-2 test kit. In the United States, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) distributed the 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) real-time RT-PCR diagnostic panel to public health laboratories through International Reagent Resources.

sourceString: One of three genetic tests in older versions of the test kits caused inconclusive results due to faulty reagents, and a bottleneck of testing at the CDC in Atlanta; this resulted in an average of fewer than 100 samples a day being successfully processed throughout the whole of February 2020.
targetString: 早期版本的检测试剂盒采用三个基因检测法，其中的一种方法由于试剂缺陷导致无法确定结果，同时，亚特兰大 CDC 出现检测瓶颈；这导致在 2020 年的整个二月，每天成功处理的平均样本数量不足 100 个。
en-mt: An early version of the test kit used three genetic tests, one of which was inconclusive due to a reagent defect, and a testing bottleneck at the Atlanta CDC; this resulted in an average number of samples successfully processed per day throughout February 2020 Quantity is less than 100.

sourceString: Tests using two components were not determined to be reliable until 28 February 2020, and it was not until then that state and local laboratories were permitted to begin testing.
targetString: 包含两个部分的检测法直至 2020 年 2 月 28 日才被认定可靠，在这时，该州和当地实验室才被允许开始检测。
en-mt: The two-part test was not deemed reliable until February 28, 2020, at which point state and local laboratories were allowed to begin testing.

sourceString: The test was approved by the Food and Drug Administration under an Emergency Use Authorization.US commercial labs began testing in early March 2020.
targetString: 此检测由美国食品药品监督管理局依据紧急使用授权批准。美国商业实验室在 2020 年 3 月初开始检测。
en-mt: This test is approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration under Emergency Use Authorization. U.S. commercial laboratories began testing in early March 2020.

sourceString: As of 5 March 2020 LabCorp announced nationwide availability of COVID-19 testing based on RT-PCR.
targetString: LabCorp 宣布，从 2020 年 3 月 5 日起可在全国范围内进行基于 RT-PCR 的 COVID-19 检测。
en-mt: LabCorp has announced that RT-PCR based COVID-19 testing will be available nationwide beginning March 5, 2020.

sourceString: Quest Diagnostics similarly made nationwide COVID-19 testing available as of 9 March 2020.
targetString: Quest Diagnostics 也同样宣布从 2020 年 3 月 9 日起可提供全国范围的 COVID-19 检测。
en-mt: Quest Diagnostics has likewise announced the availability of nationwide COVID-19 testing beginning March 9, 2020.

sourceString: No quantity limitations were announced; specimen collection and processing must be performed according to CDC requirements.
targetString: 未宣布数量限制；样本采集和处理必须按照 CDC 要求执行。
en-mt: No quantitative limit announced; sample collection and processing must be performed in accordance with CDC requirements.

sourceString: In Russia, the COVID-19 test was developed and produced by the State Research Center of Virology and Biotechnology VECTOR.
targetString: 在俄罗斯，COVID-19 检测由国家病毒学与生物技术研究中心 (VECTOR) 负责研制和生产。
en-mt: In Russia, the COVID-19 test is developed and produced by the State Research Center of Virology and Biotechnology (VECTOR).

sourceString: On 11 February 2020 the test was registered by the Federal Service for Surveillance in Healthcare.On 12 March 2020, Mayo Clinic was reported to have developed a test to detect COVID-19 infection.On 13 March 2020, Roche Diagnostics received FDA approval for a test which could be performed within 3.5 hours in high volume, thus allowing one machine to do approximately 4,128 tests in a 24-hour period.
targetString: 2020 年 2 月 11 日，该检测已在俄罗斯联邦卫生监督局注册。2020 年 3 月 12 日，据报告，梅奥诊所研制出一种可检测 COVID-19 感染的试剂盒。2020 年 3 月 13 日，Roche Diagnostics 的一个检测方法获得 FDA 的批准，该方法可在 3.5 小时内完成大量检测，从而实现一台设备可在 24 小时内进行大约 4,128 次检测。
en-mt: On February 11, 2020, the test was registered with the Russian Federal Health Surveillance Service. On March 12, 2020, it was reported that the Mayo Clinic had developed a test kit to detect COVID-19 infection. On March 13, 2020, Roche Diagnostics received FDA approval for an assay that can perform a large number of assays in 3.5 hours, enabling a single device to perform approximately 4,128 assays in 24 hours.

sourceString: On 19 March 2020, the FDA issued emergency use authorization (EUA) to Abbott Laboratories for a test on Abbott's m2000 system; the FDA had previously issued similar authorization to Hologic, LabCorp, and Thermo Fisher Scientific.
targetString: 2020 年 3 月 19 日，FDA 向雅培 (Abbott Laboratories) 发放了采用 Abbott 的 m2000 系统进行检测的紧急使用授权 (EUA)；FDA 此前曾向 Hologic、LabCorp 和 Thermo Fisher Scientific 发放了类似授权。
en-mt: On March 19, 2020, the FDA issued an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) to Abbott Laboratories for testing using Abbott's m2000 system; the FDA has previously issued similar authorizations to Hologic, LabCorp, and Thermo Fisher Scientific.

sourceString: On 21 March 2020, Cepheid similarly received EUA from the FDA for a test that takes about 45 minutes.
targetString: 2020 年 3 月 21 日，Cepheid 的一项大约需要 45 分钟的检测方法同样获得了 FDA 的紧急使用授权。
en-mt: On March 21, 2020, Cepheid also received emergency use authorization from the FDA for a test that takes approximately 45 minutes.

sourceString: The FDA has approved a test that uses isothermal nucleic acid amplification technology instead of PCR.
targetString: FDA 已批准了一项使用核酸等温扩增技术代替 PCR 的检测方法。
en-mt: The FDA has approved a test that uses isothermal nucleic acid amplification instead of PCR.

sourceString: Since this does not require a series of alternating temperature cycles this method can deliver positive results in as little as five minutes and negative results in 13 minutes.
targetString: 由于该方法不需要一系列的变温循环，因此，仅 5 分钟就可得出阳性结果，13 分钟内可确定阴性结果。
en-mt: Since the method does not require a series of variable temperature cycles, a positive result can be obtained in as little as 5 minutes and a negative result can be confirmed in 13 minutes.

sourceString: There are currently about 18,000 of these machines in the U.S. and Abbott expects to ramp up manufacturing to deliver 50,000 tests per day.A test which uses a monoclonal antibody which specifically binds to the nucleocapsid protein (N protein) of the novel coronavirus is being developed in Taiwan, with the hope that it can provide results in 15 to 20 minutes just like a rapid influenza test.
targetString: 美国当前有大约 18,000 套这样的设备，Abbott 预计会提高产量以便每天可以提供 50,000 次检测。台湾正在研发一种使用单克隆抗体（专门与新型冠状病毒的核衣壳蛋白（N 蛋白）结合）的检测方法，希望它能像快速流感检测一样在 15 至 20 分钟内提供检测结果。
en-mt: There are currently about 18,000 of these devices in the U.S., and Abbott expects to ramp up production to provide 50,000 tests per day. Taiwan is developing a test using a monoclonal antibody that specifically binds to the nucleocapsid protein (N protein) of the novel coronavirus, which it hopes will provide results in 15 to 20 minutes like a rapid flu test.

sourceString: A March 2020 literature review concluded that "chest radiographs are of little diagnostic value in early stages, whereas CT [computed tomography] findings may be present even before symptom onset."
targetString: 2020 年 3 月的一份文献综述得出了这样的结论，“在病毒早期阶段，胸片的诊断价值很小，而 CT [电脑断层扫描] 的表现可能会很明显，即使在症状出现前”
en-mt: A March 2020 literature review concluded that "in the early stages of the virus, chest radiographs are of little diagnostic value, whereas CT [computed tomography] findings may be evident even before symptoms appear"

sourceString: Typical features on CT include bilateral multilobar ground-glass opacificities with a peripheral, asymmetric and posterior distribution.
targetString: CT 的典型特征包括双肺多叶磨玻璃影，具有外周非对称和后部分布。
en-mt: Typical features on CT include bilateral multilobar ground-glass opacities with peripheral asymmetry and posterior distribution.

sourceString: Subpleural dominance, crazy paving and consolidation develop as the disease evolves.
targetString: 随着疾病进展，将发展出胸膜下显性、碎石路征和肺实变。
en-mt: As the disease progresses, subpleural dominance, lithotripsy road signs, and pulmonary consolidation will develop.

sourceString: A study comparing PCR to CT in Wuhan at the point of origin of the current pandemic has suggested that CT is significantly more sensitive than PCR, though less specific, with many of its imaging features overlapping with other pneumonias and disease processes.
targetString: 一项比较武汉（当前大流行病的最初爆发的地方）的 PCR 和 CT 的研究表明，CT 的敏感性比 PCR 高很多，但 CT 的精确度较低，它的许多影像学特点与其他肺炎和疾病重叠。
en-mt: A study comparing PCR and CT in Wuhan (where the current pandemic originated) showed that CT was much more sensitive than PCR but less accurate, and that many of its imaging features were similar to those of other pneumonia and Diseases overlap.

sourceString: As of March 2020, the American College of Radiology recommends that "CT should not be used to screen for or as a first-line test to diagnose COVID-19".As of March 2020, the CDC recommends PCR for initial screening.
targetString: 截至 2020 年 3 月，美国放射学会建议“CT 不应该用于筛查 COVID-19 或作为诊断 COVID-19 的一线检测工具”。自 2020 年 3 月开始，CDC 建议使用 PCR 进行初始筛查。
en-mt: As of March 2020, the American College of Radiology recommends that "CT should not be used to screen for COVID-19 or as a first-line test for diagnosing COVID-19." Beginning in March 2020, CDC recommends the use of PCR for initial screening.

sourceString: Part of the immune response to infection is the production of antibodies including IgM and IgG.
targetString: 对感染作出的部分免疫反应是产生抗体，包括 IgM 和 IgG。
en-mt: Part of the immune response to infection is the production of antibodies, including IgM and IgG.

sourceString: These can be used to detect infection in individuals starting 7 days or so after the onset of symptoms, to determine immunity, and in population surveillance.Assays can be performed in central laboratories (CLT) or by point-of-care testing (PoCT).
targetString: 这些抗体可用于检测症状开始后 7 天左右的个体感染情况，以确定受监测人群的免疫情况。测定可在中心实验室 (CLT) 或通过即时检测 (PoCT) 进行。
en-mt: These antibodies can be used to detect infection in individuals about 7 days after the onset of symptoms to determine the immunity status of the monitored population. Assays can be performed at a central laboratory (CLT) or by point-of-care testing (PoCT).

sourceString: The high-throughput automated systems in many clinical laboratories will be able to perform these assays but their availability will depend on the rate of production for each system.
targetString: 许多临床实验室中的高通量自动系统都能进行上述测定，但其可用性则取决于各个系统的生产率。
en-mt: High-throughput automated systems in many clinical laboratories are capable of performing these assays, but their availability depends on the throughput of each system.

sourceString: For CLT a single specimen of peripheral blood is commonly used, although serial specimens can be used to follow the immune response.
targetString: 对于 CLT，虽然可通过序列样本来追踪免疫反应，但它通常使用一份外周血样本进行测定。
en-mt: For CLT, it is usually measured using a peripheral blood sample, although serial samples can be used to track the immune response.

sourceString: For PoCT a single specimen of blood is usually obtained by skin puncture.
targetString: 对于 PoCT，一般情况下会采用皮肤穿刺获取一份血液样本。
en-mt: For PoCT, a blood sample is typically obtained using a skin puncture.

sourceString: Unlike PCR methods an extraction step is not needed before assay.On March 26, 2020, the FDA named 29 entities that provided notification to the agency as required and are now therefore able to distribute their antibody tests.
targetString: 测定前不需要执行提取步骤，这一点不同于 PCR 方法。2020 年 3 月 26 日，FDA 批准了 29 个实体申报的检测方法，这些实体现在能够分发其抗体检测试剂盒。
en-mt: Unlike PCR methods, no extraction step is required prior to the assay. On March 26, 2020, the FDA approved assays submitted by 29 entities that are now able to distribute their antibody test kits.

sourceString: As of April 7, 2020, only a single test has been approved by the FDA under an emergency use authorization.In late March 2020, Euroimmun Medical Laboratory Diagnostics and Epitope Diagnostics received European approvals for their test kits, which can detect IgG and IgA antibodies against the virus in blood samples.
targetString: 截至 2020 年 4 月 7 日，FDA 依据紧急使用授权仅批准了一项检测。2020 年 3 月下旬，欧蒙医学实验诊断股份公司和 Epitope Diagnostics 的检测试剂盒在欧洲获得了批准，这些试剂盒可针对血液样本中的病毒检测 IgG 和 IgA 抗体。
en-mt: As of April 7, 2020, FDA has approved only one test under Emergency Use Authorization. In late March 2020, Ommon Medical Laboratory Diagnostics AG and Epitope Diagnostics received approval in Europe for test kits that detect IgG and IgA antibodies against the virus in blood samples.

sourceString: The testing capacity is several hundred samples within hours and therefore much faster than the conventional PCR assay of viral RNA.
targetString: 检测能力为数小时内可检测数百个样本，因此，在测定病毒 RNA 上，比传统 PCR 测定速度快很多。
en-mt: The detection capacity is that hundreds of samples can be detected in several hours, therefore, it is much faster than traditional PCR assay in determining viral RNA.

sourceString: The antibodies are usually detectable 14 days after the onset of the infection.In early April, the UK found none of the antibody test kits it purchased were sufficiently good to use.
targetString: 一般情况下，在感染开始后的 14 天可以检测出抗体。四月初，英国发现在其购买的抗体检测试剂盒中，没有一种足够好用。
en-mt: Typically, antibodies are detectable 14 days after the onset of infection. In early April, the UK found that none of the antibody test kits it had purchased worked well enough.

sourceString: Hong Kong has set up a scheme where suspected patients can stay home, "emergency department will give a specimen tube to the patient", they spit into it, send it back and get a test result a while after.The British NHS has announced that it is piloting a scheme to test suspected cases at home, which removes the risk of a patient infecting others if they come to a hospital or having to disinfect an ambulance if one is used.In drive-through testing for COVID-19 for suspected cases, a healthcare professional takes sample using appropriate precautions.
targetString: 香港建立了一套疑似患者可以居家的机制，“急诊室给患者提供样本试管”，患者将唾液吐到试管里，然后将试管寄回，稍后便会收到结果。英国 NHS 宣布，它在试行一个居家检测疑似病例的方案，这样便可消除患者前往医院时感染其他人的风险，也可消除患者使用救护车后必须对救护车进行消毒的风险。在进行免下车检测 COVID-19 疑似病例时，医护专业人员可以采取适当的预防措施来提取样本。
en-mt: Hong Kong has established a mechanism for suspected patients to stay at home. "The emergency room provides patients with sample test tubes." The patient spits saliva into the test tube, then sends the test tube back, and the result will be received later. The NHS in England has announced that it is trialling a scheme to test suspected cases at home, which would eliminate the risk of patients infecting others when they go to hospital, or of having to sanitize ambulances after they have been used. When conducting drive-thru testing of suspected COVID-19 cases, healthcare professionals can take appropriate precautions to collect samples.

sourceString: Drive-through centers have helped South Korea do some of the fastest, most-extensive testing of any country.In Germany, the National Association of Statutory Health Insurance Physicians said on 2 March, that it had a capacity for about 12,000 tests per day in the ambulatory setting and 10.700 had been tested in the prior week.
targetString: 免下车检测中心已帮助韩国进行了比其他国家更快、最广泛的检测。在德国，全国法定健康保险医师协会在 3 月 2 日表示，非住院机构每天有能力进行大约 12,000 次检测，上一周已经检测了 10,700 次。
en-mt: Drive-through testing centers have helped South Korea conduct faster and most extensive testing than other countries. In Germany, the National Association of Physicians for Statutory Health Insurance said on March 2 that ambulatory facilities have the capacity to perform about 12,000 tests a day, having already done 10,700 in the previous week.

sourceString: Costs are borne by the health insurance when the test is ordered by a physician.
targetString: 如果是应医生要求进行检测，则费用由健康保险承担。
en-mt: If the test is ordered by a doctor, the cost is covered by health insurance.

sourceString: According to the president of the Robert Koch Institute, Germany has an overall capacity for 160,000 tests per week.
targetString: 德国罗伯特•科赫研究所 (Robert Koch Institute) 所长表示，德国每周的总检测能力是 160,000 份。
en-mt: Germany's total weekly testing capacity is 160,000, according to the head of Germany's Robert Koch Institute.

sourceString: As of 19 March drive in tests were offered in several large cities.
targetString: 截至 3 月 19 日，已在多个大城市提供免下车检测。
en-mt: As of March 19, drive-through testing has been offered in several major cities.

sourceString: As of 26 March 2020 the total number of tests performed in Germany was unknown, because only positive results are reported.
targetString: 截至 2020 年 3 月 26 日，在德国进行的总检测人数尚不知晓，因为只报告了检测结果为阳性的人数。
en-mt: As of 26 March 2020, the total number of people tested in Germany is not known, as only those who tested positive were reported.

sourceString: A first lab survey revealed that as of calendar week 12/2020 a total of at least 483,295 samples were tested up to and including week 12/2020 and 33,491 samples (6.9%) tested positive for SARS-CoV-2.In Israel, researchers at Technion and Rambam Hospital developed and tested a method for testing samples from 64 patients simultaneously, by pooling the samples and only testing further if the combined sample is found to be positive.In Wuhan a makeshift 2000-sq-meter emergency detection laboratory named "Huo-Yan" (Chinese: 火眼, or "Fire Eye" in English) was opened on 5 February 2020 by BGI, which can process over 10,000 samples a day.
targetString: 一项初期的实验室调查显示，截至 2020 年第 12 周，至少一共检测了 483,295 个样本（包括 2020 年第 12 周在内），检测出 33,491 个样本 (6.9%) SARS-CoV-2 呈阳性。在以色列，Technion 和 Rambam 医院的研究人员研制并测试了一个用于同时检测 64 名患者样本的方法，即汇总样本，并仅在合并的样本被发现为阳性时才进行进一步检测。在武汉，华大基因 (BGI) 临时建立了一个名为“火眼”的 2000 平米紧急检测实验室，于 2020 年 2 月 5 日投入使用，每天可以处理 10,000 多个样本。
en-mt: An initial laboratory survey of at least 483,295 specimens tested up to and including Week 12, 2020 found 33,491 specimens (6.9%) positive for SARS-CoV-2 through Week 12, 2020 . In Israel, researchers at the Technion and Rambam Hospital developed and tested a method for testing 64 patient samples simultaneously, by pooling the samples and conducting further testing only if the pooled samples were found to be positive. In Wuhan, BGI temporarily established a 2,000-square-meter emergency testing laboratory called "Huoyan", which was put into use on February 5, 2020, and can process more than 10,000 samples per day.

sourceString: With the construction overseen by BGI-founder Wang Jian and taking 5-days, modelling has show cases in Hubei would have been 47% higher and the corresponding cost of the tackling the quarantine would have doubled if this testing capacity hadn't come on line.
targetString: 该实验室在华大基因创始人汪建监督下 5 天建成，建模显示出，若不是达到了上述检测能力，湖北的病例会高出 47%，而相应的处理隔离费用也会翻倍。
en-mt: The laboratory was built in 5 days under the supervision of Wang Jian, the founder of BGI. Modeling shows that if the above-mentioned detection capacity had not been achieved, the number of cases in Hubei would have been 47% higher, and the corresponding processing and isolation costs would have doubled.

sourceString: The Wuhan Laboratory has been promptly followed by Huo-Yan labs in Shenzhen, Tianjin, Beijing, and Shanghai, in a total of 12 cities across China.
targetString: 继武汉实验室之后，深圳、天津、北京和上海立即相继建立了火眼实验室，目前中国共有 12 个城市建立了该实验室。
en-mt: Following the Wuhan laboratory, Shenzhen, Tianjin, Beijing, and Shanghai immediately established Huoyan laboratories. Currently, 12 cities in China have established such laboratories.

sourceString: By 4 March 2020 the daily throughput totals were 50,000 tests per day.Open source, multiplexed designs released by Origami Assays have been released that can test as many as 1122 patient samples for COVID19 using only 93 assays .  These balanced designs can be run in small laboratories without the need for robotic liquid handlers.
targetString: 到 2020 年 3 月 4 日，实验室检测日通量总计为每日 50,000 份。Origami Assays 发布的开源、多路设计，仅通过 93 次测定就可对多达 1122 个患者样本进行 COVID19 检测。这些均衡的设计可在小型实验室中运行，无需自动移液器。
en-mt: As of March 4, 2020, the total laboratory throughput is 50,000 tests per day. The open-source, multiplexed design released by Origami Assays enables the detection of COVID19 on up to 1122 patient samples with only 93 assays. These well-balanced designs can be run in small laboratories without the need for automatic pipettes.

sourceString: By March, shortages and insufficient amounts of reagent has become a bottleneck for mass testing in the EU and UK and the US.
targetString: 截至 3 月，试剂短缺和数量不足已成为在欧盟、英国和美国进行大规模检测的障碍。
en-mt: As of March, shortages and insufficient quantities of reagents had become obstacles to large-scale testing in the European Union, the United Kingdom and the United States.

sourceString: This has led some authors to explore sample preparation protocols that involve heating samples at 98 °C (208 °F) for 5 minutes to release RNA genomes for further testing.On 31 March it was announced United Arab Emirates was now testing more of its population for Coronavirus per head than any other country, and was on track to scale up the level of testing to reach the bulk of the population.
targetString: 这导致一些发起人探索样本制备方案，其涉及将样本加热到 98 °C (208 °F) 达到 5 分钟，以释放 RNA 基因组进行进一步检测。阿拉伯联合酋长国在 3 月 31 日宣布，现在已对其更多人口进行了新冠病毒检测，检测人数多于任何其他国家，并且正在扩大检测水平，以让大量民众接受检测。
en-mt: This has led some sponsors to explore sample preparation protocols that involve heating samples to 98 °C (208 °F) for 5 minutes to release the RNA genome for further testing. The United Arab Emirates announced on March 31 that it had now tested more of its population for the coronavirus than any other country, and was scaling up testing to allow large numbers of people to be tested.

sourceString: This was through a combination of drive-through capability, and purchasing a population-scale mass-throughput laboratory from Group 42 and BGI (based on their "Huo-Yan" emergency detection laboratories in China).
targetString: 实现这一检测能力的方法在于，一方面使用免下车 (drive-through) 检测，另一方面向 Group 42 和华大基因（基于其在中国的“火眼”紧急检测实验室）出资建立应对大规模人群检测需求的高通量实验室。
en-mt: The way to achieve this testing capability is to use drive-through testing on the one hand, and to invest in Group 42 and BGI (based on its "Huoyan" emergency testing laboratory in China) to build a response to large-scale testing. High-throughput laboratories for large-scale population testing needs.

sourceString: Constructed in 14 days, the lab is capable of conducting tens of thousands RT-PCR tests per day and is the first in the world of this scale to be operational outside of China.
targetString: 该实验室在 14 天内建成，每天能够进行数以万计的 RT-PCR 检测，是世界上第一个在中国境外运营的如此规模的实验室。
en-mt: The laboratory was built in 14 days, capable of performing tens of thousands of RT-PCR tests per day, and is the first laboratory of this scale operating outside of China in the world.

sourceString: Different testing recipes targeting different parts of the coronavirus genetic profile were developed in China, France, Germany, Hong Kong, Japan, and the United States.
targetString: 中国、法国、德国、中国香港、日本和美国都开发出了针对冠状病毒基因图谱各个部分的不同检测方法。
en-mt: China, France, Germany, Hong Kong, Japan and the United States have all developed different tests for various parts of the coronavirus' genetic map.

sourceString: The World Health Organization adopted the German recipe for manufacturing kits sent to low-income countries without the resources to develop their own.
targetString: 世界卫生组织采纳了德国生产检测试剂盒的方法，为没有资源开发自己的试剂盒的低收入国家寄送试剂盒。
en-mt: The World Health Organization has adopted Germany's approach to producing test kits, sending them to low-income countries that don't have the resources to develop their own.

sourceString: The German recipe was published on 17 January 2020; the protocol developed by the United States Centers for Disease Control was not available until 28 January, delaying available tests in the U.S.China and the United States had problems with the reliability of test kits early in the outbreak, and these countries and Australia were unable to supply enough kits to satisfy demand and recommendations for testing by health experts.
targetString: 德国的方法已在 2020 年 1 月 17 日公布；美国疾病控制与预防中心制定的方案在 1 月 28 日后方可使用，从而限制了美国的检测能力。中国和美国在爆发早期都遇到了检测试剂盒可靠性的问题，这两个国家和澳大利亚无法提供足够的检测盒来满足需求和健康专家提出的检测建议。
en-mt: The German method was published on January 17, 2020; the protocol developed by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention was not available until January 28, limiting US testing capacity. Both China and the United States had problems with the reliability of testing kits early in their outbreaks, with the two countries and Australia unable to provide enough tests to meet demand and testing recommendations from health experts.

sourceString: In contrast, experts say South Korea's broad availability of testing helped reduce the spread of the novel coronavirus.
targetString: 与此相反的是，专家认为韩国的广泛检测对减少新型冠状病毒的传播很有帮助。
en-mt: In contrast, experts believe South Korea's widespread testing has been helpful in reducing the spread of the novel coronavirus.

sourceString: Testing capacity, largely in private sector labs, was built up over several years by the South Korean government.
targetString: 得益于韩国政府在过去几年里建立起来的检测能力，其主要集中在私营部门的实验室中。
en-mt: Thanks to the testing capacity that the South Korean government has built up over the past few years, it is largely concentrated in private-sector laboratories.

sourceString: On 16 March, the World Health Organization called for ramping up the testing programmes as the best way to slow the advance of COVID-19 pandemic.High demand for testing due to wide spread of the virus caused backlogs of hundreds of thousands of tests at private U.S. labs, and supplies of swabs and chemical reagents became strained.
targetString: 3 月 16 日，世界卫生组织号召增加检测方案，作为减缓 COVID-19 流行病发展的最佳方法。病毒广泛传播导致对检测的需求非常大，这致使美国私人实验室积压了数十万份检测，且拭子和化学试剂的供应也开始变得紧张。
en-mt: On March 16, the World Health Organization called for increased testing programs as the best way to slow the development of the COVID-19 epidemic. The widespread spread of the virus has created such a high demand for tests that private U.S. labs have backlogged hundreds of thousands of tests and supplies of swabs and chemicals are strained.

sourceString: In March 2020 China reported problems with accuracy in their test kits.
targetString: 2020 年 3 月，中国报告了其检测试剂盒的准确性问题。
en-mt: In March 2020, China reported problems with the accuracy of its test kits.

sourceString: In the United States, the test kits developed by the CDC had "flaws;" the government then removed the bureaucratic barriers that had prevented private testing.Spain purchased test kits from Chinese firm  Shenzhen Bioeasy Biotechnology Co Ltd, but found that results were inaccurate.
targetString: 在美国， 由 CDC 研制的检测试剂盒具有“缺陷”；随后，政府消除了阻碍私人实验室检测的官僚主义障碍。西班牙从中国公司深圳易瑞生物技术有限公司购买了检测盒，发现检测结果不准确。
en-mt: In the US, a test kit developed by the CDC was "flawed"; the government subsequently removed bureaucratic barriers that prevented private labs from testing. Spain purchased test kits from the Chinese company Shenzhen Yirui Biotechnology Co., Ltd. and found that the test results were inaccurate.

sourceString: The firm explained that the incorrect results may be a result of a failure to collect samples or use the kits correctly.
targetString: 该公司解释说，检测结果不准确可能是未正确收集样本或错误地使用检测试剂盒所导致。
en-mt: The company explained that inaccurate test results could be the result of incorrect collection of samples or incorrect use of test kits.

sourceString: The Spanish ministry said it will withdraw the kits that returned incorrect results, and would replace them with a different testing kit provided by Shenzhen Bioeasy.80% of test kits the Czech Republic purchased from China gave wrong results.Slovakia purchased 1.2 million test kits from China which were found to be inaccurate.
targetString: 西班牙内阁表示，将回收返回错误结果的试剂盒，并替换成深圳易瑞生物 (Shenzhen Bioeasy) 提供的另外一种试剂盒。捷克共和国从中国购买的测试盒中有 80% 检测结果不正确。斯洛伐克从中国购买了 120 万个测试盒，结果发现不准确。
en-mt: The Spanish cabinet said it would recall the kits that returned false results and replace them with another kit provided by Shenzhen Bioeasy. 80% of test kits purchased by the Czech Republic from China gave incorrect results. Slovakia bought 1.2 million test kits from China, which turned out to be inaccurate.

sourceString: Prime Minister Matovič suggested these be dumped into the Danube.Ateş Kara of the Turkish Health Ministry said the test kits Turkey purchased from China had a "high error rate" and did not "put them into use."The UK purchased 3.5 million test kits from China but in early April 2020 announced these were not usable.
targetString: 首相 Matovič 建议这些检测盒应该被扔进多瑙河。土耳其卫生部的 Ateş Kara 表示，土耳其从中国购买的检测盒“错误率很高”，并且没有“将它们投入使用”。英国从中国购买了 350 万个检测盒，在 2020 年四月宣布这些检测盒无法使用。
en-mt: Prime Minister Matovič suggested that the test kits should be thrown into the Danube. Turkey's Health Ministry's Ateş Kara said the test kits Turkey bought from China had a "high error rate" and had not "put them to use". The UK purchased 3.5 million test kits from China and declared them unusable in April 2020.

sourceString: Testing, followed with quarantine of those who tested positive and tracing of those with whom the SARS-CoV-2 positive people had had contact, resulted in positive outcomes.
targetString: 进行检测，并对检测结果呈阳性的人员进行隔离并追踪 SARS-CoV-2 阳性人员的接触史，可获得积极效果。
en-mt: Testing, quarantining those who test positive and tracing the contacts of people who are positive for SARS-CoV-2 can have a positive effect.

sourceString: Researchers working in the Italian town of Vò, the site of the first COVID-19 death in Italy, conducted two rounds of testing on the entire population of about 3,400 people, about ten days apart.
targetString: 在意大利 Vò 市（意大利首例 COVID-19 患者死亡地）工作的研究人员，对总共约 3,400 人的群体进行了两轮检测，每轮相隔约十天。
en-mt: Researchers working in the city of Vò, Italy, where the first Italian COVID-19 patient died, conducted two rounds of testing on a group of about 3,400 people in total, each about ten days apart.

sourceString: About half the people testing positive had no symptoms, and all discovered cases were quarantined.
targetString: 其中约一半的人检测出阳性且无症状，所有发现的病例均已隔离。
en-mt: About half of them tested positive and were asymptomatic, and all detected cases have been isolated.

sourceString: With travel to the commune restricted, this eliminated new infections completely.
targetString: 通过对社区采取了出行限制，从而完全消除了新发感染。
en-mt: New infections were completely eliminated by imposing travel restrictions on the community.

sourceString: With aggressive contact tracing, inbound travel restrictions, testing, and quarantining, the 2020 coronavirus pandemic in Singapore has proceeded much more slowly than in other developed countries, but without extreme restrictions like forced closure of restaurants and retail establishments.
targetString: 通过大规模追踪接触者、限制入境旅行、检测和进行隔离，2020 冠状病毒在新加坡的传染速度远远慢于其他发达国家/地区，而且新加坡没有采取极端限制措施，例如，强制关闭餐馆和零售场所。
en-mt: Through mass contact tracing, inbound travel restrictions, testing, and quarantines, the spread of COVID-19 in Singapore has been much slower than in other developed countries, and Singapore has not resorted to extreme restrictive measures, such as mandatory closures of restaurants and retail establishments .

sourceString: Many events have been cancelled, and Singapore did start advising residents to stay at home on 28 March, but schools reopened on time after holiday break on 23 March.
targetString: 新加坡取消了许多活动，3 月 28 日开始建议居民留在家中，但学校在假期后于 3 月 23 日准时复课。
en-mt: Singapore canceled many events and began advising residents to stay home on March 28, but schools resumed on time on March 23 after the holiday.

sourceString: Several other countries have also managed the pandemic with aggressive contact tracing, inbound travel restrictions, testing, and quarantining, but with less aggressive lock-downs, such as Iceland and South Korea.
targetString: 爱尔兰和韩国等其他几个国家/地区也通过大规模追踪接触者、限制入境旅行、检测和隔离以及不太激进的封锁措施控制住了疾病的大规模流行。
en-mt: Several other countries, such as Ireland and South Korea, have also contained large-scale epidemics through mass contact tracing, restrictions on inbound travel, testing and isolation, and less aggressive lockdowns.

sourceString: A statistical study has found that countries that have tested more, relative to the number of deaths, have much lower case fatality rates, probably because these countries are better able to detect those with only mild or no symptoms.
targetString: 一项统计研究发现，相对于死亡人数，检测数量越多的国家，其病例死亡率也越低，原因可能是这些国家能够更好地检测只有轻微症状或无症状的群体。
en-mt: A statistical study found that countries with more tests relative to deaths had lower case fatalities, possibly because they were better able to test groups with only mild or no symptoms.

sourceString: WHO recommends that countries that do not have testing capacity and national laboratories with limited experience on COVID-19 send their first five positives and the first ten negative COVID-19 samples to one of the 16 WHO reference laboratories for confirmatory testing.
targetString: WHO 建议没有检测能力且国家级实验室处理 COVID-19 经验有限的国家，将他们的前五个呈阳性和前十个呈阴性的 COVID-19 样本，寄往 16 个 WHO 参比实验室中的其中一个进行确认检测。
en-mt: WHO recommends that countries with no testing capacity and national laboratories with limited experience handling COVID-19 send their first five positive and first ten negative COVID-19 samples to one of the 16 WHO reference laboratories. One of them performs a confirmatory test.

sourceString: Out of the 16 reference laboratories, 7 are in Asia, 5 in Europe, 2 in Africa, 1 in North America and 1 in Australia.
targetString: 在这 16 个参比实验室中，其中 7 个位于亚洲 、5 个位于欧洲、2 个位于非洲、1 个位于北美、1 个位于澳大利亚。
en-mt: Of these 16 reference laboratories, 7 are located in Asia, 5 in Europe, 2 in Africa, 1 in North America, and 1 in Australia.

sourceString: In the following chart, the column “Positive as % of tests” is influenced by the country's testing policy.
targetString: 在以下图表中，“检测呈阳性%”列受所在国家检测政策的影响。
en-mt: In the chart below, the "% Tested Positive" column is influenced by the country's testing policy.

sourceString: A country that only tests people admitted to hospitals will have a higher positive as % of tests than a country that tests all citizens, whether or not they are showing symptoms, other things being equal.
targetString: 在其他条件相同情况下，与检测所有公民（无论是否显现出症状）的国家相比，仅检测住院人员的国家，其阳性检出率较高。
en-mt: Other things being equal, countries that tested only hospitalized people had a higher rate of positivity than countries that tested all citizens, whether or not they showed symptoms.

sourceString: Hand washing (or handwashing), also known as hand hygiene, is the act of cleaning one's hands for the purpose of removing soil, grease, microorganisms, or other unwanted substances.
targetString: 洗手，也称为手部清洁，是为了清除手上的尘土、油脂、微生物或其他无用物质而清洁手部的行为。
en-mt: Washing hands, also known as hand cleaning, is the act of cleaning hands to remove dust, grease, microorganisms or other useless substances from hands.

sourceString: Hand washing with soap consistently at certain "critical moments" during the day prevents the spread of many diseases, for example diarrhoea and cholera, which are transmitted through fecal–oral route.
targetString: 在每天的某些“关键时刻”坚持用肥皂洗手可防止许多疾病的传播，例如腹泻和霍乱，这些疾病都可通过粪–口途径传播。
en-mt: Regular handwashing with soap and water at certain "critical times" of the day can prevent the spread of many diseases, such as diarrhea and cholera, which can be spread by the fecal-oral route.

sourceString: People can also become infected with respiratory diseases such as influenza or the common cold, for example, if they do not wash their hands before touching their eyes, nose, or mouth (i.e., mucous membranes).
targetString: 如果人们在接触自己的眼睛、鼻子或嘴（即粘膜）之前没有洗手，还可能会感染呼吸系统疾病，例如，流感或普通感冒。
en-mt: People can also catch respiratory illnesses, such as the flu or the common cold, if they don't wash their hands before touching their eyes, nose, or mouth (i.e. mucous membranes).

sourceString: The five critical moments during the day where washing hands with soap is important include: before and after defecation, after cleaning a child's bottom or changing nappies, before feeding a child, before eating and before and after preparing food or handling raw meat, fish, or poultry.
targetString: 一天中务必用肥皂洗手的五个关键时刻：排便前后、清洁孩童的臀部或换尿片后、给孩子喂食前、饭前以及处理食物前后或处理生肉、鱼或禽肉前后。
en-mt: Five key times of the day to always wash your hands with soap: before and after a bowel movement, after cleaning a child's bottom or changing a diaper, before feeding a child, before meals, and before and after handling food or handling raw meat, fish or poultry.

sourceString: If water and soap are not available, hands can be cleaned with ash.The World Health Organization recommends washing hands:
targetString: 如果没有肥皂和水，可以用草木灰清洁手部。世界卫生组织建议在下列情况下洗手：
en-mt: If soap and water are not available, plant ash can be used to clean hands. The World Health Organization recommends washing hands when:

sourceString: Before, during, and after preparing food.
targetString: 准备食物之前、过程中以及之后。
en-mt: Before, during and after preparing food.

sourceString: Before and after caring for a sick person.
targetString: 照顾病人前后。
en-mt: Caring for patients before and after.

sourceString: After changing the diapers or cleaning up a child who has used the toilet.
targetString: 更换尿布或清洁如厕孩童的臀部后。
en-mt: After changing a diaper or cleaning the bottom of a child who uses the toilet.

sourceString: After blowing your nose, coughing or sneezing.
targetString: 擦鼻涕、咳嗽或打喷嚏后。
en-mt: After wiping your nose, coughing or sneezing.

sourceString: After touching animal, animal feed, or animal waste.
targetString: 触摸动物、动物食物或动物粪便后。
en-mt: After touching animals, animal food, or animal waste.

sourceString: Medical hand hygiene refers to hygiene practices related to medical procedures.
targetString: 医务人员手部卫生指的是与医疗程序有关的卫生习惯。
en-mt: Healthcare worker hand hygiene refers to hygienic practices associated with medical procedures.

sourceString: Hand washing before administering medicine or medical care can prevent or minimize the spread of disease.
targetString: 在发药或进行医疗护理前洗手，可防止或最大限度减少疾病的传播。
en-mt: Washing your hands before dispensing medicine or giving medical care can prevent or minimize the spread of disease.

sourceString: The main medical purpose of washing hands is to cleanse the hands of pathogens (bacteria, viruses, or other microorganisms that can cause disease) and chemicals which can cause harm or diseases.
targetString: 在医疗领域，洗手的主要目的是清除手上可能伤害人体或导致疾病的病原体（细菌、病毒或可引发疾病的其他微生物）及化学物质。
en-mt: In the medical field, the main purpose of hand washing is to remove pathogens (bacteria, viruses or other microorganisms that can cause disease) and chemicals that may harm the human body or cause disease.

sourceString: This is especially important for people who handle food or work in the medical field, but also an important practice for the general public.
targetString: 对于从事食品加工或在医疗领域工作的人来说，洗手尤其重要，但对于公众来说，洗手也是非常重要的做法。
en-mt: Hand washing is especially important for those who process food or work in the medical field, but it is also a very important practice for the general public.

sourceString: Hand washing has many health benefits, including minimizing the spread of influenza, coronavirus, and other infectious diseases; preventing infectious causes of diarrhea; decreasing respiratory infections;
targetString: 洗手对健康的益处很多，包括最大限度减少流感、冠状病毒和其他传染性疾病的传播；防止传染性腹泻；减少呼吸系统感染；
en-mt: The health benefits of handwashing are many, including minimizing the spread of flu, coronavirus, and other infectious diseases; preventing infectious diarrhea; reducing respiratory infections;

sourceString: and reducing infant mortality rate at home birth deliveries.
targetString: 以及降低在家中接生时的婴儿死亡率。
en-mt: and a reduction in infant mortality during home delivery.

sourceString: A 2013 study showed that improved hand washing practices may lead to small improvements in the length growth in children under five years of age.
targetString: 2013 年的一项研究表明，改善洗手习惯对五岁以下儿童的身高增加有略微的促进作用。
en-mt: A 2013 study showed that improving handwashing habits had a modest boost to height gains in children under five.

sourceString: In developing countries, childhood mortality rates related to respiratory and diarrheal diseases can be reduced by introducing simple behavioral changes, such as hand washing with soap.
targetString: 在发展中国家，通过倡导简单的行为改变（例如，用肥皂洗手），就可减少与呼吸系统和腹泻疾病有关的儿童死亡率。
en-mt: In developing countries, child mortality from respiratory and diarrheal diseases can be reduced by promoting simple behavioral changes, such as washing hands with soap.

sourceString: This simple action can reduce the rate of mortality from these diseases by almost 50%.
targetString: 这一简单的行为可将上述疾病的致死率降低近 50%。
en-mt: This simple act can reduce the death rate from the above diseases by almost 50%.

sourceString: Interventions that promote hand washing can reduce diarrhoea episodes by about a third, and this is comparable to providing clean water in low income areas.
targetString: 倡导洗手这一干预方式可降低约三分之一腹泻事件的发生，其效果相当于在低收入地区提供清洁水源。
en-mt: An intervention that promotes handwashing can reduce the incidence of diarrhea by about one-third, which is equivalent to providing clean water in low-income settings.

sourceString: 48% of reductions in diarrhoea episodes can be associated with hand washing with soap.Hand washing with soap is the single most effective and inexpensive way to prevent diarrhea and acute respiratory infections (ARI), as automatic behavior performed in homes, schools, and communities worldwide.
targetString: 用肥皂洗手可将腹泻事件减少 48%。作为在世界各地的家庭、学校和社区进行的自发行为，用肥皂洗手是预防腹泻和急性呼吸道感染 (Acute Respiratory Infections, ARI) 的最有效和最廉价方法。
en-mt: Washing hands with soap can reduce diarrheal episodes by 48%. Handwashing with soap is the most effective and cheapest way to prevent diarrhea and acute respiratory infections (ARIs) as a spontaneous act performed in homes, schools, and communities around the world.

sourceString: Pneumonia, a major ARI, is the number one cause of mortality among children under five years old, taking the lives of an estimated 1.8 million children per year.
targetString: 肺炎作为一种主要的急性呼吸道感染，是导致五岁以下儿童死亡的首要原因，肺炎每年都会夺走大约 180 万儿童的生命。
en-mt: Pneumonia, a major acute respiratory infection and the leading cause of death in children under five, kills approximately 1.8 million children each year.

sourceString: Diarrhea and pneumonia together account for almost 3.5 million child deaths annually.
targetString: 腹泻和肺炎每年总共造成近 350 万儿童死亡。
en-mt: Together, diarrhea and pneumonia kill nearly 3.5 million children each year.

sourceString: According to UNICEF, turning hand washing with soap before eating and after using the toilet into an ingrained habit can save more lives than any single vaccine or medical intervention, cutting deaths from diarrhea by almost half and deaths from acute respiratory infections by one-quarter.
targetString: 联合国儿童基金会表示，与任何单一的疫苗或医疗干预相比，让饭前和如厕后用肥皂洗手变成根深蒂固的习惯能拯救更多的生命，可将腹泻导致的死亡减少近一半，将急性呼吸系统感染导致的死亡减少四分之一。
en-mt: Making handwashing with soap ingrained before meals and after going to the toilet would save more lives than any single vaccine or medical intervention, cut deaths from diarrhea by almost half and cut Deaths from acute respiratory infections are cut by a quarter.

sourceString: Hand washing is usually integrated together with other sanitation interventions as part of water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) programmes.
targetString: 作为供水、环境卫生和个人卫生 (WASH) 项目的一部分，在倡导洗手的同时，通常还会采取其他卫生干预措施。
en-mt: The promotion of handwashing is often accompanied by other hygiene interventions as part of water supply, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) programmes.

sourceString: Hand washing also protects against impetigo which is transmitted through direct physical contact.
targetString: 洗手还可以预防通过直接身体接触传播的脓疱病。
en-mt: Washing your hands also prevents impetigo, which is spread through direct physical contact.

sourceString: A small detrimental effect of hand washing is that frequent hand washing can lead to skin damage due to drying of the skin.
targetString: 洗手会带来一个轻微的不利影响，即频繁洗手会导致皮肤干燥，从而引起皮肤损伤。
en-mt: There is a slight downside to handwashing, which is that frequent handwashing can dry out the skin, which can cause skin damage.

sourceString: A 2012 Danish study found that excessive hand washing can lead to an itchy, flaky skin condition known as hand eczema or hand dermatitis, which is especially common among health-care workers.
targetString: 2012 年丹麦的一项研究发现，过度洗手会导致皮肤发痒、皲裂，称为手部湿疹或手部皮炎，这在医护工作人员中尤为普遍。
en-mt: A 2012 Danish study found that excessive handwashing can lead to itchy, chapped skin called hand eczema or hand dermatitis, which is especially prevalent among healthcare workers.

sourceString: Too frequent hand washing is also seen as one of the symptoms of obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD).
targetString: 过度频繁洗手也被视作强迫症 (OCD) 的症状之一。
en-mt: Excessive handwashing is also seen as a symptom of obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD).

sourceString: There are five critical times during the day where washing hands with soap is important to reduce fecal-oral transmission of disease: after using the bathroom (urination, defecation), after cleaning a child's bottom (changing nappies), before feeding a child, before eating and before/after preparing food or handling raw meat, fish, or poultry.
targetString: 为减少疾病的粪-口传播，一天中务必用肥皂洗手的五个关键时刻：如厕（排尿、排便）后、清洁孩童的臀部（更换尿片）后、给孩子喂食前、饭前以及处理食物前后或处理生肉、鱼或生禽肉后。
en-mt: To reduce fecal-oral transmission of disease, wash your hands with soap at five key times of the day: after using the toilet (urinating, defecating), after cleaning a child’s bottom (diaper changing), before feeding a child, before meals, and after handling Before or after food or after handling raw meat, fish, or raw poultry.

sourceString: Other occasions when correct handwashing technique should be practiced in order to prevent the transmission of disease include before and after treating a cut or wound; after sneezing, coughing, or blowing your nose; after touching animal waste or handling animals; and after touching garbage.
targetString: 为防止疾病传播，在以下情形中也应采用正确的方式洗手：处理切口或伤口前后；打喷嚏、咳嗽或擦鼻涕后；触摸动物粪便或处理动物后；以及碰触垃圾后。
en-mt: To prevent the spread of disease, proper hand washing should also be practiced: before and after handling cuts or wounds; after sneezing, coughing, or wiping your nose; after touching animal droppings or handling animals; and after touching garbage.

sourceString: In many countries, there is a low rate of hand washing with soap.
targetString: 在许多国家/地区，用肥皂洗手的比例很低。
en-mt: Washing hands with soap is low in many countries.

sourceString: A study of hand washing in 54 countries in 2015 found that on average, 38.7% of households practiced hand washing with soap.A 2014 study showed that Saudi Arabia had the highest rate of 97 percent; the United States near the middle with 77 percent; and China with the lowest rate of 23 percent.Several behaviour change methodologies now exist to increase uptake of the behaviour of hand washing with soap at the critical times.Group hand washing for school children at set times of the day is one option in developing countries to engrain hand washing in children's behaviors.
targetString: 在2015 年针对 54 个国家洗手情况的一项研究发现，平均 38.7% 的家庭有用肥皂洗手的习惯。2014 年的一项研究显示，沙特阿拉伯的比例最高，达到 97%；美国接近平均值，即 77%；中国比例最低，为 23%。现在，为倡导在关键时刻用肥皂洗手的行为，落实了多个改变行为的方法。为使儿童养成洗手习惯，发展中国家可选择让在校儿童每天定点集体洗手。
en-mt: A 2015 study of handwashing in 54 countries found that an average of 38.7% of households used soap to wash their hands. A 2014 study showed that Saudi Arabia had the highest percentage at 97 percent; the U.S. was closer to the average at 77 percent; and China had the lowest percentage at 23 percent. Now, multiple behavioral change methods are in place to promote handwashing with soap at critical moments. In order to make children develop the habit of washing hands, developing countries can choose to let school children wash their hands collectively at designated points every day.

sourceString: The "Essential Health Care Program" implemented by the Department of Education in the Philippines is an example of at scale action to promote children's health and education.
targetString: 菲律宾教育部推行的“基本卫生保健计划”就是采取大规模举措的一个典范，以增进儿童的健康和学业。
en-mt: The Basic Health Care Program of the Philippine Department of Education is an example of a large-scale initiative to improve children's health and schooling.

sourceString: Deworming twice a year, supplemented with washing hands daily with soap, brushing teeth daily with fluoride, is at the core of this national program.
targetString: 这一国家计划的核心是每年驱虫两次，辅以每天用肥皂洗手和用含氟牙膏刷牙。
en-mt: At the heart of this national program is deworming twice a year, complemented by daily handwashing with soap and toothbrushing with fluoride toothpaste.

sourceString: It has also been successfully implemented in Indonesia.
targetString: 在印度尼西亚，这一计划也获得了成功推行。
en-mt: In Indonesia, this program has also been successfully implemented.

sourceString: Removal of microorganisms from skin is enhanced by the addition of soaps or detergents to water.
targetString: 水中融入肥皂或清洁剂，可以更好地清除皮肤上的微生物。
en-mt: Soap or cleansers mixed into the water can better remove microbes from the skin.

sourceString: The main action of soaps and detergents is to reduce barriers to solution, and increase solubility.
targetString: 肥皂和清洁剂的主要作用是减少溶解阻碍并提高可溶性。
en-mt: The main role of soaps and detergents is to reduce dissolution barriers and improve solubility.

sourceString: Water alone is an inefficient skin cleanser because fats and proteins, which are components of organic soil, are not readily dissolved in water.
targetString: 仅使用水无法有效清洁皮肤，因为脂肪和蛋白质（有机土壤的组成部分）不易溶解于水中。
en-mt: Water alone won't cleanse the skin effectively because fats and proteins (the building blocks of organic soil) don't dissolve easily in water.

sourceString: Cleansing is, however, aided by a reasonable flow of water..
targetString: 但是，清洁洗手需要合理用水……
en-mt: But clean handwashing requires sensible water…

sourceString: Solid soap, because of its reusable nature, may hold bacteria acquired from previous uses.
targetString: 固体肥皂由于可以重复使用，可能会存留以前使用时留下的细菌。
en-mt: Since solid soaps are reusable, they may harbor bacteria from previous uses.

sourceString: A small number of studies which have looked at the bacterial transfer from contaminated solid soap have concluded transfer is unlikely as the bacteria are rinsed off with the foam.
targetString: 有少量研究调查了细菌从受污染的固体肥皂转移的情况，得出的结论是，细菌无法转移，因为细菌会被泡沫洗掉。
en-mt: A small number of studies have investigated the transfer of bacteria from contaminated bar soaps and concluded that the bacteria cannot be transferred because the bacteria are washed away by the suds.

sourceString: The CDC still states "liquid soap with hands-free controls for dispensing is preferable".
targetString: 但 CDC 仍声称“最好选用非接触式液体肥皂“。
en-mt: But the CDC still states that "no-touch liquid soap is best."

sourceString: Antibacterial soaps have been heavily promoted to a health-conscious public.
targetString: 抗菌皂已在有健康意识的大众中得到大力推广。
en-mt: Antibacterial soaps have been heavily promoted among the health conscious public.

sourceString: To date, there is no evidence that using recommended antiseptics or disinfectants selects for antibiotic-resistant organisms in nature.
targetString: 到目前为止，没有证据表明，使用推荐的抗菌剂或消毒剂选择了自然界中的抗生素耐药微生物。
en-mt: So far, there is no evidence that use of recommended antimicrobials or disinfectants selects for antibiotic-resistant microorganisms in nature.

sourceString: However, antibacterial soaps contain common antibacterial agents such as triclosan, which has an extensive list of resistant strains of organisms.
targetString: 不过，抗菌皂含有常见的三氯沙等抗菌剂，三氯沙具有大量耐药微生物菌株。
en-mt: However, antibacterial soaps contain antibacterial agents such as common triclosan, which has a large number of resistant microbial strains.

sourceString: So, even if antibiotic resistant strains aren't selected for by antibacterial soaps, they might not be as effective as they are marketed to be.
targetString: 因此，即使不是为了抗生素耐药性菌株而选择抗菌皂，抗菌皂可能也并非宣传的那么有效。
en-mt: So even if you're not choosing antimicrobial soaps for antibiotic-resistant strains, antibacterial soaps may not be as effective as advertised.

sourceString: Besides the surfactant and skin-protecting agent, the sophisticated formulations may contain acids (acetic acid, ascorbic acid, lactic acid) as pH regulator, antimicrobially active benzoic acid and further skin conditioners (aloe vera, vitamins, menthol, plant extracts).A comprehensive analysis from the University of Oregon School of Public Health indicated that plain soaps are as effective as consumer-grade anti-bacterial soaps containing triclosan in preventing illness and removing bacteria from the hands.
targetString: 除表面活性剂和护肤剂外，复杂的配方可能还含有作为 pH 值调节剂的酸（醋酸、抗坏血酸、乳酸）、抗菌活性苯甲酸，以及更多的皮肤调理剂（芦荟、维生素、薄荷醇、植物萃取物）。俄勒冈大学公共卫生学院进行的一项综合分析表明，在预防疾病和清除手上的细菌方面，普通肥皂与含三氯沙的消费品级抗菌皂的效果一样。
en-mt: In addition to surfactants and skin care agents, complex formulations may contain acids as pH adjusters (acetic, ascorbic, lactic), benzoic acids for antimicrobial activity, and more skin conditioning agents (aloe vera, vitamins, menthol, plant extracts). Plain soap is just as effective as consumer-grade antibacterial soap containing triclosan at preventing disease and removing germs from hands, according to a meta-analysis conducted by the University of Oregon School of Public Health.

sourceString: Hot water that is comfortable for washing hands is not hot enough to kill bacteria.
targetString: 热水洗手很舒适，但其热量不足以杀死细菌。
en-mt: Hot water is comfortable to wash your hands with, but it's not hot enough to kill germs.

sourceString: Bacteria grow much faster at body temperature (37 °C).
targetString: 细菌在身体温度 (37 °C) 下滋生很快。
en-mt: Bacteria grow rapidly at body temperature (37 °C).

sourceString: However, warm, soapy water is more effective than cold, soapy water at removing natural oils which hold soils and bacteria.
targetString: 但是，在清除含有土和细菌的天然油脂方面，温肥皂水比冷肥皂水更有效。
en-mt: However, warm soapy water is more effective than cold soapy water at removing natural oils that contain dirt and bacteria.

sourceString: Contrary to popular belief however, scientific studies have shown that using warm water has no effect on reducing the microbial load on hands.
targetString: 科学研究已证实，使用温水对减少手上的微生物没有效果，这与普遍的观点相反。
en-mt: Contrary to popular belief, scientific studies have confirmed that using warm water has no effect on reducing the microbes on your hands.

sourceString: A hand sanitizer or hand antiseptic is a non-water-based hand hygiene agent.
targetString: 免水洗手液或免洗杀菌洗手液属于非水基手部清洁剂。
en-mt: Hand sanitizers or hand sanitizers are non-water-based hand sanitizers.

sourceString: In the late 1990s and early part of the 21st century, alcohol rub non-water-based hand hygiene agents (also known as alcohol-based hand rubs, antiseptic hand rubs, or hand sanitizers) began to gain popularity.
targetString: 在二十世纪九十年代末和二十一世纪初，非水基的酒精手部清洁剂（也称为酒精搓手液、免洗杀菌搓手液或免洗洗手液）大受欢迎。
en-mt: In the late 1990s and early 2000s, non-water-based alcohol-based hand sanitizers (also known as alcohol-based handrubs, hand sanitizers, or hand sanitizers) gained in popularity.

sourceString: Most are based on isopropyl alcohol or ethanol formulated together with a thickening agent such as Carbomer (polymer of acrylic acid) into a gel, or a humectant such as glycerin into a liquid, or foam for ease of use and to decrease the drying effect of the alcohol.
targetString: 这类洗手液的配方大多都含有异丙醇或乙醇，再加入卡波姆（丙烯酸聚合物）等增稠剂形成凝胶，或加入甘油等保湿剂形成液体，或呈泡沫状以便易于使用，并缓解酒精导致的皮肤干燥。
en-mt: Most of these hand sanitizers are formulated with isopropyl alcohol or ethanol, and thickeners such as carbomer (acrylic acid polymer) are added to form a gel, humectants such as glycerin are added to form a liquid, or they are foamed for ease of application. And relieve dry skin caused by alcohol.

sourceString: Adding diluted hydrogen-peroxide increases further  the antimicrobial activity.Hand sanitizers containing a minimum of 60 to 95% alcohol are efficient germ killers.
targetString: 添加稀释后的过氧化氢可进一步增加抗菌活性。至少含有 60% 至 95% 酒精的免洗洗手液才可有效杀菌。
en-mt: Addition of diluted hydrogen peroxide further increased antimicrobial activity. Hand sanitizers that contain at least 60% to 95% alcohol are effective at killing germs.

sourceString: Alcohol rub sanitizers kill bacteria, multi-drug resistant bacteria (MRSA and VRE), tuberculosis, and some viruses (including HIV, herpes, RSV, rhinovirus, vaccinia, influenza, and hepatitis) and fungi.
targetString: 酒精搓手液可杀死细菌、多药耐药性细菌（耐甲氧西林金黄色葡萄球菌 (MRSA) 和抗万古霉素肠球菌 (VRE)）、结核病以及一些病毒（包括 HIV、疱疹、呼吸道合胞病毒 (RSV)、鼻病毒、牛痘、流感和肝炎）以及真菌。
en-mt: Alcohol-based hand sanitizers kill bacteria, multidrug-resistant bacteria (methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) and vancomycin-resistant enterococci (VRE) ), tuberculosis, and some viruses (including HIV, herpes, respiratory syncytial virus (RSV), rhinovirus, vaccinia, influenza, and hepatitis) and fungi.

sourceString: Alcohol rub sanitizers containing 70% alcohol kill 99.97% (3.5 log reduction, similar to 35 decibel reduction) of the bacteria on hands 30 seconds after application and 99.99% to 99.999% (4 to 5 log reduction) of the bacteria on hands 1 minute after application.Hand sanitizers are most effective against bacteria and less effective against some viruses.
targetString: 酒精含量 70% 的酒精搓手液使用 30 秒后，可杀死手上 99.97% 的细菌（减少了 3.5 个数量级，类似于减少了 35 分贝），搓手 1 分钟后可减少手上 99.99% 至 99.999%（4 至 5 个数量级）的细菌。免洗洗手液对细菌最有效，而对于一些病毒则效果略差。
en-mt: Alcohol-based handrub with 70% alcohol kills 99.97% of germs on hands after 30 seconds (3.5 orders of magnitude reduction, similar to a 35 decibel reduction) and 99.99% to 99.999% (4 to 5 orders of magnitude) bacteria. Hand sanitizers are most effective against bacteria and less effective against some viruses.

sourceString: Alcohol-based hand sanitizers are almost entirely ineffective against norovirus (or Norwalk) type viruses, the most common cause of contagious gastroenteritis.Enough hand antiseptic or alcohol rub must be used to thoroughly wet or cover both hands.
targetString: 酒精搓手液对诺如病毒(norovirus，又称诺瓦克，Norwalk) 之类的病毒（感染性胃肠炎的最常见病因）几乎完全没有效果。必须使用足够的免洗杀菌洗手液或酒精搓手液，以彻底湿润或覆盖双手。
en-mt: Alcohol-based hand sanitizers are almost completely ineffective against viruses like norovirus (or Norwalk), the most common cause of infectious gastroenteritis. Sufficient hand sanitizer or alcohol-based hand rub must be used to thoroughly wet or cover hands.

sourceString: The front and back of both hands and between and the ends of all fingers are rubbed for approximately 30 seconds until the liquid, foam or gel is dry.
targetString: 将手心和手背以及手指间和所有手指末端搓洗大约 30 秒，直至液体、泡沫或凝胶变干。
en-mt: Rub palms and backs of hands, between fingers and on all finger ends for about 30 seconds until liquid, foam or gel dries.

sourceString: Finger tips must be washed well too, rubbing them in both palms.The US Center for Disease Control and Prevention recommends hand washing over hand sanitizer rubs, particularly when hands are visibly dirty.
targetString: 指尖也必须充分清洗，在两个掌心上搓洗指尖。美国疾病控制与预防中心建议最好洗手，而不是使用免洗搓手液，特别是看上去手很脏时。
en-mt: The fingertips must also be washed well, rubbing the fingertips on both palms. The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommends washing your hands rather than using hand sanitizer, especially if your hands look dirty.

sourceString: The increasing use of these agents is based on their ease of use and rapid killing activity against micro-organisms; however, they should not serve as a replacement for proper hand washing unless soap and water are unavailable.
targetString: 由于这类搓手液易于使用并可快速使微生物失去活性，所以越来越多地得到使用；不过，它们不应替代正确洗手，除非没有肥皂和水可供使用。
en-mt: Such hand sanitizers are increasingly used because of their ease of application and rapid inactivation of microorganisms; however, they should not replace proper hand washing unless soap and water are not available.

sourceString: Frequent use of alcohol-based hand sanitizers can cause dry skin unless emollients and/or skin moisturizers are added to the formula.
targetString: 频繁使用酒精免洗洗手液会导致皮肤干燥，除非配方里添加了润肤剂和/或保湿剂。
en-mt: Frequent use of alcohol-based hand sanitizers can lead to dry skin unless emollients and/or moisturizers are added to the formula.

sourceString: The drying effect of alcohol can be reduced or eliminated by adding glycerin and/or other emollients to the formula.
targetString: 可向配方里添加甘油和/或其他润肤剂，以减少或消除酒精导致的皮肤干燥。
en-mt: Glycerin and/or other emollients can be added to the formula to reduce or eliminate alcohol-induced dryness.

sourceString: In clinical trials, alcohol-based hand sanitizers containing emollients caused substantially less skin irritation and dryness than soaps or antimicrobial detergents.
targetString: 在临床实验中，与肥皂或抗菌清洁剂相比，含有润肤剂的酒精免洗洗手液可明显减少皮肤刺激和皮肤干燥情况的发生。
en-mt: In clinical trials, alcohol-based hand sanitizers containing emollients significantly reduced skin irritation and dryness compared with soap or antibacterial cleansers.

sourceString: Allergic contact dermatitis, contact urticaria syndrome or hypersensitivity to alcohol or additives present in alcohol hand rubs rarely occur.
targetString: 过敏性接触皮肤炎、接触性荨麻疹综合征或对酒精或酒精搓手液中的添加剂过敏的情况很罕见。
en-mt: Rarely, allergic contact dermatitis, contact urticaria syndrome, or hypersensitivity to alcohol or additives in alcohol-based hand rubs.

sourceString: The lower tendency to induce irritant contact dermatitis became an attraction as compared to soap and water hand washing.
targetString: 与用肥皂和水洗手相比，酒精免洗洗手液诱发刺激性接触性皮炎的可能性较低，这是其具有吸引力的一个原因。
en-mt: Alcohol-based hand sanitizers are less likely to induce irritant contact dermatitis than handwashing with soap and water, which is one reason for their appeal.

sourceString: Despite their effectiveness, non-water agents do not cleanse the hands of organic material, but simply disinfect them.
targetString: 无水清洁剂虽然有效，但并不能去除手上的有机物质，只是将其消毒。
en-mt: Waterless cleaners, while effective, do not remove organic matter from hands, only sanitize them.

sourceString: It is for this reason that hand sanitizers are not as effective as soap and water at preventing the spread of many pathogens, since the pathogens still remain on the hands.
targetString: 因此，免洗洗手液在预防许多病原体的传播上效果不如肥皂和水，因为这些病原体依旧在手上。
en-mt: As a result, hand sanitizers are not as effective as soap and water at preventing the spread of many pathogens because those pathogens are still on the hands.

sourceString: Alcohol-free hand sanitizer efficacy is heavily dependent on the ingredients and formulation, and historically has significantly under-performed alcohol and alcohol rubs.
targetString: 无酒精免洗洗手液的功效很大程度上取决于成分和配方，其效果历来比酒精和酒精搓手液差很多。
en-mt: The efficacy of alcohol-free hand sanitizers depends largely on the ingredients and formulation, and has historically been much less effective than alcohol-based and alcohol-based hand sanitizers.

sourceString: More recently, formulations that use benzalkonium chloride have been shown to have persistent and cumulative antimicrobial activity after application, unlike alcohol, which has been shown to decrease in efficacy after repeated use, probably due to progressive adverse skin reactions.
targetString: 最近，使用苯扎氯铵的配方已被证实在使用后具有持续、累积性的抗菌活性，这一点与酒精不同，酒精已被证实在重复使用后效果会降低，可能是由于会逐渐引起不良的皮肤反应。
en-mt: More recently, formulations using benzalkonium chloride have been shown to have sustained, cumulative antimicrobial activity after use, unlike alcohol, which has been shown to be less effective after repeated use, possibly due to progressive adverse effects. skin reaction.

sourceString: Many people in low-income communities cannot afford soap and use ash or soil instead.
targetString: 低收入社区的许多人负担不起肥皂，可使用草木灰或土代替。
en-mt: Many people in low-income communities cannot afford soap and can use plant ash or earth instead.

sourceString: Ash or soil may be more effective than water alone, but may be less effective than soap.
targetString: 草木灰或土比单独用水洗手效果要好，但不如肥皂。
en-mt: Plant ashes or dirt are worse than water alone, but not as good as soap.

sourceString: One concern is that if the soil or ash is contaminated with microorganisms it may increase the spread of disease rather than decrease it.
targetString: 其中存在的一个问题是，如果土或草木灰受到微生物的污染，那么，可能会加速疾病的传播，而不是减缓传播。
en-mt: One problem with this is that if soil or plant ash becomes contaminated with microbes, it may accelerate the spread of the disease rather than slow it down.

sourceString: Like soap, ash is also a disinfecting agent because in contact with water, it forms an alkaline solution.
targetString: 与肥皂一样，草木灰也是一种消毒剂，因为它遇水后会形成碱性溶液。
en-mt: Like soap, plant ash is a disinfectant because it forms an alkaline solution when it meets water.

sourceString: WHO recommended ash or sand as alternative to soap when soap is not available.
targetString: WHO 建议如果没有肥皂可用，可以用草木灰或沙子代替肥皂。
en-mt: WHO recommends that if soap is not available, plant ash or sand can be used instead of soap.

sourceString: Correct handwashing technique recommended by the US Centers for Disease Control  for prevention of transmission of disease includes the following steps:
targetString: 美国疾病控制与预防中心为预防疾病传播而建议的正确洗手方式步骤如下：
en-mt: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommends the following steps for proper handwashing to prevent the spread of disease:

sourceString: Wet hands with warm or cold running water.
targetString: 用流动的温水或凉水弄湿手。
en-mt: Wet hands with warm or cool running water.

sourceString: Running water is recommended because standing basins may be contaminated, while the temperature of the water does not seem to make a difference.
targetString: 建议用流水是因为立式盆可能会被污染，而水温似乎关系不大。
en-mt: Running water is recommended because standing basins can become soiled, and water temperature doesn't seem to matter much.

sourceString: Lather hands by rubbing them with a generous amount of soap, including the backs of hands, between fingers, and under nails.
targetString: 使用足量的肥皂反复搓洗以产生泡沫，同时要清洗手背、手指间及指甲缝。
en-mt: Use enough soap to scrub repeatedly to create lather, while washing the backs of hands, between fingers and under nails.

sourceString: Soap lifts germs from the skin, and studies show that people tend to wash their hands more thoroughly when soap is used rather than water alone.
targetString: 肥皂可去除皮肤上的细菌，研究显示，人们在使用肥皂而不是单独用水洗手时，往往会更彻底地洗手。
en-mt: Soap removes germs from the skin, and research shows that people tend to wash their hands more thoroughly when they use soap rather than water alone.

sourceString: Scrub for at least 20 seconds.
targetString: 至少搓洗 20 秒。
en-mt: Scrub for at least 20 seconds.

sourceString: Scrubbing creates friction, which helps remove germs from skin, and scrubbing for longer periods removes more germs.
targetString: 搓洗可产生摩擦力，这有助于去除皮肤上的细菌，搓洗时间越长，去除的细菌越多。
en-mt: Scrubbing creates friction, which helps remove bacteria from the skin, and the longer you scrub, the more germs are removed.

sourceString: Rinse well under running water.
targetString: 用流水充分清洗。
en-mt: Rinse well with running water.

sourceString: Rinsing in a basin can recontaminate hands.
targetString: 用水盆洗手会造成重新污染。
en-mt: Washing hands with a basin can cause recontamination.

sourceString: Dry with a clean towel or allow to air dry.
targetString: 用干净的毛巾擦干或自然晾干。
en-mt: Dry with a clean towel or let dry naturally.

sourceString: Wet and moist hands are more easily recontaminated.The most commonly missed areas are the thumb, the wrist, the areas between the fingers, and under fingernails.
targetString: 手部潮湿比较容易被重新污染。拇指、手腕、手指间的区域以及指甲缝是最常被忽略的部位。
en-mt: Wet hands are more likely to be recontaminated. The thumb, wrist, the area between the fingers, and under the nails are the most commonly neglected areas.

sourceString: Artificial nails and chipped nail polish may harbor microorganisms.
targetString: 人工指甲和裂开的指甲油可能会藏匿微生物。
en-mt: Artificial nails and cracked nail polish can harbor microbes.

sourceString: Moisturizing lotion is often recommended to keep the hands from drying out; dry skin can lead to skin damage which can increase the risk for the transmission of infection.
targetString: 通常建议使用保湿乳液来避免手部干燥；皮肤干燥会导致皮肤受损，从而增加感染传播的风险。
en-mt: Moisturizing lotions are often recommended to avoid dry hands; dry skin can lead to damaged skin, which increases the risk of spreading infection.

sourceString: Various low-cost options can be made to facilitate hand washing where tap-water and/or soap is not available e.g. pouring water from a hanging jerrycan or gourd with suitable holes and/or using ash if needed in developing countries.In situations with limited water supply (such as schools or rural areas in developing countries), there are water-conserving solutions, such as "tippy-taps" and other low-cost options.
targetString: 在发展中国家无法获取自来水和/或肥皂的地方，可提供各种低成本措施来方便洗手，例如，通过一个悬挂着的桶或有孔的葫芦倒水，以及/或者使用草木灰洗手（必要时）。在水源供应有限的情况下（例如，发展中国家的学校或农村地区），可采用节水的洗手方案，例如，简易水龙头和其他低成本的方式。
en-mt: Where running water and/or soap are unavailable in developing countries, various low-cost measures are available to facilitate handwashing, such as pouring water through a hanging bucket or perforated gourd and/or using plant ash (if necessary ). Where water supply is limited (for example, schools or rural areas in developing countries), water-efficient handwashing options, such as simple taps and other low-cost options, can be used.

sourceString: A tippy-tap is a simple technology using a jug suspended by a rope, and a foot-operated lever to pour a small amount of water over the hands and a bar of soap.
targetString: 简易水龙头的技术很简单，用绳子悬挂好一个水罐，然后通过一个脚踏板向手上倒出少量的水，再使用肥皂。
en-mt: The technology of the simple faucet is very simple. A jug is hung by a rope, and then a small amount of water is poured into the hand through a foot pedal, and then soap is used.

sourceString: Effective drying of the hands is an essential part of the hand hygiene process, but there is some debate over the most effective form of drying in public washrooms.
targetString: 有效地擦干手是手部卫生流程的重要一步，但是，对于公共卫生间里最有效的干手方式还存在一些争论。
en-mt: Drying hands effectively is an important step in the hand hygiene process, however, there is some debate about the most effective way to dry hands in public restrooms.

sourceString: A growing volume of research suggests paper towels are much more hygienic than the electric hand dryers found in many washrooms.
targetString: 越来越多的研究表明，纸巾比许多卫生间提供的电动干手机更卫生。
en-mt: A growing body of research shows that paper towels are more hygienic than the hand dryers many restrooms offer.
