sourceString: In 2008, a study was conducted by the University of Westminster, London, and sponsored by the paper-towel industry the European Tissue Symposium, to compare the levels of hygiene offered by paper towels, warm-air hand dryers and the more modern jet-air hand dryers.
targetString: 2008 年，伦敦威斯敏斯特大学进行了一项由纸巾行业的欧洲纸巾研究会（European Tissue Symposium）赞助的研究，对纸巾、暖风式干手机以及更加现代的喷射式干手机，在卫生程度方面进行了比较。
en-mt: A 2008 study by the University of Westminster, London, sponsored by the tissue industry's European Tissue Symposium, looked at the hygienic effects of paper towels, warm-air hand dryers, and more modern spray hand dryers. A comparison was made in terms of degree.

sourceString: After washing and drying hands with the warm-air dryer, the total number of bacteria was found to increase on average on the finger pads by 194% and on the palms by 254%.
targetString: 洗手后使用暖风式干手机烘干双手，发现手指上细菌总量平均增加 194%，手掌上细菌总量平均增加 254%。
en-mt: After washing hands, using a warm-air hand dryer to dry hands, it was found that the total amount of bacteria on fingers increased by an average of 194%, and the total amount of bacteria on palms increased by an average of 254%.

sourceString: Drying with the jet-air dryer resulted in an increase on average of the total number of bacteria on the finger pads by 42% and on the palms by 15%.
targetString: 而以喷射式干手机干手，手指上细菌总量平均增加 42%，手掌上细菌总量平均增加 15%。
en-mt: When drying hands with a spray-type hand dryer, the total amount of bacteria on the fingers increased by an average of 42%, and the total amount of bacteria on the palm increased by an average of 15%.

sourceString: After washing and drying hands with a paper towel, the total number of bacteria was reduced on average on the finger pads by up to 76% and on the palms by up to 77%.The scientists also carried out tests to establish whether there was the potential for cross contamination of other washroom users and the washroom environment as a result of each type of drying method.
targetString: 洗手后用纸巾擦干手，手指上的细菌总量平均减少 76%，掌心细菌总量平均减少 77%。科学家还进行了各项测试，以确定各种干手方法是否可能造成其他卫生间使用者和卫生间设施出现交叉感染。
en-mt: Drying your hands with a paper towel after washing your hands reduced the total amount of bacteria on your fingers by an average of 76% and the total amount of bacteria on your palms by an average of 77%. Scientists also conducted tests to determine whether various hand-drying methods might cause cross-contamination of other restroom users and restroom facilities.

sourceString: The jet-air dryer, which blows air out of the unit at claimed speeds of 180 m/s (650 km/h; 400 mph), was capable of blowing micro-organisms from the hands and the unit and potentially contaminating other washroom users and the washroom environment up to 2 metres away.
targetString: 据称喷射式干手机以180米/秒（650公里/小时；每小时400英里）将空气喷出， 能够吹走手上和机身上的微生物，从而可能会污染 2 米以内的其他卫生间使用者和卫生间设施。
en-mt: Jet dryers are said to blast air at 180 m/s (650 km/h; 400 mph), capable of blowing away microbes on hands and body that could contaminate other bathroom users within 2 meters and toilet facilities.

sourceString: Use of a warm-air hand dryer spread micro-organisms up to 0.25 metres from the dryer.
targetString: 使用暖风式干手机可将微生物传播到干手机以外 0.25 米的地方。
en-mt: Using a warm-air hand dryer can spread microorganisms up to 0.25 meters away from the hand dryer.

sourceString: Paper towels showed no significant spread of micro-organisms.In 2005, in a study conducted by TÜV Produkt und Umwelt, different hand drying methods were evaluated.
targetString: 使用纸巾干手的结果表明，不会出现严重的微生物传播。2005 年，TÜV Produkt und Umwelt 进行了一项研究，对不同的干手方式进行了评估。
en-mt: The use of paper towels to dry hands showed that no significant microbial transmission occurred. In 2005, TÜV Produkt und Umwelt conducted a study in which different methods of drying hands were evaluated.

sourceString: The following changes in the bacterial count after drying the hands were observed:
targetString: 干手后观察到细菌数量发生以下变化：
en-mt: The following changes in bacterial counts were observed after drying hands:

sourceString: Many different hand dryer manufacturers exist, and hand driers have been compared against drying with paper towels.
targetString: 该研究有许多不同的干手机生产商参与，对这些干手机与用纸巾干手进行了比较。
en-mt: The study involved a number of different manufacturers of hand dryers and compared these to paper towels.

sourceString: Hand washing using hand sanitizing wipes is an alternative during traveling in the absence of soap and water.
targetString: 旅行期间，在没有肥皂和水的情况下，可以选择使用手部消毒湿巾洗手。
en-mt: During travel, hand sanitizing wipes are an option when soap and water are not available.

sourceString: Alcohol-based hand sanitizer should contain at least 60% alcohol.
targetString: 酒精免洗洗手液的酒精含量至少应达到 60%。
en-mt: Alcohol-based hand sanitizers should contain at least 60 percent alcohol.

sourceString: Medical hand-washing became mandatory long after Hungarian physician Ignaz Semmelweis discovered its effectiveness (in 1846) in preventing disease in a hospital environment.
targetString: 匈牙利医生伊格纳兹·塞麦尔维斯（Ignaz Semmelweis）于1846 年发现洗手能有效预防医院内的疾病传播，然而，在很久之后，才强制要求医护人员进行洗手。
en-mt: Hungarian physician Ignaz Semmelweis discovered in 1846 that handwashing was effective in preventing the spread of disease in hospitals, yet it was much later that handwashing was made mandatory for medical staff.

sourceString: There are electronic devices that provide feedback to remind hospital staff to wash their hands when they forget.
targetString: 医院使用可提供反馈的电子设备，以便在医院工作人员忘记洗手时进行提醒。
en-mt: Hospitals use electronic devices that provide feedback to alert hospital staff when they forget to wash their hands.

sourceString: One study has found decreased infection rates with their use.
targetString: 一项研究发现，使用这些设备后感染率有所降低。
en-mt: One study found that infection rates decreased after using these devices.

sourceString: Medical hand-washing is for a minimum of 15 seconds, using generous amounts of soap and water or gel to lather and rub each part of the hands.
targetString: 医务人员洗手至少要持续 15 秒，洗手时使用足量的肥皂和水或凝胶，以产生泡沫并搓洗手的各个部位。
en-mt: Medical staff should wash their hands for at least 15 seconds, using enough soap and water or gel to produce lather and rub all parts of their hands.

sourceString: Hands should be rubbed together with digits interlocking.
targetString: 双手手指相扣互搓。
en-mt: Rub your fingers together.

sourceString: If there is debris under fingernails, a bristle brush may be used to remove it.
targetString: 如果指甲缝之间有残渣，可以用硬毛刷清除。
en-mt: If there is residue between the nail crevices, it can be removed with a stiff brush.

sourceString: Since germs may remain in the water on the hands, it is important to rinse well and wipe dry with a clean towel.
targetString: 由于手上残留的水分可能仍有细菌，因此，必须充分清洗并用干净的毛巾擦干。
en-mt: Hands must be thoroughly washed and dried with a clean towel, as residual moisture may still have bacteria.

sourceString: After drying, the paper towel should be used to turn off the water (and open any exit door if necessary).
targetString: 擦干后，应使用纸巾关闭水龙头（必要时，使用纸巾打开出口门）。
en-mt: After drying, a paper towel should be used to turn off the faucet (and, if necessary, use a paper towel to open the exit door).

sourceString: This avoids re-contaminating the hands from those surfaces.
targetString: 这可防止由于接触这些表面而再次污染手部。
en-mt: This prevents recontamination of hands due to touching these surfaces.

sourceString: The purpose of hand-washing in the health-care setting is to remove pathogenic microorganisms ("germs") and avoid transmitting them.
targetString: 在医疗卫生机构，洗手的目的是消除病原微生物（“细菌”）并避免传播。
en-mt: In healthcare settings, the purpose of hand washing is to eliminate pathogenic microorganisms ("germs") and avoid transmission.

sourceString: The New England Journal of Medicine reports that a lack of hand-washing remains at unacceptable levels in most medical environments, with large numbers of doctors and nurses routinely forgetting to wash their hands before touching patients, thus transmitting microorganisms.
targetString: 《新英格兰医学杂志》上的报告表明，在大多数医疗环境下，仍存在洗手未达到可接受水平的情况，大量医护人员在接触病人前常常忘记洗手，从而导致微生物传播。
en-mt: The report in the New England Journal of Medicine shows that in most medical settings, there is still sub-acceptable levels of hand washing, and a large number of medical staff often forget to wash their hands before touching patients, resulting in the spread of microorganisms.

sourceString: One study showed that proper hand-washing and other simple procedures can decrease the rate of catheter-related bloodstream infections by 66 percent.The World Health Organization has published a sheet demonstrating standard hand-washing and hand-rubbing in health-care sectors.
targetString: 一项研究表明，正确洗手加上其他简单的程序，可以将导管相关的血流感染率减少 66%。世界卫生组织公布了一个工作表，对医疗机构的标准洗手和搓手方法进行了示范。
en-mt: Proper hand washing, along with other simple procedures, can reduce the rate of catheter-related bloodstream infections by 66%, according to one study. The World Health Organization has published a worksheet that demonstrates standard handwashing and handrubbing practices in healthcare settings.

sourceString: The draft guidance of hand hygiene by the organization can also be found at its website for public comment.
targetString: 该组织也在其网站上公布了手部卫生指南草稿，以获得公众意见。
en-mt: The organization has also posted draft hand hygiene guidelines on its website for public comment.

sourceString: A relevant review was conducted by Whitby et al.
targetString: Whitby 等人进行了相关综述。
en-mt: A related review was conducted by Whitby et al.

sourceString: Commercial devices can measure and validate hand hygiene, if demonstration of regulatory compliance is required.
targetString: 如果需要证实法规合规性，那么商业设备可以对手部卫生进行衡量和验证。
en-mt: Commercial devices can measure and verify hand hygiene if required to demonstrate regulatory compliance.

sourceString: The World Health Organization has "Five Moments" for washing hands:
targetString: 世界卫生组织建议洗手的“五个时刻”：
en-mt: The World Health Organization recommends "five moments" for washing hands:

sourceString: after exposure to blood/body fluids
targetString: 接触血液/体液后
en-mt: After exposure to blood/body fluids

sourceString: before an aseptic task, and
targetString: 进行无菌操作之前以及
en-mt: before performing aseptic procedures and

sourceString: after patient care.The addition of antiseptic chemicals to soap ("medicated" or "antimicrobial" soaps) confers killing action to a hand-washing agent.
targetString: 照顾患者之后。将抗菌化学品添加到肥皂中（“药皂”或“抗菌皂”）可使洗手剂产生杀菌作用。
en-mt: After caring for the patient. Antimicrobial chemicals are added to soaps ("medicated soaps" or "antibacterial soaps") to make hand sanitizers antiseptic.

sourceString: Such killing action may be desired prior to performing surgery or in settings in which antibiotic-resistant organisms are highly prevalent.To 'scrub' one's hands for a surgical operation, it is necessary to have a tap that can be turned on and off without touching it with the hands, some chlorhexidine or iodine wash, sterile towels for drying the hands after washing, and a sterile brush for scrubbing and another sterile instrument for cleaning under the fingernails.
targetString: 在进行手术前或有大量抗生素耐药微生物的环境中，可能需要这种杀菌操作。为做手术而“擦洗”双手时，必须有无需接触就可以打开和关闭的水龙头、含氯己定或碘的洗手液，洗手后用来擦干手的无菌毛巾，擦洗用的无菌刷和清洁指甲缝的其他无菌工具。
en-mt: This antiseptic procedure may be required prior to surgery or in settings with large numbers of antibiotic-resistant microorganisms. When hands are "scrubbed" for surgery, there must be a tap that can be turned on and off without touching, hand sanitizers containing chlorhexidine or iodine, sterile towels to dry hands after washing, sterile brushes for scrubbing and other sterile tools for cleaning between nails.

sourceString: All jewelry should be removed.
targetString: 所有首饰都要取下。
en-mt: All jewelry must be removed.

sourceString: This procedure requires washing the hands and forearms up to the elbow, usually 2–6 minutes.
targetString: 此程序要求清洗手、前臂直至肘部，通常要洗 2–6 分钟。
en-mt: This procedure calls for washing hands, forearms to elbows, usually for 2–6 minutes.

sourceString: Long scrub-times (10 minutes) are not necessary.
targetString: 不需要长时间搓洗（10 分钟）。
en-mt: Long scrubbing (10 minutes) is not required.

sourceString: When rinsing, water on the forearms must be prevented from running back to the hands.
targetString: 冲洗时，必须防止前臂上的水回流到手上。
en-mt: When rinsing, it is necessary to prevent the water from the forearm from running back onto the hands.

sourceString: After hand-washing is completed, the hands are dried with a sterile cloth and a surgical gown is donned.
targetString: 洗完手后，使用无菌布擦干手并穿上手术衣。
en-mt: After washing your hands, dry them with a sterile cloth and put on a surgical gown.

sourceString: To reduce the spread of germs, it is better to wash the hands or use a hand antiseptic before and after tending to a sick person.
targetString: 为减少细菌传播，在接触病人前后，最好洗手或使用免洗杀菌洗手液。
en-mt: To reduce the spread of germs, it is best to wash your hands or use a hand sanitizer before and after contact with sick people.

sourceString: For control of staphylococcal infections in hospitals, it has been found that the greatest benefit from hand-cleansing came from the first 20% of washing, and that very little additional benefit was gained when hand cleansing frequency was increased beyond 35%.
targetString: 为控制医院中的葡萄球菌感染症，人们发现，清洁手部最大的效益来自于洗手频率达到 20% 的时候，当清洁手部频率增加到 35% 以上时，进一步的获益极为有限。
en-mt: For the control of staphylococcal infections in hospitals, it was found that the greatest benefit of hand hygiene came when the frequency of hand washing reached 20%, with little further benefit when the frequency of hand washing increased above 35%.

sourceString: Washing with plain soap results in more than triple the rate of bacterial infectious disease transmitted to food as compared to washing with antibacterial soap.Comparing hand-rubbing with alcohol-based solution with hand washing with antibacterial soap for a median time of 30 seconds each showed that the alcohol hand-rubbing reduced bacterial contamination 26% more than the antibacterial soap.
targetString: 与使用抗菌肥皂相比，使用普通肥皂洗手会导致传播到食物上的细菌感染性疾病比例增加三倍以上。将使用酒精搓手液搓手与用抗菌皂洗手进行比较（分别洗 30 秒）后，发现使用酒精搓手液细菌感染的比例比抗菌肥皂低 26%。
en-mt: Washing hands with plain soap was associated with more than three times the rate of bacterial infectious diseases transmitted to food compared with antibacterial soap. When handwashing with alcohol-based handrub was compared to handwashing with antibacterial soap (30 seconds each), the rate of bacterial infection was found to be 26% lower with alcohol-based handrub than with antibacterial soap.

sourceString: But soap and water is more effective than alcohol-based hand rubs for reducing H1N1 influenza A virus and Clostridium difficile spores from hands.Interventions to improve hand hygiene in healthcare settings can involve education for staff on hand washing, increasing the availability of alcohol-based hand rub, and written and verbal reminders to staff.
targetString: 但是，对于减少手上甲型 H1N1 流感(HI1N1 influenza A)病毒和难辨梭状芽胞杆菌(Clostridium difficile spores)，肥皂和水比酒精搓手液更有效。可通过培训员工如何洗手、增加酒精搓手液的供应以及对员工进行书面和口头提醒等干预措施，来改善医疗机构的手部卫生情况。
en-mt: However, soap and water are more effective than alcohol-based hand rubs for reducing HI1N1 influenza A virus and Clostridium difficile spores on hands. Hand hygiene in healthcare settings can be improved through interventions such as training staff how to wash their hands, increasing the availability of alcohol-based handrub, and providing written and verbal reminders to staff.

sourceString: There is a need for more research into which of these interventions are most effective in different healthcare settings.
targetString: 对于在各种医疗环境下，哪些干预最有效，则需要进一步研究。
en-mt: Further research is needed on which interventions are most effective in various healthcare settings.

sourceString: In developing countries, hand washing with soap is recognized as a cost-effective, essential tool for achieving good health, and even good nutrition.
targetString: 在发展中国家，用肥皂洗手被认为是一种具成本效益的达到身体健康、甚至良好营养的重要工具。
en-mt: In developing countries, washing hands with soap is considered an important cost-effective tool for achieving good health and even good nutrition.

sourceString: However, a lack of reliable water supply, soap or hand washing facilities in people's homes, at schools and at the workplace make it a challenge to achieve universal hand washing behaviors.
targetString: 不过，人们的家中、学校和工作场所缺少可靠的水源供应、肥皂或洗手设施，这使得普及洗手行为成为一项挑战。
en-mt: However, people lack a reliable supply of water, soap or handwashing facilities in their homes, schools and workplaces, making universal handwashing a challenge.

sourceString: For example, in most of rural Africa hand washing taps close to every private or public toilet are scarce, even though cheap options exist to build hand washing stations.
targetString: 例如，在大多数非洲农村地区，即使有廉价的方法建造洗手台，在每个私人卫生间或公共卫生间附近安有洗手水龙头的情况还是非常少见。
en-mt: For example, in most rural areas of Africa, it is rare to have a hand-washing faucet near every private or public toilet, even if there are cheap ways to build hand-washing stations.

sourceString: However, low hand washing rates rather can also be the result of engrained habits rather than due to a lack of soap or water.
targetString: 不过，洗手频率低也可能是根深蒂固的习惯使然，而不是因为缺少肥皂或水。
en-mt: Still, infrequent handwashing may also be the result of ingrained habits rather than a lack of soap or water.

sourceString: The promotion and advocacy of hand washing with soap can influence policy decisions, raise awareness about the benefits of hand washing and lead to long-term behavior change of the population.
targetString: 推广和倡导使用肥皂洗手可以影响政策制定，提高对洗手好处的认识，并且导致居民长期的行为变化。
en-mt: Promoting and advocating handwashing with soap can influence policy development, raise awareness of the benefits of handwashing, and lead to long-term behavioral changes in residents.

sourceString: For this to work effectively, monitoring and evaluation are necessary.
targetString: 要想行之有效，就必须进行监督和评估。
en-mt: To be effective, monitoring and evaluation are necessary.

sourceString: A systematic review of 70 studies found that community-based approaches are effective at increasing hand washing in LMICs, while social marketing campaigns are less effective.One example for hand washing promotion in schools is the "Three Star Approach" by UNICEF that encourages schools to take simple, inexpensive steps to ensure that students wash their hands with soap, among other hygienic requirements.
targetString: 通过对 70 项研究进行系统性评估发现，在中低收入国家 (LMICs) 增加洗手比例上，基于社区的方法有效，而社会营销活动效果较差。在学校倡导洗手的一个例子是联合国儿童基金会推行的“三星方法”，除其他卫生要求外，鼓励学校采取简单、便宜的措施来确保学生用肥皂洗手。
en-mt: A systematic review of 70 studies found that community-based approaches were effective, while social marketing campaigns were less effective, in increasing handwashing rates in low- and middle-income countries (LMICs). An example of promoting handwashing in schools is UNICEF's "three-star approach", which, among other hygiene requirements, encourages schools to take simple, inexpensive steps to ensure students wash their hands with soap.

sourceString: When minimum standards are achieved, schools can move from one to ultimately three stars.
targetString: 当达到最低标准时，学校可以从一颗星升到最高的三颗星。
en-mt: Schools can go from one star to the highest three stars when the minimum standard is met.

sourceString: Building hand washing stations can be a part of hand washing promotion campaigns that are carried out in order to reduce diseases and child mortality.
targetString: 洗手推广活动可包括修建洗手台，以减少疾病和儿童死亡率。
en-mt: Handwashing promotion can include building handwashing stations to reduce disease and child mortality.

sourceString: Global Hand washing Day is another example of an awareness-raising campaign that is trying to achieve behavior change.As a result of the 2019-20 coronavirus pandemic, UNICEF promoted the adoption of a handwashing emoji.
targetString: 提升洗手意识活动的另一个例子是世界洗手日，目的是尝试实现行为上的改变。由于2019-20 冠状病毒大流行，联合国儿童基金会推广使用了一个洗手的表情符号。
en-mt: Another example of a handwashing awareness campaign is World Handwashing Day, which attempts to achieve behavioral change. Due to the 2019-20 coronavirus pandemic, UNICEF has promoted the use of a hand washing emoji.

sourceString: Few studies have considered the overall cost effectiveness of hand washing in developing countries in relationship to DALYs averted.
targetString: 很少有研究考察过在发展中国家，洗手带来的总体成本效益与避免伤残调整寿命年 (DALY) 之间的关系。
en-mt: Few studies have examined the relationship between the overall cost-effectiveness of handwashing and disability-adjusted life-years averted (DALYs) in developing countries.

sourceString: However, one review suggests that promoting hand washing with soap is significantly more cost-effective than other water and sanitation interventions.
targetString: 不过，有报告显示，与其他水和卫生设施干预相比，倡导用肥皂洗手的成本效益更显著。
en-mt: However, there are reports that promoting handwashing with soap is more cost-effective than other water and sanitation interventions.

sourceString: The importance of hand washing for human health – particularly for people in vulnerable circumstances like mothers who had just given birth or wounded soldiers in hospitals – was first recognized in the mid 19th century by two pioneers of hand hygiene: the Hungarian physician Ignaz Semmelweis who worked in Vienna, Austria and Florence Nightingale, the English "founder of modern nursing".
targetString: 最早认识到洗手对人类健康重要性的——特别是对那些身体孱弱的人（例如，医院里刚刚生产后的母亲或受伤的士兵），是19 世纪中期两位手部卫生领域的先锋人物：奥地利维也纳工作的匈牙利医生伊格纳兹·塞麦尔维斯（Ignaz Semmelweis） 和英国“现代护理学创始人”弗洛伦斯·南丁格尔（Florence Nightingale）。
en-mt: The first to recognize the importance of hand washing for human health—especially for those who are physically vulnerable (e.g., a mother after giving birth in a hospital or a wounded soldier)—were two pioneers in the field of hand hygiene in the mid-19th century: Ignaz Semmelweis, a Hungarian doctor working in Vienna, Austria, and Florence Nightingale, the "founder of modern nursing" in Britain.

sourceString: At that time most people still believed that infections were caused by foul odors called miasmas.
targetString: 那时，大多数人们仍认为感染是被称为瘴毒的恶臭味所引起。
en-mt: At that time, most people still believed that the infection was caused by a foul smell called miasma.

sourceString: In the 1980s, foodborne outbreaks and healthcare-associated infections led the United States Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to more actively promote hand hygiene as an important way to prevent the spread of infection.
targetString: 二十世纪八十年代食源性疾病爆发和医源性感染，促使美国疾病控制与预防中心更积极倡导手部卫生，强调手部卫生是预防感染传播的重要方式。
en-mt: Outbreaks of foodborne illness and hospital-acquired infections in the 1980s prompted the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to be more active in advocating hand hygiene, emphasizing that hand hygiene is an important way to prevent the spread of infection.

sourceString: The outbreak of swine flu in 2009 and the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020 led to increased awareness in many countries of the importance of washing hands with soap to protect oneself from such infectious diseases.
targetString: 2009 年猪流感的爆发和 2020 年 COVID-19 大流行，使许多国家更加认识到用肥皂洗手的重要性，以保护人们免于感染此类传染性疾病。
en-mt: The outbreak of swine flu in 2009 and the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020 have made many countries more aware of the importance of washing hands with soap to protect people from such contagious diseases.

sourceString: For example, posters with "correct hand washing techniques" were hung up next to hand washing sinks in public toilets and in the toilets of office buildings and airports in Germany.
targetString: 例如，德国在公共卫生间、办公大楼以及机场卫生间的洗手池旁会悬挂“正确洗手方法”海报。
en-mt: For example, in Germany, posters of "Correct Handwashing Methods" will be hung next to the sinks in public toilets, office buildings and airport toilets.

sourceString: The phrase "washing one's hands of" something, means declaring one's unwillingness to take responsibility for the thing or share complicity in it.
targetString: 习语“洗手不干了”的意思是，某人声明不愿对某事负责或不愿参与某事。
en-mt: The idiom "washing your hands and quitting" means that someone declares that he or she does not want to be responsible for or participate in something.

sourceString: It originates from the bible passage in Matthew where Pontius Pilate washed his hands of the decision to crucify Jesus Christ, but has become a phrase with a much wider usage in some English communities.
targetString: 它源自《圣经》马太福音中的内容，本丢·彼拉多 (Pontius Pilate) 在决定钉死耶稣后洗手，后来在一些讲英语的群体中演变为使用广泛的习语。
en-mt: It is derived from the biblical passage in Matthew, where Pontius Pilate washed his hands after deciding to crucify Jesus, and has since evolved into a widespread idiom among some English-speaking communities.

sourceString: In Shakespeare's Macbeth, Lady Macbeth begins to compulsively wash her hands in an attempt to cleanse an imagined stain, representing her guilty conscience regarding crimes she had committed and induced her husband to commit.
targetString: 在莎士比亚的《麦克白》中，麦克白夫人为试图清洗想象中的污点开始强迫性洗手，表明她对自己犯下的罪行和怂恿丈夫犯罪感到内疚。
en-mt: In Shakespeare's Macbeth, Lady Macbeth begins compulsive handwashing in an attempt to wash away the imaginary stain, revealing her guilt for the crime she has committed and for abetting her husband to commit it.

sourceString: It has also been found that people, after having recalled or contemplated unethical acts, tend to wash hands more often than others, and tend to value hand washing equipment more.
targetString: 研究表明，想起或设想了不道德行为的人，往往会比其他人更频繁地洗手，并往往更珍惜洗手设施。
en-mt: Research shows that people who think about or envision unethical behavior tend to wash their hands more often than others and tend to value handwashing facilities more.

sourceString: Furthermore, those who are allowed to wash their hands after such a contemplation are less likely to engage in other "cleansing" compensatory actions, such as volunteering.
targetString: 此外，在设想了不道德行为后可以洗手的那些人，不太可能从事其他“有净化作用的”补偿行动，例如，做志愿者。
en-mt: Furthermore, those who could wash their hands after imagining the immoral behavior were less likely to engage in other "purifying" compensatory actions, such as volunteering.

sourceString: Religions prescribe hand washing for both hygienic and symbolic purposes.Symbolic hand washing, using water but no soap to wash hands, is a part of ritual hand washing featured in many religions, including Bahá'í Faith, Hinduism, tevilah and netilat yadayim in Judaism, Lavabo in Christianity, and Wudhu in Islam.Religions also prescribe hygienic hand washing, especially after certain actions.
targetString: 宗教出于卫生和象征目的而要求洗手。洗手时用水但不用肥皂的象征性洗手是许多宗教标志性洗手礼的一部分，其中包括巴哈伊信仰、印度教、犹太教中的沐浴式 (tevilah) 和洗手式 (netilat yadayim) 洁净礼、基督教中的洗手礼和伊斯兰教中的小净。宗教还有卫生方面的洗手规定，特别是在某些行为之后。
en-mt: Religion calls for hand washing for hygienic and symbolic purposes. The symbolic washing of hands with water but without soap is part of the ritual of handwashing that is iconic in many religions, including the Tevilah (tevilah) and netilat yadayim (netilat yadayim) purification rituals in the Baha'i Faith, Hinduism, Judaism, Christianity Washing hands and wudu in Islam. Religions also have hygiene rules for washing hands, especially after certain acts.

sourceString: Hinduism, Judaism and Islam mandate washing of hands after using the toilet.
targetString: 印度教、犹太教和伊斯兰教要求在如厕后洗手。
en-mt: Hinduism, Judaism and Islam require washing hands after using the toilet.

sourceString: And, Hinduism, Buddhism, Sikhism, Judaism and Islam mandate washing of hands before and after every meal.
targetString: 印度教、佛教、锡克教、犹太教和伊斯兰教要求用餐前后洗手。
en-mt: Hinduism, Buddhism, Sikhism, Judaism and Islam require handwashing before and after meals.

sourceString: Workplace hazard controls for COVID-19
targetString: COVID-19 工作场所防控
en-mt: COVID-19 Workplace Prevention and Control

sourceString: Workplace hazard controls for COVID-19 are the application of occupational safety and health methodologies for hazard controls to the prevention of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).
targetString: COVID-19 工作场所防控是指采用防控危险的职业安全和健康措施预防冠状病毒疾病 2019 (COVID-19)。
en-mt: COVID-19 workplace prevention and control refers to the prevention of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) through occupational safety and health measures that prevent and control hazards.

sourceString: The proper hazard controls in the workplace depend on the worksite and job task, based on a risk assessment of sources of exposure, disease severity in the community, and risk factors of individual workers who may be vulnerable to contracting COVID-19.
targetString: 工作场所危险防控是否妥当取决于具体工作现场和工作任务，并应基于暴露源的风险评估、社区疾病严重程度以及可能接触 COVID-19 的易感染个人的风险因素来决定。
en-mt: The adequacy of workplace hazard prevention and control is job site and task specific and should be determined based on a risk assessment of the source of exposure, severity of disease in the community, and risk factors for susceptible individuals who may be exposed to COVID-19.

sourceString: According to the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), lower exposure risk jobs have minimal occupational contact with the public and other coworkers, for which basic infection prevention measures are recommended, including hand washing, encouraging workers to stay home if they are sick, respiratory etiquette, and maintaining routine cleaning and disinfecting of the work environment.
targetString: 根据美国职业安全与卫生管理局 (OSHA) 的要求，低度暴露风险工作与公众和其他同事的职业接触最少，因此建议采取基本感染预防措施，其中包括勤洗手、鼓励员工患病后居家隔离、遵守呼吸礼仪以及对工作环境进行日常清洁与消毒。
en-mt: According to the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), low exposure risk jobs have minimal occupational contact with the public and other co-workers, so basic infection prevention measures are recommended, including frequent hand washing, encouraging employees to stay home if they become sick, Observe respiratory etiquette and carry out daily cleaning and disinfection of the working environment.

sourceString: Medium exposure risk jobs include those that require frequent or close contact with people who are not known or suspected with COVID-19, but may be infected due to ongoing community transmission or international travel.
targetString: 中度暴露风险工作包括需要经常或密切接触未知或疑似 COVID-19 患者的工作，这些患者可能因持续的社区传播或国际旅行而导致被感染。
en-mt: Moderate exposure risk jobs include jobs that require frequent or close contact with unknown or suspected COVID-19 patients who may become infected as a result of ongoing community transmission or international travel.

sourceString: This includes workers who have contact with the general public such as in schools, high-population-density work environments, and some high-volume retail settings.
targetString: 包括接触普通公众的工作人员，例如学校、高人群密度工作环境和一些大规模零售环境。
en-mt: Includes workers who come into contact with the general public, such as schools, high-density work settings, and some large-scale retail settings.

sourceString: Hazard controls for this group, in addition to basic infection prevention measures, include ventilation using high-efficiency air filters, sneeze guards, and having personal protective equipment available in case a person with COVID-19 is encountered.
targetString: 除了基本的感染预防措施外，该群体还应使用高效空气过滤器和喷嚏防护装置进行通风，在接触 COVID-19 患者时穿戴个人防护设备和采取其他危险防控措施。
en-mt: In addition to basic infection prevention measures, this group should also ventilate with HEPA filters and sneeze guards, wear personal protective equipment and take other hazard prevention and control measures when exposed to someone with COVID-19.

sourceString: OSHA considers healthcare and mortuary workers exposed to known or suspected person with COVID-19 to be at high exposure risk, which increases to very high exposure risk if workers perform aerosol-generating procedures on, or collect or handle specimens from, known or suspected person with COVID-19.
targetString: OSHA 认为接触已知或疑似 COVID-19 患者的医护人员和殓房工作人员存在高度暴露风险，如果工作人员对已知或疑似 COVID-19 患者执行了产生气溶胶的操作，或从其身上收集或处理了标本，则暴露风险变得极高。
en-mt: OSHA considers health care workers and mortuary workers who come into contact with known or suspected COVID-19 patients to be at high risk of exposure if staff perform aerosol-generating procedures on, or collect or Once the specimen is handled, the risk of exposure becomes extremely high.

sourceString: Hazard controls appropriate for these workers include engineering controls such as negative pressure ventilation rooms, and personal protective equipment appropriate to the job task.
targetString: 适用于这类人员的危险防控措施包括工程控制，如负压通风室和适合其工作任务的个人防护装备。
en-mt: Hazard prevention and control measures applicable to such personnel include engineering controls such as negative pressure plenums and personal protective equipment appropriate to their job tasks.

sourceString: COVID-19 outbreaks can have several effects within the workplace.
targetString: COVID-19 爆发可能对工作场所内产生严重影响。
en-mt: A COVID-19 outbreak can have serious impacts within the workplace.

sourceString: Workers may be absent from work due to becoming sick, needing to care for others, or from fear of possible exposure.
targetString: 工作人员可能会因生病、需要照顾他人或害怕暴露而缺勤。
en-mt: Staff may be absent from work due to illness, need to care for others, or fear of exposure.

sourceString: Patterns of commerce may change, both in terms of what goods are demanded, and the means of acquiring these goods (such as shopping at off-peak hours or through delivery or drive-through services).
targetString: 商业模式也可能会有所变化，包括商品需求发生变化，或获得这些商品的途径发生变化（如在非高峰时段购物，或使用配送或免下车送货服务）。
en-mt: Business models may also change, including changes in demand for goods, or changes in access to those goods (such as shopping during off-peak hours, or using delivery or drive-through delivery services).

sourceString: Lastly, shipments of items from geographic areas severely affected by COVID-19 may be interrupted.An infectious disease preparedness and response plan can be used to guide protective actions.
targetString: 最后，来自 COVID-19 疫情严重地区的产品物流可能会中断。传染病预防与应对计划可用于指导保护行动。
en-mt: Finally, the logistics of products originating from areas severely affected by COVID-19 may be disrupted. Communicable disease prevention and response plans can be used to guide protective action.

sourceString: Plans address the levels of risk associated with various worksites and job tasks, including sources of exposure, risk factors arising from home and community settings, and risk factors of individual workers such as old age or chronic medical conditions.
targetString: 这些计划解决了与各种工作场所和工作任务相关的风险水平，包括暴露源、来自家庭和社区环境的风险因素以及个体工作者的风险因素，如老年人或患有慢性疾病的群体。
en-mt: These programs address the level of risk associated with various workplaces and work tasks, including sources of exposure, risk factors from home and community settings, and risk factors for individual workers, such as older adults or groups with chronic medical conditions.

sourceString: They also outline controls necessary to address those risks, and contingency plans for situations that may arise as a result of outbreaks.
targetString: 这些计划还概述了应对这些风险所需的防控措施，以及针对可能因疫情爆发而出现的情况的应急计划。
en-mt: These plans also outline the containment measures needed to address these risks, as well as contingency plans for situations that may arise as a result of the outbreak.

sourceString: Infectious disease preparedness and response plans may be subject to national or subnational recommendations.
targetString: 传染病预防与应对计划可能需要服从国家或地方的建议。
en-mt: Communicable disease prevention and response plans may need to follow national or local recommendations.

sourceString: Objectives for response to an outbreak include reducing transmission among staff, protecting people who are at higher risk for adverse health complications, maintaining business operations, and minimizing adverse effects on other entities in their supply chains.
targetString: 应对疫情爆发的目标包括减少员工间传播，保护不良健康并发症风险较高的人群，维持业务运营，以及最大限度减少对供应链中其他实体的不利影响。
en-mt: Goals of responding to an outbreak include reducing employee-to-employee transmission, protecting populations at higher risk of adverse health complications, maintaining business operations, and minimizing adverse impacts to other entities in the supply chain.

sourceString: The disease severity in the community where the business is located affects the responses taken.
targetString: 此外，应对措施还会受到企业所在社区疾病严重程度的影响。
en-mt: In addition, the response will be influenced by the severity of the disease in the community in which the business operates.

sourceString: The hierarchy of hazard controls is a framework widely used in occupational safety and health to group hazard controls by effectiveness.
targetString: 危险防控等级是职业安全和健康中广泛使用的防控框架，用于按照有效性对危险防控措施进行分组。
en-mt: The Hazard Control Hierarchy is a widely used control framework in occupational safety and health to group hazard control measures according to their effectiveness.

sourceString: Where COVID-19 hazards cannot be eliminated, the most effective controls are engineering controls, followed by administrative controls, and lastly personal protective equipment.
targetString: 如果无法彻底消除 COVID-19 的危害，则最有效的控制措施为工程控制，其次为行政控制，最后为个人防护装备。
en-mt: If the hazard of COVID-19 cannot be completely eliminated, the most effective control measures are engineering controls, followed by administrative controls, and finally personal protective equipment.

sourceString: Engineering controls involve isolating employees from work-related hazards without relying on worker behavior, and can be the most cost-effective solution to implement.
targetString: 工程控制是指将员工从工作相关危险中隔离出来，而非依靠员工的行为进行控制，这也是实施成本最低的解决方案。
en-mt: Engineering controls, which isolate employees from work-related hazards rather than relying on employee behavior for control, are also the least expensive solution to implement.

sourceString: Administrative controls are changes in work policy or procedures that require action by the worker or employer.
targetString: 行政控制是指变更工作政策或程序，要求工作人员或雇主自行采取行动。
en-mt: Administrative controls are changes to work policies or procedures that require workers or employers to take action on their own.

sourceString: Personal protective equipment (PPE) is considered less effective than engineering and administrative controls, but can help prevent some exposures.
targetString: 个人防护装备 (PPE) 的防控效果低于工程控制和行政控制，但有助于预防一些暴露。
en-mt: Personal protective equipment (PPE) is less effective than engineering and administrative controls, but can help prevent some exposures.

sourceString: All types of PPE must be selected based upon the hazard to the worker, properly fitted as applicable (e.g., respirators), consistently and properly worn, regularly inspected, maintained, and replaced, as necessary, and properly removed, cleaned, and stored or disposed of to avoid contamination.
targetString: 所有类型的 PPE 均需按照工作人员所面临的危险等级进行选择，根据适用情况配备（如呼吸器），且必须始终正确佩戴，定期检查和维护，必要时要进行更换，并妥善脱卸、清洁、储存或处理以避免污染。
en-mt: All types of PPE need to be selected according to the level of hazard faced by the worker, equipped as appropriate (such as respirators), must always be properly worn, regularly inspected and maintained, replaced if necessary, and properly removed, cleaned, Store or handle to avoid contamination.

sourceString: According to the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), lower exposure risk jobs have minimal occupational contact with the public and other coworkers.
targetString: 根据美国职业安全与健康管理局 (OSHA) 的规定，低度暴露风险工作与公众和其他同事在职业上的接触最少。
en-mt: According to the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), low exposure risk jobs have minimal occupational contact with the public and other co-workers.

sourceString: Basic infection prevention measures recommended for all workplaces include frequent and thorough hand washing, encouraging workers to stay home if they are sick, respiratory etiquette including covering coughs and sneezes, providing tissues and trash receptacles, preparing for telecommuting or staggered shifts if needed, discouraging workers from using others' tools and equipment, and maintaining routine cleaning and disinfecting of the work environment.
targetString: 建议所有工作场所都要采取基本的感染预防措施，包括勤洗手，建议患病员工居家隔离，咳嗽或打喷嚏时遵守呼吸礼仪，提供纸巾和垃圾桶，做好远程办公的准备，必要时错峰上下班，劝阻员工使用他人的工具和设备，以及保持工作场所的日常清洁与消毒。
en-mt: Basic infection prevention measures are recommended in all workplaces, including frequent hand washing, advising sick employees to stay at home, practicing respiratory etiquette when coughing or sneezing, providing tissues and trash cans, being prepared to telework, and staggering peak hours if necessary commute, discourage employees from using other people's tools and equipment, and maintain routine cleaning and disinfection of the workplace.

sourceString: Prompt identification and isolation of potentially infectious individuals is a critical step in protecting workers, customers, visitors, and others at a worksite.
targetString: 及时识别和隔离潜在传染性个体是保护工作场所人员、顾客、访客和其他人的关键。
en-mt: Prompt identification and isolation of potentially infectious individuals is key to protecting workplace personnel, customers, visitors, and others.

sourceString: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) recommends that employees who have symptoms of acute respiratory illness are to stay home until they are free of fever, signs of a fever, and any other symptoms for at least 24 hours without the use of fever-reducing or other symptom-altering medicines, and that sick leave policies are flexible, permit employees to stay home to care for a sick family member, and that employees are aware of these policies.
targetString: 美国疾病控制与预防中心 (CDC) 建议，表现出急性呼吸道症状的员工应居家隔离至少 24 小时，直至确定不存在发热、发热体征和任何其他症状为止，病假政策应灵活执行，允许员工居家照顾患病家属，并应明确告知员工该项政策。
en-mt: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) recommends that employees exhibiting acute respiratory symptoms should isolate themselves at home for at least 24 hours until they are determined to be free of fever, signs of fever, and any other symptoms, and that sick leave policies should be flexible to allow employees to care for patients at home. The family members of patients should be clearly informed of this policy.

sourceString: According to OSHA, medium exposure risk jobs include those that require frequent or close contact within six feet (1.8 m) of people who are not known or suspected COVID-19 patients, but may be infected with SARS-CoV-2 due to ongoing community transmission around the business location, or because the individual has recent international travel to a location with widespread COVID-19 transmission.
targetString: 根据 OSHA 的规定，中度暴露风险工作包括需要在 6 英尺（1.8 米）范围内频繁或密切接触未知或疑似 COVID-19 患者，但可能致使个人因工作场所附近持续的社区传播或因近期可能到过 COVID-19 疫情地区而感染 SARS-CoV-2 的工作。
en-mt: According to OSHA, moderate exposure risk jobs include those that require frequent or close contact within 6 feet (1.8 meters) of an unknown or suspected COVID-19 Those who have been infected with SARS-CoV-2 through a COVID-19 epidemic area.

sourceString: These include workers who have contact with the general public such as in schools, high-population-density work environments, and some high-volume retail settings.Engineering controls for this and higher risk groups include installing high-efficiency air filters, increasing ventilation rates, installing physical barriers such as clear plastic sneeze guards, and installing a drive-through window for customer service.Administrative controls for this and higher risk groups include encouraging sick workers to stay at home, replacing face-to-face meetings with virtual communications, establishing staggered shifts, discontinuing nonessential travel to locations with ongoing COVID-19 outbreaks, developing emergency communications plans including a forum for answering workers’ concerns, providing workers with up-to-date education and training on COVID-19 risk factors and protective behaviors, training workers who need to use protecting clothing and equipment how to use it, providing resources and a work environment that promotes personal hygiene, requiring regular hand washing, limiting customers' and the public's access to the worksite, and posting signage about hand washing and other COVID-19 protective measures.Depending on the work task, workers with at least medium exposure risk may need to wear personal protective equipment including some combination of gloves, a gown, a face shield or face mask, or goggles.
targetString: 这类工作人员包括就职于学校、高人口密度工作环境和一些大批量零售环境中会接触普通公众的工作人员。针对这一群体和高风险群体的工程控制措施包括安装高效空气过滤器、提高通风效果、透明塑料喷嚏防护装置等安装物理屏障以及安装免下车窗口提供客户服务。对这一群体和高风险群体的行政控制包括鼓励患病员工居家隔离，用虚拟通信代替面对面会议，建立错峰轮班制，取消到 COVID-19 爆发地点的非必要旅行，制定紧急通信计划，包括回答工作人员问题的论坛，向工作人员提供关于 COVID-19 风险因素和防护行为的最新教育与培训，向需要使用防护服和防护装备的工作人员提供防护服和防护装备的使用方法培训，提供有助于提高个人卫生的资源和工作环境，要求勤洗手，限制顾客和公众进入工作现场，张贴关于洗手和其他 COVID-19 防护措施的标识。根据具体工作任务，至少要为面临中度暴露风险的工作人员配备个人防护装备，包括手套、长袍、口罩或护目镜。
en-mt: This category of workers includes those working in schools, high population density work settings, and some high volume retail settings that come into contact with the general public. Engineering controls for this and high-risk groups include installation of high-efficiency air filters, improved ventilation, physical barriers such as clear plastic sneeze guards, and drive-through windows for customer service. Administrative controls for this and high-risk groups include encouraging home isolation for sick employees, replacing face-to-face meetings with virtual communications, creating staggered shifts, canceling non-essential travel to COVID-19 outbreak sites, and developing emergency communications plans, including A forum to answer staff questions, provide staff with up-to-date education and training on COVID-19 risk factors and protective behaviors, provide training on how to use protective clothing and Resources and work environments to help improve personal hygiene, require frequent hand washing, limit customer and public access to work sites, and post signage about hand washing and other COVID-19 protective measures. Depending on the job assignment, provide at least PPE for workers at moderate risk of exposure, including gloves, gowns, masks, or goggles.

sourceString: Workers in this risk group rarely require use of respirators.
targetString: 这类工作人员最好需要配备呼吸器。
en-mt: Such workers preferably need to be equipped with respirators.

sourceString: If a person becomes sick on an airplane, proper controls to protect workers and other passengers include separating the sick person from others by a distance of 6 feet, designating one crew member to serve the sick person, and offering a face mask to the sick person or asking the sick person to cover their mouth and nose with tissues when coughing or sneezing.
targetString: 如果有人在飞机上生病，应妥善采取防护措施保护工作人员和其他乘客，包括将患者安排至距离其他乘客 6 英尺距离以外，指定一名机组人员为该患者服务，向患者提供口罩，或要求患者在咳嗽或打喷嚏时用纸巾捂住口鼻。
en-mt: If someone becomes sick on an airplane, take appropriate precautions to protect staff and other passengers, including moving the sick person 6 feet away from other passengers, assigning a crew member to serve the sick person, providing the sick person with a mask, or requiring the sick person to Cover your mouth and nose with a tissue when you cough or sneeze.

sourceString: Cabin crew should wear disposable medical gloves when tending to a sick traveler or touching body fluids or potentially contaminated surfaces, and possibly additional personal protective equipment if the sick traveler has fever, persistent cough, or difficulty breathing.
targetString: 机组人员在护理患病旅行者、触摸体液或潜在污染表面时，应佩戴一次性医用手套。若患病旅行者出现发热、持续咳嗽或呼吸困难等症状，机组人员还应佩戴额外的个人防护装备。
en-mt: Flight crew should wear disposable medical gloves when caring for sick travellers, touching body fluids or potentially contaminated surfaces. Crew members should also wear additional personal protective equipment if a sick traveler develops symptoms such as fever, persistent cough or difficulty breathing.

sourceString: Gloves and other disposable items should be disposed of in a biohazard bag, and contaminated surfaces should be cleaned and disinfected afterwards.For commercial shipping, including cruise ships and other passenger vessels, hazard controls include postponing travel when sick, and self-isolating and informing the onboard medical center immediately if one develops a fever or other symptoms while on board.
targetString: 手套和其他一次性物品应放在生物危害袋中处理，随后应对被污染表面进行清洁和消毒。对于商业运输，包括游轮和其他客船，危险防控措施还包括患病时推迟旅行。如果在船上出现发热或其他症状，应自我隔离并立即通知船上医疗室。
en-mt: Gloves and other single-use items should be disposed of in biohazard bags, after which contaminated surfaces should be cleaned and disinfected. For commercial transportation, including cruise ships and other passenger ships, hazard prevention measures also include postponing travel if sick. If you develop fever or other symptoms while on board, you should self-isolate and notify the ship's medical unit immediately.

sourceString: Ideally, medical follow-up should occur in the isolated person's cabin.For schools and childcare facilities, CDC recommends short-term closure to clean or disinfect if an infected person has been in a school building regardless of community spread.
targetString: 理想情况下，医疗随访应在被隔离者舱室内进行。对于学校和儿童保育场所，疾病预防控制中心建议如果受感染者曾出现在校内，则无论社区扩散情况如何，均要短期关闭相应学校和儿童保育场所，进行彻底清洁或消毒。
en-mt: Ideally, medical follow-up should take place in the quarantined person's cabin. For schools and child care settings, the CDC recommends short-term closure of schools and child care settings for thorough cleaning or disinfection if an infected person has been present in the school, regardless of community spread.

sourceString: When there is minimal to moderate community transmission, social distancing strategies can be implemented such as canceling field trips, assemblies, and other large gatherings such as physical education or choir classes or meals in a cafeteria, increasing the space between desks, staggering arrival and dismissal times, limiting nonessential visitors, and using a separate health office location for children with flu-like symptoms.
targetString: 对于中低程度的社区传播，可实施社交距离策略，如取消实地考察、集会和体育课、合唱班或自助餐厅用餐等其他大型聚集情况，增加办公桌之间的距离，错峰到场和离场，限制非必要访客到访，以及为有流感样症状的儿童单独安排健康办公室。
en-mt: For low to moderate levels of community transmission, implement social distancing strategies such as canceling field trips, assemblies and other large gathering situations such as physical education classes, choral classes or cafeteria meals, increasing distance between desks, and staggering arrivals and departures , limiting non-essential visitors, and having separate health offices for children with flu-like symptoms.

sourceString: When there is substantial transmission in the local community, in addition to social distancing strategies, extended school dismissals may be considered.For law enforcement personnel performing daily routine activities, the immediate health risk is considered low by CDC.
targetString: 如果社区传播严重，则除了要实施社交距离策略外，还可考虑延长停课时间。对于执行日常例行活动的执法人员，疾病预防控制中心认为其面临的直接健康风险较低。
en-mt: If community transmission is severe, extended school closures may be considered in addition to implementing social distancing strategies. The CDC considers the immediate health risk to law enforcement personnel performing daily routine activities to be low.

sourceString: Law enforcement officials who must make contact with individuals confirmed or suspected to have COVID-19 are recommended to follow the same guidelines as emergency medical technicians, including proper personal protective equipment.
targetString: 建议必须接触 COVID-19 确诊患者或疑似个人的执法人员要按照与急救医疗技术人员相同的防护等级行事，包括配备适当的个人防护装备。
en-mt: Law enforcement personnel who must come into contact with individuals with confirmed or suspected COVID-19 are advised to exercise the same level of protection as emergency medical technicians, including having appropriate personal protective equipment.

sourceString: If close contact occurs during apprehension, workers should clean and disinfect their duty belt and gear prior to reuse using a household cleaning spray or wipe, and follow standard operating procedures for the containment and disposal of used PPE and for containing and laundering clothes.
targetString: 如果在逮捕过程中发生密切接触，工作人员应先对其勤务腰带和装备进行清洁和消毒，然后才能使用家用清洁喷雾或抹布清洁后再用，并应遵守标准的个人防护装备密封与处置程序以及衣物密封与清洗程序。
en-mt: If close contact occurs during an arrest, staff should clean and sanitize their duty belt and equipment before cleaning with household cleaning spray or wipes and should follow standard PPE sealing and disposal procedures and Clothes sealing and washing procedures.

sourceString: OSHA considers certain healthcare and mortuary workers to be at high or very high categories of exposure risk.
targetString: OSHA 认为某些医疗保健和殓房工作人员面临很高或非常高的暴露风险。
en-mt: OSHA considers certain healthcare and mortuary workers to be at high or very high risk of exposure.

sourceString: High exposure risk jobs include healthcare delivery, support, laboratory, and medical transport workers who are exposed to known or suspected COVID-19 patients.
targetString: 高暴露风险工作人员包括实际接触已知或疑似 COVID-19 感染者的医疗保健、支持、实验室和医疗运输工作人员。
en-mt: High-exposure workers include healthcare, support, laboratory, and medical transport workers who have had physical contact with someone known or suspected to have COVID-19 infection.

sourceString: These become very high exposure risk if workers perform aerosol-generating procedures on, or collect or handle specimens from, known or suspected COVID-19 patients.
targetString: 如果工作人员对已知或疑似 COVID-19 患者执行飞沫生成程序，或收集或处理感染者或疑似感染者的标本，则暴露风险变得极高。
en-mt: Exposure risk becomes extremely high if staff perform droplet-generating procedures on patients with known or suspected COVID-19, or collect or process specimens from infected or suspected COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: Aerosol-generating procedures include intubation, cough induction procedures, bronchoscopies, some dental procedures and exams, or invasive specimen collection.
targetString: 飞沫生成程序包括插管、咳嗽诱导程序、支气管镜检查、一些牙科程序和检查，或体腔标本采集。
en-mt: Droplet generating procedures include intubation, cough induction procedures, bronchoscopy, some dental procedures and examinations, or body cavity specimen collection.

sourceString: High exposure risk mortuary jobs include workers involved in preparing the bodies of people who had known or suspected cases of COVID-19 at the time of their death; these become very high exposure risk if they perform an autopsy.Additional engineering controls for these risk groups include isolation rooms for patients with known or suspected COVID-19, including when aerosol-generating procedures are performed.
targetString: 高暴露风险太平间工作人员包括参与整理死者尸体的工作人员，这些死者生前为 COVID-19 确诊或疑似病例；如果执行尸体解剖，则面临的暴露风险更高。针对这一风险群体需额外采取的工程措施还包括为 COVID-19 确诊或疑似病例准备的隔离室，包括在执行飞沫生成程序时。
en-mt: High-exposure mortuary workers include those involved in the preparation of the bodies of deceased individuals with confirmed or probable COVID-19 cases who are at higher risk of exposure if an autopsy is performed. Additional engineering measures for this risk group include isolation rooms for confirmed or suspected COVID-19 cases, including when performing droplet generating procedures.

sourceString: Specialized negative pressure ventilation may be appropriate in some healthcare and mortuary settings.
targetString: 一些医疗保健设施和停尸房还可配备专门的负压通风系统。
en-mt: Some healthcare facilities and mortuaries can also be equipped with specialized negative pressure ventilation systems.

sourceString: Specimens should be handled with Biosafety Level 3 precautions.
targetString: 处理标本时应采取生物安全 3 级预防措施。
en-mt: Biosafety level 3 precautions should be followed when handling specimens.

sourceString: The World Health Organization (WHO) recommends that incoming patients be separated into distinct waiting areas depending on whether they are a suspected COVID-19 case.In addition to other PPE, OSHA recommends respirators for those who work within 6 feet of patients known to be, or suspected of being, infected with SARS-CoV-2, and those performing aerosol-generating procedures.
targetString: 世界卫生组织 (WTO) 建议根据患者是否为 COVID-19 疑似病例，为患者划定不同的等候区。除其他个人防护装备外，职业安全与健康管理局还建议在已知或怀疑已感染 SARS-CoV-2 的患者 6 英尺范围内工作的人员以及执行飞沫生成程序的人员要佩戴呼吸器。
en-mt: The World Health Organization (WTO) recommends separate waiting areas for patients depending on whether they are a suspected case of COVID-19. In addition to other personal protective equipment, OSHA recommends that respirators be worn by personnel working within 6 feet of patients known or suspected to be infected with SARS-CoV-2 and by those performing droplet generating procedures.

sourceString: In the United States, NIOSH-approved N95 filtering facepiece respirators or better must be used in the context of a comprehensive, written respiratory protection program that includes fit-testing, training, and medical exams.
targetString: 美国要求在健康检测、培训、医学检查等全面成文呼吸保护计划环境中，必须使用经 NIOSH 批准的 N95 过滤口罩或更好口罩。
en-mt: The United States requires that N95 filter masks or better approved by NIOSH must be used in the environment of comprehensive documented respiratory protection programs such as health testing, training, and medical inspections.

sourceString: Other types of respirators can provide greater protection and improve worker comfort.The WHO does not recommend coveralls, as COVID-19 is a respiratory disease rather than being transmitted through bodily fluids.
targetString: 其他类型的呼吸器可以提供更好的保护，提高工作人员的舒适度。WHO 不推荐使用防护服，因为 COVID-19 是一种呼吸道疾病，并不通过体液传播。
en-mt: Other types of respirators can provide better protection and improve worker comfort. WHO does not recommend protective clothing because COVID-19 is a respiratory disease and is not spread through bodily fluids.

sourceString: WHO recommends only a surgical mask for point-of-entry screening personnel.
targetString: WHO 建议入境点筛查人员只需佩戴医用外科口罩即可。
en-mt: WHO recommends that entry point screening personnel only need to wear medical surgical masks.

sourceString: For those who are collecting respiratory specimens from, caring for, or transporting COVID-19 patients without any aerosol-generating procedures, WHO recommends a surgical mask, goggles, or face shield, gown, and gloves.
targetString: 对于需要从 COVID-19 患者身上采集呼吸标本以及为患者提供护理或转移服务，而无需执行飞沫生成程序的工作人员来说，WHO 建议其使用医用外科口罩、护目镜或口罩、长袍和手套。
en-mt: WHO recommends the use of medical-grade surgical masks, goggles or face masks, gowns, and gloves for staff who need to collect breath samples from COVID-19 patients and provide care or transfer services to patients without performing droplet-generating procedures.

sourceString: If an aerosol-generating procedure is performed, the surgical mask is replaced with an N95 or FFP2 respirator.
targetString: 如果要执行飞沫生成程序，则必须将医用外科口罩换为 N95 或 FFP2 口罩。
en-mt: Surgical masks must be replaced with N95 or FFP2 masks if droplet generating procedures are to be performed.

sourceString: Given that the global supply of PPE is insufficient, WHO recommends minimizing the need for PPE through telemedicine, physical barriers such as clear windows, allowing only those involved in direct care to enter a room with a COVID-19 patient, using only the PPE necessary for the specific task, continuing use of the same respirator without removing it while caring for multiple patients with the same diagnosis, monitoring and coordinating the PPE supply chain, and discouraging the use of masks for asymptomatic individuals.
targetString: 鉴于全球个人防护装备供应不足，WHO 建议通过远程医疗、透明窗户等物理屏障、仅允许直接护理人员进入 COVID-19 患者的房间、仅在特定任务确实有必要使用个人防护装备时使用、在护理多个诊断结果相同的患者时继续使用相同的呼吸器、监测和协调个人防护装备供应链以及不鼓励无症状人员使用口罩等措施来降低人们对个人防护装备的需求。
en-mt: Given the insufficient global supply of PPE, WHO recommends physical barriers such as telemedicine, transparent windows, allowing only direct caregivers into the room of a COVID-19 patient, using PPE only when it is truly necessary for specific tasks, Measures such as continuing to use the same respirators for each patient with the same diagnosis, monitoring and coordinating the PPE supply chain, and discouraging the use of masks by asymptomatic individuals can reduce the demand for PPE.

sourceString: FROM: Katherine Maher, Wikimedia Foundation CEO
targetString: 发件人：Wikimedia Foundation首席执行官Katherine Maher
en-mt: From: Katherine Maher, CEO, Wikimedia Foundation

sourceString: TO: All Wikimedia Foundation staff
targetString: 收件人：Wikimedia Foundation全体员工
en-mt: To: All Wikimedia Foundation staff

sourceString: SUBJECT LINE: [Covid-19] Lightening the load and preparing for the future
targetString: 主题：[Covid-19]轻装上阵，为未来做好准备
en-mt: Theme: [Covid-19] Travel light and prepare for the future

sourceString: SEND DATE/TIME: 14 March, 2020, 00:24 UTC
targetString: 发送日期/时间：2020年3月14日00:24（协调世界时）
en-mt: Sent Date/Time: 14 March 2020 00:24 UTC

sourceString: LICENSING: CC0: No rights reserved
targetString: 许可证：CC0：不保留任何权利
en-mt: License: CC0: No Rights Reserved

sourceString: We find ourselves in remarkable circumstances this month.
targetString: 本月以来，我们遇到了一些艰难的境况。
en-mt: We've had some tough times this month.

sourceString: The COVID-19 epidemic is something that makes clear our global human interconnectedness and the responsibilities we have to one another.
targetString: 在COVID-19疫情面前，我们清楚地感受到了全人类的命运休戚与共，同时也认识到了我们对彼此的责任。
en-mt: In the face of the COVID-19 epidemic, we clearly feel that the destiny of all mankind is in solidarity, and we also recognize our responsibilities to each other.

sourceString: We don’t have precedent for its challenges, but we do know that our best response relies on the sort of global empathy, cooperation, and community building that sits at the heart of this organization.
targetString: 我们面临的是前所未有的挑战，但我们深知，应对这种挑战的最佳措施需要全世界的人们感同身受、通力合作并推动社区建设，而这正是Wikimedia的核心理念。
en-mt: The challenges we face are unprecedented, but we know that the best response to them requires people around the world to empathize, collaborate and build community, which is at the heart of Wikimedia's philosophy.

sourceString: The camaraderie and care we have seen among all of our colleagues over email, calls, and chats is a remarkable validation of the incredible humans we are fortunate enough to work with.
targetString: 全体同事之间通过电子邮件、电话和聊天互相传递友爱和关怀，这充分证明了我们各位同事的不同凡响之处，我们何其有幸能与各位共事。
en-mt: The camaraderie and care that all colleagues share with each other through emails, phone calls and chats is a testament to just how special our colleagues are and how lucky we are to work with them.

sourceString: I couldn’t be more grateful and proud to count you all as colleagues.
targetString: 能与各位成为同事，我感到无比感激和自豪。
en-mt: I am extremely grateful and proud to have you all as colleagues.

sourceString: Last week, someone shared with me their appreciation for our work.
targetString: 上周，有人对我们的工作表示了赞赏。
en-mt: Last week, we were appreciated for our work.

sourceString: They reminded me how meaningful it is for the world to be able to turn to Wikipedia right now, and what a powerful symbol it is for this critical resource to remain online and available to all.
targetString: 他们让我意识到，此时此刻全世界都能使用Wikipedia，这是多么有意义的一件事，同时还让我意识到这项关键资源保持正常运行给全世界人们所带来的象征性的力量。
en-mt: They made me realize how meaningful it is to have Wikipedia available worldwide at this very moment, and the symbolic benefits that keeping this critical resource up and running brings to people all over the world. strength.

sourceString: Your work makes this possible, whether you keep the sites stay up or our colleagues paid or our communities safe.
targetString: 无论您的工作是负责网站运营、薪资支付还是社区安全，Wikimedia的正常运转都离不开各位的辛勤付出。
en-mt: Whether your job is running the site, paying your salaries, or keeping your community safe, Wikimedia depends on your hard work.

sourceString: The world needs the information that Wikipedia provides, now more than ever.
targetString: 当下的世界比以往任何时候都更需要Wikipedia提供的信息。
en-mt: Today's world needs the information Wikipedia provides more than ever.

sourceString: This is a moment in which not only what we do, but how we do it, will make a meaningful impact on the world.
targetString: 现阶段，我们的工作内容乃至工作方式，都将对世界产生重要影响。
en-mt: At this stage, what we do and even how we work will have an important impact on the world.

sourceString: Because of the importance of this mission and your role in it, we will be making some significant adjustments to how we work together, starting this coming week.
targetString: 鉴于这份使命的重要意义以及各位同事肩负的重任，我们将从下周开始对我们的协作方式做出一些重要调整。
en-mt: Given the significance of this mission and the weight of our colleagues, starting next week we will be making some important changes to the way we collaborate.

sourceString: Adjustments to our work and schedules
targetString: 工作方式和时间表调整
en-mt: Work style and schedule adjustments

sourceString: As Robyn mentioned previously, the c-team met last night to discuss our approach and schedule for the coming days and months.
targetString: 正如Robyn之前提到的，高管团队昨晚开会，对公司在接下来的几天到几个月中的工作方式和时间表进行了讨论。
en-mt: As Robyn mentioned earlier, the executive team met last night to discuss how and when the company will work over the next few days to months.

sourceString: In that conversation, we considered what we thought would be an appropriate response to what we’re facing and the best way to keep the organization sustainable during this time.
targetString: 会上，我们考虑了我们所认为的针对公司当前面临的挑战的适当应对措施，以及保证公司在疫情期间保持可持续发展的最佳做法。
en-mt: At the meeting, we considered what we thought were the appropriate responses to the challenges our company was facing right now, as well as best practices to keep our company sustainable during the pandemic.

sourceString: Overwhelmingly we wanted to remove stress and support our mission for the long term.
targetString: 高管团队一致同意为公司员工减轻压力，从而让大家能长久支持公司的使命。
en-mt: The executive team agreed to reduce stress for the company's employees, so that everyone can support the company's mission in the long run.

sourceString: If you need to dial back, that’s okay.
targetString: 我们支持您适当减轻工作压力。
en-mt: We support you in reducing work stress appropriately.

sourceString: For all staff, contractors, and contract workers:
targetString: 对于所有员工、承包商和合同工：
en-mt: For all employees, contractors and contractors:

sourceString: our daily working expectations will be about 4 hours a day, or 20 hours a week until further notice.
targetString: 我们的日常工作时间将调整为每天4小时（或每周20小时），后续如有变化会另行通知。
en-mt: Our daily working hours will be adjusted to 4 hours per day (or 20 hours per week), and we will notify you if there are any changes.

sourceString: We’re not declaring a holiday - if you are able to work more normal hours, the mission can use you.
targetString: 本次调整并非放假通知。如果您每天能工作更长时间，我们会根据您的工作时长给您安排任务。
en-mt: This adjustment is not a holiday notice. If you are able to work longer hours each day, we will assign you tasks based on your working hours.

sourceString: However, the world is unpredictable right now, and whether you need to care for loved ones, get groceries, or go to the doctor, your well-being is our priority.
targetString: 但是，鉴于当前世界形势具有不可预测性，我们会优先照顾您的个人需求，例如照顾家人、外出购物或看病就诊。
en-mt: However, given the unpredictable nature of the current world situation, we prioritize your personal needs, such as caring for family members, going shopping or seeing a doctor.

sourceString: We are not tracking your time.
targetString: 我们不会跟踪您的工作时间。
en-mt: We do not track the hours you work.

sourceString: If you are sick, do not work.
targetString: 如果您生病了，请放下工作。
en-mt: If you are sick, take time off work.

sourceString: This should go without saying, but we’re saying it.
targetString: 这虽是不言而喻之事，但我们还是想要提醒您，请您放心。
en-mt: This goes without saying, but we want to remind you to put your mind at ease.

sourceString: No sick days or PTO required - just tell your manager and help your team revise calendars and schedules to make sure key areas of work are covered.
targetString: 您无需请病假或带薪事假，但您需要告知经理，并帮助您的团队修改工作日历和时间表，确保关键的工作领域不会受到影响。
en-mt: You are not required to take sick or paid personal leave, but you will need to inform your manager and help your team revise work calendars and schedules to ensure key areas of work are not affected.

sourceString: (If you are diagnosed positive for COVID-19, please let Bryan within T&C Ops know so T&C can help with support and make sure your situation gets appropriate attention from management).
targetString: （如果您被诊断为COVID-19阳性，请告知人才与文化运营部门的Bryan，该部门会为您提供支持，并确保您的情况得到管理层的妥善关注。）
en-mt: (If you are diagnosed positive for COVID-19, please inform Bryan in Talent & Culture Operations who will support you and ensure your situation is properly addressed by management.)

sourceString: Hourly folks will be fully paid.
targetString: 对于时薪制员工，我们会全额支付薪资。
en-mt: Hourly employees are paid in full.

sourceString: We have already said, and are recommitting to honor our commitments to our contractors and hourly staff colleagues.
targetString: 我们已经表示过，并再次承诺恪守向承包商和小时工同事们做出的承诺。
en-mt: We've said it, and we're committed again to keeping our promises to our fellow contractors and hourly workers.

sourceString: Everyone will be paid on the basis of their usual hours worked during normal circumstances.
targetString: 我们向所有人支付的薪资将继续按照其在正常情况下完成正常工作时间所获的报酬进行计算。
en-mt: We will continue to pay everyone what they would have been paid for normal work hours under normal circumstances.

sourceString: This includes if you are sick and unable to work.
targetString: 即使您生病或无法工作也不例外。
en-mt: Even if you are sick or unable to work.

sourceString: If you want to work, we support you.
targetString: 如果您愿意工作，我们会为您提供支持。
en-mt: If you're willing to work, we've got your back.

sourceString: Many people use work as a way of channeling their stress with the world around us.
targetString: 许多人选择通过工作与外界进行沟通，释放自己的压力。
en-mt: Many people choose to communicate with the outside world through work to release their stress.

sourceString: What we do can be incredibly rewarding, especially during times like this.
targetString: 我们的工作能够带来令人难以置信的回报，在目前这样的时期更是如此。
en-mt: Our work can be incredibly rewarding, especially in times like these.

sourceString: Again, this is about your self-care.
targetString: 但照顾好自己仍是第一位的。
en-mt: But taking care of yourself still comes first.

sourceString: Our ask is that you communicate with your manager, so we know what to expect and can adjust accordingly.
targetString: 我们要求您与经理保持沟通，以便我们了解您的最新情况并做出相应调整。
en-mt: We ask that you stay in touch with your manager so we can update you on your situation and adjust accordingly.

sourceString: Some work is considered essential.
targetString: 优先保障重要工作。
en-mt: Prioritize important jobs.

sourceString: There are some things that we must keep doing.
targetString: 我们必须维持一些重要工作的正常运转。
en-mt: We have to keep some important jobs going.

sourceString: The SRE, HR Ops, Trust & Safety, and Fundraising teams (among others) do critical work that may need additional support.
targetString: 网站可靠性工程团队、人力资源运营团队、信任与安全团队和募资团队（及其他团队）进行的工作至关重要，这些工作可能需要额外的支持。
en-mt: The work performed by the Site Reliability Engineering team, HR Operations team, Trust & Safety team, and Fundraising team (among others) is critical and may require additional support.

sourceString: We’ll begin a process with all departments to assess current objectives and shift our focus to supporting what’s essential for our mission.
targetString: 我们将开始与所有部门一起评估当前的各项目标，并将工作重点转移到支持对我们的使命而言至关重要的一些事项上来。
en-mt: We will begin to review current goals with all departments and shift our focus to support those that are critical to our mission.

sourceString: There’s plenty to do for all of us, we just will all focus on the most essential projects.
targetString: 我们所有人都有许多工作要做，但我们都需要将工作重点放在最重要的项目上。
en-mt: We all have a lot of work to do, but we all need to focus our efforts on the most important projects.

sourceString: Slowing now won’t hurt later.
targetString: 暂时放慢脚步不会影响未来的发展。
en-mt: Temporarily slowing down will not affect future development.

sourceString: We do not plan to go “double-time to catch up” once the pandemic has passed.
targetString: 我们不打算在疫情过后“加班赶进度”。
en-mt: We do not plan to "work overtime to catch up" after the epidemic.

sourceString: You will not be expected to work extra hours to meet deadlines which are now unrealistic.
targetString: 我们不会要求您加班追赶工期，因为现在看来这不切实际。
en-mt: We won't ask you to work overtime to catch up, because that doesn't seem practical right now.

sourceString: We accept that circumstances have changed, and will work to set new targets and timelines where appropriate.
targetString: 我们接受，当前环境已然改变，我们会酌情设定新目标和时间表。
en-mt: We accept that the current environment has changed and we will set new goals and timelines as appropriate.

sourceString: What happens with the APP (Annual Planning)?
targetString: APP（年度计划）会有何变化？
en-mt: What will happen to the APP (annual plan)?

sourceString: To adjust to our new reality and daily working hour expectations, we intend to adjust the timeline for the delivery of our 2020-2021 Annual Plan.
targetString: 为了适应新的现实状况和日常工作时间要求，我们计划调整2020-2021年度计划的交付时间表。
en-mt: In order to adapt to new realities and daily working hours, we plan to adjust the delivery schedule for the 2020-2021 annual program.

sourceString: Our intention is to propose an extension of our 2019-2020 plan that allows more time for budgeting to allow employees to prioritize critical work, self-care, and care for loved ones while accommodating those who need or wish to work a reduced schedule over the next few weeks.
targetString: 我们希望提议延长2019-2020计划，换取更多的时间用于制定预算，使各位员工能够优先安排关键工作并照顾好自己和家人；同时，为那些需要或希望在未来几周内减少工作量的员工调整工作安排。
en-mt: We would like to propose an extension to the 2019-2020 plan in exchange for more time to budget and enable employees to prioritize critical work and take care of themselves and their families; Employees adjust work schedules.

sourceString: This timeline extension greatly reduces current planning workloads and pressure across the whole organization.
targetString: 延长时间表能够显著减少整个组织当前的计划工作量并降低工作压力。
en-mt: Extended timetables can significantly reduce the current planning workload and work stress across the organization.

sourceString: We will introduce our proposal to the Board next week and will update delegates and teams on the next steps as soon as we have confirmation.
targetString: 我们将在下周向董事会提出上述提议。如果提议通过，我们会尽快向各位代表和各团队更新后续的工作安排。
en-mt: We will present this proposal to the board next week. If the proposal is passed, we will update the follow-up work arrangements to representatives and teams as soon as possible.

sourceString: Thank you to the APP team for your leadership in this.
targetString: 感谢APP团队在此过程中的领导。
en-mt: Thanks to the APP team for their leadership during this process.

sourceString: Office status, exposure, and cleaning
targetString: 办公室状况、暴露和清洁
en-mt: Office Condition, Exposure and Cleaning

sourceString: Last week, we learned that one of our SF-based colleagues may have been exposed to the COVID-19 virus.
targetString: 上周，我们了解到一位旧金山办事处的同事可能接触过COVID-19病毒。
en-mt: Last week, we learned that a colleague in our San Francisco office may have been exposed to the COVID-19 virus.

sourceString: However, out of an abundance of caution, we employed an antiviral cleaning crew to disinfect all surfaces in the San Francisco office.
targetString: 但是，出于谨慎起见，我们雇用了一些抗病毒清洁人员对旧金山办公室进行了全面消毒。
en-mt: However, out of an abundance of caution, we hired some antiviral cleaners to fully sanitize our San Francisco office.

sourceString: They utilized a hospital-grade anti-viral solution to disinfect every surface, as well as the lobby and elevator banks accessing our floor.
targetString: 他们采用医院级的消毒解决方案，对各种表面以及通往我们楼层的大厅和电梯间进行消毒。
en-mt: They use a hospital-grade sanitizing solution to sanitize various surfaces as well as the lobbies and elevator lobbies leading to our floors.

sourceString: The building is employing its own duty-of-care protocol utilizing products that support the safety of their tenants.
targetString: 办公大楼正在履行其注意义务协议，使用相应产品来保障租户的安全。
en-mt: The office building is fulfilling its duty of care agreement, using products to keep tenants safe.

sourceString: We feel comfortable that the office will be well-prepared for when we decide to return.
targetString: 我们相信，当大家决定返岗工作时，办公室已做好充分准备迎接大家。
en-mt: We believe that when you decide to return to work, the office is well prepared to welcome you.

sourceString: Our DC office is located in a WeWork, which has shared its COVID-19 protocol with us and all DC-based staff members.
targetString: 我们的华盛顿特区办事处采用的是WeWork办公室，WeWork与我们以及所有华盛顿特区工作人员共享COVID-19协议。
en-mt: Our Washington DC office is a WeWork office, and WeWork shares COVID-19 protocols with us and all DC workers.

sourceString: As of last week, our DC office moved to a fully remote setup in line with the guidance shared with San Francisco.
targetString: 截至上周，华盛顿特区办事处已按照我们与旧金山办事处分享的指导措施，转为全员远程办公。
en-mt: As of last week, the Washington, D.C. office has transitioned to fully teleworking in line with the guidance we shared with the San Francisco office.

sourceString: As some of our NYC-based colleagues know, we have also been in discussion about leasing a location in Brooklyn.
targetString: 同时，正如某些纽约办事处的同事已经知道的那样，我们也一直在讨论在布鲁克林区租赁办公地点的有关问题。
en-mt: At the same time, as some colleagues in the New York office already know, we have also been discussing the issue of leasing office space in Brooklyn.

sourceString: These discussions are continuing but may be delayed.
targetString: 这些讨论仍在继续，但可能会推迟。
en-mt: These discussions are continuing but may be delayed.

sourceString: Some of our colleagues are working remotely for the first time.
targetString: 部分同事第一次接触远程办公。
en-mt: Some colleagues are exposed to telecommuting for the first time.

sourceString: Our long-time remote colleagues know that it can be an adjustment, and wanted to offer you some advice:
targetString: 另一些长期远程办公的同事希望为这些同事提供一些调整工作方式方面的建议：
en-mt: Other colleagues who have been working remotely for a long time would like to provide these colleagues with some suggestions for adjusting the way they work:

sourceString: Limit the length of meetings to at most one or two hour increments.
targetString: 会议时间宜控制在一到两个小时内。
en-mt: Meetings should be limited to one to two hours.

sourceString: If longer sessions are required, consider how they can be broken up over the course of several days.
targetString: 如需更长的时间，请考虑将会议内容分散到多个日期的会议中。
en-mt: For longer periods of time, consider spreading the meeting content over multiple dates.

sourceString: Clearly define the meeting, have an agenda, and send reading materials in advance.
targetString: 明确确定会议目标，制定会议议程，并提前发送阅读材料。
en-mt: Clearly identify meeting goals, create a meeting agenda, and send readings ahead of time.

sourceString: Make video the default, with tools like Google Docs and Zoom to facilitate live collaboration and connection.
targetString: 将视频会议作为默认会议方式，同时使用Google Docs和Zoom等工具进行在线协作和联系。
en-mt: Make video conferencing your default meeting method, while using tools like Google Docs and Zoom to collaborate and connect online.

sourceString: Have a lead to facilitate every meeting, someone to monitor the chat for questions and track the speaker list, and someone to help take notes (or do collaborative note-taking).
targetString: 在每项会议中，安排一个主持人主持会议，安排一人负责监控聊天窗口中的提问并跟踪发言人列表的变化，安排另一人负责（或采用多人协作方式）帮助做会议记录。
en-mt: In each meeting, assign a moderator to chair the meeting, assign someone to monitor the chat window for questions and track changes to the speaker list, and assign another person to be in charge (or use a multi-person collaboration method) to help take meeting minutes.

sourceString: Send an email to tech support if you need a comfortable headset.
targetString: 如果您需要舒适的耳机，请发送电子邮件与技术支持部门联系。
en-mt: If you need a comfortable headset, please email Technical Support.

sourceString: Use your wellness reimbursement for snacks.
targetString: 使用您的健康补贴来购买零食。
en-mt: Use your health allowance to buy snacks.

sourceString: Join the #remoties channel in Slack to talk with your colleagues about distributed work
targetString: 在Slack上加入#remoties频道，与同事们讨论分布式工作
en-mt: Join the #remoties channel on Slack to discuss distributed work with colleagues

sourceString: The HR Operations team is looking into webinar-based ergonomics guidance to support the increase in distributed work across the Foundation.
targetString: 人力资源运营团队正在研究网络研讨会形式的人体工程学指导，帮助Foundation全体同事在分布式办公期间提高工作效率。
en-mt: The Human Resources Operations team is working on ergonomic guidance in the form of webinars to help Foundation colleagues improve work efficiency during distributed offices.

sourceString: This past week we asked all community grant recipients to cancel Wikimedia-funded public events, such as editathons, until the WHO declares the pandemic to be over.
targetString: 上周，我们要求所有社区受款方在WHO宣布疫情结束之前取消编辑松等由Wikimedia资助的公共活动。
en-mt: Last week, we asked all community grantees to cancel Wikimedia-funded public events such as Editpine until the WHO declares the pandemic over.
