sourceString: We let them know that we understood that our request for cancellations and other restrictions could make it impossible to complete their agreed-upon grant activities and that no one would be penalized for having to delay or modify those goals.
targetString: 这些关于取消活动的要求和其他限制要求可能会导致这些社区受款方无法完成原定的捐款活动，我们已告知他们我们理解这一点，同时还承诺他们任何人都不会因为推迟或修改这些目标而受到惩罚。
en-mt: These cancellation requests and other restrictions may prevent these community recipients from completing their planned donations, and we have informed them that we understand this and promise that none of them will delay or revise these goals because of And be punished.

sourceString: This coming week we will follow up with additional guidance on Wikimania and other regional and thematic community conferences.
targetString: 在接下来的一周中，我们会在Wikimania及其他地区社区会议和主题社区会议上继续提供更多指导。
en-mt: Over the next week, we'll continue to provide more guidance at Wikimania and other regional and themed community meetings.

sourceString: The general sentiment from around the global community seems to be both sadness at the disruption but relief at the clarity and ability to focus on their own communities, Wikimedia and otherwise.
targetString: 全球社区目前似乎正笼罩在因疫情破坏带来的悲伤中，但同时也反映出因能够清楚地对各自的社区、Wikimedia以及其他方面保持关注而感到宽慰。
en-mt: The global community seems to be currently gripped by grief over the devastation caused by the pandemic, but also reflects a sense of relief at being able to clearly keep an eye on their respective communities, Wikimedia and beyond.

sourceString: Going forward, the CRT is working to set up a page on Meta-Wiki to provide a space for the community to monitor the impact and follow our communications with them.
targetString: 未来，CRT团队将在Meta-Wiki上建立一个页面，为社区提供一个用来监控影响以及跟踪社区与我们的交流的空间。
en-mt: In the future, the CRT team will establish a page on the Meta-Wiki to provide a space for the community to monitor the impact and track the community's communication with us.

sourceString: Staying in touch around COVID-19 related issues
targetString: 保持联系，沟通COVID-19相关问题
en-mt: Stay in touch and communicate about COVID-19 related issues

sourceString: We’ll be sending an invitation to your calendars for next Thursday, 14:00 UTC/07:00 PT for a special staff meeting.
targetString: 我们计划于下周四14:00（协调世界时）/07:00（太平洋时间）召开特别员工会议，我们稍后会向您的日历中发送相关邀请。
en-mt: We have a special staff meeting planned for next Thursday at 14:00 (UTC)/07:00 (PT) and we will send an invitation to your calendar shortly.

sourceString: We’ll use this time to share additional updates, answer your questions and spend some time connecting with each other.
targetString: 会上，我们会分享一些最新情况、解答您的问题并留出一些时间供大家交流讨论。
en-mt: There, we'll share some updates, answer your questions, and leave some time for networking and discussion.

sourceString: We’re in this together and here to help however we can.
targetString: 我们团结一心，在此竭诚为您提供帮助。
en-mt: We are united and here to help you.

sourceString: In the meantime, you can continue to find the information from this email, and all other essential COVID-19 related information, on Office Wiki.
targetString: 同时，您可以在Office Wiki上了解更多在此电子邮件中提到的信息以及其他与COVID-19相关的重要信息。
en-mt: In the meantime, you can learn more about the information mentioned in this email and other important COVID-19 related information on the Office Wiki.

sourceString: The CRT will keep these pages updated and all the information in one place.
targetString: CRT团队会及时更新这些页面，并将所有信息集中到一处。
en-mt: The CRT team keeps these pages updated and keeps all the information in one place.

sourceString: We are also working to maintain regular communications with staff who reside in countries that are currently significantly affected.
targetString: 我们正设法与居住在目前受到疫情严重影响的国家/地区的员工保持定期沟通。
en-mt: We are trying to maintain regular communication with our employees who live in countries currently severely affected by the outbreak.

sourceString: If you have any questions about travel, events, a major workstream, or coverage challenge, or anything else you may need help with, please don’t hesitate to notify and work with the CRT.
targetString: 如果您对旅行、活动、主要工作流程或保险方面存在任何疑问，或者需要其他方面的帮助，请随时联系CRT团队并与之合作。
en-mt: If you have any questions about travel, events, major workflows or insurance, or need assistance with anything else, please feel free to contact and work with the CRT team.

sourceString: We’re here to help provide support and liaise as needed.
targetString: 我们在此竭诚为您提供所需的支持和联络。
en-mt: We're here to provide you with the support and contacts you need.

sourceString: If you have a confidential or sensitive matter, please email Bryan Judan - Director of HR International Global Operations.
targetString: 如果您有涉密或敏感问题，请发送电子邮件联系全球人力资源运营部门主管Bryan Judan。
en-mt: If you have a confidential or sensitive question, please email Bryan Judan, Head of Global Human Resources Operations.

sourceString: None of these changes should be seen as an abandonment of our work and obligations.
targetString: 虽然我们面临这些变动，但我们不能因此而放弃自己的工作和义务。
en-mt: Although we face these changes, we cannot give up our work and obligations because of it.

sourceString: Rather, they are a recognition that at this moment, our work and obligations will likely need to adapt in a way we have not in the past.
targetString: 相反，这次疫情让我们认识到，我们目前可能需要以过去未有过的方式对我们的工作和义务做出调整。
en-mt: Instead, the pandemic has made us realize that we may now need to adjust our work and obligations in ways that have not occurred in the past.

sourceString: These are the steps we believe are necessary to support this one another so that we can continue to work, provide our movement with the support they need, and the world with the service they rely on.
targetString: 我们认为，这些措施很有必要，能让我们支持彼此继续完成工作，为我们的行动提供所需的支持，并继续为全世界带来他们所依赖的服务。
en-mt: We believe these steps are necessary so that we can support each other to continue to do the work, provide the support our operations need, and continue to bring the services the world depends on.

sourceString: Our planned work will be there waiting for us when the time comes.
targetString: 时刻做好计划，方能不惧挑战。
en-mt: Always plan well so that you will not be afraid of challenges.

sourceString: For now, it is time to support one another and create space for the important work that will be coming in the weeks and potentially months ahead.
targetString: 现在，请大家相互支持，共同为接下来几周甚至几个月的重要工作创造空间。
en-mt: Now is the time to support each other and create space for the important work in the weeks and months ahead.

sourceString: We need all of you to make that happen, and so we need you all to take care of yourself and your families so that you can be at your best when the need arises.
targetString: 我们需要大家贡献力量来实现这一目标，因此，请大家照顾好自己和家人，以便在需要时保持最佳状态。
en-mt: We need everyone to contribute to making this happen, so please take care of yourselves and your families so that you can look your best when you need it.

sourceString: Now, please -- wash your hands and don’t touch your face!
targetString: 最后，请大家牢记勤洗手、勿碰脸。
en-mt: Finally, please remember to wash your hands frequently and don't touch your face.

sourceString: Katherine, the CRT (Amanda K, Amy V, Bryan J, Doreen D, Gregory V, Jaime V, Joel L, Lynette L, Ryan M, and Tony S), and the rest of the Leadership Team (Grant I, Heather W, Jaime V, Janeen U, Lisa S, Robyn A, Ryan M, and Toby N).
targetString: Katherine、CRT团队（Amanda K、Amy V、Bryan J、Doreen D、Gregory V、Jaime V、Joel L、Lynette L、Ryan M和Tony S）携领导团队其他成员（Grant I、Heather W、Jaime V、Janeen U、Lisa S、Robyn A、Ryan M和Toby N）敬上。
en-mt: Katherine, the CRT team (Amanda K, Amy V, Bryan J, Doreen D, Gregory V, Jaime V, Joel L, Lynette L, Ryan M, and Tony S) with the rest of the leadership team (Grant I, Heather W, Jaime V, Sincerely, Janeen U, Lisa S, Robyn A, Ryan M, and Toby N).

sourceString: b'Angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) is an enzyme attached to the outer surface (cell membranes) of cells in the lungs, arteries, heart, kidney, and intestines.
targetString: 血管紧张素转换酶 2 (Angiotensin-converting Enzyme 2, ACE2) 是一种附着在肺、动脉、心脏、肾脏和肠道中细胞外表面（细胞膜）的酶。
en-mt: Angiotensin-converting Enzyme 2 (ACE2) is an enzyme that attaches to the outer surface of cells (cell membranes) in the lungs, arteries, heart, kidneys, and intestines.

sourceString: ACE2 counters the activity of the related angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) by reducing the amount of angiotensin-II and increasing Ang(1-7) making it a promising drug target for treating cardiovascular diseases.ACE2 also serves as the entry point into cells for some coronaviruses.
targetString: ACE2 通过减少血管紧张素 II 的含量并增加 Ang(1-7) 的含量来抑制相关血管紧张素转换酶 (Angiotensin-converting Enzyme, ACE) 的活性，有望成为治疗心血管疾病的药物靶点。ACE2 也是某些冠状病毒进入细胞的入口点。
en-mt: ACE2 inhibits the activity of related angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) by reducing the content of angiotensin II and increasing the content of Ang(1-7), and it is expected to become a drug target for the treatment of cardiovascular diseases. ACE2 is also the entry point for certain coronaviruses into cells.

sourceString: The human version of the enzyme is often referred to as hACE2.
targetString: 这种酶的人源版本通常称为 hACE2。
en-mt: The human version of this enzyme is commonly called hACE2.

sourceString: Angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 is a zinc containing metalloenzyme located on the surface of endothelial and other cells.
targetString: 血管紧张素转换酶 2 是位于内皮细胞和其他细胞表面的一种含锌金属酶。
en-mt: Angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 is a zinc-containing metalloenzyme located on the surface of endothelial and other cells.

sourceString: ACE2 protein contains an N-terminal peptidase M2 domain and a C-terminal collectrin renal amino acid transporter domain.
targetString: ACE2 蛋白包含一个 N-末端肽酶 M2 结构域和一个 C-末端 Collectrin 肾脏氨基酸转运蛋白结构域。
en-mt: The ACE2 protein contains an N-terminal peptidase M2 domain and a C-terminal Collectrin kidney amino acid transporter domain.

sourceString: ACE2 is a single-pass type I membrane protein, with its enzymatically active domain exposed on the surface of cells in lungs and other tissues.
targetString: ACE2 是一种单通 I 型膜蛋白，其酶活性结构域暴露于肺和其他组织的细胞表面。
en-mt: ACE2 is a single-pass type I membrane protein whose enzymatically active domain is exposed on the cell surface of lung and other tissues.

sourceString: The extracellular domain of ACE2 is cleaved from the transmembrane domain by another enzyme known as sheddase, and the resulting soluble protein is released into the blood stream and ultimately excreted into urine.
targetString: 另一种被称为脱落酶 (sheddase) 的酶将ACE2 的细胞外结构域从跨膜结构域上裂解，产生的可溶性蛋白释放到血液中并最终排泄到尿液。
en-mt: Another enzyme, called sheddase, cleaves the extracellular domain of ACE2 from the transmembrane domain, and the resulting soluble protein is released into the blood and eventually urine.

sourceString: ACE2 is present in most organs: ACE2 is attached to the cell membrane of mainly lung type II alveolar cells, enterocytes of the small intestine, arterial and venous endothelial cells and arterial smooth muscle cells in most organs.
targetString: ACE2 存在于大多数器官中：ACE2 附着在细胞膜上，主要是肺的 II 型肺泡细胞、小肠的肠上皮细胞、大多数器官的动脉和静脉内皮细胞以及动脉平滑肌细胞。
en-mt: ACE2 is present in most organs: ACE2 is attached to cell membranes, primarily type II alveolar cells of the lung, enterocytes of the small intestine, arterial and venous endothelial cells of most organs, and arterial smooth muscle cells.

sourceString: ACE2 mRNA expression is also found in the cerebral cortex, striatum, hypothalamus, and brainstem.
targetString: 在大脑皮质、纹状体、下丘脑和脑干中也发现了 ACE2 mRNA 表达。
en-mt: ACE2 mRNA expression was also found in the cerebral cortex, striatum, hypothalamus, and brainstem.

sourceString: The primary function of ACE2 is to act as a counter balance to ACE.
targetString: ACE2 的主要功能是对 ACE 进行制衡。
en-mt: The main function of ACE2 is to check and balance ACE.

sourceString: ACE cleaves angiotensin I hormone into the vasoconstricting  angiotensin II.
targetString: ACE 将血管紧张素 I 裂解为具有血管收缩活性的血管紧张素 II。
en-mt: ACE cleaves angiotensin I to angiotensin II, which has vasoconstrictor activity.

sourceString: ACE2 in turn cleaves the carboxyl-terminal amino acid phenylalanine from angiotensin II (Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-Phe) and hydrolyses it into the vasodilator angiotensin (1-7), (H-Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-OH).
targetString: ACE2 继而裂解血管紧张素 II (Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-Phe) 的羧基末端氨基酸苯丙氨酸，并将其水解为具有血管扩张活性的血管紧张素 (1-7), (H-Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-OH)。
en-mt: ACE2 in turn cleaves the carboxy-terminal amino acid phenylalanine of angiotensin II (Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-Phe) and hydrolyzes it to angiotensin (1-7 ), (H-Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-OH).

sourceString: ACE2 can also cleave a number of other peptides including [des-Arg9]-bradykinin, apelin, neurotensin, dynorphin A, and ghrelin.
targetString: ACE2 还可以裂解许多其他肽类，包括脱精氨酸 9 缓激肽、爱帕琳肽 (apelin)、神经降压素、强啡肽 A 和胃饥饿素。
en-mt: ACE2 also cleaves many other peptides, including desarginine-9-bradykinin, apelin, neurotensin, dynorphin A, and ghrelin.

sourceString: ACE2 also regulates the membrane trafficking of the neutral amino acid transporter SLC6A19 and has been implicated in Hartnup's disease.
targetString: ACE2 还可调节中性氨基酸转运蛋白 SLC6A19 的膜运输，并且与哈纳氏病 (Hartnup) 有关。
en-mt: ACE2 also regulates membrane trafficking of the neutral amino acid transporter SLC6A19 and has been implicated in Hartnup.

sourceString: As a transmembrane protein, ACE2 serves as the main entry point into cells for some coronaviruses, including HCoV-NL63; SARS-CoV (the virus that causes SARS); and SARS-CoV-2 (the virus that causes COVID-19).
targetString: 作为一种跨膜蛋白，ACE2 是某些冠状病毒进入细胞的主要入口点，包括 HCoV-NL63；SARS-CoV（导致 SARS 的病毒）；以及 SARS-CoV-2（导致 COVID-19 的病毒）。
en-mt: As a transmembrane protein, ACE2 is the main entry point into cells for certain coronaviruses, including HCoV-NL63; SARS-CoV (the virus that causes SARS); and SARS-CoV-2 (the virus that causes COVID-19).

sourceString: More specifically, the binding of the spike S1 protein of SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV2 to the enzymatic domain of ACE2 on the surface of cells results in endocytosis and translocation of both the virus and the enzyme into endosomes located within cells.
targetString: 更具体而言，SARS-CoV 和 SARS-CoV2 的 S1 刺突蛋白与细胞表面上 ACE2 的酶结构域结合，导致内吞作用，使病毒和酶共同转位至细胞内的核内体中。
en-mt: More specifically, the S1 spike protein of SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV2 binds to the enzymatic domain of ACE2 on the cell surface, leading to endocytosis that co-translocates the virus and enzyme into endosomes inside the cell.

sourceString: This entry process also requires priming of the S protein by the host serine protease TMPRSS2, the inhibition of which is under current investigation as a potential therapeutic.This has led some to hypothesize that decreasing the levels of ACE2, in cells, might help in fighting the infection.
targetString: 这种进入过程还需要宿主丝氨酸蛋白酶 TMPRSS2 引发 S 蛋白的活化，目前正在研究该过程的抑制可否作为潜在治疗方法。一些人推测，降低细胞中的 ACE2 水平可能有助于对抗感染。
en-mt: This entry also requires the host serine protease TMPRSS2 to trigger activation of the S protein, and inhibition of this process is being investigated as a potential therapeutic approach. Some speculate that reducing ACE2 levels in cells may help fight infection.

sourceString: However, multiple professional societies and regulatory bodies have recommended continuing standard ACE inhibitor and ARB therapy.
targetString: 但是，多个专业协会和监管机构建议继续使用标准 ACE 抑制剂和 ARB 疗法。
en-mt: However, several professional societies and regulatory agencies recommend the continuation of standard ACE inhibitor and ARB therapy.

sourceString: A systematic review and meta-analysis published on July 11, 2012, found that "use of ACE inhibitors was associated with a significant 34% reduction in risk of pneumonia compared with controls."
targetString: 2012 年 7 月 11 日发表的一项系统评价和荟萃分析发现，“与对照组相比，使用 ACE 抑制剂可使肺炎风险显著降低 34%”。
en-mt: A systematic review and meta-analysis published on July 11, 2012 found that "the use of ACE inhibitors was associated with a significant 34% reduction in the risk of pneumonia compared with the control group".

sourceString: Moreover, "the risk of pneumonia was also reduced in patients treated with ACE inhibitors who were at higher risk of pneumonia, in particular those with stroke and heart failure.
targetString: 而且，“对于肺炎风险较高的患者，尤其是卒中和心力衰竭患者，使用 ACE 抑制剂治疗也会降低肺炎风险。
en-mt: And, "For patients at high risk of pneumonia, especially stroke and heart failure, treatment with ACE inhibitors also reduces the risk of pneumonia.

sourceString: Use of ACE inhibitors was also associated with a reduction in pneumonia related mortality, although the results were less robust than for overall risk of pneumonia."
targetString: 使用 ACE 抑制剂还与肺炎相关死亡率降低有关，但结果不如降低总体肺炎风险那样可靠。”
en-mt: The use of ACE inhibitors was also associated with a reduction in pneumonia-related mortality, but the results were not as reliable as the reduction in overall pneumonia risk. "

sourceString: Recombinant human ACE2 (rhACE2) is surmised to be a novel therapy for acute lung injury, and appeared to improve pulmonary hemodynamics and oxygen saturation in piglets with a lipopolysaccharide-induced acute respiratory distress syndrome.
targetString: 重组人 ACE2 (rhACE2) 被认为是治疗急性肺损伤的一种新方法，似乎可以改善脂多糖所致的急性呼吸窘迫综合征仔猪中肺血流动力学指标和血氧饱和度。
en-mt: Recombinant human ACE2 (rhACE2), considered a novel approach for the treatment of acute lung injury, appears to improve pulmonary hemodynamic parameters and oxygen saturation in piglets with lipopolysaccharide-induced acute respiratory distress syndrome.

sourceString: The half-life of rhACE2 in human beings is about 10 hours and the onset of action is 30 minutes in addition to the course of effect (duration) of 24 hours.
targetString: rhACE2 在人体中的半衰期约为 10 小时，起效时间为 30 分钟，作用过程（持续时间）为 24 小时。
en-mt: The half-life of rhACE2 in humans is approximately 10 hours, the onset of action is 30 minutes, and the course of action (duration) is 24 hours.

sourceString: Several findings suggest that rhACE2 may be a promising drug for those with intolerance to classic renin-angiotensin system inhibitors (RAS inhibitors) or in diseases where circulating angiotensin II is elevated.Infused rhACE2 has been evaluated in clinical trials for the treatment of acute respiratory distress syndrome.
targetString: 一些研究结果表明，对经典肾素-血管紧张素系统 (renin-angiotensin system, RAS) 抑制剂不耐受的患者或循环血管紧张素 II 水平升高的疾病而言，rhACE2 可能是一种很有前景的药物。rhACE2 输注对急性呼吸窘迫综合征的疗效已经得到了临床试验的评价。
en-mt: Several findings suggest that rhACE2 may be a useful therapeutic agent in patients intolerant to classical renin-angiotensin system (RAS) inhibitors or in diseases with elevated circulating angiotensin II levels. Foreground drug. The efficacy of rhACE2 infusion on acute respiratory distress syndrome has been evaluated in clinical trials.

sourceString: b'COVID-19 apps are mobile software applications designed to aid contact tracing in response to the 2019-20 coronavirus pandemic, i.e. the process of identifying persons ("contacts") who may have been in contact with an infected individual.
targetString: b'COVID-19 应用程序是一种移动软件，旨在应对 2019-20 冠状病毒疫情，帮助追踪密切接触者，识别可能接触过感染者的个人（“接触者”）。
en-mt: The b'COVID-19 app is a mobile software developed in response to the 2019-20 coronavirus outbreak to help trace contacts and identify individuals who may have been exposed to an infected person (“Contacts”).

sourceString: Numerous applications were developed or proposed, with official government support in some territories and jurisdictions.
targetString: 一些地区和管辖区在官方政府的支持下开发或提出了很多应用程序。
en-mt: Several regions and jurisdictions have developed or proposed many applications with official government support.

sourceString: Several frameworks for building contact tracing apps have been developed.
targetString: 很多用于构建密切接触者追踪应用程序的框架已建立。
en-mt: Many frameworks have been established for building contact tracing applications.

sourceString: Privacy concerns have been raised, especially about systems that are based on tracking the geographical location of app users.
targetString: 隐私问题也引起了多方关注，尤其是有些系统需要追踪应用程序用户的地理位置。
en-mt: Privacy issues have also raised concerns, especially as some systems need to track the geographic location of app users.

sourceString: Less intrusive alternatives include the use of Bluetooth signals to log a user's proximity to other cellphones.
targetString: 侵入性较低的替代方案包括使用蓝牙信号记录用户与其他手机之间的距离。
en-mt: Less intrusive alternatives include using Bluetooth signals to log the distance between the user and other phones.

sourceString: On 10 April 2020, Google and Apple jointly announced that they would integrate functionality to support such Bluetooth-based apps directly into their Android and iOS operating systems.
targetString: 2020 年 4 月 10 日，谷歌和苹果联合宣布会将这种支持蓝牙应用的功能直接集成至安卓和 iOS 操作系统中。
en-mt: On April 10, 2020, Google and Apple jointly announced that they will directly integrate this Bluetooth-enabled application into the Android and iOS operating systems.

sourceString: In China, the Chinese government, in conjunction with Alipay, has deployed an app that allows citizens to check if they have been in contact with people that have COVID-19.
targetString: 在中国，政府与支付宝联合开发了一款应用程序，支持公民自行检查是否接触过 COVID-19 患者。
en-mt: In China, the government and Alipay jointly developed an app that allows citizens to self-check if they have been exposed to a COVID-19 patient.

sourceString: It is in use across more than 200 Chinese cities.In Singapore, an app called TraceTogether is being used.
targetString: 该程序目前已在中国 200 多个城市使用。新加坡则推出了一款名为 TraceTogether 的应用程序。
en-mt: The program is currently used in more than 200 cities in China. Singapore has launched an app called TraceTogether.

sourceString: The app was developed by local IT community, released as open source and will be handed over to the government.North Macedonia launched "StopKorona!", a Bluetooth-based app to trace exposure with potentially infected persons and  provide a fast response to healthcare authorities.
targetString: 这款应用由当地 IT 社区开发，作为开源软件发布，并将移交给政府。北马其顿则推出了一款基于蓝牙的应用程序“StopKorona!”，用于跟踪潜在感染者的暴露情况，帮助医疗机构做出快速响应。
en-mt: Developed by the local IT community, the app is released as open source software and will be handed over to the government. North Macedonia launched a Bluetooth-based app "StopKorona!" to track the exposure of potentially infected people and help medical institutions respond quickly.

sourceString: The app was developed by the Ministry of Communication and Technology and Ministry of Health.
targetString: 该应用程序由北马其顿通信技术部和卫生部开发。
en-mt: The app was developed by the Ministry of Communication Technologies and the Ministry of Health of North Macedonia.

sourceString: As of 14 April 2020, the app was awaiting approval by the Google Play Store and Apple App Store.
targetString: 截至 2020 年 4 月 14 日，该应用程序正在等待 Google Play Store 和 Apple App Store 的批准。
en-mt: As of April 14, 2020, the app is awaiting approval from the Google Play Store and Apple App Store.

sourceString: On 12 April, the government stated that the contact tracing app was in an advanced stage of development, and would be available for deployment within weeks.A similar app is planned in Ireland, and in France ("StopCovid").
targetString: 4 月 12 日，政府宣布密切接触者追踪应用程序已进入开发高级阶段，并将在未来几周内投入使用。爱尔兰和法国也计划推出类似应用程序（“StopCovid”）。
en-mt: On April 12, the government announced that the contact tracing app had entered an advanced stage of development and would be available in the coming weeks. Similar apps (“StopCovid”) are also planned for Ireland and France.

sourceString: Both Australia and New Zealand are considering apps based on Singapore's TraceTogether app and BlueTrace protocol.Russia intends to introduce a geofencing app for patients diagnosed with COVID-19 living in Moscow, designed to ensure they do not leave home.
targetString: 澳大利亚和新西兰都在考虑基于新加坡的 TraceTogether 应用程序和 BlueTrace 协议开发类似应用程序。俄罗斯计划为生活在莫斯科的 COVID-19 确诊患者推出一款地理围栏应用，以确保患者不会离家外出。
en-mt: Both Australia and New Zealand are considering developing similar applications based on Singapore's TraceTogether application and the BlueTrace protocol. Russia plans to roll out a geofencing app for COVID-19 patients living in Moscow to ensure patients don't leave their homes.

sourceString: Ross Anderson, professor of security engineering at Cambridge University, listed a number of potential practical problems with app-based systems, including false positives and the potential lack of effectiveness if takeup of the app is limited to only a small fraction of the population.
targetString: 剑桥大学安全工程学教授 Ross Anderson 列举了应用程序系统可能存在的一些实际问题，包括假阳性误报，以及如果只有一小部分人群使用该应用程序，则可能缺乏有效性。
en-mt: Ross Anderson, professor of security engineering at the University of Cambridge, cites some practical problems that app systems can have, including false positives and false positives, and a possible lack of effectiveness if only a small percentage of the population uses the app.

sourceString: Addressing concerns about the spread of misleading or harmful "coronavirus" apps, Apple set limits on which types of organizations could add coronavirus-related apps to its App Store, limiting them to only "official" or otherwise reputable organizations.
targetString: 为杜绝误导性或有害“冠状病毒”应用程序的传播，苹果对可在苹果应用商店中发布冠状病毒相关应用程序的组织类型设置了限制，即仅限于“官方”或其他声誉良好的组织。
en-mt: To prevent the spread of misleading or harmful "coronavirus" apps, Apple has limited the types of organizations that can publish coronavirus-related apps in the App Store to "official" or otherwise reputable organizations.

sourceString: Google and Amazon have implemented similar restrictions.
targetString: 谷歌和亚马逊也都实施了类似限制。
en-mt: Both Google and Amazon have implemented similar restrictions.

sourceString: Privacy campaigners voiced their concern regarding the implications of mass surveillance using coronavirus apps, in particular about whether surveillance infrastructure created to deal with the coronavirus pandemic will be dismantled once the threat has passed.
targetString: 隐私维权人士称对使用冠状病毒应用程序进行大规模监控表示担忧，尤其是疫情威胁消除后，是否应拆除为应对冠状病毒疫情而搭建的监控基础设施。
en-mt: Privacy advocates have expressed concern about the use of coronavirus apps for mass surveillance, especially if the surveillance infrastructure built in response to the coronavirus outbreak should be dismantled once the threat of the outbreak is eliminated.

sourceString: Amnesty International and over 100 other organizations issued a statement calling for limits on this kind of surveillance.
targetString: 大赦国际和 100 多个其他组织均呼吁限制这种监视。
en-mt: Amnesty International and more than 100 other organizations have called for limits on such surveillance.

sourceString: The organisations declared eight conditions on governmental projects:
targetString: 这些组织宣布了政府项目需满足的八项条件：
en-mt: The organizations announced eight conditions for government projects to meet:

sourceString: surveillance would have to be "lawful, necessary and proportionate";
targetString: 监视必须“合法、必要且相称”；
en-mt: Surveillance must be "lawful, necessary and proportionate";

sourceString: extensions of monitoring and surveillance would have to have sunset clauses;
targetString: 监测和监视扩展必须设有“日落”条款；
en-mt: Monitoring and surveillance extensions must have a "sunset" clause;

sourceString: the use of data would have to be limited to COVID-19 purposes;
targetString: 收集的数据仅限用于 COVID-19 目的；
en-mt: The data collected is only used for COVID-19 purposes;

sourceString: data security and anonymity would have to be protected and shown to be protected based on evidence;
targetString: 数据安全与匿名信息必须受到保护，并有证据显示切实受到了保护；
en-mt: Data security and anonymized information must be protected and there is evidence that such protection is in effect;

sourceString: digital surveillance would have to avoid exacerbating discrimination and marginalisation;
targetString: 数字化监控必须避免加剧歧视和边缘化；
en-mt: Digital surveillance must avoid exacerbating discrimination and marginalization;

sourceString: any sharing of data with third parties would have to be defined in law;
targetString: 与第三方之间的任何数据分享均应依法界定；
en-mt: Any data sharing with third parties shall be legally defined;

sourceString: there would have to be safeguards against abuse and the rights of citizens to respond to abuses;
targetString: 必须为防止数据滥用提供保障措施，并为公民提供应对数据滥用的权利；
en-mt: Safeguards must be provided to prevent data misuse and provide citizens with the right to respond to data misuse;

sourceString: meaningful participation by all "relevant stakeholders" would be required, including that of public health experts and marginalised groups.The German Chaos Computer Club (CCC) and Reporters Without Borders (Reporter ohne Grenzen) (RSF) also issued checklists.
targetString: 要求所有“相关利益相关方”“切实参与”，包括要求公共卫生专家和边缘化群体参与其中。德国混沌计算机俱乐部 (CCC) 和无国界记者组织 (Reporter ohne Grenzen) (RSF) 也发布了核查清单。
en-mt: Calls for "substantial engagement" of all "relevant stakeholders", including public health experts and marginalized groups. The German Chaos Computer Club (CCC) and Reporters Without Borders (Reporter ohne Grenzen) (RSF) also published checklists.

sourceString: The proposed Google/Apple plan intends to address the problem of persistent surveillance by removing the tracing mechanism from their device operating systems once it is no longer needed.
targetString: 谷歌/苹果拟议计划旨在解决持续监控问题，一旦不再需要追踪，便要将其从设备操作系统中移除。
en-mt: The proposed Google/Apple plan aims to address the problem of constant surveillance by removing tracking from device operating systems once it is no longer necessary.

sourceString: Some countries used network-based location tracking instead of apps, eliminating both the need to download an app and the ability to avoid tracking.
targetString: 一些国家则采用了基于网络而非应用程序的位置跟踪，用户无需下载应用，同时也避免了被跟踪的情况。
en-mt: Some countries have adopted web-based location tracking instead of apps, so users don't need to download apps and avoid being tracked.

sourceString: In Israel, network-based tracking was approved.
targetString: 在以色列，基于网络的跟踪已获得批准。
en-mt: In Israel, web-based tracking has been approved.

sourceString: Network-based solutions that have access to raw location data have significant potential privacy problems.
targetString: 可访问原始位置数据的网络解决方案可能存在严重的隐私问题。
en-mt: Web solutions that have access to raw location data can have serious privacy concerns.

sourceString: However, not all systems with central servers need to have access to personal location data; a number of privacy-preserving systems have been created that use central servers only for intercommunication (see section below).
targetString: 然而，并非所有自带中央服务器的系统均需访问个人位置数据；很多仅使用中央服务器进行相互通信的隐私保护系统现已创建（详见下文）。
en-mt: However, not all systems with their own central server require access to personal location data; many privacy-preserving systems have been created that use only a central server to communicate with each other (see below).

sourceString: In South Korea, a non-app-based system was used to perform contact tracing.
targetString: 韩国推出了一款并非基于应用程序的系统来执行接触者追踪任务。
en-mt: South Korea rolled out a non-app-based system to carry out contact tracing tasks.

sourceString: Instead of using a dedicated app, the system gathered tracking information from a variety of sources including mobile device tracking data and card transaction data, and combined these to generate notices via text messages to potentially-infected individuals.
targetString: 该系统并未使用专门的应用程序，而是选择从各种来源收集跟踪信息，包括移动设备跟踪数据和信用卡交易数据，然后将这些信息结合起来，通过短信向潜在感染者发送通知。
en-mt: Instead of using a dedicated app, the system opts to collect tracking information from a variety of sources, including mobile device tracking data and credit card transaction data, and then combines that information to send notifications to potentially infected individuals via text message.

sourceString: In addition to using this information to alert potential contacts, the government has also made the location information publicly available, something permitted because of far-reaching changes to information privacy laws after the MERS outbreak in that country.
targetString: 除了利用这些信息提醒潜在密切接触者外，政府还获准公开了位置信息，因为该国在爆发 MERS 疫情后，对信息隐私法进行了重大调整。
en-mt: In addition to using the information to alert potential close contacts, the government was given permission to release location information as the country made major changes to information privacy laws in the wake of the MERS outbreak.

sourceString: This information is available to the public via a number of apps and websites.Countries including Germany considered using both centralized and privacy-preserving systems.
targetString: 公众可通过很多应用程序和网站获得这些信息。还有一些国家（包括德国）在考虑同时使用集中式系统和隐私保护系统。
en-mt: This information is available to the public through many applications and websites. Still others, including Germany, are considering using both centralized and privacy-preserving systems.

sourceString: As of 6 April 2020, the details had not yet been released.
targetString: 截至 2020 年 4 月 6 日，尚未公布具体细节。
en-mt: As of April 6, 2020, no specific details have been announced.

sourceString: Privacy-preserving contact tracing is a well-established concept, with a substantial body of research literature dating back to at least 2013.As of 7 April 2020, over a dozen expert groups were working on privacy-friendly solutions, such as using Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) to log a user's proximity to other cellphones.
targetString: 隐私保护密切接触者追踪是一个公认理念，大量相关研究文献至少可追溯到 2013 年。截至 2020 年 4 月 7 日，有十多个专家组在研究隐私保护解决方案，如使用蓝牙低功耗 (BLE) 记录用户与其他手机之间的距离。
en-mt: Privacy-preserving close contact tracing is a well-established concept, with a wealth of related research literature dating back to at least 2013. As of April 7, 2020, more than a dozen expert groups are working on privacy-preserving solutions, such as using Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) to log the distance between a user and other phones.

sourceString: However, PEPP-PT is a co-ordination effort which contains both centralised and decentralised approaches, and is not a single protocol.Decentralised protocols include Decentralized Privacy-Preserving Proximity Tracing (DP-PPT/DP-3T), Temporary Contact Numbers (TCN, fka Contact Event Numbers, CEN), Privacy Sensitive Protocols and Mechanisms for Mobile Contact Tracing (PACT) and others.
targetString: PEPP-PT 是一个包含集中式和分散式方法的协调方案，并非单一协议。分散协议包含分散隐私保护邻近追踪 (DP-PPT/DP-3T)、临时联系号码（TCN、原来称联系事件号码，CEN）、隐私敏感协议和移动联系追踪机制 (PACT) 等。
en-mt: PEPP-PT is a coordinated scheme involving centralized and decentralized approaches, not a single agreement. Decentralized protocols include Decentralized Privacy Preserving Proximity Tracing (DP-PPT/DP-3T), Temporary Contact Number (TCN, formerly known as Contact Event Number, CEN), Privacy Sensitive Protocol and Mobile Contact Tracing Mechanism (PACT), etc.

sourceString: In these protocols, identifiable personal data never leaves the device, and all matching happens on-device.
targetString: 根据这些协议，可识别身份的个人数据绝不会离开设备，所有匹配均在设备上进行。
en-mt: Under these agreements, personally identifiable data never leaves the device, and all matching occurs on the device.

sourceString: The Privacy Group at MIT Media Lab has been developing SafePaths, a platform for using privacy-preserving techniques when collecting and using location or path intersection data to track the spread of COVID-19.
targetString: 麻省理工学院媒体实验室的隐私小组一直在开发 SafePaths 平台，该平台在收集和使用位置或路径交叉数据来跟踪 COVID-19 时会使用隐私保护技术。
en-mt: The Privacy Group at the MIT Media Lab has been developing the SafePaths platform, which uses privacy-preserving techniques when collecting and using location or path intersection data to track COVID-19.

sourceString: It is based on research from the whitepaper "Apps Gone Rogue: Maintaining Personal Privacy in an Epidemic" released in March 2020.Another similar effort is the SafeTrace platform by Enigma MPC, a company developing privacy technologies that was also originally founded at the MIT Media Lab.
targetString: 平台基于 2020 年 3 月发布的《应用程序无赖化：在疫情中维护个人隐私》白皮书研究内容开发。除此之外，一家最初同样在麻省理工学院媒体实验室创立并致力于开发隐私技术的公司 Enigma MPC 也在开发一个名为 SafeTrace 的类似平台。
en-mt: The platform is developed based on the research content of the white paper "App Rogue: Maintaining Personal Privacy During the Epidemic" released in March 2020. In addition, Enigma MPC, a company originally founded at the MIT Media Lab to develop privacy technologies, is also developing a similar platform called SafeTrace.

sourceString: SafeTrace utilizes secure hardware technologies to allow users to share sensitive location and health data with other users and officials, without compromising the privacy of that data.
targetString: SafeTrace 利用安全硬件技术，支持用户在不损害数据隐私性的情况下向其他用户和官员分享敏感的位置和健康数据。
en-mt: SafeTrace leverages secure hardware technology to allow users to share sensitive location and health data with other users and officials without compromising data privacy.

sourceString: On 5 April 2020, the global TCN Coalition was founded by groups that had coalesced around what was essentially the same approach and largely overlapping protocols, with the goal to reduce fragmentation, and enable global interoperability of tracing and alerting apps, a key aspect of achieving widespread adoption.
targetString: 2020 年 4 月 5 日，一些团体围绕基本相同的方法和基本重叠的协议联合成立了全球 TCN 联盟，目标是要减少碎片化信息，并支持追踪和警报应用程序的全球互操作性，这是实现广泛应用的一个关键。
en-mt: On April 5, 2020, several groups joined together to form the Global TCN Alliance around essentially the same approach and essentially overlapping protocols, with the goal of reducing fragmented information and supporting global interoperability of tracking and alerting applications, which is A key to widespread application.

sourceString: On 9 April 2020, the Singaporean government announced that it had open-sourced the BlueTrace protocol used by its official government app.
targetString: 2020 年 4 月 9 日，新加坡政府宣布，其官方政府应用程序使用的是开源 BlueTrace 协议。
en-mt: On April 9, 2020, the Singapore government announced that its official government apps are using the open-source BlueTrace protocol.

sourceString: On 10 April 2020, Google and Apple, the companies that control the Android and iOS mobile platforms, announced an initiative for contact tracing, which they claimed would preserve privacy, based on a combination of Bluetooth Low Energy technology and privacy-preserving cryptography.
targetString: 2020 年 4 月 10 日，分别控制安卓和 iOS 移动平台的谷歌和苹果宣布了一项密切接触者追踪计划，声称该计划将蓝牙低功耗技术与隐私保护加密技术相结合，可起到保护隐私的作用。
en-mt: On April 10, 2020, Google and Apple, which respectively control the Android and iOS mobile platforms, announced a close contact tracing plan, claiming that the plan combines Bluetooth low energy technology with privacy protection encryption technology to protect privacy. role.

sourceString: They also published specifications of the core technologies used in the system.
targetString: 此外，他们还公布了系统中使用的核心技术规范。
en-mt: Additionally, they published the core technical specifications used in the system.

sourceString: According to Apple and Google, the system is intended to be rolled out in three stages:
targetString: 苹果和谷歌称，该系统计划分三个阶段推出：
en-mt: According to Apple and Google, the system is planned to roll out in three phases:

sourceString: rollout of tools to enable governments to create official privacy-preserving coronavirus tracing apps
targetString: 推出一些工具，以支持政府创建可保护隐私的官方冠状病毒追踪应用
en-mt: Roll out tools to support governments in creating an official, privacy-preserving coronavirus tracking app

sourceString: integration of this functionality directly into iOS and AndroidGoogle and Apple plan to address the take-up and persistent surveillance problems by first distributing the system through operating system updates, and later removing it in the same way once the threat has passed.
targetString: 将这一功能直接集成至 iOS 和安卓系统中，谷歌和苹果计划首先通过操作系统更新来推出该系统，疫情威胁过后也将通过同样的方式删除该系统，以此解决后续监控问题。
en-mt: Integrating this feature directly into iOS and Android systems, Google and Apple plan to launch the system first through operating system updates, and will remove the system in the same way after the threat of the epidemic to solve subsequent monitoring problems.

sourceString: b'Drug repositioning (also known as drug repurposing, re-profiling, re-tasking or therapeutic switching) is the repurposing of an approved drug for the treatment of a different disease or medical condition than that for which it was originally developed.
targetString: b 药物重新定位（也称为药物重新利用、再评价、再分配或治疗转换）是指将一种已获批准的药物改作其他用途，以治疗与其最初研发目的不同的疾病或医疗状况。
en-mt: b Drug repurposing (also known as drug repurposing, reevaluation, redistribution, or therapeutic switching) is the repurposing of an approved drug to treat a disease or medical condition for which it was not originally developed.

sourceString: This is one line of scientific research which is currently being pursued to develop safe and effective COVID-19 treatments.
targetString: 这是目前为开发安全有效的 COVID-19 治疗方法而进行的一条科研路线。
en-mt: This is one line of research currently underway to develop safe and effective treatments for COVID-19.

sourceString: Other research directions include the development of a COVID-19 vaccine and convalescent plasma transfusion.SARS-CoV-2 has about 66 druggable proteins, each of which has multiple ligand binding sites.
targetString: 其他研究方向包括开发 COVID-19 疫苗和恢复期血浆输血。SARS-CoV-2 约有 66 种可用于制药的蛋白质，每种蛋白质均有多个配体结合位点。
en-mt: Other research directions include the development of a COVID-19 vaccine and convalescent plasma transfusions. SARS-CoV-2 has approximately 66 pharmaceutically usable proteins, each with multiple ligand-binding sites.

sourceString: Analyzing those binding sites provide the reasonable project of developing effective antiviral drug against COVID-19 proteins.
targetString: 分析这些结合位点为开发针对 COVID-19 蛋白的有效抗病毒药物提供了合理的方案。
en-mt: Analysis of these binding sites provides a rational approach for the development of effective antiviral drugs against COVID-19 proteins.

sourceString: Of the most important SARS-CoV-2 target proteins are papain-like protease, RNA dependent RNA polymerase, helicase, S protein, and ADP ribophosphatase.
targetString: 最重要的 SARS-CoV-2 靶蛋白包括木瓜样蛋白酶、RNA 依赖性 RNA 聚合酶、解旋酶、S 蛋白和 ADP 核糖二磷酸酶。
en-mt: The most important SARS-CoV-2 target proteins include papain-like protease, RNA-dependent RNA polymerase, helicase, S protein, and ADP ribose diphosphatase.

sourceString: Hussein A A, et al studied several candidate compounds which then optimized and analyzed for their skeleton similarity with the highest similar approved drugs in order to accelerate a potent anti-SARS-CoV-2 drug development in his preclinical study to be recommended in a clinical study design.
targetString: Hussein A A 等人研究了几种候选化合物，随后对照已批准的最高相似度药物，对这些候选化合物的骨架相似性进行了优化和分析，以便在其临床前试验中加速有效的抗 SARS-CoV-2 药物的开发，并在临床研究设计中加以推荐。
en-mt: Hussein AA et al studied several candidate compounds, and then optimized and analyzed the skeleton similarity of these candidates against the highest similarity approved drug, in order to accelerate the effective anti-SARS-CoV- 2 Drug development and recommendations in clinical study design.

sourceString: Chloroquine is an anti-malarial medication that is also used against some auto-immune diseases.
targetString: 氯喹是一种抗疟疾药物，也用于治疗一些自身免疫性疾病。
en-mt: Chloroquine is an antimalarial drug that is also used to treat some autoimmune diseases.

sourceString: On 18 March, the WHO announced that chloroquine and the related hydroxychloroquine would be among the four drugs studied as part of the Solidarity clinical trial.
targetString: 3 月 18 日，世界卫生组织宣布，作为团结临床试验的一部分，将对包括氯喹和相关羟基氯喹在内的四种药物进行研究。
en-mt: On March 18, the World Health Organization announced that four drugs, including chloroquine and the related hydroxychloroquine, would be studied as part of the Solidarity clinical trial.

sourceString: New York governor Andrew Cuomo announced that New York State trials of chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine would begin on 24 March.On 28 March, the FDA authorized the use of hydroxychloroquine sulfate and chloroquine phosphate under an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA).
targetString: 纽约州州长 Andrew Cuomo 宣布，纽约州氯喹和羟基氯喹试验将于 3 月 24 日开始。3 月 28 日，FDA 发布紧急使用授权 (EUA)，允许使用硫酸羟氯喹和磷酸氯喹。
en-mt: New York State Governor Andrew Cuomo announced that New York State's chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine trials will begin on March 24. On March 28, the FDA issued an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) allowing the use of hydroxychloroquine sulfate and chloroquine phosphate.

sourceString: The treatment has not been approved by the FDA's clinical trials process and is authorized under the EUA only as an experimental treatment for emergency use in patients who are hospitalized but are not able to receive treatment in a clinical trial.
targetString: 该疗法尚未获得 FDA 的临床试验程序批准，仅获 EUA 批准，以作为一种实验性治疗方法，供已住院治疗但无法在临床试验中接受治疗的患者紧急使用。
en-mt: The therapy has not yet been approved under the FDA's clinical trial program and has only been approved under an EUA as an experimental treatment for emergency use in hospitalized patients who cannot be treated in a clinical trial.

sourceString: The CDC has said that "the use, dosing, or duration of hydroxychloroquine for prophylaxis or treatment of SARS-CoV-2 infection" are not yet established.
targetString: 疾病防治中心 (Center for Disease Control and Prevention, CDC) 表示，“用于预防或治疗 SARS-CoV-2 感染的羟基氯喹的使用、剂量或用药时间”尚未确定。
en-mt: The Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) stated that "the use, dose, or timing of hydroxychloroquine for the prevention or treatment of SARS-CoV-2 infection" has not been established.

sourceString: Doctors have said they are using the drug when "there's no other option".
targetString: 医生表示他们在“别无选择”时使用该药物。
en-mt: Doctors say they use the drug when they have "no other choice".

sourceString: A Turkish research team in Istanbul is conducting a small study on the use of chloroquine in combination with zinc, vitamin A, vitamin C and vitamin D.
targetString: 伊斯坦布尔的一个土耳其研究小组正在进行一项关于氯喹与锌、维生素 A、维生素 C 和维生素 D 联合使用的小型研究。
en-mt: A Turkish research group in Istanbul is conducting a small study of chloroquine in combination with zinc, vitamin A, vitamin C, and vitamin D.

sourceString: Large studies are underway at Duke University and the University of Oxford.
targetString: 杜克大学和牛津大学正在进行大规模研究。
en-mt: Large-scale studies are underway at Duke and Oxford Universities.

sourceString: NYU Langone Medical School is conducting a trial on the safety and efficacy of preventative use of hydroxychloroquine.
targetString: 纽约大学朗格尼医学院正在进行一项关于预防性使用羟基氯喹的安全性和疗效的试验。
en-mt: NYU Langone School of Medicine is conducting a trial of the safety and efficacy of prophylactic use of hydroxychloroquine.

sourceString: Chinese clinical trials in Wuhan and Shenzhen claimed to show favipiravir was "clearly effective".
targetString: 中国在武汉和深圳进行的临床试验称，法匹拉韦“明显有效”。
en-mt: Chinese clinical trials in Wuhan and Shenzhen said favipiravir was "clearly effective".

sourceString: 35 patients in Shenzhen tested negative in a median of 4 days, while the length of illness was 11 days in the 45 patients who did not receive it.
targetString: 在深圳，35 名患者在平均 4 天内测试结果转为阴性，而 45 名未接受该药治疗的患者病程为 11 天。
en-mt: In Shenzhen, 35 patients tested negative within an average of 4 days, compared with 11 days for 45 patients who did not receive the drug.

sourceString: In a study conducted in Wuhan on 240 patients with pneumonia, half were given favipiravir and half received umifenovir.
targetString: 在武汉进行的一项针对 240 名肺炎患者的研究中，一半接受了法匹拉韦，另一半接受了阿比朵尔。
en-mt: In a study of 240 pneumonia patients in Wuhan, half received favipiravir and the other half received arbidol.

sourceString: The Italian Pharmaceutical Agency reminded the public that the existing evidence in support of the drug is scant and preliminary.
targetString: 意大利药监局提醒公众，支持这种药物的现有证据不足且是初步的。
en-mt: The Italian Medicines Agency reminded the public that the available evidence in support of the drug is weak and preliminary.

sourceString: On 2 April, Germany announced that it would purchase the drug from Japan for its stockpile, and use the military to deliver the drug to university hospitals, where the drug will be used to treat COVID-19 patients.
targetString: 4 月 2 日，德国宣布将从日本购买这种药物作为储备，并用军队将药物运送到大学医院，以使用该药物治疗医院内的 COVID-19 患者。
en-mt: On April 2, Germany announced that it would buy the drug from Japan as a stockpile and use the military to transport it to university hospitals where it would be used to treat COVID-19 patients there.

sourceString: According to the South China Morning Post, Shinzo Abe has made overtures to the Trump administration about purchasing the drug.The drug may be less effective in severe cases of illness where the virus has already multiplied.
targetString: 据《南华早报》报道，安倍晋三已向特朗普政府提出了购买该药的建议。在病毒已经繁殖的重症患者中，该药物的疗效可能会降低。
en-mt: According to the South China Morning Post, Abe has proposed to the Trump administration to buy the drug. In critically ill patients whose virus has already multiplied, the drug may be less effective.

sourceString: It may not be safe for use by pregnant women or those trying to conceive.
targetString: 孕妇或备孕期人士使用该药可能会不安全。
en-mt: This medicine may not be safe if you are pregnant or trying to become pregnant.

sourceString: One study of lopinavir/ritonavir (Kaletra), a combination of the antivirals lopinavir and ritonavir, concluded that "no benefit was observed".
targetString: 一项关于洛匹那韦/利托那韦 (Kaletra)（抗病毒药物洛匹那韦和利托那韦的联合用药）的研究得出结论，“未观察到任何益处”。
en-mt: A study of lopinavir/ritonavir (Kaletra), a combination of the antiviral drugs lopinavir and ritonavir, concluded that "no benefit was observed".

sourceString: The drugs were designed to inhibit HIV from replicating by binding to the protease.
targetString: 这些药物旨在通过与蛋白酶结合以抑制人类免疫缺陷病毒 (Human Immunodeficiency Virus, HIV) 的复制。
en-mt: These drugs are designed to inhibit the replication of Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV) by binding to proteases.

sourceString: A team of researchers at the University of Colorado are trying to modify the drugs to find a compound that will bind with the protease of SARS-CoV-2.There are criticisms within the scientific community about directing resources to repurposing drugs specifically developed for HIV/AIDS.
targetString: 科罗拉多大学的一组研究人员正在尝试对药物进行修饰，以找到能够与 SARS-CoV-2 蛋白酶结合的化合物。科学界对于将资源用于重新利用专门为 HIV/获得性免疫缺乏综合征 (Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndrome, AIDS) 开发的药物提出了批评。
en-mt: A team of researchers at the University of Colorado is trying to modify the drug to find compounds that bind to the SARS-CoV-2 protease. The scientific community has criticized resources for repurposing drugs developed specifically for HIV/Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndrome (AIDS).

sourceString: The WHO included lopinavir/ritonavir in the international Solidarity trial.
targetString: 世界卫生组织将洛匹那韦/利托那韦纳入国际团结试验。
en-mt: The World Health Organization includes lopinavir/ritonavir in the International Solidarity Trial.

sourceString: Remdesivir was created and developed by Gilead Sciences as a treatment for Ebola virus disease and Marburg virus infections . Gilead Sciences subsequently discovered that Remdesivir had antiviral activity in vitro against multiple filo-, pneumo-, paramyxo-, and corona- viruses .
targetString: 瑞德西韦是吉利德科学公司创造和开发的一种治疗埃博拉病毒和马尔堡病毒感染的药物。吉利德科学公司随后发现，瑞德西韦在体外对多种丝状病毒、肺炎病毒、副粘病毒和冠状病毒具有抗病毒活性。
en-mt: Remdesivir is a drug created and developed by Gilead Sciences to treat Ebola and Marburg virus infections. Gilead Sciences subsequently found that remdesivir had antiviral activity against a variety of filoviruses, pneumoviruses, paramyxoviruses, and coronaviruses in vitro.

sourceString: One issue with antiviral treatment is the development of resistance through mutations that can lead to more severe disease and transmission.
targetString: 抗病毒治疗的一个问题是，通过突变产生的耐药性可能会导致更严重的疾病和传播。
en-mt: One problem with antiviral treatments is that resistance through mutations can lead to more severe disease and spread.

sourceString: Some early pretrial studies suggest remdesivir may have a high genetic barrier to resistance.There are several clinical trials underway, including two conducted by Cleveland University Hospitals; one for people with moderate illness and another for those with more severe illness.
targetString: 一些早期的试验前研究表明，瑞德西韦可能具有较高的耐药遗传屏障。目前正在进行多项临床试验，其中两项由克利夫兰大学医院进行；一项针对中度症状患者，另一项针对症状更重的患者。
en-mt: Some early pre-test studies have shown that remdesivir may have a high genetic barrier to drug resistance. Multiple clinical trials are currently underway, two of which are being conducted at the University Hospital of Cleveland; one in patients with moderate symptoms and the other in patients with more severe symptoms.

sourceString: There are three ongoing clinical trials of intravenous vitamin C for people who are hospitalized and severely ill with COVID-19; two placebo controlled (China, Canada) and one with no control (Italy).
targetString: 目前正在进行三项针对 COVID-19 住院重症患者的维生素 C 静脉注射临床试验；两项安慰剂对照试验（中国、加拿大）和一项非对照试验（意大利）。
en-mt: Three clinical trials of intravenous vitamin C in hospitalized critically ill patients with COVID-19 are currently ongoing; two placebo-controlled trials (China, Canada) and one uncontrolled trial (Italy).

sourceString: New York State began trials for the antibiotic azithromycin on 24 March 2020.
targetString: 纽约州于 2020 年 3 月 24 日开始了抗生素阿奇霉素的试验。
en-mt: New York State began a trial of the antibiotic azithromycin on March 24, 2020.

sourceString: Japan's National Center for Global Health and Medicine (NCGM) is planning a clinical trial for Teijin's Alvesco (ciclesonide), an inhaled corticosteroid for asthma, for the treatment of pre-symptomatic patients infected with the novel coronavirus.
targetString: 日本国立国际医疗研究中心医院 (National Center for Global Health and Medicine, NCGM) 正计划对帝人 (Teijin) 公司的 Alvesco（环索奈德，一种用于治疗哮喘的吸入皮质激素）进行临床试验，以治疗感染新冠病毒的症状前患者。
en-mt: The National Center for Global Health and Medicine (NCGM) in Japan is planning a clinical trial of Teijin's Alvesco (ciclesonide, an inhaled corticosteroid used to treat asthma), to Treatment of presymptomatic patients infected with 2019-nCoV.

sourceString: A form of angiotensin-converting enzyme 2, a Phase II trial is underway with 200 patients to be recruited from severe, hospitalized cases in Denmark, Germany, and Austria to determine the effectiveness of the treatment.
targetString: 一种血管紧张素转换酶 2 的 II 期试验正在进行中，该试验将从丹麦、德国和奥地利的重症住院病例中招募 200 名患者，以确定该疗法的有效性。
en-mt: A phase II trial of ACE 2 is underway, enrolling 200 patients from intensively hospitalized patients in Denmark, Germany and Austria, to determine the therapy's effectiveness.

sourceString: Researchers from the Montreal Heart Institute in Canada are currently studying the role of colchicine in reducing inflammation and pulmonary complications in patients suffering from mild symptoms of COVID-19.
targetString: 加拿大蒙特利尔心脏病研究所的研究人员目前正在研究秋水仙碱在减轻 COVID-19 轻症患者的炎症和肺部并发症方面的作用。
en-mt: Researchers at the Montreal Cardiology Institute in Canada are currently studying the role of colchicine in reducing inflammation and lung complications in patients with mild COVID-19.

sourceString: The study, named COLCORONA, is recruiting 6000 adults aged 40 and over who were diagnosed with COVID-19 and experience mild symptoms not requiring hospitalization.
targetString: 这项名为 COLCORONA 的研究正在招募 6000 名 40 岁及以上的成年人，他们被诊断出患有 COVID-19，且症状轻微，无需住院治疗。
en-mt: The study, called COLCORONA, is enrolling 6,000 adults aged 40 and over who have been diagnosed with COVID-19 and have mild symptoms that do not require hospitalization.

sourceString: Women who are pregnant or breastfeeding or who do not have an effective contraceptive method are not eligible.
targetString: 孕妇、哺乳期或未采取有效避孕措施的女性不符合资格。
en-mt: Women who are pregnant, nursing, or not using effective contraception are not eligible.

sourceString: Several anticoagulants are being tested in Italy.
targetString: 意大利正在对几种抗凝剂进行测试。
en-mt: Several anticoagulants are being tested in Italy.

sourceString: Low-molecular-weight heparin is being widely used to treat patients, prompting the Italian Medicines Agency to publish guidelines on its use.
targetString: 低分子量肝素被广泛用于治疗患者，这促使意大利药监局发布了其使用指南。
en-mt: Low-molecular-weight heparins are widely used to treat patients, prompting the Italian Medicines Agency to issue guidelines for their use.

sourceString: A multicenter study on 300 patients researching the use of enoxaparin sodium at prophylaxis and therapeutic dosages was announced in Italy on April 14.
targetString: 4 月 14 日，意大利宣布进行一项针对 300 名患者的多中心研究，以研究预防和治疗剂量的依诺肝素钠的应用。
en-mt: On April 14, Italy announced a multicenter study of 300 patients to investigate the use of prophylactic and therapeutic doses of enoxaparin sodium.

sourceString: Since SARS-CoV-2 is a virus, considerable scientific attention has been focused on repurposing approved anti-viral drugs that were developed for prior outbreaks such as MERS, SARS, and West Nile virus.
targetString: 由于 SARS-CoV-2 是一种病毒，因此，重新利用已获批准的抗病毒药物引起了相当大的科学关注，这些药物是为中东呼吸综合征 (Middle East Respiratory Syndrome, MERS)、严重急性呼吸综合征 (Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome, SARS) 和西尼罗河病毒等之前爆发的疾病开发的。
en-mt: Because SARS-CoV-2 is a virus, there has been considerable scientific interest in repurposing approved antiviral drugs for Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS), Severe Acute Respiratory It has developed in previous outbreaks such as Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS) and West Nile virus.

sourceString: Ribavirin: ribavirin was recommended for COVID-19 treatment according to Chinese 7th edition guidelines
targetString: 利巴韦林：根据中国第七版指南，推荐使用利巴韦林治疗 COVID-19
en-mt: Ribavirin: According to the seventh edition of the Chinese guidelines, ribavirin is recommended for the treatment of COVID-19

sourceString: Umifenovir: umifenovir was recommended for COVID-19 treatment according to Chinese 7th edition guidelines
targetString: 盐酸阿比朵尔：根据中国第七版指南，推荐使用盐酸阿比朵尔治疗 COVID-19
en-mt: Arbidol hydrochloride: According to the seventh edition of the Chinese guidelines, Arbidol hydrochloride is recommended for the treatment of COVID-19

sourceString: Some antibiotics that have been identified as potentially repurposable as COVID-19 treatments:
targetString: 一些已被确认可用于 COVID-19 治疗的潜在可再利用抗生素：
en-mt: Some potential repurposing antibiotics that have been identified for COVID-19 treatment:

sourceString: Tocilizumab (Anti-IL-6 receptor): Approved by China.
targetString: 托珠单抗（抗 IL-6 受体）：获中国批准。
en-mt: Tocilizumab (anti-IL-6 receptor): Approved in China.

sourceString: Also trials in Italy and China. and see Tocilizumab#COVID-19.
targetString: 在意大利和中国也开展了相关试验。并参阅 Tocilizumab#COVID-19。
en-mt: Related trials have also been carried out in Italy and China. And see Tocilizumab #COVID-19.

sourceString: b'A COVID-19 vaccine is a hypothetical vaccine against coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).
targetString: b'A COVID-19 疫苗是指针对 2019 冠状病毒疾病 (COVID-19) 的假想疫苗。
en-mt: b'A COVID-19 vaccine refers to a hypothetical vaccine against coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).

sourceString: Although no vaccine has completed clinical trials, there are multiple attempts in progress to develop such a vaccine.
targetString: 尽管尚无疫苗完成临床试验，但开发这种疫苗的多种尝试仍在进行。
en-mt: Although no vaccine has completed clinical trials, multiple attempts to develop such a vaccine are ongoing.

sourceString: In late February 2020, the World Health Organization (WHO) said it did not expect a vaccine against SARS-CoV-2, the causative virus, to become available in less than 18 months.
targetString: 2020 年 2 月下旬，世界卫生组织 (WHO) 表示，预计在 18 个月内，不会出现针对这种致病病毒 SARS-CoV-2 的疫苗。
en-mt: In late February 2020, the World Health Organization (WHO) said it did not expect a vaccine against the disease-causing virus, SARS-CoV-2, for 18 months.

sourceString: Five vaccine candidates were in Phase I safety studies in April.
targetString: 4 月，有五种候选疫苗进入了 I 期安全性研究。
en-mt: In April, five vaccine candidates entered Phase I safety studies.

sourceString: COVID-19 was identified in December 2019.
targetString: 2019 年 12 月发现了 COVID-19。
en-mt: COVID-19 was discovered in December 2019.

sourceString: A major outbreak spread around the world in 2020, leading to considerable investment and research activity to develop a vaccine.
targetString: 2020 年，一场大规模疫情在全球蔓延，引发了研制疫苗的大量投资和研究活动。
en-mt: In 2020, a large-scale epidemic spread across the world, triggering a lot of investment and research activity to develop a vaccine.

sourceString: Many organizations are using published genomes to develop possible vaccines against SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: 许多组织正在利用已发布的病毒基因组开发可能的 SARS-CoV-2 疫苗。
en-mt: A number of organizations are developing potential SARS-CoV-2 vaccines using the published genome of the virus.

sourceString: Stated in April, imperatives of the CEPI initiative for vaccine development are speed, manufacturing capacity, deployment at scale, and global access.
targetString: CEPI 在 4 月提出了疫苗开发计划，并表示当务之急是速度、生产能力、大规模部署和全球可及性。
en-mt: CEPI proposed a vaccine development plan in April and said the immediate priorities were speed, production capacity, large-scale deployment and global accessibility.

sourceString: In April, CEPI scientists reported that 10 different technology platforms were under research and development during early 2020 to create an effective vaccine against COVID-19.
targetString: 4 月，CEPI 的科学家报告称，2020 年初，有 10 个不同的技术平台正在研究和开发有效的 COVID-19 疫苗。
en-mt: In April, scientists at CEPI reported that in early 2020, 10 different technology platforms were researching and developing an effective COVID-19 vaccine.

sourceString: Major platform targets advanced into Phase I safety studies include:
targetString: 进入 I 期安全性研究的主要平台靶标包括：
en-mt: Key platform targets entering Phase I safety studies include:

sourceString: nucleic acid (DNA and RNA) (Phase I developer and vaccine candidate: Moderna, mRNA-1273)
targetString: 核酸（DNA 和 RNA）（I 期开发者和候选疫苗：Moderna，mRNA-1273）
en-mt: Nucleic acids (DNA and RNA) (Phase I developer and vaccine candidate: Moderna, mRNA-1273)

sourceString: viral vector (Phase I developer and vaccine candidate: CanSino Biologics, adenovirus type 5 vector)
targetString: 病毒载体（I 期开发者和候选疫苗：CanSino Biologics，5 型腺病毒载体）
en-mt: Viral vector (Phase I developer and vaccine candidate: CanSino Biologics, type 5 adenoviral vector)

sourceString: As reported by CEPI scientists in April, 115 total vaccine candidates are in early stages of development, with 78 confirmed as active projects (79, according to the Milken Institute), and 37 others announced, but with little public information available (presumed to be in planning or being designed).
targetString: CEPI 科学家在 4 月份报告称，总共有 115 种候选疫苗处于早期开发阶段，其中 78 种已确认为正在进行的项目（根据米尔肯研究所的数据，为 79 种），另有 37 种已宣布，但几乎无公开信息（推测正在计划或设计中）。
en-mt: CEPI scientists reported in April that a total of 115 vaccine candidates were in early development, of which 78 were confirmed as ongoing projects (79, according to the Milken Institute) and 37 more had been announced, But there is little public information (presumably being planned or designed).

sourceString: A Phase I-II trial conducts preliminary safety and immunogenicity testing, is typically randomized, placebo-controlled, and at multiple sites, while determining more precise, effective doses.
targetString: I-II 期试验进行初步的安全性和免疫原性测试，通常为随机、安慰剂对照的多位点试验，同时确定更精确、有效的剂量。
en-mt: Phase I-II trials conduct preliminary safety and immunogenicity testing, usually randomized, placebo-controlled, multisite trials, while identifying more precise, effective doses.

sourceString: Phase III trials typically involve more participants, including a control group, and test effectiveness of the vaccine to prevent the disease, while monitoring for adverse effects at the optimal dose.
targetString: III 期试验通常涉及更多参与者，其中含对照组，并测试疫苗预防疾病的有效性，同时监测最佳剂量时的不良反应。
en-mt: Phase III trials typically involve more participants, include a control group, and test the vaccine's effectiveness in preventing disease while monitoring for adverse effects at optimal doses.

sourceString: Of 79 vaccine candidates in active development (confirmed as of early April 2020), 74 were not yet in human evaluation (still in "preclinical" research).
targetString: 在积极研发的 79 种候选疫苗中（确认时间截至 2020 年 4 月初），有 74 种尚未进行人体评价（仍处于“临床前”研究）。
en-mt: Of the 79 vaccine candidates in active development (identified as of early April 2020), 74 have not yet been evaluated in humans (still in "preclinical" studies).

sourceString: Around 24 January 2020 in Australia, the University of Queensland announced that it is investigating the potential of a molecular clamp vaccine that would genetically modify viral proteins in order to stimulate an immune reaction.
targetString: 2020 年 1 月 24 日左右，澳大利亚昆士兰大学宣布，正在研究一种分子钳形疫苗的潜力，该疫苗可对病毒蛋白进行基因修饰，以刺激免疫反应。
en-mt: On or about January 24, 2020, the University of Queensland in Australia announced that it was investigating the potential of a molecular clamp vaccine that genetically modifies viral proteins to stimulate an immune response.

sourceString: Around 24 January 2020 in Canada, the International Vaccine Centre (VIDO-InterVac) at the University of Saskatchewan announced the commencement of work on a vaccine, aiming to start human testing in 2021.
targetString: 2020 年 1 月 24 日左右，加拿大萨斯喀彻温大学的国际疫苗中心 (VIDO-InterVac) 宣布开始研制疫苗，目标是在 2021 年开始人体试验。
en-mt: On or about January 24, 2020, the International Vaccine Center (VIDO-InterVac) at the University of Saskatchewan in Canada announced the start of vaccine development with the goal of beginning human trials in 2021.

sourceString: Vaccine development projects were announced at the Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention on 26 January 2020, and the University of Hong Kong on 28 January.
targetString: 中国疾病预防控制中心和香港大学分别于 2020 年 1 月 26 日和 1 月 28 日宣布了疫苗研制项目。
en-mt: The Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention and the University of Hong Kong announced their vaccine development projects on January 26 and January 28, 2020, respectively.

sourceString: Around 29 January 2020, Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies, led by Hanneke Schuitemaker, announced that it had begun work on developing a vaccine.
targetString: 2020 年 1 月 29 日左右，由 Hanneke Schuitemaker 领导的 Janssen 制药公司 宣布已开始研制疫苗。
en-mt: On or about January 29, 2020, the pharmaceutical company Janssen, led by Hanneke Schuitemaker, announced that it had begun developing a vaccine.

sourceString: Janssen is co-developing an oral vaccine with its biotechnology partner, Vaxart.
targetString: Janssen 正在与其生物技术合作伙伴 Vaxart 合作研制口服疫苗。
en-mt: Janssen is working with its biotech partner Vaxart on an oral vaccine.

sourceString: On 18 March 2020, Emergent BioSolutions announced a manufacturing partnership with Vaxart to develop the vaccine.
targetString: 2020 年 3 月 18 日，Emergent BioSolutions 宣布与 Vaxart 建立生产合作伙伴关系，以共同研制疫苗。
en-mt: On March 18, 2020, Emergent BioSolutions announced a manufacturing partnership with Vaxart to jointly develop a vaccine.

sourceString: On 8 February 2020, the laboratory OncoGen in Romania published a paper on the design of a vaccine with similar technology to the one used for cancer neoantigen vaccination therapy.
targetString: 2020 年 2 月 8 日，罗马尼亚 OncoGen 研究室发表了一篇有关疫苗设计的论文，其采用的技术与用于癌症新抗原免疫疗法的技术类似。
en-mt: On February 8, 2020, OncoGen Research Laboratories in Romania published a paper on the design of a vaccine using techniques similar to those used in neoantigen immunotherapy for cancer.

sourceString: On 25 March the head of the research institute announced that they had finalized the synthesis of the vaccine and were beginning the tests.
targetString: 3 月 25 日，该研究所所长宣布，他们已完成了疫苗的合成工作并开始疫苗测试。
en-mt: On March 25, the director of the institute announced that they had completed the synthesis of the vaccine and started testing it.

sourceString: On 27 February 2020, a Generex subsidiary company, NuGenerex Immuno-Oncology, announced they were beginning a vaccine project to create an Ii-Key peptide vaccine against COVID-19.
targetString: 2020 年 2 月 27 日，Generex 的子公司 NuGenerex Immuno-Oncology 宣布，正在开始一项疫苗项目，以研制针对 COVID-19 的 Ii-Key 肽疫苗。
en-mt: On February 27, 2020, NuGenerex Immuno-Oncology, a subsidiary of Generex, announced that it is starting a vaccine program to develop an Ii-Key peptide vaccine against COVID-19.

sourceString: They wanted to produce a vaccine candidate that could be tested in humans "within 90 days."
targetString: 他们希望研制出候选疫苗，并能“在 90 天内”进行人体试验。
en-mt: They hope to have a vaccine candidate ready for human trials "within 90 days".

sourceString: On 5 March 2020, Washington University in St. Louis announced its projects to develop a vaccine.
targetString: 2020 年 3 月 5 日，位于圣路易斯的华盛顿大学宣布了其疫苗研发项目。
en-mt: On March 5, 2020, Washington University in St. Louis announced its vaccine development program.

sourceString: On 5 March 2020, the United States Army Medical Research and Materiel Command at Fort Detrick and the Walter Reed Army Institute of Research in Silver Spring, both in western Maryland, announced they were working on a vaccine.
targetString: 2020 年 3 月 5 日，位于德特里克堡的美国陆军医学研究与物资司令部和位于银泉的沃尔特·里德陆军研究所（两个机构均位于马里兰州西部）宣布，正在研制疫苗。
en-mt: On March 5, 2020, the U.S. Army Medical Research and Materiel Command at Fort Detrick and the Walter Reed Army Research Institute in Silver Spring, both located in western Maryland, announced that a vaccine is in development.

sourceString: Around 10 March 2020, Emergent Biosolutions announced that it had teamed with Novavax Inc.
targetString: 2020 年 3 月 10 日左右，Emergent Biosolutions 宣布与 Novavax Inc. 合作
en-mt: On or about March 10, 2020, Emergent Biosolutions announced a collaboration with Novavax Inc.

sourceString: in the development and manufacture of a vaccine.
targetString: 开发和生产疫苗。
en-mt: Development and production of vaccines.

sourceString: The partners further announced plans for preclinical testing and a Phase I clinical trial by July 2020.
targetString: 两家机构进一步宣布了到 2020 年 7 月进行临床前试验和 I 期临床试验的计划。
en-mt: The two institutions further announced plans to conduct preclinical and Phase I clinical trials by July 2020.

sourceString: On 12 March 2020, India's Health Ministry announced they are working with 11 isolates, and that even on a fast track it would take at least around one-and-a-half to two years to develop a vaccine.
targetString: 2020 年 3 月 12 日，印度卫生部宣布，正在研究 11 种分离株，即使加快进度，也需要至少一年半到两年的时间才能研制出疫苗。
en-mt: On March 12, 2020, the Indian Ministry of Health announced that 11 isolates are being studied, and even if the progress is accelerated, it will take at least one and a half to two years to develop a vaccine.

sourceString: On 12 March 2020, Medicago, a biotechnology company in Quebec City, Quebec, reported development of a coronavirus-like particle under partial funding from the Canadian Institutes for Health Research.
targetString: 2020 年 3 月 12 日，位于魁北克省魁北克市的生物技术公司 Medicago 报告称，在加拿大卫生研究院的部分资助下，研制出了冠状病毒的病毒样颗粒。
en-mt: On March 12, 2020, Medicago, a biotechnology company based in Quebec City, Quebec, reported that it had developed virus-like particles for coronaviruses, with funding in part from the Canadian Institutes of Health Research.

sourceString: The vaccine candidate is in laboratory research, with human testing planned for July or August 2020.
targetString: 候选疫苗正在实验室研究中，计划于 2020 年 7 月或 8 月进入人体试验。
en-mt: The vaccine candidate is being studied in the laboratory and is scheduled to enter human trials in July or August 2020.

sourceString: Earlier that week, The Guardian reported that the US President Donald Trump had offered CureVac "'large sums of money' for exclusive access to a Covid-19 vaccine", against which the German government protested.
targetString: 该周早些时候，《卫报》报道称，美国总统唐纳德·特朗普向 CureVac 提供了“‘大笔资金’，以得到 COVID-19 疫苗的独家使用权”，德国政府对此提出抗议。
en-mt: Earlier in the week, the German government protested after The Guardian reported that US President Donald Trump had offered CureVac "'big money' for exclusive access to a COVID-19 vaccine".

sourceString: On 17 March 2020, American pharmaceutical company Pfizer announced a partnership with German company BioNTech to jointly develop a mRNA-based vaccine.
targetString: 2020 年 3 月 17 日，美国制药公司辉瑞宣布与德国公司 BioNTech 合作，共同开发一种基于 mRNA 的疫苗。
en-mt: On March 17, 2020, the US pharmaceutical company Pfizer announced a partnership with the German company BioNTech to jointly develop an mRNA-based vaccine.

sourceString: mRNA-based vaccine candidate BNT162, currently in pre-clinical testing with clinical trials expected to begin in April 2020.
targetString: 基于 mRNA 的候选疫苗 BNT162 目前正处于临床前测试阶段，预计将于 2020 年 4 月开始临床试验。
en-mt: An mRNA-based vaccine candidate, BNT162, is currently in preclinical testing and clinical trials are expected to begin in April 2020.

sourceString: In Italy on 17 March 2020, Takis Biotech, an Italian biotech company announced they will have pre-clinical testing results in April 2020 and their final vaccine candidate could begin human testing by fall.
targetString: 2020 年 3 月 17 日，意大利生物技术公司 Takis Biotech 宣布，他们将在 2020 年 4 月获得临床前测试结果，其最终候选疫苗可能会在秋季开始进行人体试验。
en-mt: On March 17, 2020, Italian biotechnology company Takis Biotech announced that they will have preclinical test results in April 2020, and that their final vaccine candidate may begin human trials in the fall.

sourceString: In France on 19 March 2020, the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI) announced a US$4.9 million investment in a COVID-19 vaccine research consortium involving the Institut Pasteur, Themis Bioscience (Vienna, Austria), and the University of Pittsburgh, bringing CEPI's total investment in COVID-19 vaccine development to US$29 million.
targetString: 2020 年 3 月 19 日，在法国，流行病预防创新联盟 (CEPI) 宣布投资 490 万美元，成立一个由巴斯德研究所、Themis Bioscience（奥地利维也纳）和匹兹堡大学组成的 COVID-19 疫苗研究联盟，这使 CEPI 在 COVID-19 疫苗研发方面的总投资达到 2900 万美元。
en-mt: In France, March 19, 2020, the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI) announced a $4.9 million investment to create a COVID-19 vaccine research consortium comprising Institut Pasteur, Themis Bioscience (Vienna, Austria) and the University of Pittsburgh , which brings CEPI's total investment in COVID-19 vaccine development to $29 million.

sourceString: CEPI's other investment partners for COVID-19 vaccine development are Moderna, Curevac, Inovio, Novavax, the University of Hong Kong, the University of Oxford, and the University of Queensland.
targetString: CEPI 在 COVID-19 疫苗研发方面的其他投资伙伴包括 Moderna、Curevac、Inovio、Novavax、香港大学、牛津大学和昆士兰大学。
en-mt: CEPI's other investment partners in the development of a COVID-19 vaccine include Moderna, Curevac, Inovio, Novavax, the University of Hong Kong, the University of Oxford and the University of Queensland.

sourceString: On 20 March 2020, Russian health officials announced that scientists have begun animal testing of six different vaccine candidates.
targetString: 2020 年 3 月 20 日，俄罗斯卫生官员宣布，科学家已经开始对 6 种不同的候选疫苗进行动物试验。
en-mt: On March 20, 2020, Russian health officials announced that scientists had begun animal testing of six different vaccine candidates.

sourceString: Imperial College London researchers announced on 20 March 2020 that they are developing a self-amplifying RNA vaccine for COVID-19.
targetString: 伦敦帝国理工学院的研究人员于 2020 年 3 月 20 日宣布，正在研制一种针对 COVID-19 的自我扩增 RNA 疫苗。
en-mt: Researchers at Imperial College London announced on 20 March 2020 that they are developing a self-amplifying RNA vaccine against COVID-19.

sourceString: The vaccine candidate was developed within 14 days of receiving the sequence from China.
targetString: 该候选疫苗是在收到中国发布的病毒序列后 14 天内研制出的。
en-mt: The vaccine candidate was developed within 14 days of receiving the virus sequence released by China.

sourceString: In late March, the Canadian government announced C$275 million in funding for 96 research projects on medical countermeasures against COVID-19, including numerous vaccine candidates at Canadian companies and universities, such as the Medicago and University of Saskatchewan initiatives.
targetString: 3 月下旬，加拿大政府宣布拨款 2.75 亿加元，以资助 96 个针对 COVID-19 的医学对策研究项目，其中包括来自加拿大公司和大学的众多候选疫苗，如 Medicago 和萨斯喀彻温大学计划。
en-mt: In late March, the Canadian government announced $275 million in funding to fund 96 research projects into medical countermeasures against COVID-19, including numerous vaccine candidates from Canadian companies and universities such as Medicago and the University of Saskatchewan program.

sourceString: Around the same time, the Canadian government announced C$192 million specifically for developing a COVID-19 vaccine, with plans to establish a national "vaccine bank" of several new vaccines that could be used if another coronavirus outbreak occurs.
targetString: 大约在同一时间，加拿大政府宣布投入 1.92 亿加元专门用于研制 COVID-19 疫苗，并计划建立包括几种新疫苗在内的全国性“疫苗库”，以便再次出现冠状病毒爆发时，可以将这些疫苗投入使用。
en-mt: Around the same time, the Canadian government announced that $192 million was earmarked for the development of a COVID-19 vaccine, and that it planned to create a national "vaccine bank" of several new vaccines that could be used in the event of another coronavirus outbreak. These vaccines are put into use.

sourceString: On 2 April 2020, researchers at the University of Pittsburgh School of Medicine reported on testing of PittCoVacc, a possible COVID-19 vaccine in mice, stating that "MNA delivered SARS-CoV-2 S1 subunit vaccines elicited potent antigen-specific antibody responses [in the mice] that were evident beginning 2 weeks after immunization."
targetString: 2020 年 4 月 2 日，匹兹堡大学医学院的研究人员报告了对 PittCoVacc 的测试，这是一种可能用于小鼠的 COVID-19 疫苗，并称“MNA 提供的 SARS-CoV-2 S1 亚单位疫苗可使 [小鼠] 产生强有力的抗原特异性抗体反应，这种反应在免疫后 2 周就开始显现”。
en-mt: On April 2, 2020, researchers at the University of Pittsburgh School of Medicine reported testing of PittCoVacc, a potential COVID-19 vaccine in mice, saying that "SARS-CoV-2 S1 subunit provided by MNA The vaccine produced a robust antigen-specific antibody response in [the mice], which began as early as 2 weeks after immunization."

sourceString: In Canada on 16 April 2020, the University of Waterloo School of Pharmacy announced design of a DNA-based vaccine candidate as a possible nasal spray.
targetString: 2020 年 4 月 16 日，加拿大滑铁卢大学药学院宣布设计一种基于 DNA 的候选疫苗以作为可能的鼻喷雾剂。
en-mt: On April 16, 2020, the Faculty of Pharmacy at the University of Waterloo in Canada announced the design of a DNA-based vaccine candidate as a possible nasal spray.

sourceString: Using bacteriophages, the DNA will be designed to replicate inside human bacteria to produce harmless virus-like particles, which may stimulate the immune system to produce antibodies against the SARS-CoV-2 virus.
targetString: 研究人员利用噬菌体，将 DNA 设计为在人类细菌内部复制以产生无害的病毒样颗粒，这可能会刺激免疫系统产生针对 SARS-CoV-2 病毒的抗体。
en-mt: Using phages, the researchers engineered DNA to replicate inside human bacteria to produce harmless virus-like particles that could stimulate the immune system to produce antibodies against the SARS-CoV-2 virus.

sourceString: In March 2020, the US government, industry, and three universities pooled resources to access supercomputers from IBM, combined with cloud computing resources from Hewlett Packard Enterprise, Amazon, Microsoft, and Google.
targetString: 2020 年 3 月，美国政府、工业界和三所大学集中资源并结合来自惠普、亚马逊、微软和谷歌的云计算资源，以访问 IBM 的超级计算机。
en-mt: In March 2020, the U.S. government, industry, and three universities pooled resources and combined cloud computing resources from Hewlett-Packard, Amazon, Microsoft, and Google to gain access to IBM's supercomputer.

sourceString: Some vaccines have heterologous effects, also called non-specific effects.
targetString: 部分疫苗具有异源效应，也称为非特异性效应。
en-mt: Some vaccines have heterologous effects, also known as non-specific effects.

sourceString: That means they can have benefits beyond the disease they prevent.
targetString: 这意味着，除了预防疾病外，它们还能带来其他益处。
en-mt: This means that, in addition to preventing disease, they can have other benefits.

sourceString: A further randomized trial in Australia is seeking to enrol 4,170 healthcare workers.
targetString: 在澳大利亚进行的进一步随机试验正在招募 4,170 名卫生保健人员。
en-mt: A further randomized trial in Australia is enrolling 4,170 health care workers.

sourceString: It is possible vaccines in development will not be safe or effective.
targetString: 开发中的疫苗可能不安全或无效。
en-mt: Vaccines in development may not be safe or effective.

sourceString: Early research to assess vaccine efficacy using COVID-19-specific animal models, such as ACE2-transgenic mice, other laboratory animals, and non-human primates, indicate a need for biosafety-level 3 containment measures for handling live viruses, and international coordination to ensure standardized safety procedures.
targetString: 使用 COVID-19 特异性动物模型，例如 ACE2 转基因小鼠、其他实验动物和非人类灵长类动物，来评估疫苗功效的早期研究表明，需要为处理活病毒采取生物安全 3 级的遏制措施，并进行国际协调以确保遵守标准化的安全程序。
