en-mt: Early studies using COVID-19-specific animal models, such as ACE2 transgenic mice, other laboratory animals, and nonhuman primates to assess vaccine efficacy indicate the need for Biosafety Level 3 containment measures for handling live virus, and International coordination to ensure adherence to standardized safety procedures.

sourceString: Vaccines against SARS and MERS have been tested in non-human animal models.
targetString: 已经在非人类动物模型中测试了针对 SARS 和 MERS 的疫苗。
en-mt: Vaccines against SARS and MERS have been tested in non-human animal models.

sourceString: As of 2020, there is no cure or protective vaccine for SARS that has been shown to be both safe and effective in humans.
targetString: 截至 2020 年，尚无对人类安全且有效的 SARS 治疗或预防性疫苗。
en-mt: As of 2020, there is no safe and effective SARS treatment or preventive vaccine for humans.

sourceString: According to research papers published in 2005 and 2006, the identification and development of novel vaccines and medicines to treat SARS was a priority for governments and public health agencies around the world.There is also no proven vaccine against MERS.
targetString: 根据 2005 年和 2006 年发表的研究论文，确定和开发用于治疗 SARS 的新型疫苗和药物是世界各国政府和公共卫生机构的当务之急。此外，目前也没有针对 MERS 的有效疫苗。
en-mt: According to research papers published in 2005 and 2006, identifying and developing new vaccines and drugs to treat SARS is a top priority for governments and public health agencies around the world. In addition, there is currently no effective vaccine against MERS.

sourceString: When MERS became prevalent, it was believed that existing SARS research may provide a useful template for developing vaccines and therapeutics against a MERS-CoV infection.
targetString: 在 MERS 流行时，人们认为，现有的 SARS 研究可为开发针对 MERS-CoV 感染的疫苗和疗法提供有用的模板。
en-mt: At the time of the MERS epidemic, it was believed that existing SARS research could provide a useful template for the development of vaccines and therapies against MERS-CoV infection.

sourceString: As of March 2020, there was one (DNA based) MERS vaccine which completed phase I clinical trials in humans, and three others in progress, all of which are viral-vectored vaccines, two adenoviral-vectored (ChAdOx1-MERS,  BVRS-GamVac), and one MVA-vectored (MVA-MERS-S).
targetString: 截至 2020 年 3 月，已有一种（基于 DNA 的）MERS 疫苗完成了 I 期人体临床试验，另有三种疫苗正在研发中，其中全部为病毒载体疫苗，两种是腺病毒载体疫苗（ChAdOx1-MERS、BVRS-GamVac），一种是 MVA 载体疫苗 (MVA-MERS-S)。
en-mt: As of March 2020, one (DNA-based) MERS vaccine has completed phase I human clinical trials, and three more vaccines are in development, all viral-vectored and two adenoviral-vectored (ChAdOx1-MERS , BVRS-GamVac), and one is the MVA vector vaccine (MVA-MERS-S).

sourceString: Social media posts have promoted a conspiracy theory claiming the virus behind COVID-19 was known and that a vaccine was already available.
targetString: 各种社交媒体文章助长了阴谋论，声称 COVID-19 背后的病毒已经找到，并且已经有疫苗可用。
en-mt: Various social media posts have fueled conspiracy theories claiming that the virus behind COVID-19 has been found and that a vaccine is already available.

sourceString: The patents cited by various social media posts reference existing patents for genetic sequences and vaccines for other strains of coronavirus such as the SARS coronavirus.
targetString: 各种社交媒体文章所引用的专利都参考了现有的其他冠状病毒（如 SARS 冠状病毒）毒株基因序列和疫苗的专利。
en-mt: The patents cited in various social media articles refer to existing patents on genetic sequences and vaccines for other coronavirus (such as SARS-CoV) strains.

sourceString: b'Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is an infectious disease caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: 2019 冠状病毒疾病 (COVID-19) 是由严重急性呼吸综合征冠状病毒 2 型 (SARS-CoV-2) 引起的一种传染病。
en-mt: Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is an infectious disease caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus type 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: Common symptoms include fever, cough, and shortness of breath.
targetString: 常见症状包括发热、咳嗽和气促。
en-mt: Common symptoms include fever, cough, and shortness of breath.

sourceString: Other symptoms may include fatigue, muscle pain, diarrhea, sore throat, loss of smell, and abdominal pain.
targetString: 其他症状可能包括乏力、肌肉酸痛、腹泻、咽痛、嗅觉丧失和腹痛。
en-mt: Other symptoms may include fatigue, muscle aches, diarrhea, sore throat, loss of smell, and abdominal pain.

sourceString: The time from exposure to onset of symptoms is typically around five days but may range from two to fourteen days.
targetString: 从接触病患到发病的潜伏期为 2-14 天不等，通常为 5 天左右。
en-mt: The incubation period from contact with a sick person to onset of symptoms ranges from 2 to 14 days, usually about 5 days.

sourceString: While the majority of cases result in mild symptoms, some progress to viral pneumonia and multi-organ failure.
targetString: 尽管大多数病例症状轻微，但部分病例会发展成病毒性肺炎和多器官功能衰竭。
en-mt: Although most cases are mild, some cases develop viral pneumonia and multiorgan failure.

sourceString: As of 17 April 2020, more than 2.24 million cases have been reported across 210 countries and territories, resulting in more than 153,000 deaths.
targetString: 截至 2020 年 4 月 17 日，全球 210 个国家和地区报告的病例总数超过 224 万例，死亡人数超过 153,000 人。
en-mt: As of April 17, 2020, the total number of cases reported in 210 countries and territories around the world exceeded 2.24 million and the death toll exceeded 153,000.

sourceString: More than 568,000 people have recovered.The virus is primarily spread between people during close contact, often via small droplets produced by coughing, sneezing, or talking.
targetString: 目前有超过 568,000 人经治疗康复。病毒主要通过近距离接触在人与人之间传播，往往借由咳嗽、打喷嚏或说话时产生的飞沫散播。
en-mt: More than 568,000 people have now recovered from treatment. The virus spreads mainly from person to person through close contact, often through droplets produced when coughing, sneezing or talking.

sourceString: While these droplets are produced when breathing out, they usually fall to the ground or onto surfaces rather than being infectious over long distances.
targetString: 尽管呼气会产生飞沫，但飞沫通常落到地面或各种物体表面，并不会造成远距离传染。
en-mt: Although exhalation will produce droplets, the droplets usually fall to the ground or the surface of various objects and will not cause long-distance infection.

sourceString: People may also become infected by touching a contaminated surface and then touching their eyes, nose, or mouth.
targetString: 另外，如果有人触摸了受病毒污染的表面，然后再触摸自己的眼鼻口部，也可能感染病毒。
en-mt: Also, someone can get the virus if they touch a virus-contaminated surface and then touch their own eyes, nose, or mouth.

sourceString: The virus can survive on surfaces up to 72 hours.
targetString: 病毒最长可在物体表面存活 72 小时。
en-mt: The virus can survive on surfaces for up to 72 hours.

sourceString: It is most contagious during the first three days after the onset of symptoms, although spread may be possible before symptoms appear and in later stages of the disease.The standard method of diagnosis is by real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) from a nasopharyngeal swab.
targetString: 尽管发病前期及恢复后期也可能传播，但发病前三天传染性最强。标准诊断方法是进行鼻咽拭子实时逆转录聚合酶链反应 (rRT-PCR) 检测。
en-mt: It is most contagious in the first three days of illness, although transmission is also possible during the pre-ill and post-recovery stages. The standard diagnostic method is real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) testing of nasopharyngeal swabs.

sourceString: The use of masks is recommended for those who suspect they have the virus and their caregivers.
targetString: 建议疑似病毒感染者及其护理人员佩戴口罩。
en-mt: It is recommended that people with suspected virus infection and their caregivers wear masks.

sourceString: Recommendations for mask use by the general public vary, with some authorities recommending against their use, some recommending their use, and others requiring their use.
targetString: 关于公众佩戴口罩的建议各地有所不同，一些当局反对佩戴口罩，另一些当局要求佩戴口罩。
en-mt: Advice on the wearing of masks by the public varies from place to place, with some authorities opposing their wearing and others requiring them.

sourceString: Currently, there is no vaccine or specific antiviral treatment for COVID-19.
targetString: 目前尚无 COVID-19 疫苗或特效抗病毒治疗方案。
en-mt: There is currently no vaccine or specific antiviral treatment options for COVID-19.

sourceString: Local transmission of the disease has been recorded in most countries across all six WHO regions.
targetString: 全部六个 WHO 区域的绝大部分国家均已上报存在该病的局部传播。
en-mt: The vast majority of countries in all six WHO regions have reported localized transmission of the disease.

sourceString: Those infected with the virus may be asymptomatic or develop flu-like symptoms such as fever, cough, fatigue, and shortness of breath.
targetString: 病毒感染者可能无症状，也可能出现疑似流感症状，如发热、咳嗽、乏力和气促。
en-mt: People infected with the virus may be asymptomatic or may have flu-like symptoms such as fever, cough, fatigue, and shortness of breath.

sourceString: Emergency symptoms include difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain or pressure, confusion, difficulty waking, and bluish face or lips; immediate medical attention is advised if these symptoms are present.
targetString: 紧急症状包括呼吸困难、持续胸痛或胸闷、意识模糊、难以清醒及脸部或嘴唇发青；如果出现这些症状，建议立即就医。
en-mt: Emergency symptoms include difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain or pressure, confusion, difficulty staying awake, and bluish face or lips; immediate medical attention is advised if these symptoms occur.

sourceString: Less commonly, upper respiratory symptoms such as sneezing, runny nose or sore throat may be seen.
targetString: 少数病例可能伴有上呼吸道症状，如打喷嚏、流鼻涕或咽喉痛。
en-mt: A small number of cases may be accompanied by upper respiratory symptoms such as sneezing, runny nose or sore throat.

sourceString: Gastrointestinal symptoms such as nausea, vomiting and diarrhoea have been observed in varying percentages.
targetString: 另外还监测到不同比例的胃肠道症状，如恶心、呕吐和腹泻。
en-mt: Gastrointestinal symptoms such as nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea were also monitored in varying proportions.

sourceString: Some cases in China initially presented only with chest tightness and palpitations.
targetString: 部分中国病例初期仅出现胸闷和心悸症状。
en-mt: In some Chinese cases, only symptoms of chest tightness and palpitations appeared at the initial stage.

sourceString: In some, the disease may progress to pneumonia, multi-organ failure, and death.
targetString: 部分病例可能发展成病毒性肺炎、多器官功能衰竭，甚至引发死亡。
en-mt: Some cases may develop into viral pneumonia, multiple organ failure, and even death.

sourceString: This is called the incubation period.
targetString: 我们将此称之为潜伏期。
en-mt: We call this the incubation period.

sourceString: The incubation period for COVID-19 is typically five to six days but may range from two to 14 days.
targetString: COVID-19 的潜伏期通常为 5-6 天，但可能扩展至 2-14 天不等。
en-mt: The incubation period for COVID-19 is usually 5-6 days but may extend to 2-14 days.

sourceString: 97.5% of people who develop symptoms will do so within 11.5 days of infection.Reports indicate that not all who are infected develop symptoms.
targetString: 97.5% 的感染者在感染后 11.5 天内会出现症状。报告指出，并非所有感染者都会出现症状。
en-mt: 97.5% of infected people developed symptoms within 11.5 days of infection. Not all infected people develop symptoms, the report noted.

sourceString: The role of these asymptomatic carriers in transmission is not yet fully known; however, preliminary evidence suggests that they may contribute to the spread of the disease.
targetString: 无症状感染者在疫情传播中发挥的作用尚未完全明确；但是，初步证据表明无症状感染者可能促进疾病传播。
en-mt: The role played by asymptomatic carriers in the spread of the outbreak is not fully understood; however, preliminary evidence suggests that asymptomatic carriers may facilitate disease transmission.

sourceString: The proportion of infected people who do not display symptoms is currently unknown and being studied, with the Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (KCDC) reporting that 20% of all confirmed cases remained asymptomatic during their hospital stay.
targetString: 目前尚未确定无症状感染者比例，仍在加紧进行研究。韩国疾病控制与预防中心 (KCDC) 报告称，确诊病例中有 20% 在住院期间未表现出任何症状。
en-mt: The proportion of asymptomatic infections has not yet been determined, and research is still being stepped up. The Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (KCDC) reported that 20 percent of confirmed cases showed no symptoms during hospitalization.

sourceString: China's National Health Commission began including asymptomatic cases in its daily cases on 1 April; of the 166 infections on that day, 130 (78%) were asymptomatic at the time of testing.
targetString: 中国国家卫生健康委员会自 4 月 1 日起将无症状病例列入每日通报；在当日的 166 例感染者中，有 130 例 (78%) 在接受检测时无症状。
en-mt: China's National Health Commission has included asymptomatic cases in its daily bulletins since April 1; of the 166 infections that day, 130 (78%) were asymptomatic at the time of testing.

sourceString: Both sputum and saliva can carry large viral loads.
targetString: 痰液和唾液均可携带大量病毒。
en-mt: Both sputum and saliva can carry large amounts of virus.

sourceString: Loud talking releases more droplets than normal talking.
targetString: 大声讲话比正常讲话喷溅更多的飞沫。
en-mt: Talking loudly produces more droplets than normal speech.

sourceString: A study in Singapore found that an uncovered cough can lead to droplets travelling up to 4.5 meters (15 feet).
targetString: 新加坡的一项研究发现，无遮挡咳嗽可能导致飞沫最远传播 4.5 米（15 英尺）。
en-mt: A study in Singapore found that an uncovered cough could cause droplets to travel as far as 4.5 meters (15 feet).

sourceString: Though the virus is not generally airborne, the National Academy of Science has suggested that bioaerosol transmission may be possible and air collectors positioned in the hallway outside of people's rooms yielded samples positive for viral RNA.
targetString: 尽管此类病毒一般不会通过空气传播，但美国国家科学院认定可能会通过生物气溶胶传播，病房外走廊上的空气收集器检测出病毒 RNA 阳性样本。
en-mt: Although such viruses are generally not airborne, the National Academy of Sciences determined that they may be transmitted through bioaerosols, and air collectors in the corridors outside the wards detected positive samples for viral RNA.

sourceString: Some medical procedures such as intubation and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) may cause respiratory secretions to be aerosolised and thus result in airborne spread.
targetString: 插管和心肺复苏 (CPR) 等医疗程序可能会使呼吸道分泌物雾化，进而造成空气传播。
en-mt: Medical procedures such as intubation and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) may aerosolize respiratory secretions, resulting in airborne transmission.

sourceString: While there are concerns it may spread via feces, this risk is believed to be low.The virus is most contagious when people are symptomatic; while spread may be possible before symptoms emerge, the risk is low.
targetString: 还有人担心病毒可能会通过粪便传播，但这种风险被认为较低。当患者出现症状时，病毒的传染性最强；尽管出现症状前可能传播，但风险较低。
en-mt: There are also concerns that the virus could be transmitted through feces, but the risk is considered low. The virus is most contagious when a patient is symptomatic; although transmission is possible before symptoms appear, the risk is low.

sourceString: The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) says while it is not entirely clear how easily the disease spreads, one person generally infects two to three others.The virus survives for hours to days on surfaces.
targetString: 欧洲疾控中心 (ECDC) 表示，虽然新冠病毒的传播力尚不完全明确，但一般 1 人会传染 2-3 人。该病毒在物体表面的存活时间从几小时到几天不等。
en-mt: The European Center for Disease Control and Prevention (ECDC) stated that although the transmission of the new coronavirus is not yet fully understood, generally one person can infect 2-3 others. The virus can survive on surfaces for anywhere from a few hours to a few days.

sourceString: Specifically, the virus was found to be detectable for one day on cardboard, for up to three days on plastic (polypropylene) and stainless steel (AISI 304), and for up to four hours on 99% copper.
targetString: 具体来说，已知新冠病毒在纸板上可存活一天，在塑料（聚丙烯）和不锈钢 (AISI 304) 上最长可存活三天，在 99% 纯度的铜制品上最多可存活四小时。
en-mt: Specifically, COVID-19 is known to survive for one day on cardboard, up to three days on plastic (polypropylene) and stainless steel (AISI 304), and up to four hours on 99% pure copper.

sourceString: This, however, varies depending on the humidity and temperature.
targetString: 不过，其存活时间也受湿度和温度的影响。
en-mt: However, its survival time is also affected by humidity and temperature.

sourceString: Soap and detergent are also effective if correctly used; soap products degrade the virus' fatty protective layer, deactivating it, as well as freeing them from skin and other surfaces.
targetString: 倘若正确使用，肥皂和清洁剂也可起到杀灭病毒的效果。肥皂产品可降解病毒的脂肪保护层，使其失去活性，同时还能将病毒从皮肤和其他表面清除。
en-mt: Soaps and detergents can also kill viruses when used correctly. Soap products degrade the fatty protective coating of the virus, making it inactive, while also removing the virus from the skin and other surfaces.

sourceString: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chlorhexidine gluconate (a surgical disinfectant), are less effective.In a Hong Kong study, saliva samples were taken a median of two days after the start of hospitalization.
targetString: 其他溶液如苯扎氯铵和氯己定葡萄糖酸盐（一种手术消毒液）的效果较差。中国香港的一项研究显示，平均在入院后两天采集唾液样本。
en-mt: Other solutions such as benzalkonium chloride and chlorhexidine gluconate (a surgical antiseptic) are less effective. In a study in Hong Kong, China, saliva samples were collected an average of two days after hospital admission.

sourceString: In five of six patients, the first sample showed the highest viral load, and the sixth patient showed the highest viral load on the second day tested.
targetString: 5/6 的患者第一份样本的病毒载量最高，1/6 的患者第二天检测出的病毒载量最高。
en-mt: Five out of six patients had the highest viral load on the first sample, and one out of six patients had the highest viral load detected the next day.

sourceString: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a novel severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus, first isolated from three people with pneumonia connected to the cluster of acute respiratory illness cases in Wuhan.
targetString: 严重急性呼吸道综合征冠状病毒 2 型 (SARS-CoV-2) 是一种新型严重急性呼吸道综合征冠状病毒，最先是从武汉一批急性呼吸系统疾病病例的三名肺炎患者身上分离出的。
en-mt: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus type 2 (SARS-CoV-2), a novel severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus, was first isolated from three patients with pneumonia in a cluster of acute respiratory disease cases in Wuhan.

sourceString: All features of the novel SARS-CoV-2 virus occur in related coronaviruses in nature.
targetString: 这种新型 SARS-CoV-2 病毒的所有特征在自然界的相关冠状病毒中均有呈现。
en-mt: All the features of this novel SARS-CoV-2 virus are present in related coronaviruses in nature.

sourceString: Outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which bursts its protective bubble.SARS-CoV-2 is closely related to the original SARS-CoV.
targetString: 病毒未进入人体之前，可用家用肥皂将其杀灭，因为肥皂能够破坏病毒的保护囊膜。SARS-CoV-2 与最初的 SARS-CoV 密切相关。
en-mt: Household soap can be used to kill the virus before it enters the body, because soap destroys the protective envelope of the virus. SARS-CoV-2 is closely related to the original SARS-CoV.

sourceString: The lungs are the organs most affected by COVID-19 because the virus accesses host cells via the enzyme angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2), which is most abundant in the type II alveolar cells of the lungs.
targetString: 肺部是受 COVID-19 影响最严重的器官，因为这种病毒通过血管紧张素转换酶 2 (ACE2) 进入宿主细胞，而后者在肺的 II 型肺泡细胞中含量最高。
en-mt: The lungs are the organ most affected by COVID-19 because the virus enters host cells through angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2), which is most abundant in type II alveolar cells of the lung.

sourceString: The virus uses a special surface glycoprotein called a "spike" (peplomer) to connect to ACE2 and enter the host cell.
targetString: 该病毒通过一种名为“刺突”（囊微粒）的特殊表面糖蛋白与 ACE2 结合并进入宿主细胞。
en-mt: The virus binds to ACE2 and enters host cells through a special surface glycoprotein called the "spike" (capsule particle).

sourceString: Acute cardiac injury was found in 12% of infected people admitted in hospital in Wuhan, China, and is more frequent in severe disease.
targetString: 在中国武汉的医院收治的患者中，有 12% 的感染者发现存在急性心肌损伤，重症患者比例较高。
en-mt: Acute myocardial injury was found in 12% of infected patients admitted to hospitals in Wuhan, China, with a higher proportion of critically ill patients.

sourceString: Rates of cardiovascular symptoms is high, owing to the systemic inflammatory response and immune system disorders during disease progression, but acute myocardial injury may also be related to ACE2 receptors in the heart.
targetString: 因病症恶化过程引起全身炎症反应和免疫系统紊乱，心血管症状发生率较高，但急性心肌损伤也可能与心脏的 ACE2 受体有关。
en-mt: The incidence of cardiovascular symptoms is higher due to the systemic inflammatory response and immune system disturbance caused by the exacerbation process, but acute myocardial injury may also be related to the ACE2 receptor of the heart.

sourceString: ACE2 receptors are highly expressed in the heart and are involved in heart function.
targetString: ACE2 受体在心脏中高度表达并参与调节心脏功能。
en-mt: ACE2 receptors are highly expressed in the heart and are involved in regulating cardiac function.

sourceString: A high incidence of thrombosis (31%) and venous thromboembolism (25%) have been found in ICU patients with COVID-19 infections and may be related to poor prognosis.Autopsies of people who died of COVID-19 have found diffuse alveolar damage (DAD), and lymphocyte-containing inflammatory infiltrates within the lung.
targetString: 据悉，ICU 监护的 COVID-19 感染者的血栓 (31%) 和静脉血栓栓塞 (25%) 发生率较高，可能与预后不良有关。COVID-19 致死患者尸检发现弥漫性肺泡损伤 (DAD)，肺内见淋巴细胞炎性浸润。
en-mt: It is reported that ICU patients with COVID-19 infection have higher incidence of thrombosis (31%) and venous thromboembolism (25%), which may be related to poor prognosis. Autopsy of a patient who died of COVID-19 revealed diffuse alveolar damage (DAD) and inflammatory infiltration of lymphocytes in the lungs.

sourceString: Although SARS-COV-2 has a tropism for ACE2-expressing epithelial cells of the respiratory tract, patients with severe COVID-19 have symptoms of systemic hyperinflammation.
targetString: 尽管 SARS-COV-2 对表达 ACE2 的呼吸道上皮细胞具有嗜性，但 COVID-19 重症患者会出现全身过度炎症反应。
en-mt: Despite the tropism of SARS-CoV-2 for ACE2-expressing airway epithelial cells, severe COVID-19 patients develop an exaggerated systemic inflammatory response.

sourceString: In particular, pathogenic GM-CSF-secreting T-cells were shown to correlate with the recruitment of inflammatory IL-6-secreting monocytes and severe lung pathology in COVID-19 patients.
targetString: 特别是，COVID-19 患者体内的致病性 GM-CSF 分泌 T 细胞与炎性 IL-6 分泌性单核细胞的募集和严重肺部病理相关。
en-mt: In particular, pathogenic GM-CSF-secreting T cells in COVID-19 patients were associated with recruitment of inflammatory IL-6-secreting monocytes and severe lung pathology.

sourceString: Lymphocytic infiltrates have also been reported at autopsy.
targetString: 尸检报告同样见淋巴细胞浸润。
en-mt: The autopsy report also showed lymphocytic infiltration.

sourceString: The WHO has published several testing protocols for the disease.
targetString: WHO 公布了几种疾病检测方案。
en-mt: WHO publishes several disease detection protocols.

sourceString: The standard method of testing is real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).
targetString: 标准检测方法是采用实时逆转录聚合酶链反应 (rRT-PCR)。
en-mt: The standard detection method is real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).

sourceString: The test is typically done on respiratory samples obtained by a nasopharyngeal swab; however, a nasal swab or sputum sample may also be used.
targetString: 这项检测通常对通过鼻咽拭子获取的呼吸道样本进行检测；但是，也可以使用鼻拭子或痰液样本。
en-mt: This test is usually performed on a respiratory sample obtained by nasopharyngeal swab; however, a nasal swab or sputum sample can also be used.

sourceString: Results are generally available within a few hours to two days.
targetString: 一般情况下，几个小时至两天内即可得到结果。
en-mt: Typically, results are available within a few hours to two days.

sourceString: Blood tests can be used, but these require two blood samples taken two weeks apart and the results have little immediate value.
targetString: 还可以进行血液检测，但要求两次采集血样需间隔两周，结果几乎不具备即时价值。
en-mt: Blood testing is also available, but requires two weeks between blood samples and results have little immediate value.

sourceString: Chinese scientists were able to isolate a strain of the coronavirus and publish the genetic sequence so laboratories across the world could independently develop polymerase chain reaction (PCR) tests to detect infection by the virus.
targetString: 中国科学家已经能够分离冠状病毒菌株并公布基因序列，以便世界各地的实验室独立开发聚合酶链反应 (PCR) 检测试剂，进而检测是否感染病毒。
en-mt: Chinese scientists have been able to isolate coronavirus strains and publish their genetic sequences, allowing laboratories around the world to independently develop polymerase chain reaction (PCR) tests to detect infection with the virus.

sourceString: As of 4 April 2020, antibody tests (which may detect active infections and whether a person had been infected in the past) were in development, but not yet widely used.
targetString: 截至 2020 年 4 月 4 日，抗体检测（不仅可以检测活动性感染，还能检测个人过去是否感染过病毒）仍在研发当中，但尚未推广使用。
en-mt: As of April 4, 2020, antibody tests (which can detect not only active infection but also whether an individual has had the virus in the past) are still in development but not yet widely available.

sourceString: The Chinese experience with testing has shown the accuracy is only 60 to 70%.
targetString: 根据中国的经验，检测准确度仅为 60% 到 70%。
en-mt: According to China's experience, the detection accuracy is only 60% to 70%.

sourceString: The FDA in the United States approved the first point-of-care test on 21 March 2020 for use at the end of that month.Diagnostic guidelines released by Zhongnan Hospital of Wuhan University suggested methods for detecting infections based upon clinical features and epidemiological risk.
targetString: 2020 年 3 月 21 日，美国 FDA 批准了首个即时诊断试剂，并于当月底投入使用。武汉大学中南医院发布的诊断指南提出根据临床特征和流行病学风险检测感染的方法。
en-mt: On March 21, 2020, the US FDA approved the first point-of-care diagnostic reagent and it was put into use at the end of the month. The diagnostic guidelines issued by Zhongnan Hospital of Wuhan University propose methods to detect infection based on clinical features and epidemiological risk.

sourceString: Bilateral multilobar ground-glass opacities with a peripheral, asymmetric and posterior distribution are common in early infection.
targetString: 早期感染多见双肺多叶磨玻璃影，具有外周非对称和后部分布。
en-mt: Early infection often sees multilobar ground-glass opacities in both lungs, with peripheral asymmetry and posterior distribution.

sourceString: Subpleural dominance, crazy paving (lobular septal thickening with variable alveolar filling), and consolidation may appear as the disease progresses.
targetString: 随着病毒发展，可能出现胸膜下显性、碎石路征（小叶间隔增厚伴不同程度的肺泡充盈）和肺实变。
en-mt: As the virus progresses, subpleural dominance, gravel road signs (thickened interlobular septa with varying degrees of alveolar filling), and pulmonary consolidation may occur.

sourceString: Few data are available about microscopic lesions and the pathophysiology of COVID-19.
targetString: 关于 COVID-19 微观病理损伤和病理生理的信息极少。
en-mt: Little information is available on the microscopic pathological lesions and pathophysiology of COVID-19.

sourceString: The main pathological findings at autopsy are:
targetString: 尸检主要病理发现如下：
en-mt: The main pathological findings of the autopsy were as follows:

sourceString: Macroscopy: pleurisy, pericarditis, lung consolidation and pulmonary oedema
targetString: 肉眼检查：胸膜炎、心包炎、肺实变和肺水肿
en-mt: Macroscopic examination: pleurisy, pericarditis, pulmonary consolidation, and pulmonary edema

sourceString: Four types of severity of viral pneumonia can be observed:
targetString: 观察到四个严重级别的病毒性肺炎：
en-mt: Four grades of severity of viral pneumonia were observed:

sourceString: mild pneumonia: pulmonary oedema, pneumocyte hyperplasia, large atypical pneumocytes, interstitial inflammation with lymphocytic infiltration and multinucleated giant cell formation
targetString: 轻度肺炎：肺水肿、肺细胞增生、大量非典型肺细胞、间质性炎症伴淋巴细胞浸润及形成多核巨细胞
en-mt: Mild pneumonia: pulmonary edema, pneumocyte hyperplasia, large number of atypical pneumocytes, interstitial inflammation with lymphocytic infiltration and formation of multinucleated giant cells

sourceString: severe pneumonia: diffuse alveolar damage (DAD) with diffuse alveolar exudates.
targetString: 重度肺炎：弥漫性肺泡损伤 (DAD) 伴弥漫性肺泡渗出液。
en-mt: Severe pneumonia: Diffuse alveolar damage (DAD) with diffuse alveolar exudate.

sourceString: DAD is the cause of acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) and severe hypoxemia.
targetString: DAD 是引发急性呼吸窘迫综合征 (ARDS) 和严重低氧血症的病因。
en-mt: DAD is the cause of acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) and severe hypoxemia.

sourceString: healing pneumonia: organisation of exudates in alveolar cavities and pulmonary interstitial fibrosis
targetString: 恢复期肺炎：肺泡腔渗出液机化和肺间质纤维化
en-mt: Convalescent pneumonia: organization of alveolar exudate and pulmonary interstitial fibrosis

sourceString: Blood: disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC); leukoerythroblastic reaction
targetString: 血液：弥散性血管内凝血 (DIC)；幼白-幼红细胞反应
en-mt: Blood: disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC); leukoerythroblast reaction

sourceString: Preventive measures to reduce the chances of infection include staying at home, avoiding crowded places, washing hands with soap and water often and for at least 20 seconds, practising good respiratory hygiene and avoiding touching the eyes, nose or mouth with unwashed hands.
targetString: 为降低感染几率，可采取的预防措施包括：呆在家中；避开进入人群密集区域；经常用肥皂和水洗手并至少持续 20 秒；保持良好的呼吸道卫生；避免未洗手的情况下触摸眼睛、鼻子或嘴巴。
en-mt: To reduce the chance of infection, preventive measures you can take include: staying home; avoiding crowded areas; washing hands frequently with soap and water for at least 20 seconds; practicing good respiratory hygiene; nose or mouth.

sourceString: The CDC recommends covering the mouth and nose with a tissue when coughing or sneezing and recommends using the inside of the elbow if no tissue is available.
targetString: 美国疾控中心 (CDC) 建议在咳嗽或打喷嚏时用纸巾捂住口鼻；如果没有纸巾，建议使用手肘内侧遮挡。
en-mt: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) recommends covering your mouth and nose with a tissue when coughing or sneezing; if a tissue is not available, use the inside of your elbow.

sourceString: Proper hand hygiene after any cough or sneeze is encouraged.
targetString: 建议在咳嗽或打喷嚏后妥善清洁手部卫生。
en-mt: Proper hand hygiene after coughing or sneezing is recommended.

sourceString: The CDC has recommended the use of cloth face coverings in public settings, in part to limit transmission by asymptomatic individuals.Social distancing strategies aim to reduce contact of infected persons with large groups by closing schools and workplaces, restricting travel and cancelling large public gatherings.
targetString: CDC 建议在公共场合佩戴布面口罩，在某种程度上防止无症状患者传播病毒。保持社交距离策略的核心在于关闭学校和工作场所、限制出行并取消大型公共集会，从而减少感染者与大规模群体接触的机会。
en-mt: The CDC recommends wearing cloth face masks in public as a way to prevent asymptomatic patients from spreading the virus. At the heart of social distancing strategies are closing schools and workplaces, restricting travel and canceling large public gatherings to reduce the chances of infected people coming into contact with large groups.

sourceString: Distancing guidelines also include that people stay at least 6 feet (1.8 m) apart.
targetString: 另外，社交距离准则规定在人际交往中至少保持 6 英尺（1.8 米）的距离。
en-mt: In addition, social distancing guidelines require maintaining a distance of at least 6 feet (1.8 meters) between people.

sourceString: There is no medication known to be effective at preventing COVID-19.As a vaccine is not expected until 2021 at the earliest, a key part of managing COVID-19 is trying to decrease the epidemic peak, known as "flattening the curve".
targetString: 尚无有效预防 COVID-19 的药物。鉴于预计至少要到 2021 年才能研制出疫苗，因而努力降低疫情峰值是控制 COVID-19 传播的关键，也就是我们所知的“拉平流行病学曲线”。
en-mt: There are no effective drugs to prevent COVID-19. With a vaccine not expected to be developed until at least 2021, efforts to reduce the peak of the epidemic are key to controlling the spread of COVID-19, known as "flattening the epidemiological curve."

sourceString: The CDC also recommends that individuals wash hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, especially after going to the toilet or when hands are visibly dirty, before eating and after blowing one's nose, coughing or sneezing.
targetString: 同时，CDC 建议人们经常用肥皂和自来水洗手至少 20 秒，尤其是在如厕后或手上有明显污物时、饭前以及擤鼻涕、咳嗽或打喷嚏后。
en-mt: In the meantime, the CDC recommends that people wash their hands frequently with soap and running water for at least 20 seconds, especially after using the toilet or when hands are visibly soiled, before eating, and after blowing their nose, coughing or sneezing.

sourceString: It further recommends using an alcohol-based hand sanitiser with at least 60% alcohol, but only when soap and water are not readily available.For areas where commercial hand sanitisers are not readily available, the WHO provides two formulations for local production.
targetString: 另外，还建议使用酒精含量至少达 60% 的含酒精洗手液洗手，但仅在身边没有肥皂和自来水时使用。对于无法购买免水洗手液的地区，WHO 提供了两种配方以便就地生产。
en-mt: Washing your hands with an alcohol-based hand sanitizer that contains at least 60% alcohol is also recommended, but only when soap and running water are not readily available. For areas where hand sanitizers cannot be purchased, WHO has provided two formulations for on-site production.

sourceString: In these formulations, the antimicrobial activity arises from ethanol or isopropanol.
targetString: 这些配方通过乙醇或异丙醇激发抗菌活性。
en-mt: These formulations stimulate antimicrobial activity with ethanol or isopropanol.

sourceString: Hydrogen peroxide is used to help eliminate bacterial spores in the alcohol; it is "not an active substance for hand antisepsis".
targetString: 利用过氧化氢帮助消除酒精中的细菌孢子；过氧化氢并非“手部消毒活性物质”。
en-mt: Utilizes hydrogen peroxide to help eliminate bacterial spores in alcohol; hydrogen peroxide is not a "hand sanitizing active."

sourceString: Glycerol is added as a humectant.
targetString: 加入甘油作为保湿剂。
en-mt: Glycerin is added as a humectant.

sourceString: People are managed with supportive care, which may include fluid therapy, oxygen support, and supporting other affected vital organs.
targetString: 为人们提供支持性护理，其中可能包括输液疗法、氧气支持及其他受影响的重要器官支持。
en-mt: Provide supportive care for people, which may include infusion therapy, oxygen support, and support for other affected vital organs.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that those who suspect they carry the virus wear a simple face mask.
targetString: CDC 建议疑似病毒携带者佩戴简易口罩。
en-mt: CDC recommends that suspected virus carriers wear simple masks.

sourceString: Extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) has been used to address the issue of respiratory failure, but its benefits are still under consideration.
targetString: 现已采用体外膜式氧合 (ECMO) 缓解呼吸衰竭症状，但其益处仍有待研究。
en-mt: Extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) has been used to relieve symptoms of respiratory failure, but its benefits remain to be studied.

sourceString: Personal hygiene and a healthy lifestyle and diet have been recommended to improve immunity.
targetString: 建议保持个人卫生并倡导健康生活方式和饮食习惯，从而提高免疫力。
en-mt: It is recommended to maintain personal hygiene and promote a healthy lifestyle and diet to improve immunity.

sourceString: Supportive treatments may be useful in those with mild symptoms at the early stage of infection.The WHO and Chinese National Health Commission have published recommendations for taking care of people who are hospitalised with COVID-19.
targetString: 对于感染早期的轻症患者，支持性疗法可能有效。WHO 和中国国家卫生健康委员会发出倡议，呼吁妥善护理入院治疗的 COVID-19 患者。
en-mt: For mild patients in the early stages of infection, supportive care may be effective. WHO and the National Health Commission of China have issued an initiative calling for proper care of COVID-19 patients admitted to hospital.

sourceString: Intensivists and pulmonologists in the U.S. have compiled treatment recommendations from various agencies into a free resource, the IBCC.
targetString: 美国危重病学专家和肺脏专家已将各机构提出的治疗建议汇编成册并通过 IBCC 免费提供。
en-mt: Treatment recommendations from various institutions have been compiled by American critical care and pulmonary specialists and are freely available through IBCC.

sourceString: As of April 2020, there is no specific treatment for COVID-19.
targetString: 截至 2020 年 4 月，尚未研制出 COVID-19 特效疗法。
en-mt: As of April 2020, no specific treatment for COVID-19 has been developed.

sourceString: For symptoms, some medical professionals recommend paracetamol (acetaminophen) over ibuprofen for first-line use.
targetString: 针对某些症状，部分医学专家建议使用扑热息痛（对乙酰氨基酚）代替布洛芬进行一线治疗。
en-mt: For some symptoms, some medical experts recommend paracetamol (acetaminophen) instead of ibuprofen as first-line treatment.

sourceString: Precautions must be taken to minimise the risk of virus transmission, especially in healthcare settings when performing procedures that can generate aerosols, such as intubation or hand ventilation.
targetString: 必须采取预防措施，最大限度地降低病毒传播风险，在医疗环境下完成可能产生气溶胶的操作，如插管或以手通气时尤其要注意防护。
en-mt: Precautions must be taken to minimize the risk of virus transmission, especially when performing aerosol-generating procedures in healthcare settings, such as intubation or manual ventilation.

sourceString: For healthcare professionals caring for people with COVID-19, the CDC recommends placing the person in an Airborne Infection Isolation Room (AIIR) in addition to using standard precautions, contact precautions and airborne precautions.The CDC outlines the guidelines for the use of personal protective equipment (PPE) during the pandemic.
targetString: 对于看护 COVID-19 患者的医护人员，CDC 建议除采取标准预防措施、接触预防措施和空气传播预防措施以外，还应将患者转移到空气传播传染病隔离室 (AIIR)。CDC 概括介绍了疫情期间个人防护设备 (PPE) 的使用准则。
en-mt: For healthcare workers caring for a patient with COVID-19, CDC recommends that, in addition to standard precautions, contact precautions, and airborne precautions, the patient be transferred to an Airborne Infectious Disease Isolation Room (AIIR). CDC has outlined guidelines for the use of personal protective equipment (PPE) during an outbreak.

sourceString: The recommended gear is: PPE gown, respirator or facemask, eye protection, and medical gloves.When available, respirators (instead of facemasks) are preferred.
targetString: 推荐装备：PPE 防护服、呼吸器或口罩、眼部防护和医用手套。如果可以，最好使用呼吸器（而非口罩）。
en-mt: Recommended equipment: PPE protective clothing, respirator or mask, eye protection and medical gloves. It is preferable to use a respirator (rather than a mask) if available.

sourceString: N95 respirators are approved for industrial settings but the FDA has authorised the masks for use under an Emergency Use Authorisation (EUA).
targetString: N95 口罩获准在工业场合使用，但 FDA 已根据紧急使用授权 (EUA) 授权使用这种口罩。
en-mt: N95 masks are approved for use in industrial settings, but the FDA has authorized their use under an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA).

sourceString: They are designed to protect from airborne particles like dust but effectiveness against a specific biological agent is not guaranteed for off-label uses.
targetString: 它主要用于防止吸入悬浮粒子（如灰尘），但用作其他用途时无法保证有效隔绝特定生物制剂。
en-mt: It is primarily used to prevent the inhalation of suspended particulates such as dust, but is not guaranteed to be effective against specific biological agents when used for other purposes.

sourceString: When masks are not available, the CDC recommends using face shields or, as a last resort, homemade masks.
targetString: 如果没有口罩，CDC 建议使用面罩，必要时还可以佩戴自制口罩。
en-mt: If a mask is not available, the CDC recommends using a face covering and, if necessary, a homemade mask.

sourceString: Most cases of COVID-19 are not severe enough to require mechanical ventilation or alternatives, but a percentage of cases are.
targetString: 大多数 COVID-19 病例症状较轻，无需使用机械通气或其他备选方案，但一定比例的病例需要采取此类措施。
en-mt: Most cases of COVID-19 have mild symptoms that do not require the use of mechanical ventilation or other alternatives, although a proportion of cases require such measures.

sourceString: The type of respiratory support for individuals with COVID-19 related respiratory failure is being actively studied for people in hospital, with some evidence that intubation can be avoided with a high flow nasal cannula or bi-level positive airway pressure.
targetString: 医护人员正在积极开展研究，希望为出现呼吸衰竭症状的 COVID-19 患者提供呼吸支持。有证据表明，经鼻高流量氧疗或双相气道正压通气可避免插管。
en-mt: Healthcare professionals are actively conducting research to provide respiratory support for COVID-19 patients with symptoms of respiratory failure. There is evidence that nasal high-flow oxygen therapy or biphasic positive airway pressure can avoid intubation.

sourceString: Whether either of these two leads to the same benefit for people who are critically ill is not known.
targetString: 尚不清楚上述两种治疗方案能否对重症患者产生同等疗效。
en-mt: It is unclear whether the two treatment options described above are equally effective in severely ill patients.

sourceString: Some doctors prefer staying with invasive mechanical ventilation when available because this technique limits the spread of aerosol particles compared to a high flow nasal cannula.Severe cases are most common in older adults (those older than 60 years, and especially those older than 80 years).
targetString: 如果条件允许，有些医生倾向使用有创机械通气，因为相较于经鼻高流量氧疗，这项技术还能限制气溶胶颗粒扩散。重症病例以老年人（60 岁以上，特别是 80 岁以上的老年人）为主。
en-mt: When available, some physicians prefer to use invasive mechanical ventilation because this technique also limits the spread of aerosol particles compared to nasal high-flow oxygen therapy. Severe cases are mainly elderly people (over 60 years old, especially those over 80 years old).

sourceString: Many developed countries do not have enough hospital beds per capita, which limits a health system's capacity to handle a sudden spike in the number of COVID-19 cases severe enough to require hospitalisation.
targetString: 许多发达国家人均病床数不足，鉴于医疗条件限制，医疗体系无法应付因 COVID-19 病例人数激增导致需要入院治疗的严峻局面。
en-mt: Many developed countries have insufficient hospital beds per capita and, given medical constraints, healthcare systems cannot cope with the severe situation of surges in the number of COVID-19 cases requiring hospital admissions.

sourceString: One study in China found 5% were admitted to intensive care units, 2.3% needed mechanical support of ventilation, and 1.4% died.
targetString: 中国的一项研究发现，5% 的患者需送往重症监护室，2.3% 的患者需机械通气，1.4% 的患者将因此致死。
en-mt: A Chinese study found that 5% of patients required admission to the intensive care unit, 2.3% required mechanical ventilation, and 1.4% would die.

sourceString: In China, approximately 30% of people in hospital with COVID-19 are eventually admitted to ICU.
targetString: 中国约有 30% 的 COVID-19 入院患者最终被送入 ICU。
en-mt: About 30% of patients admitted to hospital with COVID-19 in China end up in the ICU.

sourceString: Mechanical ventilation becomes more complex as acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) develops in COVID-19 and oxygenation becomes increasingly difficult.
targetString: 随着 COVID-19 引发的急性呼吸窘迫综合征 (ARDS) 的发展，机械通气复杂度进一步提升，氧合难度越来越大。
en-mt: With the development of acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) caused by COVID-19, the complexity of mechanical ventilation has further increased, and oxygenation has become more and more difficult.

sourceString: Ventilators capable of pressure control modes and high PEEP are needed to maximise oxygen delivery while minimising the risk of ventilator-associated lung injury and pneumothorax.
targetString: 届时需采用支持压力控制模式和高 PEEP 的呼吸机，以期最大程度地输送氧气，同时尽量降低呼吸机引发肺损伤和气胸的风险。
en-mt: Ventilators that support pressure-controlled modes and high PEEP will be required to maximize oxygen delivery while minimizing the risk of ventilator-induced lung injury and pneumothorax.

sourceString: High PEEP may not be available on older ventilators.
targetString: 旧式呼吸机可能无法实现高 PEEP。
en-mt: Older ventilators may not be able to achieve high PEEP.

sourceString: Research into potential treatments started in January 2020, and several antiviral drugs are in clinical trials.
targetString: 自 2020 年 1 月起开始研究潜在疗法，目前已有若干抗病毒药进入临床试验阶段。
en-mt: Research on potential treatments has been underway since January 2020, and several antivirals are currently in clinical trials.

sourceString: Remdesivir appears to be the most promising.
targetString: 瑞德西韦似乎是目前最具潜力的一种药物。
en-mt: Remdesivir appears to be one of the most promising drugs right now.

sourceString: Although new medications may take until 2021 to develop, several of the medications being tested are already approved for other uses or are already in advanced testing.
targetString: 尽管或许到 2021 年才会研发出新的药物，但接受测试的几种药物要么已批准用作其他用途，要么已进入高级测试阶段。
en-mt: While new drugs may not be developed until 2021, several of the drugs tested are either already approved for other uses or in advanced testing.

sourceString: Antiviral medication may be tried in people with severe disease.
targetString: 重症患者可尝试使用抗病毒药物。
en-mt: Severely ill patients can try antiviral drugs.

sourceString: The WHO recommended volunteers take part in trials of the effectiveness and safety of potential treatments.The FDA has granted temporary authorisation to convalescent plasma as an experimental treatment in cases where the person's life is seriously or immediately threatened.
targetString: WHO 呼吁广大志愿者参与潜在疗法有效性和安全性试验。FDA 已临时授权恢复期血浆输血作为实验性治疗，治疗生命垂危的重症患者。
en-mt: WHO calls on volunteers to participate in trials of the effectiveness and safety of potential treatments. The FDA has temporarily authorized convalescent plasma transfusions as an experimental treatment for critically ill patients who are dying.

sourceString: It has not undergone the clinical studies needed to show it is safe and effective for the disease.
targetString: 目前尚未开展必要临床研究来证明该疗法能否安全有效地治疗这种疾病。
en-mt: The clinical studies necessary to prove that this therapy is safe and effective in treating this disease have not yet been conducted.

sourceString: In February 2020, China launched a mobile app to deal with the disease outbreak.
targetString: 2020 年 2 月，中国发布了一款用于遏制疫情爆发的移动应用。
en-mt: In February 2020, China released a mobile app to contain the outbreak.

sourceString: Users are asked to enter their name and ID number.
targetString: 用户需按要求输入姓名和身份证号码。
en-mt: Users need to enter their name and ID number as required.

sourceString: The app is able to detect 'close contact' using surveillance data and therefore a potential risk of infection.
targetString: 这款应用能够通过监测数据检测“密切接触”，进而判断潜在感染风险。
en-mt: This app can detect "close contact" through monitoring data, and then judge the potential risk of infection.

sourceString: Every user can also check the status of three other users.
targetString: 每位用户还可检查另外三位用户的状态。
en-mt: Each user can also check the status of three other users.

sourceString: If a potential risk is detected, the app not only recommends self-quarantine, it also alerts local health officials.Big data analytics on cellphone data, facial recognition technology, mobile phone tracking and artificial intelligence are used to track infected people and people whom they contacted in South Korea, Taiwan and Singapore.
targetString: 一旦检测到潜在风险，该应用不仅会建议自我隔离，还会向当地卫生官员发出警报。综合运用手机数据大数据分析、面部识别技术、手机跟踪和人工智能，跟踪感染者及其在韩国、中国台湾和新加坡接触的人员。
en-mt: Once a potential risk is detected, the app not only recommends self-isolation, but also alerts local health officials. Comprehensively use big data analysis of mobile phone data, facial recognition technology, mobile phone tracking and artificial intelligence to track infected people and their contacts in South Korea, Taiwan and Singapore.

sourceString: In March 2020, the Israeli government enabled security agencies to track mobile phone data of people supposed to have coronavirus.
targetString: 2020 年 3 月，以色列政府批准安全机构追踪疑似冠状病毒携带者的手机数据。
en-mt: In March 2020, the Israeli government authorized security agencies to track cellphone data of suspected coronavirus carriers.

sourceString: The measure was taken to enforce quarantine and protect those who may come into contact with infected citizens.
targetString: 采取这项措施的目的在于强制隔离，保护可能接触已感染公民的群体。
en-mt: The purpose of this measure is to enforce isolation and protect groups that may have come into contact with infected citizens.

sourceString: Also in March 2020, Deutsche Telekom shared aggregated phone location data with the German federal government agency, Robert Koch Institute, in order to research and prevent the spread of the virus.
targetString: 同样在 2020 年 3 月，德国电信与德国联邦政府机构罗伯特·科赫研究所共享汇总的手机位置数据，以便研究并防范病毒扩散。
en-mt: Also in March 2020, Deutsche Telekom shared aggregated mobile phone location data with the Robert Koch Institute, a German federal government agency, to study and prevent the spread of the virus.

sourceString: Russia deployed facial recognition technology to detect quarantine breakers.
targetString: 俄罗斯部署面部识别技术，检测违反隔离规定的人员。
en-mt: Russia deploys facial recognition technology to detect people violating quarantine rules.

sourceString: Italian regional health commissioner Giulio Gallera said he has been informed by mobile phone operators that "40% of people are continuing to move around anyway".
targetString: 意大利区域卫生专员 Giulio Gallera 指出，移动电话运营商数据显示“40% 的公民仍在四处走动”。
en-mt: Giulio Gallera, Italy's regional health commissioner, pointed to data from mobile phone operators showing that "40% of citizens are still moving around".

sourceString: German government conducted a 48 hours weekend hackathon with more than 42.000 participants.
targetString: 德国政府举办了一场48小时的周末黑客马拉松，参与人数超过 42,000 人。
en-mt: The German government hosted a 48-hour weekend hackathon with more than 42,000 participants.

sourceString: Also the president of Estonia, Kersti Kaljulaid, made a global call for creative solutions against the spread of coronavirus.
targetString: 另外，爱沙尼亚总统 Kersti Kaljulaid 呼吁在全球范围内采取创意解决方案，防止冠状病毒扩散。
en-mt: Separately, Estonian President Kersti Kaljulaid called for creative solutions around the world to prevent the spread of the coronavirus.

sourceString: Individuals may experience distress from quarantine, travel restrictions, side effects of treatment or fear of the infection itself.
targetString: 隔离、出行限制、治疗副作用或担心自身感染，所有这些都可能让人困扰不已。
en-mt: Quarantine, travel restrictions, side effects of treatment, or fear of getting infected yourself can all be overwhelming.

sourceString: BBC quoted Rory O'Connor in saying, "Increased social isolation, loneliness, health anxiety, stress and an economic downturn are a perfect storm to harm people's mental health and wellbeing."
targetString: BBC 引用 Rory O'Connor 的观点，“社会孤立感、孤独感、健康焦虑、压力和经济不景气是伤害人们心理健康和福祉的完美风暴。”
en-mt: The BBC quotes Rory O'Connor, "Social isolation, loneliness, health anxiety, stress and a bad economy are the perfect storm to harm people's mental health and wellbeing."

sourceString: The disease may take a mild course with few or no symptoms, resembling other common upper respiratory diseases such as the common cold.
targetString: 这种疾病较为温和，症状很少甚至不表现症状，类似于另一些普通的上呼吸道疾病，如普通感冒。
en-mt: The disease is milder, with few or no symptoms, similar to other common upper respiratory illnesses, such as the common cold.

sourceString: Mild cases typically recover within two weeks, while those with severe or critical diseases may take three to six weeks to recover.
targetString: 轻症病例通常在两周内可以恢复，而重症或危重症病例则可能需要三至六周才能恢复。
en-mt: Mild cases usually recover within two weeks, while severe or critical cases may take three to six weeks to recover.

sourceString: Pregnant women may be at higher risk for severe infection with COVID-19 based on data from other similar viruses, like SARS and MERS, but data for COVID-19 is lacking.In some people, COVID-19 may affect the lungs causing pneumonia.
targetString: 据其他类似病毒（如 SARS 和 MERS）数据显示，孕妇发展成 COVID-19 重症患者的风险较高，但缺乏 COVID-19 数据支持。COVID-19 可能会对部分人的肺部产生影响，进而引发肺炎。
en-mt: Pregnant women are at higher risk of developing severe COVID-19, according to data from other similar viruses such as SARS and MERS, but COVID-19 data are lacking. COVID-19 may affect the lungs of some people, causing pneumonia.

sourceString: In those most severely affected, COVID-19 may rapidly progress to acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) causing respiratory failure, septic shock or multi-organ failure.
targetString: 在受影响最严重的地区，COVID-19 可能迅速发展成为急性呼吸窘迫综合征 (ARDS)，进而导致呼吸衰竭、败血性休克或多器官功能衰竭。
en-mt: In the worst-affected areas, COVID-19 can rapidly progress to acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS), which can lead to respiratory failure, septic shock, or multiorgan failure.

sourceString: Complications associated with COVID-19 include sepsis, abnormal clotting and damage to the heart, kidneys and liver.
targetString: COVID-19 相关并发症包括败血症、凝血异常，以及心脏、肾脏和肝脏损伤。
en-mt: Complications associated with COVID-19 include sepsis, blood clotting abnormalities, and heart, kidney, and liver damage.

sourceString: Clotting abnormalities, specifically an increase in prothrombin time, have been described in 6% of those admitted to hospital with COVID-19, while abnormal kidney function is seen in 4% of this group.
targetString: 6% 的 COVID-19 入院患者存在凝血异常，尤其是凝血酶原时间延长，同时该组有 4% 的患者出现肾功能异常。
en-mt: Coagulation abnormalities, especially prolonged prothrombin time, were present in 6% of patients admitted to the hospital with COVID-19, while renal function abnormalities were present in 4% of patients in this group.

sourceString: Approximately 20-30% of people who present with COVID-19 demonstrate elevated liver enzymes (transaminases).
targetString: 约 20-30% 的 COVID-19 患者肝酶（转氨酶）升高。
en-mt: Liver enzymes (transaminases) are elevated in approximately 20-30% of COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: According to the same report, the median time between onset of symptoms and death was ten days, with five being spent hospitalised.
targetString: 据同一份报告显示，从发病到死亡的平均时间为十天，其中平均住院时间为五天。
en-mt: According to the same report, the average time from onset to death was ten days, with an average hospital stay of five days.

sourceString: However, patients transferred to an ICU had a median time of seven days between hospitalisation and death.
targetString: 但是，转入 ICU 的患者入院到死亡的平均时间为七天。
en-mt: However, the average time between admission and death for patients admitted to the ICU was seven days.

sourceString: In a study of early cases, the median time from exhibiting initial symptoms to death was 14 days, with a full range of six to 41 days.
targetString: 早期病例研究发现，从出现早期症状到死亡的平均时间为 14 天，总体时间范围为 6 至 41 天。
en-mt: Early case studies found that the mean time from onset of early symptoms to death was 14 days, with an overall time range of 6 to 41 days.

sourceString: In a study by the National Health Commission (NHC) of China, men had a death rate of 2.8% while women had a death rate of 1.7%.
targetString: 中国国家卫生健康委员会 (NHC) 的一项研究发现，男性死亡率为 2.8%，女性死亡率为 1.7%。
en-mt: A study by China's National Health Commission (NHC) found that the death rate was 2.8 percent for men and 1.7 percent for women.

sourceString: Histopathological examinations of post-mortem lung samples show diffuse alveolar damage with cellular fibromyxoid exudates in both lungs.
targetString: 尸体解剖肺部样本组织病理学检查显示，双肺均出现弥漫性肺泡损伤伴细胞纤维粘液样分泌物。
en-mt: Histopathological examination of autopsy lung samples revealed diffuse alveolar damage with cellular fibromyxoid secretions in both lungs.

sourceString: Viral cytopathic changes were observed in the pneumocytes.
targetString: 肺细胞观察到病毒性细胞病变。
en-mt: Viral cytopathy was observed in lung cells.

sourceString: The lung picture resembled acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).
targetString: 肺部影像类似于急性呼吸窘迫综合征 (ARDS)。
en-mt: Lung imaging is similar to acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).

sourceString: In 11.8% of the deaths reported by the National Health Commission of China, heart damage was noted by elevated levels of troponin or cardiac arrest.
targetString: 在中国国家卫生健康委员会报告的死亡病例中，有 11.8% 因肌钙蛋白水平升高或心脏骤停引发心脏损伤。
en-mt: Among the deaths reported by China's National Health Commission, 11.8% were caused by elevated troponin levels or cardiac injury caused by cardiac arrest.

sourceString: According to March data from the United States, 89% of those hospitalised had preexisting conditions.Availability of medical resources and the socioeconomics of a region may also affect mortality.
targetString: 根据美国 3 月份发布的数据，89% 的入院患者具有既往病史。医疗资源供应和区域社会经济状况也可能影响死亡率。
en-mt: According to data released in March in the United States, 89% of patients admitted to the hospital had a previous medical history. The availability of medical resources and regional socioeconomic conditions may also affect mortality.

sourceString: Estimates of the mortality from the condition vary because of those regional differences, but also because of methodological difficulties.
targetString: 鉴于区域差异和方法难度，疾病死亡率估算结果有所不同。
en-mt: Estimates of disease mortality varied due to regional differences and methodological difficulties.

sourceString: The under-counting of mild cases can cause the mortality rate to be overestimated.
targetString: 低估轻症病例可能导致高估死亡率。
en-mt: Underestimation of mild cases may lead to overestimation of mortality.

sourceString: However, the fact that deaths are the result of cases contracted in the past can mean the current mortality rate is underestimated.
targetString: 但是，如果病例死亡是由于之前感染所致，则可能意味着当前的死亡率被低估了。
en-mt: However, if the case death was due to a previous infection, it may mean that the current death rate is underestimated.

sourceString: Smokers were 1.4 times more likely to have severe symptoms of COVID-19 and approximately 2.4 times more likely to require intensive care or die compared to non-smokers.Concerns have been raised about long-term sequelae of the disease.
targetString: 相较于不吸烟者，吸烟者发展成 COVID-19 重症患者的几率高出 1.4 倍，需要重症监护或致死几率高出约 2.4 倍。人们对这种疾病的长期后遗症表示担忧。
en-mt: Compared with non-smokers, smokers were 1.4 times more likely to develop severe COVID-19 illness, and about 2.4 times more likely to require intensive care or die. Concerns have been raised about the long-term sequelae of the disease.

sourceString: The Hong Kong Hospital Authority found a drop of 20% to 30% in lung capacity in some people who recovered from the disease, and lung scans suggested organ damage.
targetString: 中国香港医院管理局发现，部分康复者的肺活量下降 20% 至 30%，肺部扫描显示器官受损。
en-mt: The Hong Kong Hospital Authority found that some of those who recovered had a 20% to 30% drop in lung capacity, and lung scans showed damage to the organ.

sourceString: This may also lead to post-intensive care syndrome following recovery.
targetString: 另外，康复后可能面临重症监护后综合征。
en-mt: In addition, post-intensive care syndrome may be faced after recovery.

sourceString: As of March 2020, it was unknown if past infection provides effective and long-term immunity in people who recover from the disease.
targetString: 截至 2020 年 3 月，尚不确定既往感染能否使康复者获得有效长效免疫。
en-mt: As of March 2020, it is uncertain whether past infection confers effective long-lasting immunity in recovered individuals.

sourceString: Immunity is seen as likely, based on the behaviour of other coronaviruses, but cases in which recovery from COVID-19 have been followed by positive tests for coronavirus at a later date have been reported.
targetString: 根据其他冠状病毒的行为特征认定可能产生免疫力，但有报道称部分 COVID-19 病例康复后不久进行冠状病毒检测呈阳性。
en-mt: Immunity is assumed to be possible based on behavioral characteristics of other coronaviruses, but there have been reports of some cases of COVID-19 testing positive for the coronavirus shortly after recovery.

sourceString: These cases are believed to be worsening of a lingering infection rather than re-infection.
targetString: 人们认为这些病例是持续感染恶化而非再感染。
en-mt: These cases are thought to be exacerbations of persistent infection rather than reinfection.

sourceString: The virus is thought to be natural and have an animal origin, through spillover infection.
targetString: 这种病毒被认为是自然病毒，起源于动物，通过溢出感染。
en-mt: This virus is considered to be a natural virus, originating in animals and infected by spillage.

sourceString: The actual origin is unknown, but by December 2019 the spread of infection was almost entirely driven by human-to-human transmission.
targetString: 实际起源尚未确定，但截至 2019 年 12 月，感染范围几乎全部是人际传播。
en-mt: The actual origin has not been determined, but as of December 2019, the infection was almost entirely human-to-human.

sourceString: A study of the first 41 cases of confirmed COVID-19, published in January 2020 in The Lancet, revealed the earliest date of onset of symptoms as 1 December 2019.
targetString: 2020 年 1 月《柳叶刀》发表的第一批 41 例确诊 COVID-19 病例研究显示，最早发病日期为 2019 年 12 月 1 日。
en-mt: A study of the first 41 confirmed COVID-19 cases published in The Lancet in January 2020 showed an earliest onset date of December 1, 2019.

sourceString: Official publications from the WHO reported the earliest onset of symptoms as 8 December 2019.
targetString: WHO 官方出版物报道的最早发病日期为 2019 年 12 月 8 日。
en-mt: The earliest date of onset reported in official WHO publications was 8 December 2019.

sourceString: Several measures are commonly used to quantify mortality.
targetString: 通常采用几种方法量化死亡率。
en-mt: Several methods are commonly used to quantify mortality.

sourceString: These numbers vary by region and over time and are influenced by the volume of testing, healthcare system quality, treatment options, time since initial outbreak and population characteristics such as age, sex and overall health.
targetString: 这些数字因地区而异，会随时间发生变化，并受检测量、卫生系统质量、治疗方案、疫情首次爆发时间以及年龄、性别和总体健康状况等人口特征的影响。
en-mt: These numbers vary by region, change over time, and are influenced by the volume of testing, the quality of the health system, treatment options, when the outbreak first occurred, and demographic characteristics such as age, sex, and general health status.

sourceString: In late 2019, WHO assigned the emergency ICD-10 disease codes U07.1 for deaths from lab-confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection and U07.2 for deaths from clinically or epidemiologically diagnosed COVID-19 without lab-confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection.The death-to-case ratio reflects the number of deaths divided by the number of diagnosed cases within a given time interval.
targetString: 2019 年底，WHO 将 ICD-10 紧急疾病代码 U07.1 指定给实验室确诊的 SARS-CoV-2 感染死亡病例，将 U07.2 指定给临床或流行病学诊断感染 COVID-19 但未经实验室确诊的 SARS-CoV-2 死亡病例。病死率等于给定时间范围内的死亡总数除以确诊病例总数。
en-mt: In late 2019, WHO assigned ICD-10 emergency disease code U07.1 to laboratory-confirmed deaths from SARS-CoV-2 infection and U07.2 to clinically or epidemiologically diagnosed cases of COVID-19 infection without laboratory confirmation. Confirmed fatal cases of SARS-CoV-2. The case fatality rate is equal to the total number of deaths divided by the total number of confirmed cases in a given time frame.

sourceString: Based on Johns Hopkins University statistics, the global death-to-case ratio is 6.9% (153,822/2,240,191) as of 17 April 2020.
targetString: 根据约翰·霍普金斯大学的统计数据，截至 2020 年 4 月 17 日，全球病死率为 6.9% (153,822/2,240,191)。
en-mt: According to statistics from Johns Hopkins University, as of April 17, 2020, the global case fatality rate was 6.9% (153,822/2,240,191).

sourceString: The number varies by region.Other measures include the case fatality rate (CFR), which reflects the percent of diagnosed individuals who die from a disease, and the infection fatality rate (IFR), which reflects the percent of infected individuals (diagnosed and undiagnosed) who die from a disease.
targetString: 不同地区的病死率也不同。其他一些衡量标准还包括病例死亡率 (CFR) 和感染死亡率 (IFR)，前者反映的是疾病死亡人数占确诊人数的百分比，后者反映的是疾病死亡人数占感染人数（包括确诊和未确诊人数）的百分比。
en-mt: The case fatality rate varies from region to region. Other measures include the case fatality rate (CFR), which reflects the percentage of deaths from a disease as a percentage of confirmed cases, and the infection fatality rate (IFR), which reflects the percentage of deaths from a disease as a percentage of the number of infections (both confirmed and undiagnosed). number of people).

sourceString: These statistics are not time bound and follow a specific population from infection through case resolution.
targetString: 这些统计数据没有时间限制，并且跟踪的是特定人群从感染到病例解决的全过程。
en-mt: These statistics are not time-bound and track a specific population from infection to case resolution.

sourceString: While not all infected people develop antibodies, the presence of antibodies may provide information about how many people have been infected.
targetString: 尽管并非所有感染者均会产生抗体，但抗体的存在可提供感染人数信息。
en-mt: Although not all infected people develop antibodies, the presence of antibodies can provide information on how many people are infected.

sourceString: In the epicentre of the outbreak in Italy, Castiglione d'Adda, a small village of 4600, 80 (1.7%) are already dead.
targetString: 意大利疫情中心 Castiglione d'Adda 是一个仅有 4600 人口的小镇，目前已有 80 人 (1.7%) 死于疫情。
en-mt: Castiglione d'Adda, the epicenter of the outbreak in Italy, is a small town of 4,600 people, and 80 people (1.7%) have died from the outbreak so far.

sourceString: In Gangelt, the disease was spread by Carnival festivals, and spread to younger people, causing a relatively lower mortality, and not all COVID-19 deaths may have been formally classified as such.
targetString: 在 Gangelt，疫情通过各种狂欢节日扩散蔓延，甚至波及年轻人，但死亡率相对较低，并非所有 COVID-19 死亡病例均正式归类。
en-mt: In Gangelt, the outbreak spread through various carnivals, even among young people, but the death rate was relatively low and not all deaths from COVID-19 were officially classified.

sourceString: Furthermore, the German health system has not been overwhelmed.
targetString: 此外，德国医疗体系已不堪重负。
en-mt: In addition, the German healthcare system is overwhelmed.

sourceString: In the Netherlands, about 3% may have antibodies, as assessed from blood donors.
targetString: 经献血者评估显示，约有 3% 的荷兰公民可能具有抗体。
en-mt: About 3% of Dutch citizens may have antibodies, as assessed by blood donors.

sourceString: 69 (0.004% of the population) have been confirmed to have died from COVID-19.
targetString: 截至目前为止，确认已有 69 人（占人口总数的 0.004%）死于 COVID-19。
en-mt: To date, 69 people (0.004% of the population) have been confirmed to have died from COVID-19.

sourceString: The impact of the pandemic and its mortality rate are different for men and women.
targetString: 疫情影响及死亡率因性别而异。
en-mt: The impact of the epidemic and the mortality rate vary by sex.

sourceString: Mortality is higher in men in studies conducted in China and Italy.
targetString: 中国和意大利研究显示，男性的死亡率高于女性。
en-mt: Studies in China and Italy have shown that males have a higher mortality rate than females.

sourceString: The highest risk for men is in their 50s, with the gap between men and women closing only at 90.
targetString: 50-60 岁男性死亡风险最高，仅有 90 岁年龄段的性别差距相近。
en-mt: Men aged 50-60 had the highest risk of death, with only the 90-year-old age group having a similar gender gap.

sourceString: In China, the death rate was 2.8 percent for men and 1.7 percent for women.
targetString: 中国男性死亡率为 2.8%，女性死亡率为 1.7%。
en-mt: In China, the male mortality rate is 2.8%, and the female mortality rate is 1.7%.

sourceString: The exact reasons for this sex-difference is not known, but genetic and behavioural factors could be a reason.
targetString: 产生这种性别差异的确切原因尚不明朗，但可能由遗传和行为因素导致。
en-mt: The exact cause of this sex difference is unknown, but genetic and behavioral factors may be involved.

sourceString: Sex-based immunological differences, lesser prevalence of smoking in women and men developing co-morbid conditions such as hypertension at a younger age than women could have contributed to the higher mortality in men.
targetString: 基于性别的免疫学差异，女性吸烟率较低，男性出现合并症（如高血压）的年龄低于女性，因而导致男性死亡率高于女性。
en-mt: Sex-based immunological differences, women's lower smoking rate, men's comorbidities (such as high blood pressure) occur at a younger age than women, resulting in higher mortality rates in men than women.

sourceString: In Europe, 57% of the infected individuals were men and 72% of those died with COVID-19 were men.
targetString: 在欧洲，男性感染者占 57%，因 COVID-19 致死的总人数中男性占比更是高达 72%。
en-mt: In Europe, men accounted for 57% of infections and 72% of all deaths from COVID-19.

sourceString: As of April 2020, the US government is not tracking sex-related data of COVID-19 infections.
targetString: 截至 2020 年 4 月，美国政府尚未跟踪 COVID-19 感染的性别相关数据。
en-mt: As of April 2020, the US government is not tracking gender-related data on COVID-19 infections.

sourceString: Research has shown that viral illnesses like Ebola, HIV, influenza and SARS affect men and women differently.
targetString: 研究表明，埃博拉病毒、HIV、流感和 SARS 等病毒性疾病对男性和女性造成的影响有所不同。
en-mt: Research shows that viral diseases such as Ebola, HIV, influenza and SARS affect men and women differently.

sourceString: A higher percentage of health workers, particularly nurses, are women, and they have a higher chance of being exposed to the virus.
targetString: 女性卫生工作者（特别是护士）的比例较高，接触病毒的几率也较高。
en-mt: Female health workers, especially nurses, are more likely to be exposed to the virus.

sourceString: The World Health Organization announced on 11 February 2020 that the official name of the disease would be "COVID-19".
targetString: 2020 年 2 月 11 日，世界卫生组织宣布将这种疾病正式命名为 "COVID-19"。
en-mt: On February 11, 2020, the World Health Organization announced that the disease was officially named "COVID-19".

sourceString: WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus explained that CO stands for corona, VI for virus, D for disease, and 19 for when the outbreak was first identified: 31 December 2019.
targetString: WHO 负责人 Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus 对此做出了解释：CO 代表“冠状”，VI 代表“病毒”，D 代表“疾病”，19 代表疫情首次爆发时间（2019 年 12 月 31 日）。
en-mt: Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, head of the WHO, explained this: CO stands for "coronavirus", VI stands for "virus", D stands for "disease", and 19 stands for the first outbreak of the epidemic (December 31, 2019).

sourceString: The name had been chosen to avoid references to a specific geographical location (e.g. China), animal species or group of people, in line with international recommendations for naming aimed at preventing stigmatisation.The virus that causes COVID-19 is named severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: 之所以选择这个名称，是为了避免引用特定的地理位置（例如，中国）、动物物种或人群，以符合防止污名化的国际命名建议。引发 COVID-19 的病毒称为严重急性呼吸综合征冠状病毒 2 型 (SARS-CoV-2)。
en-mt: This name was chosen to comply with international naming recommendations to prevent stigma by avoiding reference to a specific geographic location (e.g., China), animal species, or group of people. The virus that causes COVID-19 is called severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: The WHO additionally uses "the COVID-19 virus" and "the virus responsible for COVID-19" in public communications.
targetString: 此外，WHO 还在大众传播中使用“COVID-19 病毒”及“引发 COVID-19 的病毒”。
en-mt: Additionally, WHO uses the terms "COVID-19 virus" and "the virus that causes COVID-19" in mass communication.

sourceString: Both the disease and virus are commonly referred to as "coronavirus".
targetString: 疾病和病毒通称为“冠状病毒”。
en-mt: Diseases and viruses are collectively referred to as "coronaviruses".

sourceString: During the initial outbreak in Wuhan, China, the virus and disease were commonly referred to as "coronavirus" and "Wuhan coronavirus".
targetString: 中国武汉初次爆发疫情期间，人们普遍将病毒和疾病称为“冠状病毒”和“武汉冠状病毒”。
en-mt: During the initial outbreak in Wuhan, China, viruses and diseases were commonly referred to as "coronavirus" and "Wuhan coronavirus".

sourceString: In January 2020, WHO recommended 2019-nCov and 2019-nCoV acute respiratory disease as interim names for the virus and disease in accordance with 2015 guidance against using locations in disease and virus names.
targetString: 2020 年 1 月，WHO 根据 2015 年关于在疾病和病毒名称中使用位置的指南，建议将 2019-nCov 和 2019-nCoV 急性呼吸道疾病作为临时病毒和疾病名称。
en-mt: In January 2020, WHO recommended 2019-nCov and 2019-nCoV acute respiratory disease as interim virus and disease names based on the 2015 guidelines on the use of positions in disease and virus names.

sourceString: The official names COVID-19 and SARS-CoV-2 were issued on 11 February 2020.
targetString: 2020 年 2 月 11 日发布正式名称 COVID-19 和 SARS-CoV-2。
en-mt: The official names COVID-19 and SARS-CoV-2 were issued on February 11, 2020.

sourceString: Due to capacity limitations in the standard supply chains, some digital manufacturers are printing healthcare material such as nasal swabs and ventilator parts.
targetString: 鉴于标准供应链存在容量限制，一些数字制造商开始打印卫生保健材料，如鼻拭子和呼吸器部件。
en-mt: Given the capacity constraints of standard supply chains, some digital manufacturers are printing healthcare materials such as nasal swabs and respirator parts.

sourceString: In one example, when an Italian hospital urgently required a ventilator valve, and the supplier was unable to deliver in the timescale required, a local startup reverse-engineered and printed the required 100 valves overnight.
targetString: 举例来说，一家意大利医院急需通风阀，供应商无法在要求的时间内交付部件，一家本地初创公司进行逆向工程，一夜之间打印出所需的 100 个通风阀。
en-mt: For example, when an Italian hospital urgently needed ventilation valves and the supplier was unable to deliver the parts in the requested time, a local start-up reverse engineered and printed the 100 needed ventilation valves overnight.

sourceString: After the initial outbreak of COVID-19, conspiracy theories, misinformation and disinformation emerged regarding the origin, scale, prevention, treatment and other aspects of the disease and rapidly spread online.
targetString: 最初爆发 COVID-19 疫情后，关于疾病起源、规模、预防、治疗及其他方面的阴谋论、错误信息和虚假信息铺天盖地，通过网络迅速传播。
en-mt: After the initial outbreak of COVID-19, conspiracy theories, misinformation and disinformation about the disease's origins, scale, prevention, treatment and more spread rapidly across the web.

sourceString: Humans appear to be capable of spreading the virus to some other animals.
targetString: 人类似乎能够将病毒传播给另一些动物。
en-mt: Humans appear to be able to transmit the virus to other animals.

sourceString: The study failed to find evidence of viral replication in pigs, ducks, and chickens.
targetString: 研究未在猪、鸭和鸡体内发现病毒复制的证据。
en-mt: Studies have found no evidence of viral replication in pigs, ducks and chickens.

sourceString: No medications or vaccine is approved to treat the disease.
targetString: 目前尚未批准任何用于治疗这种疾病的药物或疫苗。
en-mt: There are currently no drugs or vaccines approved to treat this disease.

sourceString: International research on vaccines and medicines in COVID-19 are underway by government organisations, academic groups and industry researchers.
targetString: 政府机构、学术团体和行业研究人员正在积极开展国际研究，研发治疗 COVID-19 的疫苗和药物。
en-mt: Government agencies, academic groups, and industry researchers are actively conducting international research to develop vaccines and drugs to treat COVID-19.

sourceString: In March, the World Health Organization initiated the "SOLIDARITY Trial" to assess treatment effects of four existing antiviral compounds with the most promise of efficacy.
targetString: 3 月，世界卫生组织发起“团结试验”，评估目前最有可能产生疗效的四种现有抗病毒化合物的治疗效果。
en-mt: In March, the World Health Organization launched the "Solidarity Trial" to assess the efficacy of the four existing antiviral compounds currently most likely to be effective.

sourceString: There is no available vaccine, but various agencies are actively developing vaccine candidates.
targetString: 目前尚无疫苗，但各级机构都在积极研发候选疫苗。
en-mt: There is no vaccine yet, but there are active efforts at all levels to develop candidate vaccines.

sourceString: Previous work on SARS-CoV is being utilised because SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 both use the ACE2 receptor to enter human cells.
targetString: 由于 SARS-CoV 和 SARS-CoV-2 均通过 ACE2 受体进入人类细胞，因此需要利用 SARS-CoV 先前的工作成果。
en-mt: Since both SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 enter human cells through the ACE2 receptor, prior work on SARS-CoV needs to be leveraged.

sourceString: There are three vaccination strategies being investigated.
targetString: 人们正在研究三种疫苗策略。
en-mt: Three vaccine strategies are being studied.

sourceString: First, researchers aim to build a whole virus vaccine.
targetString: 首先，研究人员计划研发全病毒疫苗。
en-mt: First, the researchers plan to develop a whole-virus vaccine.

sourceString: The use of such a virus, be it inactive or dead, aims to elicit a prompt immune response of the human body to a new infection with COVID-19.
targetString: 利用此类病毒，无论是非活性病毒还是死亡病毒，其目的是在新感染 COVID-19 时激起人体的迅速免疫反应。
en-mt: Using such viruses, whether inactive or dead, the aim is to elicit a rapid immune response in the body upon new infection with COVID-19.

sourceString: A second strategy, subunit vaccines, aims to create a vaccine that sensitises the immune system to certain subunits of the virus.
targetString: 第二种策略是研发亚单位疫苗，旨在研制一种激发免疫系统对病毒的某些亚单位做出敏感反应的疫苗。
en-mt: The second strategy is the development of subunit vaccines, which aim to create a vaccine that sensitizes the immune system to certain subunits of the virus.

sourceString: In the case of SARS-CoV-2, such research focuses on the S-spike protein that helps the virus intrude the ACE2 enzyme receptor.
targetString: 在 SARS-CoV-2 案例中，此类研究集中专研辅助病毒侵入 ACE2 酶受体的 S 刺突蛋白。
en-mt: In the case of SARS-CoV-2, such studies have focused on the S spike protein that helps the virus penetrate the ACE2 enzyme receptor.

sourceString: A third strategy is that of the nucleic acid vaccines (DNA or RNA vaccines, a novel technique for creating a vaccination).
targetString: 第三种策略是研制核酸疫苗（DNA 疫苗或 RNA 疫苗，一种新型疫苗研制技术）。
en-mt: The third strategy is to develop nucleic acid vaccines (DNA vaccines or RNA vaccines, a new vaccine development technique).

sourceString: Experimental vaccines from any of these strategies would have to be tested for safety and efficacy.On 16 March 2020, the first clinical trial of a vaccine started with four volunteers in Seattle.
targetString: 必须对上述各项策略研制的试验疫苗的安全性和有效性进行测试。2020 年 3 月 16 日，四名西雅图志愿者发起了首次疫苗临床试验。
en-mt: The safety and efficacy of experimental vaccines developed with each of the above strategies must be tested. On March 16, 2020, four Seattle volunteers launched the first clinical trial of the vaccine.

sourceString: The vaccine contains a harmless genetic code copied from the virus that causes the disease.Antibody dependent enhancement has been suggested as a potential challenge for vaccine development for SARS-COV-2, but this is controversial.
targetString: 疫苗含有从引发疾病的病毒复制而来的无害基因序列。人们一直认为抗体依赖性增强作用可能成为开发 SARS-COV-2 疫苗过程中面临的一大挑战，但这种说法存在争议。
en-mt: Vaccines contain harmless genetic sequences copied from the virus that causes the disease. Antibody-dependent potentiation has long been thought to be a potential challenge in developing a SARS-COV-2 vaccine, but this has been disputed.

sourceString: There are more than 300 active clinical trials underway as of April 2020.
targetString: 截至 2020 年 4 月，开展的临床试验共有 300 多项。
en-mt: As of April 2020, more than 300 clinical trials have been conducted.

sourceString: Seven trials were evaluating already approved treatments for malaria, including four studies on hydroxychloroquine or chloroquine.
targetString: 七项试验完成评估并获准用于治疗疟疾，包括四项关于羟氯喹或氯喹的研究。
en-mt: Seven trials were evaluated and approved for malaria, including four studies of hydroxychloroquine or chloroquine.

sourceString: Repurposed antiviral drugs make up most of the Chinese research, with nine phase III trials on remdesivir across several countries due to report by the end of April.
targetString: 转换抗病毒药物用途占中国研究的绝大部分，4 月底之前将在多个国家进行九项关于瑞德西韦的 III 期临床试验。
en-mt: Switching the use of antiviral drugs accounts for the vast majority of research in China, and nine phase III clinical trials on remdesivir will be conducted in multiple countries by the end of April.

sourceString: A dynamic review of clinical development for COVID-19 vaccine and drug candidates was in place, as of April 2020.Several existing antiviral medications are being evaluated for treatment of COVID-19, including remdesivir, chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine, lopinavir/ritonavir and lopinavir/ritonavir combined with interferon beta.
targetString: 截至 2020 年 4 月，已开始对 COVID-19 疫苗和候选药物的临床开发情况进行动态审查。目前正在评估几种治疗 COVID-19 的现有抗病毒药物，包括瑞德西韦、氯喹和羟氯喹、洛匹那韦/利托那韦及洛匹那韦/利托那韦组合干扰素 β。
en-mt: As of April 2020, a dynamic review of the clinical development status of COVID-19 vaccines and drug candidates has begun. Several existing antiviral drugs are currently being evaluated for the treatment of COVID-19, including remdesivir, chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine, lopinavir/ritonavir, and the lopinavir/ritonavir combination interferon beta .

sourceString: There is tentative evidence for efficacy by remdesivir, as of March 2020.
targetString: 截至 2020 年 3 月，瑞德西韦的疗效已得到初步证实。
en-mt: As of March 2020, the efficacy of remdesivir has been preliminarily confirmed.
