sourceString: Clinical improvement was observed in patients treated with compassionate-use remdesivir.
targetString: 经观察发现，采用同情用药瑞德西韦治疗的患者的临床症状有所缓解。
en-mt: It was observed that the clinical symptoms of patients treated with sympathetic drug remdesivir were relieved.

sourceString: Phase III clinical trials are being conducted in the US, China and Italy.Chloroquine, previously used to treat malaria, was studied in China in February 2020, with preliminary results.
targetString: 现阶段美国、中国和意大利正在开展 III 期临床试验。2020 年 2 月，中国启动氯喹（过去用来治疗疟疾）研究并取得初步结果。
en-mt: Phase III clinical trials are currently underway in the United States, China and Italy. In February 2020, China launched a study of chloroquine (used to treat malaria in the past) and achieved preliminary results.

sourceString: However, there are calls for peer review of the research.
targetString: 但是，有人呼吁对这项研究实施同行评审。
en-mt: However, there have been calls for the study to be peer-reviewed.

sourceString: Korean and Chinese Health Authorities recommend the use of chloroquine.
targetString: 韩国和中国卫生主管部门建议使用氯喹。
en-mt: Health authorities in South Korea and China recommend the use of chloroquine.

sourceString: However, the Wuhan Institute of Virology, while recommending a daily dose of one gram, notes that twice that dose is highly dangerous and could be lethal.
targetString: 但是，武汉病毒学研究所建议每天服用 1 克，同时提醒两倍剂量非常危险，甚至可能致命。
en-mt: However, the Wuhan Institute of Virology recommends taking 1 gram per day, while warning that a double dose is very dangerous and may even be fatal.

sourceString: On 28 March 2020, the FDA issued an emergency use authorisation for hydroxychloroquine and chloroquine at the discretion of physicians treating people with COVID-19.The Chinese 7th edition guidelines also include interferon, ribavirin or umifenovir for use against COVID-19.
targetString: 2020 年 3 月 28 日，FDA 签发了氯喹和羟氯喹紧急使用授权，但医生有权决定是否使用上述两种药物治疗 COVID-19 患者。中国第七版指南还提出使用干扰素、利巴韦林或盐酸阿比朵尔治疗 COVID-19。
en-mt: On March 28, 2020, the FDA issued an emergency use authorization for chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine, but doctors have the right to decide whether to use the above two drugs to treat COVID-19 patients. The seventh edition of the Chinese guidelines also proposes the use of interferon, ribavirin or arbidol hydrochloride to treat COVID-19.

sourceString: Preliminary data indicate that high doses of ribavirin are necessary to inhibit SARS-CoV-2 in vitro.
targetString: 初步数据表明，高剂量利巴韦林在体外对 SARS-CoV-2 具有抑制作用。
en-mt: Preliminary data suggest that high-dose ribavirin has an inhibitory effect on SARS-CoV-2 in vitro.

sourceString: Nitazoxanide has been recommended for further in vivo study after demonstrating low concentration inhibition of SARS-CoV-2.Studies have demonstrated that initial spike protein priming by transmembrane protease serine 2 (TMPRSS2) is essential for entry of SARS-CoV-2 via interaction with the ACE2 receptor.
targetString: 在证实 SARS-CoV-2 的低浓度抑制作用后，建议使用硝唑尼特开展进一步的体内研究。研究表明，跨膜蛋白酶丝氨酸 2 (TMPRSS2) 引发的原始刺突蛋白是 SARS-CoV-2 与 ACE2 受体相互作用进入人体的必要条件。
en-mt: After the low-concentration inhibition of SARS-CoV-2 was confirmed, further in vivo studies with nitazoxanide are recommended. Studies have shown that the original spike protein triggered by the transmembrane protease serine 2 (TMPRSS2) is required for SARS-CoV-2 to interact with the ACE2 receptor to enter the body.

sourceString: The studies of chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine with or without azithromycin have major limitations that have prevented the medical community from embracing these therapies without further study.Oseltamivir does not inhibit SARS-CoV-2 in vitro and has no known role in COVID-19 treatment.
targetString: 无论是否与阿奇霉素结合使用，氯喹和羟氯喹研究均存在严重局限性，除非经进一步研究，否则医学界无法接受这些疗法。奥司他韦在体外对 SARS-CoV-2 没有抑制作用，而且尚未发现对 COVID-19 具有治疗效果。
en-mt: Both chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine studies have serious limitations, whether combined with azithromycin or not, and the medical community cannot accept these therapies unless further research is conducted. Oseltamivir has no inhibitory effect on SARS-CoV-2 in vitro and has not been found to have a therapeutic effect on COVID-19.

sourceString: Cytokine storm can be a complication in the later stages of severe COVID-19.
targetString: 细胞因子风暴可能成为 COVID-19 重症患者后期治疗的并发症。
en-mt: Cytokine storm may become a complication of late treatment in critically ill patients with COVID-19.

sourceString: There is evidence that hydroxychloroquine may have anti-cytokine storm properties.Tocilizumab has been included in treatment guidelines by China's National Health Commission after a small study was completed.
targetString: 有证据表明，羟氯喹可能具有抗细胞因子风暴特性。在完成一项小型研究后，中国国家卫生健康委员会将托珠单抗列入治疗指南。
en-mt: There is evidence that hydroxychloroquine may have anti-cytokine storm properties. After completing a small study, China's National Health Commission included tocilizumab in its treatment guidelines.

sourceString: It is undergoing a phase 2 non randomised test at the national level in Italy after showing positive results in people with severe disease.
targetString: 继重症患者检测结果呈阳性后，意大利正在进行国家级 2 期非随机试验。
en-mt: A national phase 2 non-randomized trial is underway in Italy following positive tests in critically ill patients.

sourceString: Combined with a serum ferritin blood test to identify cytokine storms, it is meant to counter such developments, which are thought to be the cause of death in some affected people.
targetString: 结合血清铁蛋白血液检测，识别细胞因子风暴，旨在遏制病情发展，而细胞因子风暴被认为会导致部分感染者死亡。
en-mt: Combined with a serum ferritin blood test to identify the cytokine storm that is thought to kill some infected people, it aims to curb the disease's progression.

sourceString: The interleukin-6 receptor antagonist was approved by the FDA based on retrospective case studies for treatment of steroid refractory cytokine release syndrome induced by a different cause, CAR T cell therapy, in 2017.
targetString: 2017 年，在回顾性病例研究的支持下，FDA 批准使用白细胞介素 6 受体拮抗剂治疗由其他原因引起的类固醇难治性细胞因子释放综合征，即 CAR T 细胞疗法。
en-mt: In 2017, supported by retrospective case studies, the FDA approved the use of interleukin-6 receptor antagonists, known as CAR T-cell therapy, for the treatment of steroid-refractory cytokine release syndrome caused by other causes.

sourceString: To date, there is no randomised, controlled evidence that tocilizumab is an efficacious treatment for CRS.
targetString: 迄今为止，尚无随机对照证据证明托珠单抗可有效治疗 CRS。
en-mt: So far, there is no randomized controlled evidence that tocilizumab is effective in the treatment of CRS.

sourceString: Transferring purified and concentrated antibodies produced by the immune systems of those who have recovered from COVID-19 to people who need them is being investigated as a non-vaccine method of passive immunisation.
targetString: 目前正在研究抽取 COVID-19 康复者免疫系统产生的纯化浓缩抗体，注射给需要抗体的人们，在疫苗研制成功之前作为被动免疫疗法。
en-mt: Purified and concentrated antibodies produced by the immune system of recovered COVID-19 patients are currently being studied and injected into people who need them as passive immunotherapy until a vaccine is developed.

sourceString: This strategy was tried for SARS with inconclusive results.
targetString: SARS 疫情期间曾尝试过这项策略，但疗效尚无定论。
en-mt: This strategy was tried during the SARS outbreak, but its efficacy was inconclusive.

sourceString: Viral neutralisation is the anticipated mechanism of action by which passive antibody therapy can mediate defence against SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: 病毒中和是被动抗体疗法介导 SARS-CoV-2 免疫防御的一种预期作用机制。
en-mt: Virus neutralization is a predicted mechanism of action for passive antibody therapy to mediate immune defense against SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Other mechanisms however, such as antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity and/or phagocytosis, may be possible.
targetString: 不过，抗体依赖性细胞毒性和/或吞噬作用等其他一些机制也可达到同样的效果。
en-mt: However, other mechanisms such as antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity and/or phagocytosis may also achieve the same effect.

sourceString: Other forms of passive antibody therapy, for example, using manufactured monoclonal antibodies, are in development.
targetString: 目前正在开发其他形式的被动抗体疗法，例如使用人造单克隆抗体。
en-mt: Other forms of passive antibody therapy, such as the use of man-made monoclonal antibodies, are currently being developed.

sourceString: Production of convalescent serum, which consists of the liquid portion of the blood from recovered patients and contains antibodies specific to this virus, could be increased for quicker deployment.
targetString: 康复期血清产生量可能会增加，有利于快速部署。血清由康复患者血液的液态部分构成，其中包含针对这种病毒的特异性抗体。
en-mt: Convalescent serum production may increase, facilitating rapid deployment. The serum is made up of the liquid portion of the recovered patient's blood and contains antibodies specific to the virus.

sourceString: Coronavirus diseases, a group of closely related syndromes
targetString: 冠状病毒疾病，一组密切相关的综合征
en-mt: Coronavirus disease, a group of closely related syndromes

sourceString: Li Wenliang, a doctor at Central Hospital of Wuhan, who later contracted and died of COVID-19 after raising awareness of the spread of the virus.
targetString: 武汉市中心医院医生李文亮提高了对新冠病毒传播的认识，而后不幸染上 COVID-19 并去世。
en-mt: Li Wenliang, a doctor at Wuhan Central Hospital who raised awareness of the spread of the novel coronavirus, tragically contracted COVID-19 and died.
